Just today they told me that everyone they have phone conversations with comment on how clearly they can hear them.  The setup is very simple, basically plug-and-play.  Setting the clock was intuitive; I did it without reading the manual. Four headsets let them have a headset wherever they want one.If it lasts, I would consider this is a very well designed, and reasonably priced system.

I used this drain with a Dreamline Slimline DLT-1130602 acrylic shower base.  The drain looks very good and was easy to install.  It is all metal parts with the exception of the rubber seal and the internal bushing.  It uses Fernco bushing to seal against the drain pipe rather than a compression bushing like Oatey 140 NC drain.  I was concerned about potential leaks, but so far it seems fine.  It is pricey however, I got a good deal on a Like New but I wouldn't pay full price.  In that case I would go with Oatey.  Although Kohler does look nicer.

I recently remodeled two bathrooms.  I used these doorstops to prevent doors slamming into the toilet in one bathroom and into the glass shower door in another.  They work great.  I used two per door - one on each hinge to reduce strain on the hinge and the molding.  I prefer them over the spring door stops which may rust and transfer all force of tge door swing to one small spot.

This grill is easy to set up and use.  The cooking surface is large and is sufficient to grill for a family of 3.  The cleanup is easy thanks to non-stick coating.  The grill feels stable on the counter, but with the included stand it feels top heavy and potentially unstable.

I like the scent.  Bodywash specifically is pretty refreshing.  Deodorant stick and fragrance spray are probably more suitable for younger guys.  The cardboard insert which hold individual containers inside the outer box sheds fibers, which takes away from the appearance of the product.  Overall, this might be a nice set for younger guys, as for me, I'd only use bodywash.

I replaced the battery in my watch and it works again.  I always try to go for Renata or Sony and I have never had any regrets.Purchased from MyBatterySupplier - reasonable price, quick delivery, fresh battery.
The bar tastes good.  The flavor of nuts and chocolate are clearly identifiable.  I am not a fan of cinnamon, and this bar has a little, but cinnamon flavor is not too strong.

This is one of those ubiquitous film screen protectors like the cheapest ones for phones and other portable screens.  It consists of the screen protection film sandwiched between two layers.  You peel layer one and apply the protector to the screen, squeeze bubbles out, and then peel off layer 2.This type of film works well enough for me, and I use it on every screen device in the family.  The film might get scratched, but the screen under remains like new.  If you are careful enough to not have any dust on the screen before applying the screen protector, you will be able to remove all bubbles, but even the tiniest speck of dust will result in a bubble.  Aligning the protector requires patience because due to its size even the slightest deviation from the bezel line at the beginning of the application will result in the screen protector being noticeably off by the end of the install.The problem I have with this protector is that after carefully cleaning the screen, aligning and applying the protector, and squeezing out all bubbles, I cannot get the upper right corner to stick - about 1/16" is stubbornly lifting.  It does not seem like it is sitting on the bezel, but it just won't stay down.  It is not a big deal, because the rest of the screen is completely bubble free, but it is annoying.  In the past I had a similar problem with this type of film, so it was not completely unexpected.However, there are other types of film e.g. self-healing ZAGG InvisibleShield and Skinomi which I never had a problem with those not fully sticking to the surface.  When I purchased SUPERSHIELDZ screen protector, I thought I was getting that type of film.

It tastes fine, but "one pot no drain" seems like a gimmick to me.  If you do not read cooking directions every time before cooking and have both Pronto and regular pasta in your kitchen, you might confuse cooking methods because Pronto and non-Pronto boxes look identical.  The time and effort savings, in my opinion, do not justify the higher price.  However, as I said, from the taste perspective it is a good product.

Nice fresh masculine scent.  My skin feels clean and soft after I use this soap.  Like many men I do not use moisturizers, and I appreciate that this bar has moisturizer already in it.  A good product from a well-known brand.

UPDATE Nov-2015:  I use this tablet every day and still like it. If speakers were front facing and it had an auto-dim feature, I'd consider it a perfect tablet.  I use it with Qy8 BT earphones and it is great for Netflix.ORIG REVIEW Jul-2015: I have been using Lenovo Tab2 A10-70 for a few weeks.  So far, I am happy with it.  The setup was easy.  It performs well.  There doesn't seem to be a lot of bloatware. Netflix, YouTube, Gmail, and Chrome all work well.  The screen image is good, and 10" screen is my preference for tablets.  Overall, I like this tablet.Lollipop update for this tablet has been released. Please note that UPDATE TAKES A LONG TIME for the tablet to restart after an update.  Mine showed Lenovo splash screen and then the screen stayed black for 10 minutes.  Since my tablet was only a week old and I had everything backed up/synced, I did a full factory reset after update to Lollipop.  Not sure if this was necessary, but I had bad experience installing just updates on my other devices - they slowed down and misbehaved.  After update to Lollipop, the factory reset will not take you back to Kit Kat, but it will erase all data and settings and remain at Lollipop.  The tablet works fine with Lollipop.The following items I see as negatives.  First, the center of the tablet's back panel is flexing, which gives it a cheap feeling.  I addressed it by installing a Fintie cover.  Second, there does not seem to be a screen brightness auto-adjustment feature.  My four year old Toshiba Thrive, which this tablet has replaced, had that feature.  I wish speakers were front facing.  Other than these, I have not found any problems with the tablet.

I garden all the time - in wet and cold weather, too. These gloves are perfect for either wearing under regular gardening gloves for extra warmth or alone for protection from moisture. When working in muddy areas, it's lots easier to rinse or dispose of these gloves than to launder ordinary gardening gloves.These gloves are thick enough to withstand heavy work and good enough to be reusable. The bright orange makes them hard to lose and the textured surface gives them grippiness. These are the best disposable gloves I have ever used and well worth the price.

It has a graceful shape and is sturdy. I use it to make iced tea, almost every day. I fill the pitcher half way with ice cubes, put a knife in the ice so the pitcher won't break, and pour in the hot water containing the tea through a sieve. It looks pretty in the pitcher, just like in the picture. Really. Previously I had the same pitcher and used it for about 15 years before it developed a crack. Very good value!UPDATE: 4/14/2015 after only 5 weeks of use the pitcher has developed a long crack around the handle. Guess my first reaction was too good to be true.

Chuck Palahniuk has done it again.  As in Fight Club, Invisible Monsters, and Choke, he manages to give you nightmares.  Some of these stories are so twisted you may be glad they're only a couple pages long.  This way you have a little recovery time before diving into the next crazy scenario.  They often begin in a realistic enough way, and just when you're getting comfortable he drags you along some horrific turn.  For the reader that enjoys this sort of punishment you won't be able to put this book down.These 23 very dark tales exhibit Palahniuk’s fascination with the macabre. Descriptions of his stories include sensational, twisted, disturbing, perverse and horrific. If this is your cup of tea, you should love this collection.Like all short story collections, some rise to the top while others sink, but none are boring.  If you enjoy bizarre stories involving some of society’s misfits, “Stories You Can’t Unread” is for you. But be careful; as the title says, they truly are stories you can't unread.

Oregon restricts the use of dinotefuran, the active ingredient in this product, due to 25,000-50,000 bumblebees and other insects that died as a result of exposure to dinotefuran sprayed on Linden trees. Dinotefuran is a commonly used neonicotinoid and a systematic pesticide absorbed by every part of the plant, thus exposing bees, butterflies and other pollinators to the residue. Neonicotinoids are suspected of causing detrimental effects on bumble bee colony growth and queen production.Consider using a selective approach to whatever undesirable insect that is affecting your trees or shrubs, and avoiding pesticides. We need our birds, bees, butterflies and other pollinators. Beneficial insects are important in controlling pests on ornamentals and must not be killed as past of the remedy.

I used the Oreck Revitalize to clean a very light cream wool carpet that had lots of stains and dirt on it. The result was nice, but not perfect. The stains still require spotting, which does not surprise me. The remainder of the carpet looked immensely improved; however, not as good as the results of professionals with a truck-mounted cleaner.Cleaning the carpet was significant work. You do have to vacuum carefully, first, including the edges where dirt is trapped. As other reviewers noted, the soap and water dispenser is rather small and requires several refills to finish a small room. You have to push the soap and water release button while you cover a path, then go over the same path without releasing the soap and water in order to suck up the soap and dirty water. Going over the path several times results in better cleaning. Following this, you have to refill the container with clean water (no soap) and repeat the process in order to rinse the carpet and remove more dirt.Although the lower container did have some muddy water in it, there wasn't nearly the amount of water that I had released onto the rug. When I opened the collection container, I realized that there is a filter in it that might have been clogged with carpet fibers.Also, the cord had accidentally looped around the front of the cleaner and opened the covering of the hole used to insert the attachment hose. I'm thinking that this might have reduced the suction of the cleaner while I used it.The cleaner does collect a lot of carpet fiber, even from a high quality carpet. I had to clean the carpet fibers from the brushes several times while using the machine.I found it difficult to clean the Oreck. The machine is clear plastic so you can see accumulated dirty carpet fibers inside. The two front brushed detach easily so you can pick out the gunk. The remove the other brushes, you need to unscrew them from the machine.  The worst was the interior of the front section where you attach the hose for cleaning upholstery. It was filled with dirty carpet fibers and had no easy access. I used a Q-Tip to push the fibers towards the opening where I could remove them.In the end, the Oreck cleans the carpet well enough; it's just a lot of work.

The large number of positive reviews influenced me to read this memoir of the tragic death of the author’s first husband, Boone, at the age of fifty-one from brain cancer.  It details the ordeal suffered by the wife, Prissy Elrod, during the approximate year from diagnosis to death.There are several things that I didn’t realize before I read “Far Outside the Ordinary.” This is Elrod’s first book and is, basically, self-published through her own publishing house called Leather Leaf Publishing.  It is not simply a memoir of the death of her husband.  It is written like chick-lit.  You learn that Prissy is putting on bronze lipstick. She cries in the arms of her black nanny.  She cries in the arms of the man she just hired to care for her sick husband.  There is a lot of crying.More importantly, the last 72 out of 254 pages are about the romance between Prissy and her second husband, largely through AOL (“you’ve got mail”) email.  The cute exchange of messages ultimately leading to their union was not what I expected in this memoir, nor did it interest me.  Typical of the prose was Prissy’s phone call to her girlfriend to help her decide whether she should meet her intended wearing black pants and top or a brown and yellow sun dress.Prissy’s story is told from the perspective of extremely wealthy people.  Both Prissy and Boone seemed to have enjoyed extremely affluent backgrounds.  For example, in the summers of her youth Prissy spent the month of July at the Cloister, a venerable resort on Sea Island, with her Mother, sisters and black nanny.  Prissy’s mother commissioned an artist to paint old-world-style portraits of Prissy and her sister, so Prissy did the same for her daughters. On Prissy’s first date with Boone, he took her to his grandmother’s winter home, Waverly Plantation, where he lived alone while attending law school.The family continued to have significant financial resources.  Prior to Boone’s illness, Prissy was not working, had two children (one 19 and the other 16 years old) and relied on a housekeeper two days a week.  The family had a beach house on St. Teresa Island, on the Gulf of Mexico.  One of Boone’s hobbies was large game hunting.  Annually, he and his friends paid a lot of money to hunt “some of the finest bull elk, cow elk, bear and wild birds in North America” on the Mescalero Apache reservation in New Mexico, with the associated taxidermy. When Prissy realized that wheelchair-bound Boone should have time outside, she didn’t build a ramp but had a deck built on the rear of the house so he could be rolled outside.Prissy is a physician’s daughter, yet she made illogical decisions.  When Boone was initially diagnosed with brain cancer, she found a medical center and outstanding surgeon from the latest recommendations of U.S. News and World Report, yet she paid $900 for a Chinese foot soak treatment guaranteed to travel from his feet to his brain, where it would miraculously dissolve the lethal tumor.She and Boone moved from their home in Tallahassee, Florida, to Houston for several weeks to get controversial, unproven, alternative medicine treatment at the clinic of Stanislaw Burzynski, touted as able to cure inoperable brain tumors.  According to Prissy, the government spent years “suppressing” this cancer treatment and trying to “put this pioneer scientist and inventor in jail.” According to Prissy, “Burzynski was indicted for fraud and seventy-five counts of violating laws; some of these events were taking place at the time we needed him.”The initial fee for treatment at the Burzynski Clinic was $10,000 with an additional “$7,000 to $9,500" per month, according to the American Cancer Society.  In short, Prissy became responsible for administering the treatments ordered by the Burzynski Clinic, which became a painful ordeal for Boone as the weeks passed and his condition worsened.Prissy hired the following caregivers for Boone: a black man named “Du,”  his “sister” Sallie, and Willie, a substitute black man who, according to Du, occasionally volunteered at Du’s church.  Prior to their hiring, Betty, the housekeeper, helped Prissy care for Boone.Du and his alleged sister were compassionate, experienced caregivers, and good with Boone, but no mention was made of any training.  They both moved into the house and Prissy became dependent on them and involved in their lives. Du's “sister” turned out to be his girlfriend.  Du’s mother became terminally ill and was admitted to the hospital, and Willie was actually a homeless alcoholic and drug addict (he seemed stoned when Prissy found him on the street) who lived in a shelter.  Prissy helped Du divorce his wife, helped Sallie when her son was arrested and jailed and generally tried to solve their problems because she relied on them to care for Boone.  Du recruited Willie from the homeless shelter when Prissy felt that she was “living on the set of some B-list soap opera.”One might wonder why Prissy, an educated person of means, did not hire a trained, experienced caregiver, perhaps from an agency, to care for Boone.  Maybe qualifications were not relevant for Prissy, since, following Boone’s death, she did get a job as a legal secretary to the deputy general counsel to the governor of Florida based on her connections but with absolutely no training or experience.Some of the reviews mentioned that they laughed at parts of this memoir.  However, any humor escaped me.

I love this mat! I do a lot of cooking and baking. The mat is portable so I can place it by the sink, my baking counter, or in front of the stove. My feet get really tired from prolonged standing and this mat feels like a foot massage. It's wonderful!The mat is easy to clean and does not absorb water. Liquid beads up on the mat and is easily wiped off. Flour and other spills come off with a damp rag or towel.An added benefit for me is that the mat adds about an inch to my meager 60 inch height, making it easier to work on my too-tall counters and stove. I definitely want to use the Comfort Mat during the entire 20-year warranty period. In fact, I'm buying a second mat!

Anyone who has been to Everglades City or even smaller Chukaluskie knows what a small, insular community it is – and how easy it would be to become completely lost in the Ten Thousand Islands region of the Everglades.  When I went there in the 1980's, I was amazed at the number of expensive cars and boats parked or docked at what looked like very modest houses.  It wasn't until a year or so later, when I read that more than 200 people had been arrested for smuggling marijuana, that I understood the attraction of the Ten Thousand Islands for smugglers and the reason behind all the cars and boats.Tim McBride tells a “stranger than fiction” story about this period in time – one in which smugglers could easily make tens of thousands of dollars a night, and a team of smugglers could net as much as a cool million dollars for transferring a load of marijuana from an offshore freighter to pickup points elsewhere in Florida.  The book tells of outwitting the local police; the hard work involved in moving the bales of marijuana from freighter to boat, from boat to dock, and from dock to other towns; and -- lest you be tempted to try this yourself – the ultimately inevitable arrest and jail time.  To hear Tim tell it, everyone was friendly, no one poached another guy’s marijuana even if it was found floating in the water, and the biggest problem was trying to figure out what to do with all the money.  (Hint:  buy your buddy a truck – with cash – on a whim.)The contrast between that environment and most other large-scale drug smuggling operations that you read about, featuring double crosses, guns and killings, is astonishing to read.  And if you have been there, you almost certainly will read about the places where you have been: dinner at the Captains Table, camping on Rabbit Key, and the juncture of the Turner River and US 41 where teams of smugglers sometimes unloaded bales of marijuana into trucks.  The book is certainly not great literature, but it is an interesting and entertaining read, well worth the investment of a couple of hours of your time.

My dog thrives on a Natural Balance Limited Ingredient Diet. She eats the dry food and also about 1/3 can of the wet food morning and evening.. Any other food causes diarrhea. Like an infant, she does well on simple, limited foods without grain.I tried the kangaroo more for me than for her. She is happy with the same food every day, or a mix of the duck, fish and venison dry food. The kangaroo was eaten just like the other food, nothing special but not rejected. She digested the kangaroo food as well as all the other Limited Ingredient dry food. So, I ended up buying exotic meat as a novelty.It has 5 stars because it keeps my dog healthy and happy. However, you could do the same with any of the other Natural Balance L.I.D. foods for a bit less money.

Author Amanda Williams uses a mix of chick-lit overtones, the standard female private detective character, and police procedural to create an engaging murder mystery. Detective novel fans will recognize bits of the female private detective formula of Janet Evanovich’s Stephanie Plum and Sue Grafton’s Kinsey Milhorne.Keye Street, the protagonist and female detective is, as usual, flawed but brilliant. She is a recovering alcoholic, with continuing struggles with her addiction.  Keye worked with the FBI as a criminal investigative analyst and profiler.  Having been fired for being drunk, she now is a private detective, bail recovery agent and process server with her own business in Atlanta.Street has a serious relationship with a manly cop but is not immune to temptations presented on the job, like Sheriff Ken Metzler who exudes testosterone and animal magnetism.Keye is more competent than Stephanie Plum, able to actually retrieve her bond enforcement bail jumpers.  Yet, like Stephanie, Keye returns home to her man covered with orange juice and coffee resulting from a process serving mishap.“Don’t Talk to Strangers” is engaging, entertaining and well written with good plot twists.  It’s not goofy and humorous, but an analytical, procedural murder mystery.  “Don’t Talk to Strangers” is the third of William’s Keye Street series and the first for me.  It works as a stand-alone novel, but inspires me enough to read the others in the series.

Although this spatula is designed to clean out jars, being long and narrow, I like it for baking. I just used it when making a large cheesecake. The cream cheese, sugar, eggs and flour must be beaten until totally smooth to avoid lumps of cheese in the cake. The batter looks like mayonnaise when finished. To achieve this result, when mixing you must clean the beater and the bowl, several times, to incorporate the unmixed material. This jar spatula was superb for reaching into the bottom and wiping the sides of my Kitchen Aide bowl, with the beater still attached. The best part is that it will fit into the openings of the flat beater where unmixed batter accumulates. This spatula is stiff enough to clean both beater and bowl effectively. I have no doubt that it will clean out jars just as efficiently.The one-piece design of the spatula enables thorough cleaning, with no trapped food, and prevents the spatula from accidentally coming apart during use.  Also, the non-wood material of the handle is sanitary, being dishwasher-proof.The description of the spatula states that it is heat-resistant up to 600F, which means that it can be used to sauté food in non-stick pans. We'll see how that plays out after a longer period of use. I just threw out a spatula with the same claim when it left bits of plastic in the food.Like all OXO products, it has the "Good Grip" design of the very comfortable handle. This is nice when you are manipulating a spatula to clean out a jar or bowl.The OXO Jar Spatula is a bargain at $6.99.

Fad Diets are stupid. Author Rebecca Harrington is a really smart person who wrote a book about this stupid subject. Celebrities hold limited interest for me, perhaps not so for others. This book was probably a bad match for me.Rebecca Harrington is also rather young and quite thin. She does not need any diet. She certainly does not need Beyoncé's Master Cleanse diet, inspired by Tom Hanks, who lost fifty pounds for his role in "Cast Away."Okay, I realize that authors do stupid things so they can write about them. A.J. Jacobs spent a year living "Biblically," doing what the literal reading of the Bible instructs. Then, he wrote an informative, entertaining book about it. He also read the entire Encyclopaedia Britannica, then wrote "The Know-It-All: One Man's Humble Quest to Become the Smartest Person in the World," which was also rather interesting.I guess Harrington's 161 page book on her experience following 14 celebrity diets, in my view, did not provide adequate material for an entire book. It did reveal some of the absolutely bizarre ideas on nutrition of famous people, but it left me hungry (sorry). Note: the pre-publication version that I read did not contain illustrations, so I cannot comment on them.Hilarious? I wasn't laughing. I found it mildly amusing, at best. Yes, I do enjoy humor, but more like Laurie Notaro, Bill Bryson or J. Maarten Troost. Maybe I'm just too old for this . . . my days of fad diets are long behind me.

This knife is in between a paring knife and a chef's knife.  Much like a futon (is it a bed or a couch?), it's not good at being either.  The blade isn't very wide and doesn't extend at the base, so when chopping, your hand hits the cutting board.  You can't hold it in your hand for control as you would with a paring knife, unless maybe you have gorilla hands, which I don't The blade is very sharp and it does have a nice feel to it.  It actually cuts tomatoes nicely.The packaging is still giving me nightmares.  It's the heat sealed thick plastic kind, but there's also a thick zip tie type thing at the base.  I've seen the lifehack where you use a can opener to open clamshell packages, but it didn't occur to me at the time.  It was more traumatic because if I only had the knife free, I could have use it to open the darn package.

All of Basil's food is Natural Balance Limited Ingredients because she can't digest other, more complex, foods. However, as training treats I have given her  Zuke's Mini Naturals Roasted Chicken Recipe Dog Treats. These mini-rewards are like Zuke's, but better. I consider these as "high value" treats because Basil likes them so much.We play duck ball with these. I send tennis balls as far as I can using a racquet, and Basil gallops to the ball, snatches it up, gallops back, drops it at my feet, and sits. Then, she gets a mini-reward. That's duck ball. She will, of course, retrieve without the treat, but the mini-reward makes it special.Natural Balance food is NOT made in China and is safe for our dogs. I wrote to the company to ask where this product is made and they stated:"Thank you for contacting Natural Balance and for your interest in our products. Please know that all of the plants which manufacture the Natural Balance Dry, Canned, Treats, Rolls, Pouches are located in the United States: California, Arizona, Utah, South Carolina, Kansas, Nebraska, Missouri, Georgia, Pennsylvania, and Colorado. Our Delectable Delights Stews are made in Thailand by a state of the art US FDA approved plant.""Please also know that Natural Balance tests every lot of our products for nine potential contaminants that have been implicated in pet food recalls in the past. In a Test and Hold Program, our products are held in the warehouse and not available for sale until all the tests for those products come back with a passing result. We enter the results on our website so that you can view the results for your product. Go to http://www.naturalbalanceinc.com/bwc-search.aspx and follow the instructions about entering product name and date code to view the testing report for you product. Also please review the video on that page that describes our lab and testing.""If you have further sourcing questions, please feel free to call and speak with our Customer Care Specialists at the phone number below.If you have any further questions or concerns please feel free to contact us at the number below (800-829-4493 x226), thanks and have a nice afternoon."

The only problem is they go away so fast!We give Basil Natural Balance Limited Ingredients food and treats because she cannot digest other foods. I used this Shampoo to wash my motorcycles. As claimed, it removed the dirt without dulling the finish. Yes, I had to work on removing grease, but that's expected. A little on a sponge seemed to go a long way.The reason that Einszett isn't getting 5 stars is that it is competing with S100 Total Cycle Cleaner, which I have used for 15 years. S100 is such an effective cleaner, that my husband uses it on his Porsche.  It, too, is non-acid, pH controlled, contains corrosion inhibitors, and is biodegradable. Although Einszett seems to clean equally well, it can't compete with the price and convenience of S100. Amazon sells S100 at $14.95 for 33.8 ounces. It's even less expensive when you buy the 1.32 gallon Amazon sells the Einszett shampoo at $11.90 for only 16.9 ounces! Also, the S100 comes with a convenient spray bottle. This prevents accidental spillage, which did occur on the driveway with the Einszett. It is interesting to note that both Einszett and S100 are made in Germany.In short, although Einszett shampoo cleans well, S100 cleans as well or better at half the price and comes in a nice spray bottle.

So far, I have used Griot's Garage Leather Cleaner on 3 recliners and 1 sofa and still have about a third of a bottle left. At $12.99 a bottle, that's a great deal!Of course, the price wouldn't matter if the cleaner didn't work, but it does. The chairs were sun-bleached and looking tired. After liberally applying the Leather Cleaner, the original color returned, the leather felt soft, supple, and rich, again. No, the chairs don't look like new. This is leather conditioner, not dye. However, this leather cleaner did take years off the chairs' age.The application is easy and quick. It's neither too thick nor too thin. You apply it on the leather and give it a light rub. That's it.The smell? Griot's Leather Cleaner smells like leather!  Really, the scent is saddle leather. It's what you would expect in a good leather cleaner.

Basil, the GoldenDoodle, only eats Natural Balance Limited Ingredients food, and Natural Balance treats. Her digestive system simply does not tolerate other brands of food.As the other reviewers stated, the Dental Chews, as all Natural Balance food, are NOT made in China and are safe for our dogs. Have a nice day!If you have any further questions or concerns please feel free to contact us at the number below (800-829-4493 x226), thanks and have a nice afternoon."These dental chews are hard, of course, have horizontal ridges and are about 4 inches by 1 inch. Upon receiving the dental chew, Basil immediately took it to her "lair" in the family room to eat it where no one would bother her. She does this with seriously good treats.I watched her as she ate it. It took about a minute. She bit it in half, leaving a few crumbs and the other half on the rug. She then ate the second half and the crumbs, and licked the rug. I didn't check her breath, but there was no bad odor. This looks like a five star dental chew to both of us.

While reading "Mr.  Bones" I kept telling my husband that he just has to read this book.  It is so good that I couldn't wait to share it with him.What brilliant writing and amazing imagination!  "Mr.  Bones" has aspects of Stephen King style weirdness, but on a more sophisticated level.  Theroux gives us twenty short stories of varied settings and styles, from four to fifty pages in length.  Their commonality is that all are artfully written and ingenious.Three stories are actually collections of vignettes of a page or two in length.  Yet, Theroux is able to convey compelling images and events in this short space.  I am at impressed with the effective characters and scenes he creates in just a page.A general theme of "Mr.  Bones" is that people are strange, even grotesque, in behavior.  Often we witness the gradual disintegration of a person.  These are fascinating portraits of bizarre experiences and characters.Theroux's nonfiction writing of people and places has been critical, even controversial.  I sense that "Mr.  Bones" may capture Theroux's impressions of people, on an exaggerated level."Mr.  Bones" loses one star due to poor endings.  The stories are magnificent, but just tail off.  I felt like Theroux didn't know how to wrap them up.
Super fast shipping and excellent product. Great deal and no sale's tax.8 pounds of creamer plus free shipping...can't beat it!

This really sinks into the skin without feeling topically greasy at all. I mix this with my ceramide complex sold by 'MakingCosmetics Inc.' here on Amazon and the two work great together. High quality ingredients and NO allergic reactions (*phew*).Great packaging and shipping too.
I only bought these to make coconut-almond-chocolate rice Krispy treats as well as maple-bacon rice Krispy treats and this cereal was very fresh and made delicious yum-yums.

My husband has been using this for about a week now (every night before bed) for his acne and I can already see an improvement in his skin (less break-outs and his skin just looks more radiant). He has recently quit using antibiotics and so far this (and a healthier diet) has helped keep him from suffering again from horrible break-outs.I tried a little of this myself one night and I was pleasantly surprised that I didn't have an allergic reaction (since I seem to be allergic to EVERYTHING).

Excellent replacement carafe and fit my 12 cup Cuisinart coffee maker perfectly. These are made of very thin glass so you definitely have to be careful not to slam these around.Excellent shipping and packaging.

Not sure what Galil is trying to pull but every can in the box was dented and one was completely split open. Also, I had ordered two sets of these and one set wasn't even the sliced olives but the whole, pitted olives and every single one of those cans was dented too (and some of these cans were hissing).Not good when food manufacturer's try to pawn off severely damaged items that would never be sold off the shelves of regular grocery stores.ETA: 5 stars for Amazon for refunding me for the wrong items (they would have refunded me for both but I felt because I was able to rescue a few cans that a refund for just one of the orders was fair).
I donated these to the homeless. Thank you for the great deals, Amazon so that I can help fight hunger for people who are struggling to survive.These are extra greasy but sinfully delicious.

I bought three packs of these to donate to the homeless who are vegetarians and don't have a lot of choices regarding soup kitchens.Out of all three packages, only one had a dented can and the expiration dates on these were excellent.Yes, these don't have much cheese in the filling (mostly white rice as a filler) and yes, they do have HFC but overall not a bad tasting product.Thank you for helping me feed the homeless, Amazon. XOXO

These are very sturdy, HUGE kitchen towels which is exactly what I was looking for because I bake a lot of bread and I really needed some big, cotton towels to cover my long French loaves while they cool.As suggested, I laundered these first and they did wrinkle (not badly) and I air dried them on a rack after partially being dried in the dryer. Minimal (if any) shrinkage.These feel like they will last me for years and years! Excellent product!

Just when I thought horseradish sauce couldn't get better than Woeber' original...This is so yummy  beyond description. Horsey-sauce heat, mayonnaise with a hintof smokey goodness.This is the bacon of horsey sauce!!!!!!

Serious problems with this item. If you notice the photos accompanying this product says 'garlic' it's because that's exactly what you will get instead of the honey roasted.Oddly, if you check out the 'garlic' peanuts by this brand the accompanying images show 'honey' flavor:http://www.amazon.com/Kayaking-Garlic-Roasted-Peanut-Ounce/dp/B00I7PZP50/ref=sr_1_3?s=grocery&ie=UTF8&qid=1433803047&sr=1-3I've alerted Amazon to this issue but, meanwhile, if you want the honey flavor peanuts, order the garlic and visa versa.Also, upon further inspection of these 'garlic' peanuts, I noticed that the best by date was already over [05/04/15]. :\Amazon was good enough to refund me but I was not able to return these so, I went ahead and tried a taste and boy oh boy, garlic, sugar and peanuts are definitely not my thing [I had to spit them out]. If you're a garlic addict you might love 'em though. All I could even think these could possibly be good for was maybe in an Asian stir fry but that's my taste-buds and one person's icky is another person's yummy.

I've become hooked on Szechuan pepper [xanthoxylum peperitum] and Whole Spice freshness and quality does not disappoint. Don't be put off by this being 'Szechuan' as these peppercorns [which taste nothing like black pepper] can go with a lot of different ethnic cuisines perfectly fine. The lemony/peppery umami flavor with the slight numbing effect on the tongue of this pepper is so, so good.This was well packaged in two 2.5 pound sealed, zip top bags.

These sardines are bland and a little dry (I made the mistake of draining the sauce which these probably needed for added moisture). The first can I opened had two medium-sized sardines (which is a nice choice for a light snack).These cans have easy open pull-tops and are about the same exact size as a small 6- ounce can of tomato paste. Some of the cans had minor dents but nothing major and the packaging was well done. The expiration date on these cans was very good [Feb. 08, 2017].I'm a bit surprised these cans of only two [dry] sardines have 8 grams of fat though. Although the recipe doesn't say, I think some oil was added to the sauce because it looked a bit oily actually which might account for the higher fat content.

This spice mix is new to me (and quite tasty) with a slight sweet-spicy tang and lovely aroma. I've added this to meatballs, roasted chicken and steamed vegetables so far and this spice combination really added a unique, distinctive 'secret ingredient' type of flavor.I would highly recommend this if you like the individual spices included:Cloves, Allspice, Black Pepper, Mace, Cardamom, Cinnamon, Ginger, Turmeric, Rosebuds, Cumin, White Pepper, Coriander, Nutmeg, Saffron, Bay Leaves and Paprika.

Decent quality seasoned vinegar but the added red food coloring makes for some rather strange looking pink rice if you plan on using this for sushi. For dipping pot-stickers, stir-fries, pickling vegetables or making a rice vinegar dressing this works fine.The bottles I received were near their expiration date but I'm hoping vinegar doesn't actually 'expire'.

Lovely, baby-pink colored rosebud powder with a delicate scent and flavor.This powder is fine but does have a few [very few] rosebud flakes which I sifted out. I actually bought this for my green smoothie drink mix I make [I was reading how good rosebuds are for you] but now I'm thinking I might add this powder to my homemade lip-balms too.This was well-packaged by Whole Spice in an opaque, black, re-sealable zip-top style bag (not in a transparent bag as shown on this page).Another home-run from Whole Spice.
Delicious Wasabi paste with authentic Wasabi in it! This has just the right nostril-sting to it for my homemade sushi and sashimi. YUM.

Gorgeous, tasty, slightly nutty whole grain rice.This cooks up beautifully and the color is a lovely coral as described.Even though this rice comes in individual boxes, these are all tightly vacuum sealed inside each box for optimum shelf-life and freshness.A+++
Excellent and fresh pickling spices. Top notch quality. I was really impressed with this mix of spices.

Delicious! The flavor of these onions is VERY toasted (almost borderline burnt). I ground some of these for toasted onion powder as the pieces of onion are HUGE and would be hard to incorporate into a recipe as is.But, honestly, these taste amazing.

Terribly dry, flavorless, smoked oysters even though these were packed in cottonseed oil.I've tried a lot of brands of canned oysters and this was a huge disappointment. These were the worst canned oysters I've ever eaten and that's saying a lot.If you like eating chewy sawdust with the hint of smoke and oysters, these might be for you.*update*: After trying a few more cans, some of them were quite good, so, it seems these cans of oysters are a bit of a gamble.

This whisk is great for whisking up small amounts of ingredients [like eggs, gravies, salad dressings or sauces] in smaller bowls or ramekins. This whisk is small enough to mix something up in smaller glass jars as well. This washes easily with hot tap water and hand-dried with a towel.If you purchase a lot of different sizes and styles of whisks for your cooking/baking needs, this is a must have for your collection.

Love these brushes and they manage to remove a lot of lint from my hair (eww). I also bought some of these as gifts and everyone I've given these brushes to just raves about how great they work. I have stick straight, baby fine hair that rats up easily and these handle my hair without tangling it up worse like some brushes I've tried in the past.

Excellent for zapping germs and critters as well as a deodorizer in your laundry. I add a few drops of clove oil to every load of laundry now and it really helps freshen my clothes and linens. I also add this to my dish soap to zap fungus and germs as well.If you add this to a carrier oil and apply it to a wound it really speeds healing (just don't use this on cats and other pets as their liver cannot process many essential oils).

This is one of my favorite shapes of pasta because they cook up with a chewier center and softer outer edges which gives you a combination of textures in one dish of pasta. These make great 'butter noodles' with a few pinches of sea salt, a teaspoon of sweet basil, butter (or ghee) and a sprinkling of grated Parmesan.These are great for making pasta salads or with spaghetti sauce and meatballs but definitely too big for soups.

These really do help combat the gas and bloat before eating a bean feast or a lot of steamed cruciferous vegetables in the cabbage family.Also, you can add 1/4 teaspoon of baking soda and/or ginger to your bean recipe which also helps cut down on the gas.

This is good B-complex but the smell is so overwhelmingly 'vitaminey' and yes, this will give you stinky, bright yellow 'vitamin pee' as well.Definitely take this with a meal as this gave me an upset stomach when I made the mistake of taking this without eating first.

Hibiscus is so good for you and tastes oddly like fruit rather than a flower! I grind this into a fine powder to add to my tea, smoothies, jams, homemade cranberry sauce, jello, sweet & sour soups etc. for the added health benefits. This was very good quality, dried, deep maroon/purple hibiscus.

Good quality MSM sulfur powder but since the price went up I've switched to another brand. Otherwise, this is very good and mixes well into fruit or vegetable juice and to combat the bitterness you can mix it with vitamin C powder.MSM sulfur powder is a must for controlling my eczema.

This camera is adorable and the functions are easy and fairly intuitive to acclimate to [especially if you've owned other Sony cyber-shot cameras]. This is my fourth cyber-shot camera [this one being the least expensive one I've ever bought]. This little camera has a lot of bang for the buck. You will need to use the flash for indoor photos but this camera takes very decent videos and photos. This definitely needed the soft camera case included in the kit because this thing is so tiny that if you dropped it from a distance it would probably damage it severely.The pink camera came with a super cute, soft pink camera case. So far, I've really enjoyed this camera.

We use a lot of Olive Oil in our home , and frequently use infused Olive oils , so when I was offered a chance to receive this at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion , I decided to give it a try .This oil comes in a good sized bottle , and the bottle is actually full ( unlike others I have purchased where you literally get maybe half a bottle full ) the spray nozzle works very well to spray on exactly what you need .This was a very surprising flavor burst ! When I first received this tablet I honestly did not expect that I would use it much and that my kids would be the ones who used it . I have been using my iPad and Kindle PaperWhite for years now and live them both even though I love the Windows platform more than any other .When I received this , the first thing I really noticed that stood out to me was the size . I love that the actual screen size is large and easy to read and see . This also has Zoffice 365, which is a huge plus , because with most any other tablet , you have to either download some type of app for those programs or get another similar program that mimics Office , or worst case scenerio , you have to pay extra , but this tablet has it included . It also has several other things already added that you use most often .This tablet comes with a very nice case that fits perfectly and is a nice quality case . The case is actually a keyboard case that hook the keyboard right to the tablet so you can use the touchscreen or the keyboard ( I prefer the keyboard for everything other than games )Setting up the tablet is very simple . It is just like setting up your laptop or PC with the Windows operating system . You choose your user name , password , time zone , etc then you will set up your wireless connections . The other tablets we have in our home all connect through our lower bandwidth WiFi but this IRULU tablet connected right to our high speed higher bandwidth modem so that was another HUGE plus for me. Once you get to the main screen where you see all of your goodies and it all looks exactly like your typical screen on your laptop except better .The picture on this IRULU tablet is great . The colors are perfect and spot on with what they should be . To test out exact how the colors were , we decided to watch Mickey Mouse on it while watching it on TV as well ( different shows but we mainly wanted to see how Mickey and friends looked so we could compare ) my son also had his Samsung tablet out and did the same . I was completely surprised that this tablet had an excellent picture that was even better than my sons big name brand tablet . We did not have any lag issues or have to constantly wait for video to buffer . It all loaded fast and the picture was good quality , good colors and very clear . ( Many tablets , including my iPad , tend to have too much green or Red undertones in them , but so far I have not noticed that with this tablet , I will update if that starts to happen )The sound quality on this is also good . I think if you turn it up super loud and add speakers then it gets distorted , but that happens with most anything you do that too . I did have to turn the volume up quiet a bit just to be able to hear it enough to watch a video , but once we got it to the volume level that we could hear , the vume was good and clear , it stayed steady without any interruptions .The sound and the video stayed in tune with each other , thankfully we didn't have any lips moving before the words actually came out of their mouths .The processor on this tablet seems to work very well and is quiet fast . We have used this on and off line without any issues so far at all . This has 1 gb tam which is really good for a tablet and I have put several movies and games on here so far in case my grandson wants to watch movies or play while we are driving or just relaxing at home .The camera on this takes a really good picture . It is right on par with the camera on my iPad and iPhone , and it has good focus on it .You have easy access buttons for your email , but nyer et explorer, facebook , camera, messenger , Google maps and more .Overall I am giving this tablet a solid 5 stars . You really cannot find a better high quality tablet at such an amazing price . This has everything you need on a daily basis , that you can easily take with you everywhere you go . The WiFi will connect anywhere , we have so far connected at home , McDonalds , Starbucks and at two other places with no problems at all . This tablet is fast , it has all the bells and whistles plus the added extras such as the keyboard case and the high pixel camera and I would highly recommend this to anyone . This would make an excellent gift for a teen or pretend first tablet , it's great for school or college and college kids can easily carry in bookbags without lugging around bulky laptops .I did receive this at a disclaimer by in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and all opinions are based on my personal experience with this IRULU 9" Windows Tablet PC.

When I was first offered a chance to receive this at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review, I was hesitant, I know how cats like to scratch and claw at things and had never used any soft carriers for cats before, but decided I would go ahead and give it a try ( AND if it didn't work for the Cat, I figured I could always let my girls use it for their stuffed animals, which I fully expected that was where it would end up)The first thing I noticed about this Pawfect Pet Carrier was how well made it is. The Carrier is made from High quality heavy duty materials. The material that the main part of the carrier is made of, id=s nice and thick and very strong. The Mesh on the sides and front is a thicker type of mesh that if you have a cat inside here, the cat will not easily claw through or in case of a dog or puppy, chew through. The form of the carrier is hard to help it hold the "Pawfect" shape that you need for the carrier to work.The handles on this case are amazing. We all knwo that just because your animal may be small enough to fit in here, doesn't always mean that they are small in weight. I have a Pug, he looks like he would be very light, but he is a former show dog and is very muscular and weighs in now at 27 pounds but only looks like he would weigh about 16-18 pounds. So the fact that I can put him in this carrier and actually pick him up and the handles hold firm, that shows me how well made and study they are. The handles also have a comfort part of the strap which is where you would typically carry it with which will protect your hands, shoulders, etc while you carry them. I read previous reviews that said the sides caved when they used the handles to carry the pets, but frankly, I honestly did NOT have that issue even though after reading the other reviews, I was expecting too, hence the reason I tried using my heavier dog that fit inside here.The inside of the carrier is very roomy, much larger than you would be expecting. The carrier has a solid hard flat piece to put on the bottom which also helps with the frame, to hold the shape of the carrier and then you place the nice fluffy and comfy padding that is included on top of the bottom form for the comfort of your pet. This also has a back pocket on the carrier where you can store a leash, small bag of food, collapsible water bowl, waste bags, etcNow, the funny thing is that I actually got this carrier for my Brother in laws Cat, he is attached to this cat, and when he was forced to move to a new apartment because the apartments he was living in, one caught fire which went over in to the others, he had to move, and the new place he found that was available and in his price range, did not allow pets, but he refused to give the cat away. So, having no other choice, he moved in to this " NO pets allowed " Apartment, even though we advised against it. He has inspections once a month, so each month on inspection day, he gets up really early, packs the cat, some litter, food and toys and walks his cat to our house where she stays in our garage for the day while he awaits the end of the monthly inspections. He literally carries her in his arms and walks the probably 1 mile here, then 1 mile back , because the cat hates the car ( he doesn't drive but we always offer rides) then when she is here, if my husband or I need to use the garage for anything, we have to first go out and put her in a small wire cage I have here for my dogs.His cat loves, loves, loves this carrier! As soon as I took it over to him when I received it, he set it up and just left it open, she started going in and out of it and eventually layed down inside on the comfy padding. Now you can frequently find her napping or relaxing inside of this instead of on top of the chair,couch or windowsill. So when he made the trek over to our house today, he said she had no issues being in the carrier while he walked here, she still screamed when we attempted to drive him home because it was raining, so he made us stop and he got out with his umbrella and walked the remainder of the way, but at-least he no longer has to worry about her jumping out of his arms and running off or getting hurt, and we no longer have to worry about catching her to put her in this wire cage in out garage because she was in the carrier every time we went to the garage today!Overall, a solid 5 stars for a well made, comfortable  and roomy carrier.I did receive this Pet Carrier at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and all opinions are based onpersonal experiences with this carrier.

You really can do so much with a blank canvas, and these bags are basically like a blank canvas and the sky is the limit.The first thing you will notice with these is that they are very well made. The Bags themselves are nice and thick, not flimsy like so many other brown bags like this that you buy. They have strong handles that are perfectly rounded and attached to the bag very securely so that you do not have to worry about the handles coming loose from the bag itself. These really are made from high quality paper and materials.So, what can you do with these bags? You can really do a lot. If you plan to use these as Gift Bags, then these can be used just as they are and would look cute if you add some tissue inside and a name tag, or you can pretty them up by adding some curled ribbon and different colored tissue paper inside with a nice sparkly name tag ( or any name tag really) and you can decorate the outside with markers ( We found that chalk markers actually work great on these bags and hold the color well without bleeding through ) or if you are crafty, you can get some cute prints of Duct Tape and make some shapes of even just random small strips and place sporadically on the bag and use long strips as your ribbon, cut it in half then fold the halves and drape it over the bag after securing it to the handles. Or you can use Duct Tape or decorative tape and make a striped pattern by doing a strip then leave a space then add another strip ( makes a cute chevron pattern )These bags hold quiet a bit. They are much larger inside than I actually expected and the bottoms are strong and well made. We actually had one bag filled and it weighed almost 8 pounds total and the bag still looked great and was not buckling or bulging at all and the bottom had no issues holding it. You will not have to worry about the glue coming loose or basically becoming so dry that the bag comes apart, as this is well secured , as all bags should be. ( However, we know that not all bags are made the same, thankfully these are great because I will admit I was worried when I first ordered them that they may end up being "crispy" as in dried out and falling apart)I think these would make great bags if you are giving away goody bags at an adult or kids party, Teacher Holiday Gifts and letting your child(ren) decorate them for each teacher themselves or for playing a fun game of your own version of dirty Santa or secret gift exchange.Pro's :Well MadeHeavy Paper ConstructionBottom securedExcellent handles properly securedCan be used "As Is" or decoratedLarge insideCon'sNoneOverall, I am very pleased with my purchase and will definitely buy more of these, they are going to be great for Christmas and Birthdays ( We have 7 children and 2 grandchildren so we go through a lot of nags and a lot of craft projects, so score for us on this product) I would recommend these to anyone considering these as an option especially for the upcoming Holiday season. You really can't go wrong and you can turn your Blank Canvas in to a work of art!I did receive these Paper Gift bags at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion, and all opinions are based on my personal experience with these paper gift bags.

High Quality, real cork, good to use not only for Wine making but for crafts as well. We love to make our own wine , so these will come in handy for that. These corks are very high quality. Amazingly soft, very functional, perfect for any new baby. So this would have been a home run for us.  This bib is great from the time you bring them home ( you know all the spit up and drool that dribbles down) and will be able to use for several months as well.This entire set washes well and holds its shape even after many washes. It is very vibrant in color and the color stays just as vibrant as well after many washes.Overall, an excellent set, well worth the money that would be a great gift or a great purchase for your own little one.I did receive this at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and all opinions are based on my personal experience with this Bamboo Moon baby Gift Set.

Such a fun clock! These are adorable. These brought back so many memories when I saw them that I just had to have them. I have tried so many different product since I was first diagnosed with my first Brain tumor two years ago, and as you would expect, nothing helped, always hoping and looking for my miracle drug or supplement and obviously have yet to find it, but this Pure Black Shilajit has made me feel better than I have felt in the past two years .I tried this a couple of different way, in water as a drink form and by simply making a pea sized ball and swallowing it like a pill. The taste is not great, so I chose to use it in a ball and swallow like a pill, but my husband likes the drink form. I have never tried Shilajit in any other way or form, not from any other company, and after using this, I feel like this is a winner for me, and I will continue to use this PurBlack Shilajit.I also have an Autoimmune disorder that basically means that any possible germ or virus that gets near me, makes me sick. Most times, if I go to my kids school or have my little ones around ( grand-kids) , I will end up sick for a few days after with whatever germ just happened to be passed around that week. PurBlack Shilajit  has not totally made my immune system where I can avoid all of this, but it really has made a noticeable difference. It has also made a huge difference in my overall attitude and the way I feel about life when I wake up and go through each day. Case in point was that I had my Grandson and Granddaughter over the weekend and we went to a popular outing for kids, normally I would expect to be sick all week from this, granted, I usually just keep pushing on, but this time I did not get sick at all. Was it because i had been taking this? I honestly cannot say for certain but I have not done anything else different and any other time in the same situation I would have had a virus of some sort after that.This actually may remind you of Tar, and even has the consistency in its rare form of tar, but it doesn't taste like tar and if you do add it to a drink, you really can't taste it much. ( I just prefer to swallow it because hey, the faster you get it down, the better right? )I have more energy than I have had in two years, to the point where everyone around me has noticed, and if you knew the person I was before my Brain Tumor and the person I was just 3 weeks ago, you would notice as well and this is a difference that literally brings tears to my eyes. Imagine never feeling like leaving home, not just depression but a serious lack of overall energy. Brain Surgery, Chemo , Spine surgery and overall bad health issues and I am not even 40..my life was going on a downward spiral and i hated it, I felt helpless, so if this continues and I feel more energy everyday, then this will be my wonder drug for sure and as of right now, for me, it is my miracle.I think this would honestly be good for anyone. My husband is healthy and a normal middle age male, but once he started taking this with me, even he has felt better ( He didn't even realize he didn't feel at his best until he started taking this) AND he has more energy as well. So it's a win-win situation in my house and I can easily recommend this to anyone no matter your age,health ailment or overall demeanor.I did receive this at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review and all opinions stated all based solely on my personal experience with Pure Black Shilajit.

Nice quality cables. We always find ourselves in need of these cords around our home. When I first saw these boots in the picture, I knew I had to have them, they were awesome. So my expectations were high before they even arrived. These boots are decently well made. They have quality materials used on them. The stitching is done beautifully and no loose or broken stitches anywhere.I love the look of how the Dark grey comes down over the black and appears like you have chaps or pants on over the boots themselves. The Leather top is very nice.I did have some issues with these boots. First, they are narrow, and even though my feet are not that wide and normally do not have to get a wider shoe, I feel like maybe these should come in a wide option as well . The next issue is that the zipper on the side has no real function, so even though they fit me fine, if you have larger calves, I would not recommend these simply because the zipper will not loosen the top part of the boot , so if your calves are large you will not be able to get these on. ( I had no problem but were my calves a tab bit larger I would not have been able to get them on) The zipper actually looks like it would zip from the bottom up, which could be a cool look I guess, but not when it has no real purpose. Obviously it tells you on the listing that the zipper is non functional, so pay attention.The decorative stitching is neat, adds a nice touch to the boots themselves. The boots do feel nice when I walk in them, but I did have to take them off after just a few hours, where with normal boots I can wear them all day without issue. So maybe this was just an issue with breaking them in, as I have now worn them 4 times and still cannot wear them for a long time period yet.I did receive these boots at a discount in exchange for my honest review and all opinions are solely my own based on my experience with these boots,  which sadly I now see is regular price ( or sale price as they show) which leads me to feel like they only marked these up for a few days to make a few of us feel as if we were getting a discount . These boots are worth the $49.00, you will pay that or more for good quality boots no matter where you go.

Such a cute shirt. The first thing you will notice when you receive this shirt s how soft it is. I have to say that I am honestly surprised at the awesome exceptional quality of this skirt. My husband is always having something that needs Soldered around here either for home or for our business. It has a transparent handle so that you can see inside. The handle itself is made of strong heat resistant materials ( It feels much better for me to hold than some of the others we have had that ended up getting too hot for me to touch) The Tips and iron are also well made and heavy duty yet not so heavy that you have to worry about them.This also has two additional tips for the soldering iron which are very easy to put on, they are simply screw on, screw off.Overall, this is an excellent Soldering Iron which is just as high quality as the ones we have paid triple for . I had previously tried Grapefruit Essential Oil from another company and was not impressed  , so when I was offered a chance to receive this at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion, I was not really very keen on it, but decided to give it a try anyway.I am very happy that I did because thankfully my first impression based on the other brand I had tried was nothing like what real Grapefruit Essential Oil really should smell like at all.This has an amazing smell and has quickly become my favorite smelling essential Oil by far. It also has helped with my bruising, I tend to bruise so easy but using this right away, it has helped to cut down the amount of time I keep those bruises.As with any Essential Oils you use, I think you will find they have some benefits for your health as long as you can get them as pure as possible. It's really hard to tel which ones are pure anymore, especially on Amazon as it seems like there are so many on here that claim to be 100 % pure, yet I have had many that look and smell like nothing more than vegetable oil.  Thankfully, that is not the case with this one, I could not smell anything unnatural in this oil. I have ax excellent sense of smell and my husband often will ask me even if the stuff on the ground smells like Antifreeze lol. Seriously though, I am super sensitive to smells and many oils I have purchased over the past couple of years have went in the trash within minutes, but these ( I have the entire 10 bottle set of Oils by Natural Acres that I received at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion)  are here to stay. I am comfortable using this and the other oils I received around my kids and pets . which really says a lot because I am really picky when it comes to what we choose to use around or home.The only issue I have with this was that when I opened up the box, the smell was really strong, and granted I had 10 oils in the box,and not one was leaking and one were wet or oily, but the smell was overpowering to the pint that we had the tie the box up in several small trash bags and put outside in our trash cans. I am not sure if maybe one had previously spilled in the box or around the box,  but thankfully none of mine had been spilled and my bottles were all good, so it worked out just fine for us.Overall, I will give these 5 stars. This Grapefruit  Essential Oil had  No unnatural smells, the bottles were completely full, The labels were easy to read with good details.As stated above, I did receive this Natural Acre's Essential Oil at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion and all opinions are based on my personal experience with this oil
