Finally, track down and watch "Beyond the Boundary: The Future".Note: When it comes to subtitles versus voice dubbing, I'm no purist; I'm willing to accept either though all things being equal I prefer dubbing to subbing so that I can watch what's showing on the rest of the screen easier.  However, all is not equal in this set.  For reasons I could only speculate upon, the subtitling is better, providing information the dubbing does not.  So if you would understand as much as possible about what is going on watch the subtitled version at least once, and pay attention.Note: The Collector's Edition comes with both Blu-ray and DVD discs, but basic sets are available a lot more cheaply in either Blu-ray or DVD only versions.  Of course you don't get the extra goodies in those, the most significant of which are those infamous red glasses, just perfect for collectors, cosplayers,... and perverts.
We won't be able to test the "heat tolerance" until next summer, but it is growing and filling in the bad area.
Gets the job done but the large holes get caught on things.
We noticed an improvement, but not necessarily enough to justify the bother of administering it.

Yet Another attempt to achieve peace by anything other than fighting for it (or being prepared to fight for it) fails while introducing new readers to an unusual, downright intriguing premise for a new middle grader series: a heroic boy mountain climber.  The absolutely laughable concept of mountain climbing for peace (but for that reason, also absolutely believable) falls apart when terrorists with a strong sense of irony attack. This is the second book, after Peak, and from what I can tell author Roland Smith knows what he is writing about, having added good research to personal experience at being a climber.

Quirky, oddball, perhaps even slightly mad but ultimately endearing characters make yet another cautionary tale about the consequences of time travel into one of the most memorable, heartrending tales you will ever watch.  Self-proclaimed mad scientist Rintarou Okabe attends (and disrupts) Dr. Nakabachi's seminar on time travel and has a number of unsettling experiences that will eventually mean much, ending with seeing Kurisu Makise lying in a pool of blood.  His almost inadvertent text to "Daru" Hashida, who was conducting experiments with his cell phone hooked up to a microwave at the time, triggers the first temporal anomaly, in which past events have changed leaving only Okabe to remember them.What follows are several mostly lighthearted episodes in which Okabe, Daru, and a very much alive Kurisu Makise conduct experiments first to prove and then to understand and improve upon the time travel mechanism they have stumbled upon, including allowing some of their friends to try to alter past events more to their liking.  This builds slowly to a cataclysmic event at the end of episode 12 and several shocking reveals.  Now the show's tone grows increasingly dark as an increasingly frantic Okabe, who is the only one able to fully remember all the time changes, attempts to undo the horrific events he unintentionally unleashed or caused to be set in motion.  With the aid of a Kurisu Makise he must repeatedly explain the time changes to, can Okabe leap backwards through time carefully enough to fix the mess he has created?And can he bear the ever increasing emotional cost?Note: This set contains all 24 episodes of the TV show, plus the OAV episode "Egoistic Poriomania" set two months after the end of the show on both Blu-ray and DVD but does NOT contain either "Steins;Gate the Movie: Burdened Domain of Déjà Vu" set a year after the end of the series nor the four "Steins;Gate The Sagacious Wisdom of Cognitive Computing" animated shorts.  IMHO these last two are nice-to-haves fans will wish to watch online at least one, particularly the movie as it first annoyingly presents another obstacle to a HEA ending but then pretty cleverly resolves it while tying off a few loose ends left over from the show.  Hopefully it will be released on home video in the not too distant future.Note: Steins Gate began as a visual novel available in various formats.Steins;Gate - PC (Regular Edition),Steins;Gate - PC (Limited Edition),Steins;Gate - PlayStation 3,Steins;Gate - PlayStation Vita.
Dark, chilling, southern tale about young people behaving badly, the consequences of such, and adults behaving badly in response.

Of course the Sun King is a direct reference to King Louis XIV of France, but I contend that the more apt comparison is with Napoleon Bonaparte.  Louis never conquered the world, but Napoleon came fairly close.  Louis was actually shorter than Napoleon, but due to differences between the lengths of the French and British inches and the fact that Napoleon was usually surrounded by exceptionally tall bodyguards, the myth that Napoleon was short is the one that has come down to us.  Finally, while both men had plenty of women, only Napoleon was truly in love with one woman and one woman only:the Empress Josephine, an unconventional woman, who was older than he was.At the age of 15 Livius I is the ruler of his world, following a three-year campaign of conquest characterized by military brilliance and utter ruthlessness that began when he ascended to the throne after his mother's assassination.  You could say that the murder of his mother changed him, even unhinged him, but you'd better not say it in his presence.  Livius' victory has brought peace and prosperity to most peoples in most places, because (unlike Napoleon) he is about as competent at ruling as he is at conquering, but Livius is a little bit bored with peace.  He is never more alive than when he is dodging assassination attempts and calculating how to use them as excuses to justify crushing his remaining enemies, whether they had anything to do with it or not.Somewhere in all of this the decision was made that it was time for Livius to marry, but as with everything else, cold, ruthless calculation was behind it, not love, and certainly not lust.  The far off (but not far enough off) Principality of Rain was told that if they wished to keep their autonomy, they must provide Livius with a bride from among the four royal daughters, all of whom possessed the royal family's traditional magical power of summoning rain, something that would be very useful in Livius' home country, the Sun Kingdom, an arid land Livius had already put considerable effort into building an irrigation system for.  Though generally accepting of the idea that it was the duty of at least the younger royal daughters to make advantageous marriages for their homeland, having heard nothing but bad things about Livius, no one was willing to volunteer for the job so the youngest, 17 year old Nike got the nod after losing a game of rock, paper, scissors.As expected these two initially got along about as well as matter and antimatter (within minutes of meeting Livius, Nike gets herself thrown into prison to starve; she breaks out that night spouting threats to kill, fillet, and eat Livius), but gradually grow fond of each other as they begin to understand each other through various shared adventures that run the gamut from comical to deadly serious.  In the manga the story continues, but this is a pretty good place to end the anime, though I'd prefer to see more.Note: This show is only subtitled in English. There is no English voice dubbing.

After fifteen years of brutal, indecisive warfare between humans and demons, a human Hero comes along, equipped with great fighting skills and overwhelming magical powers, ready to end the war with a single stroke by slaying the Demon King, but after leaving behind his equally heroic companions and storming the Demon King's castle alone, he finds a beautiful demon girl who says that she is the Demon King and that she belongs to him, and he to her, and has ever since he was born.  Instead of fighting and killing each other she suggests that they join forces, in what is all but name a marriage contract, and discover a way to end the war in such a way as to bring real peace and true prosperity to both humans and demons alike.This truly is an odd one, in many ways reminiscent of Spice & Wolf, that proposes to teach you something while telling you a story, namely how improvements in food production, education, and certain scientific breakthroughs can lead to increasing prosperity, greater freedom, and peace.  As such, the most exciting scenes are not the battles, though they are exciting enough, but rather other things: a fiery stem-winder of a speech that rouses a population of cowering peasants into a revolutionary army, an intricate commodity futures trading scheme that undermines a more powerful enemy's war effort, and an abandoned human garrison and associated merchants working out a power sharing arrangement with the demon inhabitants of a human conquered city whose trust said garrison's good behavior has earned and who have no desire to see war roll through their hometown for a second time.It is also a hilarious, fan service featuring harem tale, as both the Demon King (Queen) and the Female Knight struggle to get the virgin Hero they are both in love with to make up his dithering mind, which does not get easier when the Fire Dragon demon clan Grand Princess joins the contest.Defects?  Well, the lack of character names takes some getting used to; everyone in this world is known simply by his or her title: the Hero, the Demon King, the Knight, etc.  More importantly a noticeable amount of detail was lost cramming this story into a mere 12 episodes; in particular the Mage, a character apparently inhabited by three spirits simultaneously is barely utilized and not at all explained.  Still, this was a fun and, yes, educational romp that I'd love to see continued or amplified in English translations of the novels and the manga.Just be careful if you watch it.  Like the stubborn, pigheaded sons of nobles personally taught by the Demon King in disguise as the Crimson Scholar, if you are not careful, you might learn something,...without even realizing it.Note: This show is only subtitled in English.  There is no English voice dubbing.

You probably remember the second "Miracle on Ice", when a pickup team of enthusiastic Americans defeated the mighty Soviet team and went on to win Olympic gold in hockey.  Well, this is the story of the first one, only this miracle was performed on the ice of the bobsled run.  Deserves to be made into a movie as well.

This device provided some small amount of relief, once I figured out the correct size, but that took trying a couple to figure this out.  For this reason first time users should probably start by purchasing the Rhinomed Turbine Nasal Dilator for Athletic Breathing, 3 Pak Assorted, from then on purchasing three-packs in your correct size:Rhinomed Turbine Nasal Dilator for Athletic Breathing, 3 Pak Large,Rhinomed Turbine Nasal Dilator for Athletic Breathing, 3 Pak Medium,Rhinomed Turbine Nasal Dilator for Athletic Breathing, 3 Pak Small.
This is a good, basic apron, nothing special, but functional.
I was surprised at how helpful this product was in humid Florida, but in fact it cleared up some skin irritation that I was blaming on too much moisture.

If you have someone who is really interested in My Little Pony Equestria dolls, this makes a nice play set.  You will need not included 3 AAA batteries for the DJ booth; it plays 3 short instrumental tunes with matching light shows.  Making it so it can be folded up smaller than the original box without (much) disassembly is a nice feature, but one wishes for more secure storage for the smaller pieces, which can fall out.
A rather fascinating premise marred by completely unbelievable diplomatic breaches and not much of an ending as we segue into the series, with See How They Run as the next book.

With most room heaters, you end up either huddling around it or retreating to the edges of the room, depending on your personal comfort range and the chosen setting.  This is only the second one I've tried where the temperature achieved around the heater and at the edges of the room feel pretty much the same., and unlike the Vornado MVH Whole Room Vortex Heater, Black, this model has a temperature setting thermostat.Defects?  The lack of an EFFECTIVE fan only setting.  Oh it has one, but that setting doesn't move anything like the speed or volume of air that a regular fan would.  So much for any hopes of an all season appliance.
A fascinating beginning to a very different sort of fantasy trilogy.

Note: The publisher has unfortunately given the same exact titles to both the light novels and the numerically corresponding manga volumes, when they already had the same author and illustrator!  Now, since the stories in both are basically identical (except that Volume 2 of the manga only covers from Chapter 6 of the first novel through the first part of Chapter 1 of the second novel, leaving the rest to Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon?, Vol. 3 (manga), chances are that if you love one you will also love the other, with the novels giving you more details and the manga giving you more visuals.  However, in order to purchase the version you actually want, you must be sitting on the correct product page.For the novel click here: Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon?, Vol. 2 (novel).For the manga click here: Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon?, Vol. 2 (manga).Note: Another reason for purchasing both is that some manga volumes include text pieces apparently cut from the novels.  For example Vol. 2 (manga) includes a Special Episode "The Goddess' Job Situation" apparently cut from Chapter 1 of Vol. 2 (novel).Note: An animated TV series has also been produced in Japan and made available at various digital outlets in this country though not yet officially released on home video.  Having seen it, I can assert that it is excellent also and tracks the light novels and manga very well, though of necessity it cuts out the most story.  The second part of TV episode 2 and episode 3 correspond to this manga.Dungeons & Dragons the Fantasy Roleplaying Game has inspired countless novels and stories (and a hilarious comedy sketch about some gamers with goals somewhat similar to Bell's on Take Down The Grand Master by The Dead Alewives), not to mention an entire industry of roleplaying games, but very few good novels and stories incorporating anything of the game system itself.  In fact I'd venture to say that this series is the first success at it and a true joy to read for gamers and non-gamers alike, besides.The story that began in Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon?, Vol. 1 (manga) continues.  Having obtained the magical knife she wanted to get for Bell from her former BFF Hephaistos through a combination of intense begging, promises to work it off, and maybe, just maybe starting to convince Hephaistos that she has really changed, Hestia decides to wait to give it to him until after their "date" at the Monster Festival (Bell is actually trying to bring a purse to a friend who had forgotten it.)  This proves nearly disastrous as Freya, the Goddess of Beauty, who has become infatuated with Bell, decides to test him by releasing several monsters, in particular a giant white-haired gorilla that she sends after Hestia.  Soon Bell and Hestia are fleeing for their lives.  Realizing he can neither beat this monster nor flee it forever while carrying Hestia, Bell decides to sacrifice his life so that Hestia can escape, leaving her behind sputtering and unable to give him the magic knife.  Can Hestia catch up to Bell before he is killed and give him both the status update and the weapon he needs to win?Meanwhile, though Bell is too clueless to see it, his potential harem is assembling right before his eyes.  Every girl he gets to know seems to end up falling for him: for his honesty, for his kindness, for his work ethic, for his innocence and purity, even for his courage, usually on display when he's the most scared out of his wits: his goddess, his guild supervisor, waitresses at his local tavern, Freya the Goddess of Beauty (What a piece of work she is!), even Aiz Wallenstein, his secret crush and the greatest female adventurer of all time, though she is getting depressed over the way he screams and runs away every time she saves him (she's obviously starting to think there is something wrong, something monstrous about her).The adventure continues in Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon?, Vol. 3 (manga).

The juxtaposition of comedy and horror is not especially unusual, but I've rarely seen such absolutely lunatic comedy contrasted with such gruesome horror, which makes for some pretty wide swings in overall episode mood.  If you haven't seen it before, you never know whether in a given episode you are going to see our heroes tangling with monsters that can merely make them smell bad or monsters that can rip their bodies or their minds to shreds.  Thus IMHO the comedy serves a useful purpose: it allows us to get to know (and get to like) the characters under less stressful than life or death situations and it lightens the mood because without it this would be a pretty depressing ordeal.At its most basic Beyond the Boundary is Yet Another story about young monster slayers.  The monsters are Youmu, invisible-to-ordinary-humans spirit creatures, said to be the product of negative human emotions.  As a result, most (though by no means all) youmu are harmful, ranging from annoying pranksters through vicious killers to world consuming horrors, and the only thing standing between them and us are a relative handful of young men and women with the spiritual affinity necessary to see youmu and the supernatural abilities (and the willingness to use them) necessary to destroy them.  Finally, when a youmu is killed, it drops a Youmu Stone, which can be exchanged for money at a sanctioned appraiser who pays out according to things like aggressiveness, degree of difficulty, etc.  This is strangely similar to how the economy works in the light novel/manga/anime series  Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon, but with two important differences.  In IIWTTTPUGIAD adventurers slay monsters for fame, fortune,... and girls (Don't ask!), but in BTB the only practical goal is money.  After all there isn't much fame to be had for slaying monsters most people cannot even see and which you are not even allowed to talk about with normies, and spirit world warriors tend to have it pretty awful in the romance department.  For example Shizuku Ninomiya, a rather attractive and personable (if slightly silly) spirit world warrior working as a teacher at the high school most of the characters attend gets dumped so often it has become a joke to her spirit world oblivious students.  Izumi Nase, effective head of the Nase clan of spirit world warriors goes so far as to counsel her younger sister, Mitsuki, to stay alone until she retires, something Izumi seems to be practicing herself, which has resulted in Mitsuki missing out on most normal childhood experiences with her "normal" peers.  In light of this, spirit world warrior Yayoi Kanbara producing a child with a youmu father doesn't seem all that inconceivable, in any sense of the word.Into this grim situation come our two main protagonists: Akihito Kanbara, the half human, half youmu product of said union and Mirai Kuriyama, the last living member of a cursed and nearly exterminated clan of spirit world warriors that use their own blood as a lethal weapon, and amazingly, joyously, they manage to hit it off, though naturally they are the last to know it.  Despite his fetish for glasses, her overuse of the phrase that translates to "how unpleasant", and an entire box full of screwball comedy romantic complications, not to mention all this spirit world business, they gradually, oh, so gradually fall in love, but is happiness even possible for them in this world where the greatest evil comes not from rampaging youmu but rather from the horrifyingly corrupt human mind and heart?Let's just say it comes to a satisfying ending IMHO,...or rather it SEEMS to....I've got to give the creators credit, they made a sincere effort to give those viewers who would rather stop here a seemingly happy ending, but the story isn't really happily ended, not by a long shot.  I'll give you one word:amnesia.Yes, it's the most overused trick in an author's toolbox, but it is used with great care and skill here.  If someone had lived a life filled with misery and regret, wouldn't said person be happier if it were now possible to live without all those sad memories?  Even if it meant you had to give up associating?  Even if you had been in love?  More importantly, do you have the right to make that decision for someone else?  All these questions are considered in a story that also ties up some loose ends from the TV show you might have forgotten about in the rush of the cataclysmic climax.  This is the plot of "Beyond the Boundary: The Future", the second of two movies produced after the series ended, the first "Beyond the Boundary: The Past", being a compilation film, and though watching the compilation is optional, watching the second really isn't if you would have a true happy ending.  Unfortunately, it is only available online at present, but hopefully Sentai Filmworks will eventually release it as well.  Interestingly, to a much greater extent than the TV series, it drives home a moral that works for spirit world warriors and normies alike: don't go it alone.  A burden shared is a burden eased whether you are talking about couples, families, or friends.  In a time when the increasing tendency is to get completely wrapped up in our own worlds with our own problems, that's good and perhaps even necessary advice.Note: All versions of this TV series complete collection include a prequel OAV Episode 0 that shows what happened when Akihito and the Nase family first met and 5 episodes of "Beyond the Boundary Trial Idol!" which amount to a self-parody.  I would recommend watching Episode 0 first, before the 12 regular episodes and then watching the 5 idol trial episodes afterwards because otherwise they will make no sense.  Finally, track down and watch "Beyond the Boundary: The Future".Note: When it comes to subtitles versus voice dubbing, I'm no purist; I'm willing to accept either though all things being equal I prefer dubbing to subbing so that I can watch what's showing on the rest of the screen easier.  However, all is not equal in this set.  For reasons I could only speculate upon, the subtitling is better, providing information the dubbing does not.  So if you would understand as much as possible about what is going on watch the subtitled version at least once, and pay attention.Note: The Collector's Edition comes with both Blu-ray and DVD discs, but basic sets are available a lot more cheaply in either Blu-ray or DVD only versions.  Of course you don't get the extra goodies in those, the most significant of which are those infamous red glasses, just perfect for collectors, cosplayers,... and perverts.

More than anything this reminds me of The Death of Meriwether Lewis: A Historic Crime Scene Investigation, a book based on the theory that Meriwether Louis was murdered as part of a conspiracy.  The author of that book claims that proof of this will be found when his body is disinterred ,... but the federal government, which owns the land the grave sits upon, refuses to allow it.Shouldn't you wait until you've acquired the data you need to prove your case before you publish a book about it?

You can hazard a few guesses about what you are going to get with a mentally ill girl who blames everything bad that happens on her "evil twin", and chances are, one of those guesses will prove to be correct here.

At 55 I'm getting up there, and at least until I started going to a gym recently, I had begun to notice a little wobbliness in my footing in the shower so I leaped at the chance to try this.  All they were offering for testing purposes was the pizza slice shape intended for corner showers, but placing it crossways of the standard sized bathtub in my hotel room made it fit.The result?  Stable footing for the first time since I moved here.Note: These mats are available in four different colors and four different shapes so be sure you are selecting the one you want:DII 15.75 by 39" Non Slip Transparent Safety Grip Suction Cups Vinyl Bath Tub Mat with Drain Cutout, Large, Blue,DII 15.75 by 39" Non Slip Transparent Safety Grip Suction Cups Vinyl Bath Tub Mat with Drain Cutout, Large, Clear,DII 15.75 by 39" Non Slip Transparent Safety Grip Suction Cups Vinyl Bath Tub Mat with Drain Cutout, Large, Purple,DII 15.75 by 39" Non Slip Transparent Safety Grip Suction Cups Vinyl Bath Tub Mat with Drain Cutout, Large, Teal,DII 15 by 27.5" Non Slip Transparent Safety Grip Suction Cups Vinyl Bath Tub Mat, Medium, Blue,DII 15 by 27.5" Non Slip Transparent Safety Grip Suction Cups Vinyl Bath Tub Mat, Medium, Clear,DII 15 by 27.5" Non Slip Transparent Safety Grip Suction Cups Vinyl Bath Tub Mat, Medium, Purple,DII 15 by 27.5" Non Slip Transparent Safety Grip Suction Cups Vinyl Bath Tub Mat, Medium, Teal,DII 20.25 by 20.25" Non Slip Transparent Safety Grip Suction Cups Rounded Triangle Vinyl Bath Tub Mat, Small, Blue,DII 20.25 by 20.25" Non Slip Transparent Safety Grip Suction Cups Rounded Triangle Vinyl Bath Tub Mat, Small, Clear,DII 20.25 by 20.25" Non Slip Transparent Safety Grip Suction Cups Rounded Triangle Vinyl Bath Tub Mat, Small, Purple,DII 20.25 by 20.25 " Non Slip Transparent Safety Grip Suction Cups Rounded Triangle Vinyl Bath Tub Mat, Small, Teal,DII 20.75 by 21.75" Non Slip Transparent Safety Grip Suction Cups Square Vinyl Bath Tub Mat, Blue,DII 20.75 by 21.75" Non Slip Transparent Safety Grip Suction Cups Square Vinyl Bath Tub Mat, Clear,DII 20.75 by 21.75" Non Slip Transparent Safety Grip Suction Cups Square Vinyl Bath Tub Mat, Purple,DII 20.75 by 21.75" Non Slip Transparent Safety Grip Suction Cups Square Vinyl Bath Tub Mat, Teal.
This is an odd one.  A creepy mystery involving a serial killer goes sideways along with the timeline.
An intriguing recreation of a story Will hinted at but never told from "Much Ado About Nothing".
A slow beginning builds to an epic, if inevitable, ending.

The heroic State Department employee (seriously) from The Golden Hour returns with another interesting theory about the criticality of the timing of diplomatic efforts in a crisis and with the able assistance of a wife with an even more interesting job.

I selected this as a possible improvement over/replacement for our TP-LINK TL-WR842ND N300 Multi-function Wireless Router, 2.4GHz, 802.11n/g/b, 1 USB port, 2 detachable antennas, VPN, 4 SSIDs, but after giving this one a good try, it will be going back into the box while the TP-LINK is going back in line.Why?  Partly it is a matter of not needing the extra features and power in our home network, but also we didn't like the way EVERYTHING required choosing a password; the "no password" option might be stupid for people in different circumstances, but we'd have liked it.  In the end this would probably be of more use in an apartment or restaurant based setup than an ordinary home.
Something I conclude from the lack of closure here, and didn't appreciate.

There is nothing all that secret in here; most people will recognize the "rightness" of the concepts taught as soon as they are read.  But it is one thing to recognize, it is another to put into practice.
Probably would have benefitted from less emphasis on the gross and more emphasis on the plot, which is pretty interesting.  Not for sensitive stomachs.

In this age of technological advancement, we sometimes forget that accomplishment is still basically about getting people to do what is needed (leadership) and conveying these truths on an individual basis.  Gus Lee's excellent book reminds us.

But al least it is an interestingly dressed and equipped action figure. Add one more figure and you can make use of this WWE Create a WWE Superstar Ring Builder Playset, which comes with no figures.Note: The enclosed temporary tattoos are for the action figure NOT your child because of skin irritation possibilities.

Compared to modern metal detectors this is just a toy, but it is a great way to get children started on a hobby that could last them a lifetime.Defects?  IMHO it is the lack of a handle with controls at the top.  Using this device absolutely requires crawling on your hands and knees.Well, at least a kid won't have to worry about Daddy "borrowing" it and going off metal detecting by himself!

But al least it is an interestingly dressed and equipped action figure. Add one more figure and you can make use of this WWE Create a WWE Superstar Ring Builder Playset, which comes with no figures.Note: The enclosed temporary tattoos are for the action figure NOT your child because of skin irritation possibilities.

A biting satire of the publishing industry was a potentially interesting idea, but perhaps because author Mal Peet was dying (and knew it) it came off much darker than expected.  "Phantasy" publishing is certainly deserving of a good satirizing but perhaps it would be better done by someone less bitter.
Mine may have been a defective return as it was missing both instructions and batteries, and does not work.A pity.

A big book about an actor as multitalented (and a person as genuinely interesting) as Bill Murray would bhroe a great idea, but only if Bill Murray himself were involved.  Plus, the topical rather than chronological arrangement simply confused.

As several other reviewers have pointed out, this book is largely composed of sections reprinted from Lonely Planet's larger France books.  If doing this will allow you to stuff this in your pocket and leave the Big Boys in your hotel, it may be of use to you; otherwise, you might as well stick to the larger books.

I've something of a love-hate relationship with Clive Cussler.  On the one hand, I love the way he works fascinating, occasionally obscure, historical events unexpectedly into his plots, on the other, I hate the way he comes up with amazing, world changing ideas, events, discoveries, and inventions...that never actually change the world, which is right back to where it was at the beginning of the next book.  In many ways Jack Du Brul is following directly in his footsteps, which makes for a frustrating read.  If you can turn your Logical Nitpicker not off but down a bit, you will enjoy this more.

This book is a throwback to the heady days of The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Handbook, back before the creators of that masterpiece got lazy and greedy and tried to pad their immense bank accounts by slapping their trademark on every piece of crap they could come up with, such as their nearly worthless (in part because nearly scenario free) almanacs like The Worst-Case Scenario Almanac: History and The Worst-Case Scenario Almanac: Politics.  Readers get a respectable 85 scenarios in 224 pages on all sorts of topics of varying degrees of likelihood, from how to survive "someone who 'thinks outside the box' in meetings" to how to survive an earthquake or a tsunami to how to survive a zombie attack or time travel, all delivered with the same serious-with-only-the-slightest-wink attitude.About the only nit to pick is the lack of a pocketable paperback edition; in many of these scenarios you are unlikely to have access to (or room for) either a bulky hardback or a Kindle edition.

The problem is that there is a relatively simple technique other reviewers have noted that can render the info you've blotted out with this device readable again.  That doesn't make it completely useless, not every piece of your personal info requires the same level of protection,...but keep running the most Top Secret stuff through your shredder.

Here's an exciting throwback: a children's book written in 1962 available in English in a brand new translation.  As with any half century old book, especially one from another culture and another country, readers should be tolerant of any noncompliance with current standards of Political Correctness.

I got the opportunity to try both this product and Hershey's Caramels in Milk Chocolate Stand-Up Bags, 7.2 Ounce (Pack of 15) and could not help but notice that the chocolates shipped in the tin had not melted though the ones in the bag had. I wonder if this might be due to the fact that Hershey's makes a special box designed to protect their chocolate tins from the elements.

A truly slow-moving first book in a trilogy has our heroine fleeing the man who murdered her parents for her gold finding abilities, disguised as a boy, journeying and Journeying and JOURNEYING to Gold Rush California.

This would be a more accurate name for the game but one more likely to result in lawsuits.  Think Pictionary with clay instead of paper.  The problem is that it is going to be more expensive replacing the clay when it gets used up than it will be replacing thh

The Sorcerer to the King has got some problems.  Some he cannot do anything about, like the fact that he is black, an emancipated slave, in a society where racial prejudice exists.  Others he very much hopes that he can, like the fact that England's magical stocks are drying up because that is certainly within the job description.  Then he meets a woman with extraordinary magical powers , in a society where women are taught to suppress their magical powers and leave this to the men.  Is she just another problem for him?Or part of the solution?

I needed a safe to keep our important documents in so that if there were ever a flood or fire the papers would be safe. This thing is a SOLID. It is really, really heavy. I feel it will get the job done but hopefully I never have to find out.My only complaint is that it needs to be a smidge wider on the inside for my manila envelopes (9X12 size). I have to put them in at diagonal.Be cautious if there are children around and be cautious yourself. If this thing slams down on your fingers you may break something. There isn't a safety mechanism to keep it from slamming down fast and hard.

This is great storage for our pet food. I didn't even realize it came with the scoop. I missed that part so that was a cool surprise. The scoop is like a big measuring cup, with marks for 1/2 cup, 1 cup, etc. so you know how much food you're giving your pet.My only complaint is that the top bin doesn't lock on to the bottom bin. In order to get into the larger bin you'll have to remove the top every time or risk it falling off. There are, however, grooves so that the top bin settles against the lid of the bottom bin nicely. It does not lock on and can fall off if you push too hard when rolling the unit around.Overall I feel this storage unit is strong and sturdy. I like the wheels. I love the color (Blue Moon/Gray). Could use for so many other purposes other than pet food, too. We use the bottom bin for dog food and the top for cat food. We bought a separate, smaller scoop for the cat food from another company (OXO) here on Amazon and should have a review for that if you check my reviews.

I have been a Boppy user with five babies. My Boppy was used so much to the point I finally had to toss it. Well yay, baby #6 is on the way and I find myself trying to justify the cost of a $40 pillow that I won't use as often as I did when having the first five because this is likely our last child. I came across this NurSit pillow and I was REALLY hesitant to purchase. I noticed great reviews, the pics show a decent looking pillow so I decided to take the chance. I got the cloud print with removable pink cover.It arrived in a plastic bag, with rope handle, much like a Boppy. I noticed right away that the packaging states it is filled and finished in the USA with recycled and hypoallergenic material. This pillow is FULL and so plump. I haven't measured next to a Boppy but I think it is plumper than Boppy. Part of my hesitation to purchase this pillow, sight unseen, was because I did not want a flat pillow. I found that my Boppy was getting flatter and flatter over time. I need my nursing pillow to be nice and full; that's how I prefer it when nursing my baby (I see others left reviews in the negative for that but it's a positive in my book!). I do not want to have to lean over to reach baby when nursing. A plump pillow means baby is closer to my chest.The fabric itself is super soft. I feel that the fabric texture is definitely comparable to Boppy. One thing Boppy does have going for it is that they have more chic and modern prints. But you'll be covering up the print on this NurSit pillow anyway which leads me to..........My only issue - why is the print on the main body of the pillow, only to be covered up with a boring solid colored cover? That seemed odd to me. For the price this issue isn't a deal breaker whatsoever. I just found it a little backward.I will update my review when baby is here and I've actually used it for intended purposes (feeding baby).My first impressions lead me to leave a five-star review at this time! In fact if this pillow is everything I'm hoping and dreaming when I actually nurse baby I'll be getting a second pillow to keep on another floor of the house (I always forget to grab my pillow when going up and down the stairs all day!).

I love the way this toothpaste makes my mouth feel. I was using this same toothpaste but in the mint flavor BUT I prefer the cinnamon. So this review is specifically for the cinnamon flavored one. My mouth just feels cleaner when I use the cinnamon. It is a more expensive toothpaste compared to common brands but it's worth it to me when it comes to my oral health. My kids will use this one but the younger ones (under age 4) do complain that it is spicy if they get too much. So I do caution about that. This toothpaste does foam up when using and it is a paste, not a gel. Two thumbs up from me! It's my absolutely favorite toothpaste.

Perfect gift for my 2-year-old son. He is obsessed with guitars. So much so that he will find a stick or any other random object and pretend it is a guitar! This toy guitar isn't realistic looking or sounding but it is fun and he feels 'just like daddy' with his own guitar.

Purchased 2/9/2014 (over one year ago) and this case stretches out. When first received the phone fit nice and snug. Over time the plastic stretches out to the point the phone falls out so it doesn't fulfill it's purpose which is to protect the phone. And yes the phone broke and had to be replaced.Prefer phone cases that are silicone with plastic casing that snaps over it as it is way more secure and have found those cases for half the cost of this one. This case wasn't worth the cost especially when the phone broke while in this case.

Great gift but the book part seems to be falling apart after very minimal reading. Music is absolutely phenomenal, the magnets are fun. So just took off a star for poor spine construction on the book.

These tests are pretty substantial and heavy duty. I normally use FRER but found this pack of Clearblue digitals for less money here on Amazon and with free Prime shipping. I am pretty loyal to something that I know works and I have never used these "weeks estimator" tests before. I have PCOS and have low progesterone in the first trimester, which can lead to miscarriage. Because of this I test every cycle, even though we were not actively trying to have a baby, because I have to get supplements to prevent miscarriage. This means I take a lot of pregnancy tests and price matters!Okay so that aside I took one of the tests mid-December. Due to longer cycles I was kind of guessing when I should test. It came up Not Pregnant. Later on in the month, on 12/29, I realized I still hadn't gotten a period. PCOS can cause irregularity and long cycles so I didn't actually suspect anything. I took the second test and surprisingly it popped up with Pregnant and 1-2 Weeks!!! I still cannot believe it, a month later.So I don't give this brand five stars because I got pregnant. I give five stars because 1). the tests are just really impressive with overall design and advanced technology, 2). they are accurate when used correctly, and 3). the price was right for a pack of three especially when they're so well made.I see a lot of reviews about how these tests fluctuate with the week estimations. Take that with a grain of salt, people. A lot can affect how much hCG is detectable in urine at the time of the test. Go by your blood tests and sonograms. The week estimation is not to take place of your medical professional nor indicate a problem (miscarriage, ectopic, etc.). Listen to your doctor/midwife and to your body if something feels wrong.

Got these as Christmas gifts and they're a huge hit. So happy to have found a set that included Wyld Style and Emmett AND Uni-Kitty. Just wish it came with President Business instead of Bad Cop. But can't complain. There were several extra pieces in our sets in case pieces were missing or defective so that alone is pretty great as I've gotten sets in the past that were missing key components. We used a lot of the extra colorful pieces to make the Cuckoo Palace even more spectacular and colorful. Each of the faces is double-sided (for example Emmett has a regular face but a scared face on the other side if you turn it around).

These are amazing and almost too cute to use as intended! I've been in love with these since I saw some in a boutique. Amazon's pricing is just right (boutique was almost triple the cost) and this made a great gift for a loved one this Christmas. She loved it!

It's okay. It tastes similar to the Simply Salted, maybe a little more butter flavor (does Orville even make Simply Salted? I may be mixing brands up here). The bags are really small, which is good when you want a bag to yourself. It didn't blow me out of the water. Maybe I should try the lime one. It doesn't sound like it'd taste good but looks like it has good reviews. I had no problem microwaving this popcorn; nothing got burned. Microwaved for 1.30 like the package directions stated. Leaving a neutral review for a neutral popcorn that just felt bland.

It hurts, it works, it's worth it. I used it on my chin like two weeks ago and only had to pluck a couple strays that showed up since. I did do some upper lip but that seriously hurt so much more than the chin. Just do it quick. I can imagine that it feels the same as waxing but isn't that quick rip that waxing provides (haven't waxed so not sure). I have PCOS and, while I'm not exactly The Bearded Lady, I want my face to look smooth and youthful and, well, hairless. It's been bothering me for awhile. I feel like not having to duck my head and hide embarrassing hairs makes me a more confident person.

I have never used an epilator. I liked the idea of it. But when I got it, plugged it in and turned it on... I just couldn't bring myself to use it. Those tweezers move FAST. And the thing is loud, like really loud. I have nothing to compare this particular one, too. Several days later I finally got brave, got it out and just did it. It hurts, I won't lie. It's not unbearable. I imagine it is very similar to getting a tattoo. After a few passes your skin starts to go a little numb. It takes some time, longer than shaving. I had to go over several areas more than once. I only did my calves. They immediately got red bumps ALL over. But by morning the red bumps were gone. It was just irritation.So back to the speed of these tweezers rolling around the barrels... it moves fast. I was terrified to set it against my skin! So the first calve that I did had way more irritation and red bumps because I was having to go over spots several times. By the time I got to my second calve I was more comfortable and was able to work faster and more efficiently.Overall I'm pleased with the results. I just barely have any stubble and it's been about five days since I first used it. I usually have stubble the NEXT day after shaving. As I use it more I expect the redness from irritation to lessen and lessen. Worth not having to shave for a week or two! I knocked off a star because I hate how loud it is (it annoyed everyone!).

Just got my phone case and it arrived the same day as my new 5c. I got a blue 5c and I'd say the blue of this pink&blue case are *almost* identical. As far as the case itself goes: the blue part is the silicone. I love silicone on my phone because I feel it absorbs the impact if the phone gets dropped, as opposed to a metal/wood/plastic case with no silicone. The pink part of this particular phone is the plastic that snaps together after you put the blue silicone on. It's a hard plastic but it looks like this slick metallic hot pink. It's awesome! It almost has this velveety feel to it, too. I'm going to be getting other colors so the blue of my 5c stands out around the camera and the apple logo. Very impressed and happy with my purchase thus far.

We just finished watching the movie. Highly disappointed. Nothing like the historical role models. Isabelle constantly scowled and looked forlorn, was very jealous of others instead of making an effort to better herself, spoke rudely and nastily to her sister and to a bully. Returning nastiness for nastiness is NOT okay in my book. Also, these AG girls are to be role models, using their hardships to provide other young girls with a moral compass to follow on the path to success and giving back to the community selflessly.What I expected and hoped for: a young girl who faced challenges but overcame them with poise and an admirable attitude. A girl who encouraged other young girls to keep on trying, even if you mess up again and again. I wanted a role model!That wasn't to be. The movie was 3/4 whining and drama. I also didn't appreciate the dances outside of the actual ballet classes/performance. They were moves that my young girls don't need to be imitating. I don't care if that is what is the "norm" now. It doesn't make it right. We'll be sticking to Molly, Samantha and the classics. This one is going in the trash. So unfortunate as my oldest daughter LOVES her Isabelle doll and is in ballet herself! We are using this video as a teaching tool on how NOT to act or react (quite the opposite of what the AG company has stood for until the making of this movie).

These dried out so fast and when they wrote it wasn't very smooth. There were lots of skips as you wrote. I need to get some good Gelly Rolls, like I had as a teen. Those rocked! I thought that is what I bought but apparently I was half asleep when I ordered because these are called Gel Xtreme. The name alone should scare you. Run, run as fast as you can.

Make sure you measure your sink. I read some Q&A and some people said it would fit my sink drain because the outmost part is very flexible. This is true but it is quite a tight squeeze and I worry about longevity. I thought I had a standard sink drain but trying to find a new sink stopper has been a nightmare. None of the standards fit. I like this stopper, just wish it was a smidge smaller. If you do have a smaller one like ours you CAN get it in the drain but maybe don't count on it to last as long due to the pressure that is created.

This is great! It looks exactly as pictured. Arrived safe and sound. I LOVE that the little guard on the front is a little taller (less chances for misses). It has little handles on the side. In the past we've had potty rings that had all these nooks and crannies and they'd get DISGUSTING. This is a simple, simple ring that is solid so it is much easier to clean. It came with a little hook, like a mini over-the-door hook except you put it on the toilet tank, under the lid. The hook part obviously hangs outside the toilet so you can pop the potty ring off the toilet seat and you have a place to put it OTHER than the floor (or tub or sink or wherever).One negative that I have is that my son cannot easily put this on the toilet himself, which is a big deal if he needs to go and I'm not immediately there to snap it on for it. It COULD be our specific toilet seat, though. But the ring snaps in and he has a hard time getting it on there. We cannot leave it on the toilet all the time because we are a 7-person family of all ages. Not everyone can fit on this, LOL!All-in-all I give it two thumbs up and highly recommend!

So cute! Arrived pretty quick from the UK to the USA. The lingo is definitely very British but I just substitute words that are more familiar to my son when reading it to him. HE LOVES HIS THOMAS BOOK! We still haven't conquered the potty but we're getting there. This book came with a little reward poster and a sheet of Thomas stickers. When your child uses the toilet or potty chair they get a sticker to put on their little poster! I taped his up to the bathroom wall near the toilet for motivation. He wants those Thomas stickers so bad!

These are awesome. They are crystal clear and you can cut right down the middle of a single laminated sheets without it coming apart (it will come apart if you laminate two sheets back-to-back and cut too close to the papers with lamination sticking to one side of each page). WARNING: Make sure you insert the page closed-side first. If you insert the open side then you will break your laminator. True story! Happened to me because I was trying to do too many things at once and wasn't paying attention. It melted all around the rolling bar inside my laminator. Had to get a new one. BESIDES the point. But just wanted to give warning when I can. Great sheets. Great price. Love them!

Chihuahua loves these...too much!  She now wants to live on these and these alone (barks at the top of the refrigerator when I put her dog food down...asking me to give her one of these instead).  Some important things you may benefit by knowing:  not made in USA (and we have all become skeptical of anything made in China for dogs to eat, haven't we??).  Another problem: too many of these give my dog some digestive problems- we're not talking incontinence in the house or anything, just looser BMs.  I would have skipped buying them again in the future once I knew both of these things, but my dog is so picky that there isn't one other treat she will eat,...I've tried them all, and to her: these are 'the bomb' and that's that.  However, all of these considerations aside: if you want these for training treats (a great use that I would recommend them for, which will limit your dog's exposure to a foreign made treat) I bet you will not find a dog who won't do cartwheels for these.  Not recommended however, for a steady diet (due to concerns already mentioned).

Love this product and here's how I use it: I keep it in the fridge for when I'm back from a 'sweat' inducing errand in the hot days of summer. When I come home, I spritz it on my bare arms for some cooling and for a touch of the lightest of scents.  (If I didn't wear makeup, I'd probably spritz my face as well!)  The scent is light enough that its nothing like using a cologne spray, nor does it interfere with other scents I may have on.  Its just a simple, lovely product with an ultra-light refreshing scent!  Add to that a bit of skin softening effect- and what more could you ask for?

A PERFECT sunhat!  After trying and using MANY hats for walking in the sun, here is why I've settled on this one as my all time favorite:  its super lightweight.  I didn't know how important that was until I wore a heavier one in the hot sun...ugh!  It feels like it keeps out the sun, but still allows a nice airflow.  Also- a GREAT size- the brim is wide enough to really provide shade.  I had a similar hat with a smaller brim that I liked, but I felt that my neck & decolletage were still getting beaten up by the sun!  Lastly, it won't necessarily wreck your hairdo- because its so lightweight.  Of course, if you work up a great sweat...can't promise anything regarding the inevitable 'hathead hairdo'!  All in all- I just LOVE this hat.  It does seem too pricey however, so that's why I'm only giving it 4 stars.  If it were $10 less, I'd give it 5!!
Good but not my favorite flavor.  Some people love them and some are neutral about them. Me: I'm neutral, but still have to say that they are true to flavor!

I can't believe how popular these are...take one out and everyone is holding out their hands!  I use them to suck on one on way home from nightshift to keep me awake.  Warning: they are almost PAINFULLY spicey if you aren't used to them!  (but to me, that's just a 'plus'!)  Another thing I like is that the spiciness lasts to very end (unlike candies that have a sour or spicy coating that melts off to a bland center).  There's a reason these have been around a zillion years!

Was very happy with these sprayers: nice, dark bottles for protecting the essential oil concoctions I mix up in them. Practical size too (I fill them halfway, which is 1 oz).  Other: I prefer the pretty blue bottle over the typical amber ones because to me, it looks more 'aromatherapy' over medicinal...just a prettier bottle, and yet still practical!

About this scent: its masculine and musky and delightful- most women friends I know were crazy about it when I polled them, while some men I sampled it to thought it to perhaps be too strong/perfumey.  I find that funny because it brings up the question: who do we wear cologne for?  Ourselves or others?  :-)  Anyway, a wonderful scent in my opinion...spicy, rich & fragrant!  In case this of interest to anyone: I can tell you from my female friends and myself...it drives women crazy!  (BTW, this may not come up as a 'verified purchase' because the sample size I bought is no longer available, but I assure you- I bought it here on Amazon!)

This is an expensive perfume when all I wanted was a little sprayer to keep with me for when I need to improve the aromas nearby.  I actually just WANTED tiny sample size sprayers but couldn't locate any more freebies at dept stores, so this option was perfect!  About this scent: its masculine and musky and delightful- most women friends I know were crazy about it when I polled them, most men thought it to perhaps be too strong/perfumy.  I find that funny because it brings up the question: who do we wear cologne for?  Ourselves or others?  :-)  Anyway, a wonderful scent in my opinion...spicy, rich & fragrant!

Love these hooks, have found a million uses for them!  To help others I wanted to say why I buy these, versus ones with the little balls on the end (designed to protect fabrics), or the chrome color ones, etc.  These will hook into tiny spaces whereas those with the balled ends will not. You can dig these into a wreath, etc, for hanging, with minimal damage to the item (you don't need a big 'path' to fit the hook through).  They also will hold up to 40 lbs without bending.  So...if you are undecided about what S hooks to get, and are not a handyman (I'm not even a 'handywoman'!), then I'd  advise this way: buy black if you want the hook to be inconspicuous. Buy shiny chrome color if its going to be seen (as in hanging pots from a chrome rack), buy the ones with the balled edges if for fabrics or hanging kitchen tools (they will look nicer & will not prick a fabric like these ones might), and so on!  Just think about what you are going to use the hooks for, and then consider all the varieties of S hooks available.  Hope that helps!
Nasty flavor- guess you can't hide the taste of 40 mg caffeine, even with mint overlay!  Would never eat them for pleasure, just for the caffeine!
These are the famous Lemonheads brand...good and sour!  Recommend for anyone who wants/likes the experience of SOUR lemon!
Good staying power, plus easy to apply.  The only negative is that they are shiny when applied, so that stops them from looking 'real'.
Didn't taste fresh, the sugar in them was partly crystallized.
Hot & spicy, which is what I wanted, but a slightly weird flavor so I couldn't give them a full 5 stars.

Here's what you may want to know if you are considering getting pillow protectors: these are waterproof, but they are quiet and soft like regular pillow cases and you wouldn't even know they are on the pillow under the pillowcase.  Therefore I was very happy with this product and the pricing and recommend!  (Can't give five stars yet because I haven't had them long enough to know about things like wear & tear, washability, etc.)

Hard to pick number of stars and here's why: I didn't like the smell.  I thought it smelled like burning wood, and actually so did some other people ("is something burning?" was the frequent question)_  However- if you really want a pure wood smell, this may be right for you.  I just didn't find it 'aromatherapeutic' in any way...as in 'pleasant and relaxing and delightful to the nose'.  I think I'll use it on the fake coals in my fireplace.

This bag received with seal open and jelly beans rolling all over the box. Extremely poor packaging plus no food labeling - no ingredient list or manufacturer name/location (China?).  I don't think the brand name Jelly Belly would allow their product to be packaged this way, but there is no way to know the manufacturer since no labeling came with - or on- the product.

Very happy with this lock. Here's what I can think of that may be helpful to other buyers: Fits in the standard hole of any locker but has a big enough loop to put around something with a 1" diameter.  Easy to program, works reliably & easily  (unlike the combination locks which may be secure but are so doggone frustrating!), and you only have to remember 4 numbers (which you program yourself).  Its also fairly substantial in weight and does not seem easy to cut off. However,  I would call this a minimum security lock (for work lockers and such that aren't exposed to alot of professional thieves), which is all I happened to need.  However, for airport lockers and public places, I would still choose a more secure combination locks (the round black & stainless types).
Heavy duty but standard in size and weight...was very happy with this badge holder/lanyard!
This may be ultra pure, but its also ultra weak in scent. Was not impressed.

Love Aeropostale for the following reason: garments are always interesting/trendy, and the pictures are great: you can expect them to be exactly as described!  Plus many of their clothes are made of natural fabrics (that still amazingly wash really well!), and when on sale, their prices can't be beat. Suggestion: you may want to do as I do, and that is to buy UP one size as they are cut just a tiny bit small.  This particular top was not representative of the best of their quality, but I still liked it for 'hanging around home' PJ type top!

Love Aeropostale for the following reason: garments are always interesting/trendy, and the pictures are great: you can expect them to be exactly as described!  Plus many of their clothes are made of natural fabrics (that still amazingly wash really well!), and when on sale, their prices can't be beat. Suggestion: you may want to do as I do, and that is to buy UP one size as they are cut just a tiny bit small.  This particular top was not representative of the best of their quality, but I did LOVE the colors in the print (which is why I got it).

Love Aeropostale for the following reason: garments are always interesting/trendy, and the pictures are great: you can expect them to be exactly as described!  Plus lots of natural fabrics (that still amazingly wash really well!), and when on sale, their prices can't be beat. Suggestion: you may want to do as I do, and that is to buy UP one size as they are cut just a tiny bit small.  Other info that you may want to know: This particular top is a very boxy short cut.

Love Aeropostale for the following reason: garments are always interesting/trendy, and the pictures are great: you can expect them to be exactly as described!  Plus lots of natural fabrics (that still amazingly wash really well!), and when on sale, their prices can't be beat. Suggestion: you may want to do as I do, and that is to buy UP one size as they are cut just a tiny bit small.

These look like take-out containers that you get for free, but here's the reason I got them and love 'em:  they are PBA free, so no worries as you keep re-heating them that you are releasing harmful chemicals into your food.  They seal LEAK PROOF (try THAT with free take out containers!) so no careful balancing needed to keep them from dripping.  And they have SECTIONS for dividing different foods.  Also- big enough to allow you to freeze an entire meal and store neatly.  A suggestion: when microwaving, remove the lid and cover the food with a paper towel or a paper plate instead to control spatters (that way your lids will keep from warping & staining!).  Also, I don't put covers in dishwasher, just the bottoms.  Can't recommend highly enough!

These look like take-out containers that you get for free, but here's the reason I got them and love 'em:  they are PBA free, so no worries as you keep re-heating them that you are releasing harmful chemicals into your food.  They seal LEAK PROOF (try THAT with free take out containers!) so no careful balancing needed to keep them from dripping.  Also- big enough to allow you to freeze an entire meal and store neatly.  A suggestion: when microwaving, remove the lid and cover the food with a paper towel or a paper plate instead to control spatters (that way your lids will keep from warping & staining!).  Also, I don't put covers in dishwasher, just the bottoms.  Can't recommend highly enough!

Very functional, was very happy with this purchase. What else can I tell you that will be helpful?  They will look exactly like the picture.  Some extra features: comes with stakes for when you are staking it to the soil over a plant.  The very top portion is an extra layer of sun shield, sides allow both sun and air to circulate. They pop open and fold flat for storage.  A great idea for plants that need to develop first, or are vulnerable to predators, or are just too delicate during those times of year when the sun is too intense.

This collar far surpassed the hard collar I was given in the hospital following my surgery.  If you have to live in a hard collar for 6 weeks or so...that will seem like an eternity with other collars!!  Here's what special and makes this purchase worth it:  It has a much bigger opening for air flow where you don't need to have plastic- which means air can circulate and you won't be pouring down sweat every time you move!!  Its also designed so that it doesn' t press on your neck and esophagus (like my other collar did) when you lay down.  It also has replaceable pads for inside, which is great if you have to do walking exercise because you will sweat and oil up the original padding (of any type of hard collar!)  in no time.  And the knob for adjusting for neck length is simply invaluable!  If you have to live in a hard collar for a while, I definitely recommend that you treat yourself to this one.  It will make life much more bearable!!!

This runner is made extremely well, with quality fabric that is thick & very pretty.  HOWEVER, its just too narrow.  Its not a standard runner width (see other reviews saying same thing, which I should have read first- plus I should have looked at the measurements and taken a ruler to compare).  If you have a small table (as pictured) and if its a French Country White, this runner would be ideal.  But for a standard dining room table, its just too narrow.  Also- I'm not sure if  you can see in the picture (because I missed it) but the print has some crystals and sparkles on it, which is quite pretty but I hadn't expected and it did not go with my decor.
A healthy, tasty, and filling snack alternative!  Not recommended if you have fragile teeth or teeth issues however, as these are harder than nuts. But for kids & others- excellent!!

I love Aeropostale clothes and this cami was no exception.  The material is soft, it has a built in bra (not very supportive however, but it keeps it from being see-through at the bust) and their  color selection is very broad.  About sizing: I usually buy UP a size with Aeropostale but with this cami, buy your regular size since its cut loose plus stretches a bit while you are wearing it.  One word on colors: I picked what I thought was a neon yellow, but it was a neon GREEN color when I recieved it- so pay attention to not only the color on your screen (there are several that look like the same shade of yellow, but they are all kinds of shades of neon yellow/green), but the color description as well.  I don't know how the other colors are, relative to how they appear online.  This confusion I had with understanding their colors was the reason for 4 instead of 5 stars.

This is one of those tops that seem like you have had it a million years: soft, worn & seasoned- great for lounging or for a pajama top.  I liked it for the latter because its not see-through, which can be helpful in mixed company.  Expect it to look exactly like the picture and the length to end just about the waist.

I love Aeropostale clothes and this cami was no exception.  The material is soft, it has a built in bra (not very supportive however) and the stripes are a nice change from the usual solid  color cami.  About sizing: I usually buy UP a size with Aeropostale but with this cami, buy your regular size since its cut loose plus stretches a bit while you are wearing it.  Overall: I recommend!

Great quality!  I saw that prism glasses generally range in price from about $7 to $29 dollars, so I read many reviews to understand why the broad price range.  This particular pair costs about $12.99 and is a great value for the following reasons: stable frame, not wobbly like the cheaper ones.  Wider prism and frame for better viewing too.  Really feel like a quality pair of glasses- some reviewers who bought the very pricier ones decided that these were actually better quality!  Good for using when needing to lie flat (or almost flat) to watch TV.  I just had neck surgery so this is what prompted my own decision.  Also good if you need to lay flat for any other reason (paralysis, treatments, back surgery, etc.)  Wanted also to advise, that if you never used prism glasses, they will take some getting used to. They are like the R side mirrors of many cars, where things appear smaller than they are, and further away. Also, you won't want to move your head alot when wearing them, or you'll likely get dizzy!  But if you lie still and give them a bit of time to get used to, you will probably eventually like them very much!

Excellent decison to purchase this particular travel stool!  Its supportive, strong and lightweight...with built in carry strap.  Weighs just about 2 pounds but is sturdy enough to seat up to 250 pounds.  Plus biggest reason to select this particular brand/model is the height.  This one is a true 24 inches high when you sit on it. Some others have said they are 20-22 inches high but turned out to be about 18 inches when sat on (from the reviews people have offered).  May not seem like much difference, but very hard on knees to get up & down off just 18 inches!  So... I definitely recommend this brand based upon quality, price, portability for hiking, for the accurately stated sitting height and the very light weight of it!

I always try to help with the purchasing decision of others, so here goes:  I kept hearing about WEN and wondered if it was hype or good products.  So I decided to try this spray because I have thin hair that needs volumizing all the time.  How I use it is that I spray it on my finished hairdo.  It brings out the curl and adds volume. But it IS slightly sticky/stiff, like regular hairspray-  but on the light side. That may sound like a bad thing, but it means skipping additional hairspray and it does help you hold a style (besides being a volumizer).  Although I like this product and am happy with it,  I only gave this product 4 stars because 1) its so pricey and 2) I bought the cheapest scent and it actually smells AWFUL (scent called: sweet almond mint).  However, the scent goes away pretty quickly and that's a good thing! I recommend for thin hair that needs volumizing (like mine!) or for thick straight hair where you want to combat natural oil & increase texture.

Very nice hoodie jacket- soft, medium thickness.  Its cut on the small side, so I recommend ordering a size UP.  Also- its a big shorter that it appears in the picture (which personally I liked).  One other thing I like is that the arm width is cut on the generous side, so if you don't have skinny arms (I don't!), this hoodie will still fit!  Other than that, very nice hoodie....I recommend!

I try to think of the things to share that might help others in their purchasing decision: the most important being that this particular 'jacket' is  REALLY lightweight and thin, slightly transparent even, and its runs SMALL (order UP at least one size!).  Its very casual, and even though most hoodies are casual, this one is even more so (has that well-washed look & feel).  I would recommend it for: a soft pajama/workout/round the house top,  or for when you want something really light to tie around your waist in case the weather cools off a bit later in the day when you are out hiking or walking or heading home from the gym.  AND...once I received the first one and knew what to expect, I actually ordered it again in other colors.  (I live in a HOT climate most of the year, so lightweight is good!).  I believe that if you know what to expect, you won't be disappointed!

Depends on what you're looking for!  This is a very thin, lightweight 'sweater', perfect for the warmer weather here in S. California.  Its thin and lightweight, so I feel it might be necessary to wear a coordinating bra underneath!  However, its very pretty. A nice true Navy & white, soft fabric, and a shortish, boxy cut.  You can expect it to fit just below the waist (picture an inch shorter than it appears in the picture). Also- since it was so inexpensive, I ordered a size UP and was glad I did.  It was really hard to pick a number of stars, because while it wasn't what I expected (lighter weight, boxier), I really liked it all the same!  It really deserves 3.5 stars but I'm rounding UP to 4, because the pricepoint was so low!

Here's why I purchased this particular charger so maybe I can help with your purchasing decision too:  The pro's: tiny, nearly lipstick size (but heavier, of course!), color choices are vibrant (making it easy to locate), worked exactly as described for charging my S5; priced fairly for the amount of charge you get, handy to have for that time when you realize you forgot to charge your device!  (How is it that even though I can charge things at home, in the car, and at work...that STILL I seem to need to keep a little portable charger on hand?)  It works with any device that has a mini USB port (and it comes with the cord that you need to connect it with).  And you can use your device while its charging (just give it about 2 minutes or so, first)  I saw that it has very good ratings here and elsewhere, so I didn't have to worry too much about whether this item would be reliable.  Con's: wish it had a bigger capacity (there are chargers out there that do, but they're bigger in size and cost more), and wish it had bars to tell you how much charge was left.  Also wish the carrying case was a bright metallic color (even just silver!) like the device, otherwise the black case defeats the purpose of picking a bright colored device for ease of finding in one's purse or carry-on (you can put it in your purse with no cover, but in my purse...that's a risky venture!)  Overall, considering its pricepoint- I recommend and was glad I purchased!

I really don't want to be too unkind to the seller, but I'm hard pressed to say anything positive about these pants!  They are made of cheap rayon and the print was unattractive.  They do fit true-to-size (or somewhat larger), but that's the only positive thing I can think of.  Sorry...but these were a return for me!

I'll try to help everyone with a purchasing decision regarding a starter waist training corset (which is what I wanted): this one is stylish enough that I don't feel like I look too vampy if I go out with it on over a black tank top (I like to wear cotton under it for comfort). So- if you are looking for really sexy/flashy, this is not the one to get. This is a REAL waist trainer (albeit inexpensive and perhaps won't last that long...that remains to be seen so I'll update you in the future too!)  Now for the most important advice: how to pick a size and get it ON.  I returned the first ones I ever got because I thought they were way too small. Turns out I didn't understand HOW to get them on & laced, and THAT is everything!!!  So- measure your waist and order a size that will go to 4inches SMALLER.  Don't get distracted by a label size of 2XL when you never wore larger than a size 14-16, for example.  Go by the inches stated in the sizing!!  The idea is to REALLY loosen the ties to wide open, and then put it on and get the front snapped, and then cinch the ties inward (by pulling cord at each level behind your back, which you may need a mirror to do at first).  Important: if it fits right away with almost no work- you probably have gotten one way too big and it won't work for 'waist training'!  Expect it to be a JOB getting it on and cinched the first time!!  (But I promise it will get much easier in a very short amount of time).  Last bits of advice: there are MANY videos online and waist training books, etc that you really should look at before deciding the type & size to order. And beware of any corset really that's cheaper than this one- steel boning is more expensive than plastic and works better too.  You need to know that a REALLY good corset will cost upwards of $150- but I'm not ready for that yet (want to see how committed I am to waist training first!) and you are probably not either.  P.S. I do think only the front 'bones' are metal, and in a really high end waist trainer, they are ALL steel.  That's why I gave it only 4/5 stars- but I really wish I could have picked 4.5 stars- because you can't beat this corset for the price!

I always try to think about what might help the next buyer make a good purchase decision so here goes:  these pants are lightweight but still warm.  The material is really different, very smooth but not shiny.  Extremely comfortable!  I would recommend these pants for: workouts, hikes, or any casual roundabout wear.  Some things to consider: they are very LONG.  Fortunately, I'm tall (5'7").  They do have an elastic at the bottom but its very loose so certainly if you are  5'3", and under, I would not recommend these pants for you.  (They feel like cotton, but are polyester- so do not count on any shrinking in the dryer!)  Another thing to consider is that I would say these pants run slightly small.  Therefore I would recommend buying one size UP (I listened to other reviews that made same recommendation and I'm glad I did!).  Overall, for me, this was a very good purchase decision and I really like these pants!
Great candles (non-toxic, smoke-free) from a Mom & Pop company...I highly recommend!

These are soft and nicely loose in the calf (so I can wear them all day without binding).  The 'ruffle' on top is different, but thats what eliminates the tightness that so many socks have at the top.  I was VERY happy with these!

What helpful thing can I say?  These were delivered exactly as hoped for and described.  One recommendation (which I did) is that you take a ruler and be CERTAIN  you know what size they are before ordering, as other sizes are also available.  I used them for: repairing costume jewelry (silver color) earrings, sterling jewelry, adding charms, even linked a few together as an extender. Very handy to keep around!
This top fits well, holds it shape throughout wearing, and the fabric is a perfect thickness (not tissue thin, but not thick either!)  I recommend!

A great hair excessory!  Not sure why some others didn't like, but I'm guessing that it takes some experience to figure out how to use these well.  If you have a lot of hair- or really need height that spans the width of the top of your head, I recommend that you buy TWO of these (and maybe one to spare, as I stepped on one of mine and broke it!).  I find them: easy to use, fun to play with, replace having to tease my hair AT ALL, and stay in well with a tiny spritz of hair spray.  These were popular in Joan Crawford's day, when a big role on each side of your head was pinned in place (a look I sometimes do, but modified a bit).  No issues with this product whatsoever, it is what it is!

I was surprised to not like this dress as I have many pieces in the Sakkas clothing line and usually love how they fit.  This one is boxy on top and not very flattering.  I know that many have given it excellent reviews, so I'm guessing it may have to do with one's dress size- so I'll try to help others decide whether to buy. I'm a 14/16 (closer to 14) and it fit very well, it just wasn't flattering.  It didn't go in at the waist like the picture (like the model in the picture is pinching the waist fabric behind her to make it more shapely).  I'm 5'7 and length was great, so was the print of the fabric.  I'm also a 38C and although the bust fit fine (its nice and stretchy on top), I thought it looked frumpy and not shapely on top.  So in summary I'm going to guess that this dress may be most flattering (after reading other reviews) for sizes 8-12 only.  One other thing (that I like to put in all my Sakkas reviews): the reason for the reasonable pricing of their line is that even though their colors and prints are gorgeous, these cotton items are VERY fragile to wash (they run, can't be put in dryer, need cold water TLC when washing and a press cloth when ironing, etc).  So if you like 'durable', their line is not it- but if you like clothes/dresses that are: inexpensive, fun, GREAT colors/prints and are cut exceptionally well (usually!) with a lovely forgiving/flattering drape to most of their styles- Sakkas does it very well!  I recommend that you check out many of their other dresses if this is not the one for you!!

I think that this product should say that it will not fit someone with a lot of hair.  Otherwise, its just OK (fitting a little like a bathing cap). I'd only recommend for small heads and/or short hair.

It seems like entitlement is an attitude that is on the rise. It's the attitude that one is exempt from responsibility and is owed special treatment. Townsend makes it clear he is not writing about those who are truly in need, are incapable, or who are lacking skills. He is writing about the person capable of taking care of him or himself yet expects others to do that.Townsend says he has written this book primarily to help those who struggle with entitlement disease. He suggests we all struggle with it a bit, what he calls pocket entitlement. There is a solution, he writes, called the Hard Way. It's “the habit of doing what is best, rather than what is comfortable, to achieve a worthwhile outcome.” He has good insights into the outcomes of following this path, how change starts at a tipping point, and includes really practical suggestions on how to get and keep going on this Hard Way path.This book is also good for someone in relationship with one having entitlement disease.
