The writing and storytelling are quite smart, and my one complaint is one little group became a little too problematic a little too fast... at least, I as a reader did not see it coming and found parts of such wrap-up underwhelming. Even so, it's a wonderfully satisfying final installment and I daresay the best of the bunch (good for ending).

So, the summary of my feelings: It's okay. Frankly, I largely think this would be a cute and fun wedding gift... but perhaps not something you necessarily want for yourself (is that so horrible to say? Give it to other people?) The theory is cool and charming... a mini ice-cream maker with little freezy mugs for a date night or something similar.The product works. I can't say it doesn't. This does make ice cream. But... I guess I just want the same quality ice cream as that big ol' electric bucket in the garage that I have to lug out and makes the loudest noise possible but makes a heck of an ice cream bunch. This is just... okay. Similar to something you can make for the fun of making ice cream.The product is really cute-looking, so that's a perk. But the process for these single-servings is a bit much and in the end, it's only decent. This is definitely a novelty item for the cuteness factor, and not for great homemade ice cream.

Puzzle and play set in one... now that is the way to go, folks. I got this for my preschooler who is just enchanted by the adorable food/kitchen pieces that just so happen to form a gorgeous puzzle. Muted, soft colors, lovely detail, plus the added bonus of the ABCs if you wish to go that far. In a world of wooden toys being only so-so in construction, this is very well crafted, so expect quality.

I have an older set of flour sack towels and sadly these just don't compare. While excellent for food prep services, there isn't much in the way of absorbancy. Hopefully they improve with use, though a few prep washes have not done much. A decent towel, but not what could be.
My one complaint is the tactile feel of this case. Could be a sensory thing or just something new being tried. The case fits great here and the protection is up to standard.

Those parents looking for a touch less of preservatives will be pleased with these pouches.  Actually hydrating to a worthy baby meal, they're quite easy to use with a noteworthy ingredient list. Nice food option.

This is a great option if you need a heavy-duty vacuum for a lot of space. I trust this to be one that lasts a long time and I'm impressed with its power and performance. The extra long cord and hose make this ideal for big spaces or just in areas where you don't feel like unplugging unnecessarily. It does wrap up a bit clumsy and thus requires a bit of storage space for the main vacuum and attachments, but I don't know if that's a huge problem considering just how nice this is.

I  have another waterproof pad from American Baby Company and was very impressed with how well it worked. This is a nice pad option that fits well under most sheets as well as whatever little extra need you have for it. It's light, cozy, and so far stays put with the right arrangement. Nice for those who need something to adjust as needed.

Well, heck if this isn't a cute option without getting fancy old-school tablecloths. Nice machine washable polyester tablecloth that looks extremely charming! Copycat awesomeness. It's durable, adorable, and is great for decorating.

Perhaps I'm entering a phase of my literary life where (horrors!) I'm losing my taste for fantasy, because this book just did not do it for me. It was just all too much for me who may be now seeking something more practical. So, I still tried to look at the book from a fantasy point of view... and still wasn't impressed. I love the idea of the "aftermath" scenario, a fantasy war idea that doesn't get enough exploration, but the result here was a rather bleak and depressing area that only seemed to thrive on that aspect. Okay. Give me more! The writing is quite lyrical, though some may find it too flowery. The plot is well-thought-out, but almost painfully slow, the moodiness of the characters and the setting getting most of the attention. Many a young reader will probably love that, and I appreciate what Ms. Bobet was trying to do. But, not for me.

Oh, wow, but here is a bassinet cover that actually fits with ideal snugness (at least in my case). I find this great for a standard bassinet mattress, and yes it is sufficiently water-proof. Nothing too fancy about this pad, but it does its job well, fits wonderfully on the mattress pad and under your standard bassinet sheet, and is softly quilted.

So I'm one of those folks who have never read the first book (but will probably check it out after thoroughly enjoying this installment), but I found this is a bit of excitement that stands quite well on its own. It's a "boy book" of the best kind, a fast-paced thriller with enough over-the-topir moments to keep young readers hooked with a little suspension of disbelief. Afghanistan and its surrounding mountain rangers are explored, and the climbing details are just fun. It's exciting and thrilling fluff, is well-written, and I think youngsters will love it.

I love just how much of an interesting cereal this is. Following the ways of all things crunchy (the social term) this is a great little cereal of great consistency that is great for beginning eaters. The ingredients are actually healthy and I like the method of preservation, as opposed to canning. Nice option for infant feeding.

So, mixed feelings from me on this. Let it be known this will probably work wonders on many a face. But there is an intensity this that not even Proactive has that seems less useful and more confusing. The formulas work well with my skin, but it also takes a lot out of it, even with redness on some days. I'm dealing with this my scaling back my use of this system to once a week. Now, for severe acne, this trial-by-fire might be just the ticket.

If you're looking for just a good, basic doll without any frills, this one is just charming!  A cuddly baby doll that is well-crafted without getting too fancy or upscale, she has the classic closing eyes and soft pajamas and the essential accessories. My daughter is just in love with her, and I like the idea of a good-quality doll that's fairly budget-friendly.

So I've been playing around with several eye creams as of late, and this is one of my favorites. Wonderful texture and consistency, a rather nice aroma, and just a clean feeling on my eye area. The effects of the immediate sort are quick, and I'm already seeing some nice long-term improvement. Great little jar!

So, first and most impressive reaction to this: cool, looks great, provides lots of blocks. When thinking of this as a kid's toy, what more do you want? So an easy and well-deserved 4 stars for that aspect: cool blocks of good quality in high quantity. The modern architecture spin is a nice perk as well. But if I wish to get nit-picky, these are good - quality but not great quality, sad when so many toy makers are trying to get back to classic wood. We had a few instances of uneven blocks and chipping paint. Nothing major, but I'd like it to be known of an estimate of quality of what shoppers will get into.

This is fairly on par with other colic treatments of the natural variety I've tried. Looks disgusting, but hopefully does its job depending on the condition of the child. For my toddler, it's a fine tummy so other for mild aches. I appreciate the natural spin on this one.

I hate to say it, but this is one of those books entirely dependent on the reader for recommended enjoyment and thus fairly impossible to recommend or condemn. I liked it quite a lot. Some may love it all the more. Some might find it psychotic drivel.So be aware you're getting into a black comedy that is both hysterical and sad in the oddest of ways. This is a satire of our modern literary world, Faust, and some possible comment of something else altogether.The writing. The syntax is a delight unto itself and makes this a book to get into easily.The characters. Great. Can't say enough good about them. Quirky and interesting to the extreme.Plot. Thorough. Interesting. Well-done.The theme and the story is where this will attract or frighten off a reader. But I say it's worth a shot.

I'm sorry to say this looked like a cuter adventure than it was, which is sad, because this really could have been something delightful, along the lines of "The Magic Treehtouse" series. Instead, this is a just-nice Common Core integration attempt that's a little heavier on the educational aspect and a little lighter on the exciting read end. Even so, I enjoyed the idea of time travel and the writing is decent. But Bubba and his family... well, their characters left a lot to be desired and their adventures weren't quite there. The information is nice, and this is a rather fun idea, but it's only a midl recommendation from me.

I've been in the past pleased with Nature's Bounty as providing pretty good supplements and this fits the usual pattern. Small, easy-to-swallow capsules and a schedule that recommends a spread-out through the day--which makes for better absorption of the rhodalia root. I'm happy with the effects and think this is also quite price-friendly.

For what's it's worth... my husband and I have never been particularly enchanted with OtterBox. But they still often make a case that is at least decent, and this one, being just a slim protective cover, is really quite nice. Very durable (I tend to break phones) with a nice snug fit and all the right cut-outs for the different features. It's nothing fancy in the way of OtterBox, but it's a great basic case.

Sometimes I'm amazed at just how fancy bottles are getting, with their who can name what features. This one is focused on air flow for colic prevention and all those tummy troubles babies can have. It's a well-ventilated bottle, and I'm particularly fond of the nipple design. The shape is comfy to hold, the material looking good. Good bottle to consider.
These are the way dishcloths were meant to be outside the actual home knit ones. Well-worn and wonderfully scrubby for actual dish cleaning. Very well-made and do a great job!
This is a doll of rather decent quality that just looks adorable in a stylized Evie outfit. My daughter is just enchanted with her. The accessories are fun, the doll quite well put together!

Well, as far as your basic shower heads go, this is a pretty good one with nice spray options and an allowance for the preferable pressure. However, I rather wish they had stuck to just making a shower head, because the rest of this one is rather gimicky. Which wouldn't be a bad thing if it wasn't so vocally insistent about presenting the water temperature. I like this to avoid surprises/find one's preferred temperature, but it's a product that goes a bit far beyond.

I rather have a fondness for ABC sheets. They're inexpensive, wash well, and hold up respectably despite not being particularly fancy. All in all, a great basic sheet that doesn't cost an arm and a leg. This twin pack is a very nice bargain, and the organic cotton is extremely comfy. Great way to buy crib sheets

I've never before indulged in Bose, but these are worth the price3 for a good basic earphone that is just... quality. This is a wonderfully sturdy set that I feel I can actually use without fearing any ripping or obnoxious tangling or good ol' falling apart after a week. The sound quality is incredible to boot, the ear pieces comfortable (something I have always struggled with concerning ear phones.) Great set, highly recommended.

I'll go right and ahead and say it: this is one awesome conditioner and probably one I would highly recommend to those with thinner hair. This is wonderfully light conditioning for anyone who wants great conditioning power without anything terribly heavy as some of the more intense conditioners tend to be. I have very thick hair and even I fell in love with how thorough but gentle this was. Lightweight is the key word here, and Tresemme doesn't lie about it.

This is a charming little fluff read I managed to happily read in one sitting due to its engaging storyline and upbeat writing. It's a fairly familiar story of a woman who finds herself abandoned by a wealthy husband and suddenly needing to work things out for herself--seen in a few movies and books, but still plenty delightful particularly when done well as it is done here.Jessie Stanton is dumped from her high class life of wealth when her husband disappears with all the assets. She pawns off her ring to pay for the services of private investigator Danny Callahan and to start a business renting out her designer clothes.It's a fun cast of characters Jessie leads, each one likable, and the plot moves along briskly as Danny searches for Jessie's husband, Jessie and her friends put together a new business, and Jessie and Danny deal with their attraction to one another.Add in a dash of Christian message to make this a fun yet quite worthy read.

I enjoyed the first book in the series, but somehow felt this one had a little more meat. Or, more accurately, more drama that made this quite easy to read in a few sittings if not one. The eldest daughter of the Chicory Inn family is hitting a rut and more in her marriage. The spark is gone, and husband Jesse is dealing with a conniving female co-worker. The story is believable in its look at year-worn marriages where couples find themselves approaching middle age. The characters are once again delightful, the Christian message comforting.

What is there to love if not a good dog tale? Here is one of the classic kind, a beloved companion on the road with just the sort of man who needs the help of a good dog and a faith-promoting message of God and forgiveness. Jim Kraus is comfortable in his writing and tells this story in an easy-going, thoughtful manner. Lewis, the titular St. Bernard, is quite the most saintly of animals indeed with his insistence for telling the truth and his interactions with the obviously suicidal George are heart-warming. My only wish is for a choice between more or shorter story. It plods along at a nice and comfortable pace with nice bits of inspiration and warm fuzzies but without too much action and an obvious direction to the conclusion. Mr. Kraus' writing and insight makes for a good read, but this wasn't what I would call a one-sit read.

I received a sample of this product in exchange for an honest review.Truth be told, I'm perfectly happy to use boiling water in a mug to diffuse my essential oils. I've never used the super-fancy diffusers, and I've used the cheaper end of the scale with satisfied results. This isn't quite the cheapest end, but still on the the simple bargain side of things. And I'm happy to say it does the job.I love the amount of water allowed for this product, rather than just an ounce. Requiring very little oil for operation, this diffuses a nice flow of air that fills a moderately sized room (I've been keeping it in my kitchen). The cylinder shape is unassuming, and I like the look of its color change mode--once again, quite modest.I have no real critiques with this and have been happily using it in my home. It's easy and obvious to operate and works just fine.

Once again, American Baby Company. Not the best quality, but will do and do just fine. So if you like bargains and good enough for your sheets (good enough for me!) these are good. And I really like this quality of cotton this time around and I think there has been some improvement on the fitting as this is more snug than a fancier cradle sheet I purchased. Hooray! Washes well, looks cute, and still continues to fit nice and snug.

Earlier this year I purchased another Cuisinart grill set as a gift and was told good things about the product design. Figured it would be nice to have a set for myself. So I have this and another 14-piece set for our own home and, all things told, I feel this MetalliQ collection is the better quality of the two. Not perfect, but certainly well-made and sturdy with great metal. My big issue concerns the tongs, the kind with a clasping mechanism that in my experience doesn't always last well long. I'm the type that would prefer more basic and trusty tongs. Even so, they have held up well to so-far summer barbecues since these have arrived. I love the length of the items and the spatula has a nice broad head. The handles are secure, and this is again a well-made set.

A lovely bangle this bracelet is. A simple oval clasping at the Celtic knot, subtle detailing on said knot. The sterling silver has a muted look, giving this an older than it is feel, which I like. I disagree with those who say this looks more expensive than its value but I think it comes off comfortably in its price range. Great-looking, understated bangle.

While I'm afraid such books as these are getting lost with the insta-info nature of the internet, this is still a handy little guide that just has the misfortune of mostly being what one can find for free on the internet without the scrutiny and insight of the super-professionals. It's a quick reference to the basics of pregnancy and is written lively enough.

I suppose I'm more concerned with the price for these rather than the quality. This is a decent brush with a decent pan, but the price seems a bit high when I see brushes of similar quality around for much less.Still, it's a decent brush with a nice bendy lip for scrubbing under the rim. The shape of the brush works great for my home's toilets with so-far sturdy bristles that don't weaken under scrubbing. The ban is steady and holds the brush well. It's a nice and inconspicuous set that's happy in the basics.

Despite my best efforts I find myself always tending toward low-maintenence when it comes to hair, and as a result I like add product at the same time I blowdry my hair. This balm is more than decent for my very thick hair (I would recommend those with thinner hair be conservative with this product) for creating a nice sleek and tamed look. It's a nice distance away from the whole scrunchy feel and is really quite smooth without much of a weird texture.

I confess, I selected these for classroom purposes (oh, the labeling and activities to be done!) rather than mailing scenarios. In my case, I want something simple that will stand up to 2nd graders. These look pretty darn good. Quality, sturdy cardstock with a metal - rimmed hole that in most cases is in a good safe spot not prone to tearing. I must admit my favorite feature is simply the paper - again, very good material.

I rather wish a locker shelf of this quality had been around when I was in high school, though it's wonderfully useful for our storage lockers and I'll be darned if this thing can't hold the touted weight of 100 lbs. Construction-wise, this one awesome shelf that fits comfortably in the standard locker and remains (this is very important) stable and sturdy. My one complaint is the drawer, which already is begins to stick on us, requiring a jimmy. But our interest being the basic shelf, I highly recommend this.

I've been using this to attack some fast-sprouting weeds in my garden. Used as directed, this in a matter of a couple of weeks have prevented any of the nasty and terrifying sprouts I fear. Already super impressed!

It's been a journey of laundry experience, but after 13 years of getting to buy my own laundry detergent... Tide really is the way to go and I'ma  big fan of this basic formula. Excellent cleaning power and even this basic formula does a fine job of battling stains. I feel I can even halve the recommended amount with warm and hot washes to still get a great clean. Wonderful stuff.

I suppose preference or hate for this seat will really come down to how you feel about basic car seats.No, this isn't the fanciest or even I daresay best on the market, but it's a solid car seat that will do its job. I've used an older model of the Graco Snugride in the past and had no complaints or issues with that, and I feel about the same so far with this one, with a specific nod to the based, which I find fits, at least for me, better in the car.The click connect system is a good general system that I'm happy fits with much of the already existing line--very cool. The safety features are respectable, and I find the seat cover design quite cozy and snug and so far have had no problems with the buckling system.Bulkiness... alas, it's not as trim and compact as other, fancier seats and that might be considered good or bad--I'm just telling it like it is.So, here it is, another Graco car seat of simplicity. Nothing fancy, but does the job and looks cute while doing it. If you like your basic Graco car seats, this will fit the bill nicely.

I've seen and heard enough about CPS (including friends in the programs) to be dubious about many a case. As a teacher and mother, I was curious to read a little more about the debate. Perhaps even fill myself with a bit of righteous rage. Alas, after reading this, I'm not really convinced either way.

The book keeps itself pointed and simple, a rather misleading state differing from the dramatic empty swing of the cover, but not bad in its purpose. In fact, a good chunk of this is tactics on what to do if approached by the CPS. Useful reference.

But when a book says it's a case against the CPS I expect more of a case. Again, I wasn't convinced and I already know there are flaws in the system. The book reiterates those flaws without any evidence system abuse is a wide-spread problem.

It's an interesting read, but hardly world-changing. Numbers, advice, and little beyond for a real case.

I've long heard good things about this laundry treatment and while it certainly works better than other treatments I've tried it's still not the magical cure I was hoping for (we have hard water.) That being said and living without magic, this is a pretty darn good product that is especially great for whites.

I don't know how unique this set is in the world of baby building blocks, but it sure is cute with its bright zoo theme and nice chunky animal face blocks (look at them!) The tiger is certainly more interesting than the rest, but they are all holdable for tiny hands and the little zoo building is adorable. They seem to be of good quality material and hopefully will hold up for awhile. For now, they are fun and bright and chunky, so that's all that matters.

Here's the thing about nursery rhymes: they are supposed to be timeless classics. I've seen other nursery rhyme films that do a nice, timeless job in presenting the tales. This is horribly dated and quite cheap in production value.

This is the second year I attempted to grow Cherokee Purples. The first year, about 4 years ago, I started with the plants themselves and lost them to... heck, it was hot and I just couldn't keep any plants hydrated enough. This year, I remember the Cherokee Purples and purchased the seeds. They germinated nicely enough indoors and took to growing when I transplanted them outside. Thumbs up in that department.And onto the fruit. Other reviewers said they got quite the harvest from these. I haven't seen that yet. Rather, I've been having trouble getting blossoms to really do anything. I get that this is an heirloom variety and heirlooms aren't exactly known for the high yield of engineered seeds, but I had long heard Cherokee Purples gave a decent harvest. Perhaps I'll just let the season play out a little longer.All that being said, however, I have had a fairly decent crop so far and I'm very impressed with the fruit. The tomatoes are lovely and have a deliciously sweet flavor. Yay. Really, if you're looking for an interesting tomato that's not too outlandish, these are tasty.All in all, I'm happy with these seeds and shall continue my tomato season.

We've had a Keurig for a number of years, and I honestly thought it was the best system for getting an affordable cup of coffee that there was.I was totally wrong.I had seen the Ninja Coffee Bar commercials but I thought that, like most infomercials, they were trying to sell something that simply wasn't anywhere near as good as they made it out to be. But when they claim that this makes one of the best cups of coffee you've ever had, they're right!! I have no idea how this machine works so well, but it is amazing.We recently returned from a vacation where we met a Brazilian couple who told us that American coffee is "dirty water". After having coffee from this machine I completely understand what we were missing out on! It's delicious!PROS:- Delicious coffee. What do you buy a coffee maker for? Delicious coffee. This maker has delivered on every cup of coffee we've tried making so far, and we even bust open a few "iced tea" k-cups for the Keurig and, using the "brew over ice" feature, managed to make a number of delicious cups of iced tea - my son said it was far better than the Keurig version that the K-cups were made for!- Multiple sizes of coffee. We've made all of the sizes, from the carafe to the single cup, and if you follow the directions with how much grounds to put into the filter, the coffee always comes out tasting amazing, no matter what size you want.- Multiple strengths. My husband likes his coffee a bit strong. I prefer mine light. With this maker I'm able to use a breakfast blend, brew normal for me and then brew stronger for him on the next batch to get two cups of coffee, in less than 5 minutes, that are made for both of our tastes.- Reusable filter. I've had reusable filters before with my old coffee makers but nothing like this one. You can tell it's high quality from the second you hold it. I don't foresee ever having to use a paper filter.- Looks amazing. Style counts for something, right? This maker definitely looks fantastic sitting on the counter.- Milk frother. It's actually way better than I thought it would be! My children even made hot cocoa and used the frother to make some milk to put on top of the cocoa, then added a bit of cocoa powder to make an amazing looking hot chocolate!CONS:- Size. Either I have lower cabinets or this simply isn't designed to fit under cabinets, I'm not 100% sure which, but I know it's about a half an inch too tall to fit under my cabinets. But that's honestly not that big of a deal for me because the coffee is so good that I have no problem giving it a place of honor on our counter! If, however, space is an issue then I would recommend checking the dimensions carefully before ordering.VERDICT:My husband was extremely skeptic when we got this after he saw the price. Then I made him a travel mug of coffee. He sipped it. Then he sipped again. Then again. He then looked at me and said, "I get it...freaking a that's good coffee" then wandered off to watch his hockey game. If Mr. Cheapskate approves of it, it has to be worth it!! I love showing off our coffee bar to anyone who comes over and can't wait to experiment more with different coffees!

My husband is stunned by this watch. He's not someone who wears tons of watches, but whenever we go out to eat or go out for a day together he does like to wear one. We recently took a trip to Disney World and he wore this watch every day. Not only was it extremely comfortable for him to wear every day, he actually got a compliment on it while we were in line! It was easy to set and he especially LOVES the way that the watch latches.

I'm in love. That's all I can say - I'm in love with this perfume! I'm someone who doesn't wear perfume often - not because I don't like perfume, but because it tends to be tricky for me to find a scent that I not only like but that also works well with my body chemistry.When I got this perfume I put a spritz on my wrist and rubbed and a spritz that I walked through. I wanted to make sure the scent was thoroughly on me to see how strong it was, if it was off-putting or if it wasn't too bad. Firstly, the scent was definitely not too strong. Every person that I came across I asked to smell my perfume. I wanted to see what their opinion was without me telling them how expensive the perfume was. Every single person sniffed my wrist and their eyebrows shot up. "wow - that smells REALLY good!" they all said! My husband, Mr. Cheapskate himself, took a whiff and immediately said that he loved the smell - then he started sniffing my neck to ask if I'd put any there!I have now learned that you should ignore the price of something and go with what works for you. This perfume absolutely works beautifully for me and has enough of a scent that it smells amazing but not so much that it's cloying. I'm definitely a fan!!

This is my first activity and sleep tracker so I was extremely excited to see what all of the fuss is about. I wasn't disappointed!PROS:-Looks. The UP2 looks amazing! Everyone I showed it to was shocked that it tracked activity and sleep because they all said that it looked like a piece of jewelry. That definitely makes it more appealing to use!-Tracking. I never realized how crappy I slept until this!! Apparently I toss and turn a lot in bed, and it's interesting to see that! I also loved tracking my movements and the fact that I can set the UP2 to buzz me whenever I'm being truly lazy.CONS:-No Display. Although I absolutely love the look of the tracker, it would be amazing to be able to have a simple display that pops up showing the time and maybe the amount of steps that you've taken, but the fact that it doesn't definitely isn't a deal breaker.-Alarm. Yeah, no. I set the alarm to wake me up with a "gentle buzzing" and realize that if I had used this to wake up every morning, I'd be late all the time. The buzz is enough to wake you up, but all you have to do is smack it and it shuts off, which allows you to fall back to sleep way too easily.OVERALL:The UP2 is a sleek and gorgeous tracking device that helps you to track your activity and sleep, and that also gives advice on how to get healthier without being obnoxious about it. I'm definitely a fan!

We're an HP household, with three HP laptops in our home, so we're definitely familiar with the HP brand and how their computers work. One thing we don't have is a convertible laptop and we were all anxious to give this a try.PROS:-Small. It's perfect if you're going somewhere or if you just want to laze on the couch and browse the internet. The size is definitely an asset as you can easily move this laptop from room to room, unlike my 17" laptop which feels like a brick to move around.-Cost. My son's HP laptop, with an i5 processor (middle of the road) went for a bit over $700. At just under $300 this laptop is a great price for someone who is working on a budget.-Three Different Modes. I honestly think that my favorite mode is what I call the "tee-pee" mode. This is where you bend the screen back just enough to have the laptop stand up like a teepee. It's ideal for watching Netflix hands-free, trust me on that one! I feel awkward using it in tablet mode, however, because I always feel like I'm going to mess something up with the keys, even though they stop working once you switch modes, but that's likely just me.-Touchscreen. There are definitely benefits to having a touchscreen, especially when you're running Windows 10. The laptop recognizes when you're in tablet mode and immediately switches the display to a more touchscreen friendly mode, much like how Windows 8 looked.CONS:-Speed. This isn't the fastest laptop out there, but for this price point it's not bad. We've noticed that it seems to run slower with Chrome than it does with Windows newer browser, Edge. As long-time Chrome users, Edge may take a bit of getting used to, but the added speed definitely helps.-Really a Tablet? I recently got an exercise tracker that required an app to use. I went to the Google Play store on the laptop, when I was in Tablet mode, and tried to download the app. It stated that I couldn't because the device I was using wasn't compatible. If they're going to market this as a tablet, I feel that it should allow you to download apps like you would be able to with a tablet.-Sound. Again, this is a small laptop so the sound isn't as good as I'd like it to be, but what really bugs me is that you can't adjust the treble and bass so you're stuck with it sounding how it sounds.-Switching Modes. Heads up: if you want to have the laptop automatically adjust your screen, you have to set it that way in the settings area. Initially the laptop does not register the changing motion and so if you're trying to watch something in "tee-pee" mode, the video stays upside down.VERDICT:At just under $300, this is definitely not a horrible laptop. My 14 year olds laptop was much more expensive, but he tends to do a lot of online gaming. I feel that this price, and this size, is ideal for my 11 year old daughter, who has basically confiscated it anyway. It's light and easy for her to tote around and it has all of the functions that she wants and needs it to have.

I got this shaver with the thoughts to give it to my daughter as her first shaver. She's 11 and I figured that, within the next year or so, this would be a great introduction for her to the world of shaving. I was so, so wrong and I'm super glad that I actually tried the shaver before I gave it to her.While she was sitting there I put the recommended head onto the shaver, I believe it's called the epilator head, and put it onto my leg. I IMMEDIATELY felt a stinging pain, much like you'd feel if you had gotten zapped with electricity.I've never had that type of experience with any shaver and you can bet that I'll be looking for something different to start my daughter off with.

I will be the first to admit that I've always used less expensive makeup. Okay, so cheap makeup. I don't wear makeup every day, in fact as a photographer I usually only put it on if I'm shooting a wedding or if my husband takes me out on a date (which is definitely rare!!), so I generally go for pretty cheap makeup. I never saw a reason to spend money on high quality makeup, so I honestly thought when I got this eye shadow palette that I wouldn't see much of a difference between the cheap makeup I purchase and this kit.I was wrong. I was so, so wrong.Firstly, it comes in a beautiful, heavy case - you can definitely tell that it's all there. Secondly, the minute I put my makeup brush to the eye shadow I could tell the difference. It was so silky and smooth and came away from the cake of makeup beautifully. I applied it and again could tell the difference because it is so, so light. Not that the color is light, but it FEELS like when it's on your eye! My daughter and I had an absolute blast trying all of the colors in various combinations, and it seems to stay on very well! The good news, though, is that it also washes off with just soap and water.The sparkly colors don't go on overly sparkly, but do add a little bit of shine to your eye. They blend together absolutely amazingly on the eye as well - I'm very, very happy with this kit and now I realize that I'll have to spend a little more on my makeup if I want to get the same results that I'm getting from this!

When you buy razors you're looking for something that does the job right and something that doesn't break the bank. If you're looking for something that's affordable and that does a good job, these might be a good option for you. At about a dollar a head, and each head lasts four or five shavings, the price honestly isn't horrible. But when I would bang the head against the sink to clear out the head it would pop off every time.For the price, however, the blades work great and for the price, you probably won't get much better of a deal!

Our family is pretty used to playing board games and we were excited to get to try Dragons Gold.PROS:- Easy to Understand Instructions. Unlike some games, these instructions that come with Dragon's gold are thorough and very easy to understand, which made setting up, then playing the game, very easy.- Fun Pieces. Okay, being able to have gems to physically play with is definitely fun!- Simple Gample. It's not complicated, it's very easy, and while the game says you have to be over the age of 12 to play, I'd argue that a smart 10 year old could easily play it.- Advanced Version. I love that there's a simple version and an advanced version. Now that we've gotten the hang of the simple version, we're definitely excited to try the advanced one.CONS:- Repetitious. While the game is fun, it does get a little repetitious. While my two kids (14 and 11) and I will likely pull it out to play a few times, my husband says it's not his cup of tea because of the repetition.OVERALL:This is definitely a fun game for families to play. There was a little debate between us when it came time to divvy up the gems, but the fact that you lost all gems if you didn't use them made us think twice and we were able to divvy things up pretty quickly!

Review from my 11 year old daughter:This is pretty okay. I like that it's not too hard to wrap things. But switching the thread is kind of annoying. I wrapped a pen and a pencil to bring to school, and when I had a friend over we wrapped a few things. It's pretty cool but I don't know how much I'll use it.FROM MOM:I, personally, think this thing is ridiculously fun and I may find myself using it when she's not here! I love how easy it is to personalize things with the thread wrapper and only wish that they had one that would work with hair!

I'm not a fan of spicy but my husband is, so I got these hoping it would fill his craving for spicy treats a bit. Firstly he says they're amazing and, seriously, the box was empty the next day. What he reports, however, is that these are not "that" spicy. He says it's more like a heat that you get in your mouth when you're near the end of chewing a bite, which is extremely enjoyable! If you like a little spicy kick to your treats, this granola bar will definitely be worth the price!

So my husband has used this a few times and I can honestly say that it's his new favorite "toy". The minute it came he was oohing and aahing over how gorgeous it looked and then he immediately ran outside and chopped down a small birch tree (in his defense the tree had been destroyed by an ice storm this past winter and needed to come down). The only complaint he has with it is the handle. The paracord can become a little slippery when you use it for a bit, but other than that, he loves it!

As someone who really enjoys planners, I'm extremely happy with this one. It not only gives me enough space to put all of my important information in the monthly calendar, allowing me to know at a glance what I have going on, but it also give me tons of space daily to be able to organize my day. I'm extremely happy with this!

So I have an 11 year old daughter who was interested in these adorable AmiGamis and while I was hoping it would entertain her for longer, overall we're both pretty please with the set.I won't bore you with how it works, as I'm sure many other reviewers will tell you everything, but instead will tell you how long it kept my daughter entertained. 30 minutes. That's how long she played with them. Now to be fair my 11 year old likes to decorate something one way and then leave it that way, so children who like to change things up will likely get much more play time out of them, but she folded the paper, put stickers on, and then put it on her shelf and left it there. Children who like to decorate things will definitely get amusement out of this set, but those who like to simply decorate it once and leave it alone will only be entertained a short time.

So where I live we have some pretty crappy internet. It's high speed, but the lowest high speed you can get, unfortunately. The only place the line can come in is in our bedroom, which is on one end of the house, while everyone else usually spends time in the other end of the house. We're a pretty technological family - 3 laptops, 2 tablets, smart TV, Wii U, and Amazon's Echo are all connected all the time. Recenly we also got Nintendo's Splatoon, where you get to play online against other people, and both my 14 year old son and I were constantly getting frustrated because we would be in the middle of a game that we were winning only to get kicked offline. I first thought that it was the internet, simply because I know it's not the best.Then I had the opportunity to try the Amped Wireless Extender and I thought, "hey, maybe we're not getting a strong enough signal and that's the problem." When the box arrived I simply took the unit out, plugged it in and followed the on-screen directions and, within 10 minutes, I was hooked up to the wireless and ready to go.One thing to know is that you have to set your computer/electronic gadgets to the new wireless access point in order to get the access you want. As soon as I did that to my computer it went from 3 bars to 5! Even on the back porch! I hooked the new wireless point to the Wii U and turned on Splatoon, hoping and praying that it worked, and it did!! Now occasionally I do get kicked offline on the Wii U but it went to getting kicked off 5 times out of 10 to getting booted maybe 2 times out of 10, which I can attribute to our internet and can definitely handle.My entire family is extremely impressed with how much this extender has helped to connect everyone in our house better wirelessly and I'll definitely never be without one again!

The scent - ooooohhh the scent. This soap smells SO GOOD! My husband used it first and when he came out of the shower he immediately called me in and said "you have GOT to try this." Now for a man to get excited over the smell of soap, that should say something, but he seriously was excited and now, after I've had a shower with it, I definitely get why. It seriously smells amazing. It's hard to describe the scent - the first whiff I got wasn't that great, but as I started using it a sweet, but not overly-sweet, fruity-scent started filling the shower and the steam actually accentuated the smell. And, hours later, my skin still smells amazing. I'm definitely more than happy with this scent and with the feel of my skin after using it.

We have 2 Malamutes and a Husky/Wolf mix so we're no stranger to large pet beds. I had hoped that this bed would be my dogs new favorite, replacing the old, much cheaper bed, but honestly they haven't gotten on it!! We were able to get them to lay on it, all three of them (separately, of course) but  they wouldn't stay. Now I have absolutely no idea why they won't stay on this bed, as they have with many others, but we'll continue to keep working with them on it and trying to figure it out.I absolutely adore this bed. Our children's friends have all come here and jumped on it (this is after we attempted to have the dogs use it, it was clean of kid scent when we attempted it), and surprisingly enough, the cats have sort of taken it over! We have 4 cats and three of them absolutely LOVE the bed. I think it's because they sink so far down into it, it's very cozy.So while my dogs have not yet successfully used the bed, I do find that it is a gorgeous bed with lots of cushiness.

Yesterday was a rare Sunday off. I should've enjoyed spending time with my family, getting out with the kids and the husband, adventuring around our area and enjoying the early summer weather.In both cases I SHOULD have done something - but instead I spent my Sunday arguing with my kids, and my husband, over whose turn it was to play Splatoon. You'd think a 35 year old woman wouldn't be able to get easily addicted to a game. Yeah, you'd be wrong! I even spent two hours this morning playing the game when I should have been working. Splatoon is everything I've ever wanted in a shooter game, and so much more. Let me preface this by saying that I stink - I really stink - at almost all shooter games. My husband has been playing Goldeneye on the Wii for years and gets addicted, and I honestly never understood his obsession with the shooter game until Splatoon came out. The great thing about this game is that even though I stink at first person shooter, it's okay! The main purpose of the game is to get the most ink on the map, NOT to kill the most people, so not only do I have a chance at doing good, I've been one of the number one players for my teams a vast majority of the time, which is not something I'm used to!PROS:- Great for all ages. My husband and I love it, our 14 year old is obsessed, and even our 11 year old daughter loves it too!- Perfect for the non-shooter gamer. Let me repeat: THIS IS NOT A GAME FOCUSED ON SHOOTING OTHERS! Yes, you can spent your time taking out the opposition, but you may not get the most points. You can also, however, spend the most time putting ink on the map and you can get tons more points, which translates into in-game money, which lets you buy gear that makes your character better. So shooting? Not the main priority.- Awesome colors. I haven't seen anyone comment on the colors yet - they're amazing. I'm a visual person and seeing the contrasting colors go against each other, pink and bright yellow, purple and teal, blue and orange - it's a visual feast for the eyes.CONS:- The connectivity isn't always the best. Now this could be because of the servers, or it could be because our internet isn't anywhere near as fast as I'd like it to be. Honestly the connectivity isn't horrid, but there's nothing like having 4 seconds left in a game that your team is winning only to have the game cut out. GAH!- There's no way to be able to play with either local friends or others online. It would be nice to be able to set up a four person team, or a two person team, but right now there's no reliable, easy way to do that.OVERALL:I'm in serious love with this game - my whole family is. If you look at the price and think, "that's a little too expensive." I completely understand - I thought the same thing. In fact our son paid for half of the game because I wasn't convinced it would be worth the money. After making the whole family take turns playing the game on Sunday, my son noted that I absolutely loved the game and asked if I'd pay him back his money LOL. Seriously, though - well done by Nintendo. I can see a bunch of other companies copying this style of game very soon!

I have always hear that goji berries are extremely healthy for you, and if that is the case than it is something that I could definitely eat. Many healthy products taste absolutely nasty, but after having five adults try these, this is the conclusion as to the taste:"At first bite it's a bit leathery - then you get a slight prune taste, or, a slight tart taste, but nothing very strong. The taste then finishes with a slight tin-y tang."The aftertaste wasn't the favorite of anyone, but my husband did do as the bag suggested and made a sort of "tea" out of a handful of berries. He enjoyed the tea and said if it was something he could drink that would help him to stay healthy, he'd down a cup every day!

First let me say that I haven't noticed a HUGE difference in our air quality or in the amount of dust/dander we have. Now, let me also say that we have 3 cats and 4 dogs and it's quite possible that this purifier has decided that we simply have far too many animals for it to handle. But when we were sitting in the same room with it (the dining room is where we placed it - we have an open living plan) we did notice that the air seemed to be a bit fresher, and it was definitely nice and cool. The dusting went down a tiny bit, but again, I've only tried using it during allergy season (and we have no environmental allergies in the house) and with all the animals. I will continue to use this and will update later this summer when our oldest cat, who is allergic to something about the end of summer, tends to have issues.

My daughter LOVES this set. It was tricky to find Ever After High PJ's that would fit her as she's 11, but these not only fit, they fit beautifully and they're very comfortable for her - a total win!!

This playpen was ideal for housing baby bunnies in my house. As a photographer I do a shoot once a year with baby bunnies and this worked beautifully! I will say that we had to put some cardboard on the outside of the playpen (we used zip ties to secure it) because the bunnies were so little they snuck through the grate! But only a week after we got them they were too big to go through, so just make sure you check if you're putting baby bunnies in this to make sure they can't sneak out :D

I absolutely adore this necklace. Firstly, it's a fantastic gift for any mom! I will say that I've had a lot of people ask me why the gem is blue, assuming that it has some significance. Honestly, it doesn't :D. But it is a gorgeous necklace! what surprised me most, I think, is that the box it came in was gorgeous - I almost didn't want to take it out of it, it hung in there so well! The pendant is sturdy and the "mom" is clearly visible even from a number of feet away. Very happy with this!!

Firstly these are absolutely gorgeous. Seriously - they're beautiful and I've had tons of compliments on them! The biggest complaint I have, however, is that they definitely hurt my ears. The metal on the ear piece gets wider the closer it gets to the dangled design. Because of this it definitely stretched my ears out a bit and wasn't very comfortable. The earrings themselves, however, are absolutely gorgeous and I will definitely continue to wear them and hope that my hole stretches out a tiny bit :D

First of all, these earrings are absolutely gorgeous. They look far more expensive than they are! They came in an absolutely gorgeous Amazon box that I loved so much I had to keep them in! The only problem I have is that my ears got a little sore with these on after a bit of time. But as a disclaimer, I don't wear earrings all the time so that may be one of the reasons why? Overall, though, I love these earrings and everyone has commented on how gorgeous they are, so I'll definitely handle any little pain I get from wearing them :D

My dog now has a new favorite toy, and it's this ChuckIt ball. We have medium sized ChuckIt balls that we use our thrower with and we were a little surprised to find that this didn't fit - at the time we didn't realize there was a size different. Be aware: there is! Even though we can't chuck this nearly as far as our medium sized one, our dog LOVES this ball. We have 2 Giant Malamutes and believe it or not this is one of the few toys that he has not managed to totally destroy yet! He did break the squeaker after 2 days, but with a giant malamute gnawing on it I'm surprised the squeaker lasted that long! The ball, however, is still in perfect shape and Kamik and Takaani love sharing this ball!

I got this for my husband mainly because his previous taste in male perfume has been extremely smelly - so much so that it gives me a headache if I walk into the bathroom even a half hour after he's used it!!Eternity is SO much nicer! It's got a masculine, delicious smell that isn't overpowering. So far everyone who has smelled it has really enjoyed it, and I enjoy that not only does it smell great, it isn't overpowering and hasn't caused any headaches!! I'll definitely make sure to stuff his stocking with this every year from now on!

This is a LOT of Jolly Ranchers!! You don't quite realize until you get the bag how many you actually get for 5 lbs. We got it and immediately put it into a large classic-candy jar I'd gotten from an auction a month or so ago. They barely fit into the jar (and this jar is huge!!). My kids immediately jumped into it, and so did their friends, and I have since had to shoo them away after they proved that they have no willpower when it comes to Blue Raspberry Jolly Ranchers. While there were a few broken, and a few pieces in the bag, overall you get great quality and a fantastic product for any Jolly Rancher Lovers! Now if only it came in green apple!!

I apparently had a much different experience than the other reviewers of this stapler. It came and was very easy to set up, which is great, but when we tried to use it we found that it has one fatal flaw: if you want to staple 20 pages, it's great - if you want to only staple two or three together it will staple so hard that the back end of the staple comes through the front side making anything you've stapled become a weapon! We fiddled with it for awhile and my husband immediately said that it should have some way to dial the intensity back a bit, but apparently that's not possible. So while it may be great for stapling large quantities of paper together, it's not so hot for stapling just a few.

I am in love with this shirt. First let me state that I'm not a small woman - and I definitely have a larger chest. While it would be possible to button this up, it wouldn't be as loose as I'd want, so I decided to put a cami under it and to leave it half unbuttoned. My husband complimented me the second I walked out of the bedroom and said it was his new favorite outfit of mine!! I absolutely adore this shirt and will definitely be wearing it in the spring and fall months here in VT!

The problem with this conditioner is that how it works depends on the type of hair you have (which isn't too much unlike other conditioners).My 10 year old daughter used it and she not only loved the smell, she also has found that her hair is much easier to control, and in Vermont's frigid cold weather her hair was filled with static. This conditioner actually helps keep the static down!My hair, however, didn't fare as well. I took a shower on Thursday evening. By Saturday morning my hair was very greasy-looking. I can usually go two days without having to wash my hair but this conditioner has shown that my hair is apparently more greasy than I thought it was!The best part of this conditioner is the smell - it smells FABULOUS. I now have an obsession with finding other fig-smelling items to see if they smell as good!!VERDICT:If you have dry hair, this is ideal for you. If, however, your hair tends to go to grease rather than dryness, you may want to find another conditioner.

This is the first time we've had a memory foam mattress in our house so know that this review is coming from a total memory foam mattress virgin.We got this bed for our 14 year old son and immediately knew we wanted it to be a platform bed. When the bed arrived it was in a VERY tiny box. The box was so small that I worried that it was an inflatable mattress! But once you get the bed out of the box it decompresses in less than 24 hours.PROS:- Comfortable!! It definitely has a very firm feel to it, but it's really, really ridiculously comfortable. A friend told me that memory foam mattresses are "relationship killers" because all you want to do is sleep in them, and I can totally see that now!- Actually very cooling. The mattress truly doesn't get very hot. I'm anxious to see how it does this summer!- Chemical smell - so the chemical smell isn't a plus, but the fact that the smell goes away pretty quickly IS a plus. We live in a cold climate so the smell was a bit stronger than we expected, but the smell went away in less than 2 days.- Works great as platform bed. We prefer platform beds here but this works well as one! You just have to make sure that you have a solid foundation under the mattress so that it doesn't sag between the slats. We purchased this frame to use and so far it's working beautifully! LINK: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00CP53DB6/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o01_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1OVERALL:Our 14 year old son got this bed, as he desperately needed a new one, and he has slept very good since it's been in his room! He usually tosses and turns a bit but we've found that he tends to do so less with this mattress, and he sleeps very deeply, so yay!I definitely, absolutely love this bed! It's important to know that if you're used to a "regular" spring mattress it's definitely more firm (for example we have a pillow-top mattress and it feels very different) but once you get used to the firmness it feels really great, and I'd imagine that if you had back issues it would help a lot!!

Would you believe that this actually makes dishes a little more fun to do, especially when you can con your teenager and 10 year old into doing dishes in order to USE the product?True story!When the scrubber came in both of my children were interested in it. It looks so different from any other kitchen cleaning tool we have that they were actually excited to use it. They did the dishes for the next few nights - and any night off of doing dishes is good!!The scrubber actually works really well. It hasn't scratched anything yet and is great at getting all that "gunk" off of the dishes and pots and pans. The only negative thing I can say about it is that I used it with my butcher knife (which may have been wrong but I did) and it cut a bit of the scrubber very quickly, so, note to you, works fantastically as long as you keep it away from the knives!

We've definitely had some fun with this blender!First, we decided to really check the power and make kool aid slushies. The machine had more than enough power to crush all of the ice quickly and easily.Then we made shakes and used the program mode on the blender. It went well, but we actually had to turn it on a little more so that we were able to get rid of all of the chunks of ice cream out of the shake.Next was smoothies. We did two different kind of smoothies - one with all frozen fruit and another with half frozen, half fresh, and both smoothies were made to the perfect texture.This blender does what it says it's going to do - nothing more, nothing less. The bonus parts? The suction cups on the bottom of the blender which helps the blender to avoid moving all around the counter. Another bonus that I loved? There is a place on the bottom of the blender where you can wind up the cord, making it easy to store it on your counter - if your cabinets are high enough to do so as this blender is REALLY tall. Overall, we definitely liked the blender and it will get plenty of use!

We were introduced to Munchkin about a month ago, and we love it. It's a game that the whole family can play (we have a 10 year old daughter and 14 year old son) and we really enjoy it, so we were excited to try Munchkin Panic. We've never played Castle Panic so it took a little while to figure out the rules - but, just as with the Munchkin game, the rule book does make it fairly easy to figure out.The first game we played took about an hour and a half - most of that, I think, is because it took so long to figure everything out. The next game, though, was less than an hour. There are still a few things we're not completely clear of, such as what to do if a monster destroys the tower - does it stay there or does it get taken off? - but overall we definitely like the game! It's a fun addition to the Munchkin family and having the castle pieces definitely adds a lot to the game :D

I have no idea why some people have said that this doesn't warm up well - it definitely does! Yes, it takes four or five minutes to get hot, but it says to expect this in the instructions.PROS:-Easy to store.-Makes the panini perfectly with no pressure needed. It says to not push down on the lid and it means to not do that. The weight of the top is perfect to create a delicious panini-Doesn't make just panini's! My daughter and I sliced a few pieces of french bred and made some freaking amazing french bread pizza on this thing. We put down a piece of aluminum foil first and used the knob on the side to keep the top from pushing onto the pizza. We loved it so much we made it two days in a row!-Easy to clean. We spray the plates with nonstick cooking spray and then just wipe it down once it's cooled and it cleans perfectly.CONS:-The knob. While it's nice that the knob can help lock the top in place, it's not perfect. The knob is on the right side so the left side droops down when you lock it. Having knobs on both sides would definitely improve this design.OVERALL:This Panini press is absolutely fantastic and my family is now excited to add paninis to our regular dinner rotation!

These earrings are absolutely beautiful! They are definitely heavy so they feel solid. The gems in the earrings are decently sized and overall the earrings look great and feel good too! The only complaint I have about them is how you put them on. You have to pull the earring apart in order to get the post to pull out enough to put it on your ears. But overall I definitely really like these earrings!

As I stated in my previous table tennis racket review, I am not a professional table tennis player. The interesting thing is that you don't have to be a professional to feel the difference between this type of racket and one that is cheesy and comes with your table. It truly does make a difference and it feels really good in your hand. One thing ot note, though, is that I liked this racket a bit less than the other racket I reviewed, but honestly it is still absolutely amazing and makes playing the game much more fun!

This is, quite simply, a fantastic racket. I'm in no way a professional table tennis player, but my family loves to play for fun. This racket actually showed me that there's a huge difference between a professional racket and a cheap one that comes with your table. Not only does it give a wonderful bounce to it, it also feels great in your hand.

We purchased this TV when our old one was on the fritz and so far we're in LOVE. The television is definitely a unique size - you don't see a lot of 58" tv's, but it's perfect. The big thing I want to note is the weight. We got our last TV about 8 years ago. This TV is 12" bigger and 20 lbs lighter! Because of that we were able to use the same stand we'd used for the previous TV.As for the television itself, the only complaint I have is that the remote seems to react a little sluggishly, but other than that, it works beautifully. We had some movies on a memory stick. I stuck the stick into the back and was easily able to watch the movie. Not only that, the next day I put it back into the back of the television and the TV is SO smart that it remembered where I was in the movie and started it there! THAT impressed me! I've been a Samsung product user for years and this television is just proof why I'll continue to be one.

I absolutely LOVE this deodorant! I've had issues before with deodorants not working well. I swear I'm not that sweaty, but many of them don't last a whole day and I find myself having to reapply. The Dove formula has always worked well for me, and this spray antiperspirant is honestly some of the best I've worn. I had 2 full days of photo shoots - over 40 families in my studio in 2 days - and I only had to apply in the morning for all-day-long coverage. Yay!

I had a problem that a similar reviewer did. The stripping worked beautifully on windows, but it didn't stay stuck on the door at all - which really bummed me out because it truly did help keep the cold out. If it would have stayed stuck, I would have given it beyond five stars, but I'm guessing the adhesive is not able to handle Vermont cold.

I'm not sure what happened to the reviewer who had a problem installing this surface because not only did it go on beautifully for us, it also has stayed on like it was designed to be there.PROS:-Easy Installation. My husband and I made sure to make this level by bringing out, well, a level, and by marking it with pencil on the wall. The bottom of the surface is taped to the tube it comes wrapped around and we used this to help weigh down the surface so that it went on easily. We undid a bit of the backing on the surface, attached it to the wall and slowly but surely smoothed the surface down the wall. The bubbles came out very easily and before we knew it, the surface was on the wall! It did help that there were two of us doing it.-Writes beautifully. Even though you can feel the wall behind the dry erase surface, the surface is so slick that the markers glide right over any small little bumps that may be on the wall. SMALL bumps. I'm sure if there were a large bump you'd feel it LOL.-Erases even more beautifully. This comes with an erase cloth which both my daughter and I found to be MUCH better than any eraser we've ever used!CONS:-No markers. It comes with no markers. This may be a little thing, but since it comes with an eraser cloth I kind of feel like it should come with some markers too LOL.-No holder. There is no holder that goes with this (that I know of) which is why we spent a bit of time taking an old yogurt container, decorating it, and adding it to the wall next to this surface with a hook. It's perfect for holding the markers but if Post-it created something that is designed to hold markers with this system, that would definitely be ideal!!VERDICT:We're in love with this surface. It is HUGE! It's more than large enough for a number of children to be drawing on it at the same time, and I really feel like while the company should market to businesses, they should also market to parents of children because it simply is a perfect way to get a huge white board quickly and easily!

My husband and my son both snagged a pair of these to try on.My husband:"These are pretty nice. They're sleek and they're smooth and they're definitely very cool (temperature wise). It feels almost like another layer of skin on your body, a cool one, and they hug your legs and move with your body very well. I don't feel like my underwear is jostling around in my pants anymore - these hug my body so well it feels almost like you're not wearing them."My almost 14 year old son:"These are freaking awesome, mom. Can I have these? Dad! You don't want these, do you? They are SO comfortable and I can move around really well. So dad...you don't want these, do you? MOM! Order more!!!"So apparently I'll be ordering more for my 14 year old AND for my 41 year old!!

I am definitely not very impressed with this rug. Firstly, the rug came curled up in a box. When we unrolled it (it was shrink-wrapped) we found there was a huge flaw with this rug: it wouldn't unfurl fully. We thought that maybe it had gotten cold during the trip to our home (Vermont in autumn is known for being chilly) so we set it up and decided to give it a few days to see if it would decide to get tame and lay down. It has been over 5 days and the rug still has not lay flat, even though we put it in an area where it would be walked on to try to help ensure that the edges went flat. They haven't.Also, the design isn't very clear in the rug. If you have someone hold it up and you stand away from it, you can see the design. If, however, it's on the floor as it's designed to be, you definitely can't see the full design. It looks more like a gray shag carpet with no real design.I would not purchase this rug again.

These scissors are absolutely AMAZING! We have a slight problem with scissors disappearing in our house. For some reason they seem to just vanish! So the fact that we got 3 scissors in one pack is absolutely fantastic and means that we'll have scissors for awhile! Not only is the amount of scissors you get amazing, the fact that these scissors cut almost effortlessly is honestly one of the most amazing things ever. I've cut a few things with these including paper, light cardboard, tape and even fabric and they cut through all of these things with very little effort from me.I am very, VERY impressed with these scissors and I won't be going without them again!

We've played all the other Just Dance games, so we had to get this one!PROS:-Amazing music! It seriously has some of the best music I've seen on any of the just dance games!-Great reactions. The game reacts very well to the wiimote.-Background stuff. Having things in the background definitely takes a whole new dimension to the game!-Online play - being able to play someone online is really fun and makes it fun even if you're just playing by yourself!CONS:-Difficult interface. We spent 15 VERY frustrating minutes trying to figure out how to make a new dancer card! For those who want to know, here's how:NEW DANCER CARD:Go to YOUR dancer card. At the bottom you'll find "local dancers". CLICK THAT and you can finally create a new dancer!VERDICT:Just Dance 2015 is definitely a good addition to the whole series and we're very glad we got it!

There has been a lot of talk about games getting more high def, but what many people aren't talking about is the fact that the audio is also getting more high def as well. Play a first person shooter and you may find yourself in serious trouble if you can't hear every small sound. Miss that crunch of boot on gravel and you may wind up being killed by your enemy. Turn your television up too loudly, however, and you wind up annoying anyone in the rooms around you. These headphones are definitely one ideal solution.PROS:-Connects quickly and easily. We managed to have the headphones hooked up to the Xbox within just a few minutes. A couple of tweaks and the sound and the mic were both working beautifully.-Adjusting sounds separately. I personally loved this. I loved that I could adjust the mic and the sounds separately. It definitely made it easy to find the perfect level on both, and relatively quickly too.-Completely wireless! No connecting to the controller! I hadn't realized how tethered I'd felt before until I gave this a shot. Not having to worry about that wire definitely changed things quite a bit!-Extremely comfortable. The earphones are padded beautifully, and so is the head piece. The combination of padding allows for you to wear the headphones for over an hour with relative comfort. I haven't worn them for longer than an hour and a half yet, but so far they've been comfortable the whole time I've worn them.-Multiple uses. We not only used this on the Xbox, we hooked it up to the computer as well. The microphone does not work on the computer (I do not believe it is supposed to - I'm guessing it's a driver issue), but the sound works beautifully on the computer as well, making this an electronic device that has multiple uses, which is exactly what we love in this household.CONS:-No mic on computer. As I've said, the microphone does not work when hooked to the computer, but the company does not claim that it does. I, however, wish they could fix the driver issue so that it could - that would make these go from fantastic to absolutely amazing.VERDICT:These headphones are absolutely perfect and do exactly what the company says they do. They work beautifully, wirelessly, and are extremely comfortable to wear for fairly long periods of time and I am extremely happy to have them! Now if only I could wrestle them away from my 13 year old son...

I LOVE these kitchen towels. Words honestly can't describe my love. No, seriously! Okay, I have reasons for this. Firstly I've had a lot of kitchen towels, but most of them have been unsuccessful at drying dishes well. These towels, however, absorb the water SO GOOD! We did a large load of dishes and the towel was SOAKED - but it was still holding water!! We put it in the bath tub to drain and, the next morning, it was completely dry!Towels always fall off my stove handle - I'm sure a lot of people have this issue. These towels, however, are the perfect size to stay on the rack and haven't fallen off once! Not only that, they have a loop sewn into them so that you can hang them from a hook if you so choose.I seriously love these towels and will not be doing without them in my kitchen ever again!

This gyrobot was actually something that the whole family enjoyed! I got it for my 10 year old daughter, who is intrigued by science, but what surprised me the most is that the whole family actually enjoyed getting involved in building these robots! We started by building just one but wound up building two of the robots in the same session. I really, really enjoyed this robot kit and would be interested in purchasing another kit from the same company!
Great fun!! Wish it were longer! A definite 5 stars.

I actually love these placemats. They're not like any placemats I've ever seen before because, firstly, they're round!! The roundness is definitely something that makes me really happy and I absolutely love the fact that they're the size that they are. They're not too large but, at the same time, they're the perfect size for dinner service. The material that they're made of makes them easy to wipe off and they're not uncomfortable to eat on. But I definitely love these placemats! The most important thing, however, is that they don't even annoy my husband - now THAT is amazing!

This is definitely not your typical book, which is probably what I liked the most about it. told in many lists (although not entirely in lists), this is definitely a unique book. I have read a LOT of books, but this is definitely the first I've read that incorporates lists in it like this. However in reading this the first thing that came to my mind was something my literary professor in college said a long time ago. To paraphrase, he basically said that you have to learn to write correctly in the English language and to have a good plot before you go mucking around with using grammar incorrectly.Now, telling a story with lists isn't necessarily using grammar incorrectly, but it doesn't necessarily help the story. As you'll read, many reviews say that it helps to understand teenagers and their "one word answers", but having a teenager myself, and knowing and working with many teenagers, it really isn't that difficult to get more than a one word answer from them.But back to the story. I felt badly for Darren and all that he was going through at such a crucial time in his life, but it sort of felt like an avalanche of crap was thrust on him all at once. And, sometimes, that's exactly how life is. Unlike many teens, who feel like their life is horrible when all that's wrong is that they've lost cell phone reception, Darren truly deals with a very difficult time. It is the struggles he faces, and how he takes those challenges and learns from them, that helped me enjoy this book, not the fact that lists were heavily sprinkled throughout the work. My advice to the author would be to stop employing gimmicky tactics and to start focusing more on story. A great story needs absolutely no gimmicks to propel it to the top.

Okay, this Bluetooth speaker definitely surprised me. I expected something this tiny to have absolutely no power - I was definitely wrong!! Firstly it was very easy to set up with bluetooth. We had my daughter's Samsung Galaxy Tab hooked up to it very quickly after we powered it up.What shocked me the most is that this little speaker definitely makes your phone (or Tab) sound much louder than the little speakers that come with it do. The design of the cube seems to allow the music to reverbrate through the tube beautifully, giving a halfway decent sound. Now, you don't have the huge bass you would have if you spend hundreds of dollars on an expensive bluetooth speaker, but if you're putting your phone in a plastic cup to get the sound louder, this is DEFINITELY a better option and has a much better sound!Disclaimer: I received this product to test for an honest review.

These headphones are absolutely fantastic no matter whether you have a Playstation or not!! We do not have a Playstation but are huge music lovers and had not yet found a good wireless headset that sounded great and that had an affordable price point. These headphones meet almost every desire we have for a headset.PROS:- Works beautifully with our computer and with our tab. We hooked up the USB stick that comes with the set (the set also comes with tons of other wires that allow you to use these headphones for multiple things) and got it set up fairly easily. Once we had it synced up (took less than 10 seconds once we figured out how to do it), music was pumping out quickly!- These headphones have some serious range! We got about 50 feet away and the headphones worked beautifully. When my husband got out of range it didn't stutter but just shut off. Then, the second we got back in range, it was back on again and it was all done extremely smoothly.- The sound is great! I'm picky about sound but the bass and treble both seem to be beautifully set and so far all the different types of music we've listened to have sounded absolutely fantastic!- Once we synced it once to my laptop I simply had to put the USB stick in again and the headset was automatically synced to it. Nice!CONS:- The syncing takes a second to figure out. Make sure that you read the instructions before you try to set it up, and that you have something small like a paperclip as you have to push it into the hole to get the USB stick to start the sync process. This seems a little clunky to me and while I guess it helps to prevent someone from accidentally hitting the sync button while they're using it, it's kind of a pain to deal with.- It's LOUD! My husband turned them up about as loud as they could go and was easily over 30 feet away from me and I could definitely hear him listening to Stan Bush's "The Touch" (yes, he's a huge Transformers fan!). I'm definitely going to keep an ear out to make sure that the kids aren't listening to it too loudly.- Not noise cancelling. You can still hear someone trying to talk to you. Granted, they may be muted a bit if you're listening to loud music but there's no excuse for saying that you couldn't hear someone calling you LOL.VERDICT:While we have not used these headphones for gaming or speaking through, I can tell you from a music lover's point of view that these headphones are absolutely fantastic and should definitely not be pigeonholed into being thought of as simply a gaming headset!!

The best chefs say that you should never have a tool that does only one thing, but that all of your kitchen gadgets should have multiple uses. This spatula definitely has multiple uses! So far I've used it to scrape the last of the mayo out of the jar, to get the batter out of a bowl and have used it to help spread frosting over a cake! Its unique shape makes it the perfect multi-tool in any kitchen and it's something that I'm very glad is an addition to my tools as it will definitely be a go-to tool in my house!

If I had one of these when I was little I would have terrorized my entire family daily! This TerraDrone is something that is extremely fun and is something that has actually bonded my husband and son a bit!PROS:- SERIOUSLY FUN! Yes, this is a huge pro because for the first time there's a cool, great-working Nerf remote control vehicle that you can fire darts from while sitting in your chair. It's perfect for terrorizing the cats! (note: I've never hit them, the remote control vehicle simply crawling towards them freaks them out enough!!)- Works well. Unlike other RC vehicles, this spider-like vehicle is designed to be used very easily. The remote control has 3 buttons - one that points the turret up and down, one that rotates it, and one that makes the TerraDrone crawl forward or backwards. Whatever direction the turret is pointing, that is the direction that the TerraDrone walks forward! This makes so much sense as you simply point the turret where you want to go and press forward towards your target.- Easy to load the darts. The cartridge simply pops out and you load the darts gatling-gun style.- Not difficult to put together.
