Make sure you pick the right size and Left Draw/Right Draw, but you can't go wrong.Thank you for reading. If this was helpful, please click yes below!

Works perfectly. It's Incredibly accurate. I use this almost weekly and it's perfect every time. Easy to apply and absolutely accurate. I've compared it with 2 other gauges and it's always spot on.It's worth a few dollars more for a digital gauge (which professional reviews seem to rate consistently more accurate than analog on higher end gauges anyway) and for one with the bleeder valve. It makes getting the exact pressure, so much easier. I've used this on everything from cars, motorcycles, bicycles and even hand trucks.

I have had one of these for 15 years and loved it. I bought another after I lost the original velcro shoulder straps and it started to wear out.This holster has a lot of room for adjustment, to get the perfect fit. You can wear it lower or higher to your liking. I've had to maneuver mine a little so that it doesn't rest right against my rib cage, but after a little finessing, it tucks in perfectly. I can wear this all day with a light shirt and not worry about imprinting. It will hold a Glock 26/19 and multiple spare magazines.  You can throw it in the wash (on cold, hang dry) to clean it and it will last for over a decade. Simplicity, service and function.One caveat; it's a DEEP conceal, meaning it's not made for quick draw. If you need/want fast access; this isn't the holster. It's going to sit under a layer, deep under your armpit and may be secured with a velcro strap. Fast access is not it's purpose, so know what your need is.All in all, I give it top marks for use and durability.Please check yes below if this was helpful. Thanks for reading.

It's a well made holster designed perfectly for the Glock 26. However I had a few issues with it.Firstly, if you're looking for a true concealable CCW holster, this one is still a little too bulky (at least for me). I'd have to wear a large over shirt or jacket to avoid imprinting with this holster. The convenience of the magazine pouch, does add bulk that makes it more visible. That being said it's well made, sturdy and the clip has enough power to hold well.The clip was my second issue. Weirdly enough on 2 occasions I pulled the bottom of the clip out to slide it over my belt and the metal was so finely shaved it immediately cut me. To the point, my wife asked why I had blood on my shirt. It's razor sharp. I'm a young guy, in good shape and not on any blood thinners, so nay sayers'; it wasn't my fault. The clip is just shaved too thin for it's purpose. Maybe mine was an aberration as the reviews of this product are pretty good (reason I bought it). But be forewarned.All in all, a good holster depending on your need. I went with a tried and true Blackhawk inside the pants holster, which has a much slimmer profile and a deep concealment shoulder holster. Both of which work perfectly.Please check yes below if this was helpful to you. Thanks for reading.

Great Look and Sound: Absolutely terrible fit and install: I've installed these on multiple bikes but for the softail; they are terrible. The exhaust mount bracket is snug up against the swing arm and very difficult to get to. Vance and Hines did not weld the nuts onto their exhaust, so you've got to try and get the bolt and nut into a tiny space. It's too tight for almost any tool, including open ended wrenches. It's an absolute nightmare. This would have been so much easier if they welded the nut in place like the stock pipe.Just be warned. If I was doing it over, I would not buy these. I'd buy a different pipe or a full system simply because slip on install shouldn't be this difficult. They are typical Vance and Hines finish and sound. Excellent, loud, throaty sound. Just not worth the pain.

I have this frother and the Aeroccino Plus. I use one at the office and one at home and have had them over a year. This one performs much better in my opinion. It's taller and narrower than the plus and doesn't have a handle, however the frothing is much smoother and more consistent. I've used this with whole milk, 2%, Almond Milk and Silk. Without the mesh whip it delivers a creamy froth and a fair amount of whipped foam. For me it's the perfect amount. With the mesh whip attached it produces a full amount of cappuccino style foam and less cream.Having used both for over a year, I can say they are both good, reliable and a required addition to any home latte/cappuccino system. I would take the 3 over the plus. I'm not sure why Nespresso and stores package the plus and push it, being it's the older model.Maybe they have an excess of stock? Both are easy to clean, reliable and consistent. Both are fairly quick, completing the whip silently within 2-3 minutes (depending on amount). This combined with my Nespresso has completely changed my coffee drinking. I love making Latte's at home and have cut my store bought coffee drinking by 2/3.  This frother is an essential part of that package.[...]. Thank you.

I installed this on my 2015 Forty Eight with a Screaming Eagle Stage 1 air cleaner and Vance and Hines 3 inch slip ons.It's so easy I wouldn't even consider it an install. Plug it in, turn on bike done. It immediately connected with my iPhone. I was able to originally select stock HD pipes and high intake air cleaner. The bike immediately ran a little smoother and cooler. This was great since the bikes (especially in CA) come extremely lean from the factory to meet emissions standards. Just upgrading your stock bike with the fuel pak will help it run richer (cooler) and smoother.After I installed the new pipes, I upgraded it selecting the exact V&H pipes, high intake air cleaner and uploaded a new map again. Bike runs smooth through the gear range, has quicker acceleration and sounds incredible. The Fuel Pak made it easy and saves you $150-200 you'd pay each time the dealer flashed the map.I leave the FuelPak installed and am able to see everything on the bike in real time.  You can see intake temperature, operating temperature, spark, fuel economy etc.  Download the app and check it out in demo mode. You can see everything it has available.  I haven't used the autotune (don't need to) but it's simple and comprehensive if needed. You can also go in and individually adjust the map parameters if you're so inclined, but I don't need to and don't have the level of knowledge to make individual decisions. But the flexibility is there if you need it.This or the Powervision Dyno jet? Both great units. The Dyno jet has some additional features. You may have to call them and give them your specs to download a specific map. But you can load custom maps from other sources into it. You can leave it attached to the bike, but you'd have to mount it on your handlebars. Dynojet is operated through it's screen, while the V&H is through your phone app (which is more convenient to me). The dynojet is a little more complex and flexible, but also not quiet as simple or accessible. Depends on your need. For more advanced programming and/or racing probably the dynojet. For casual riding, regular use and ease; I like the V&H. The only 2 downsides I think to the V&H Fuelpak is the lack of brands represented in pipes (i.e.; V&H, Roland Sands, etc).  If you have Bassani, Cobra etc, you'd have to either call V&H and they will tell you which map to use, or use a base map and autotune. Both acceptable and easy, but it contributed to my decision to buy the V&H pipes. Just easier.  Second is inability to load custom maps. Ie; you can't download a map off the internet and load it, if that matters to you.Overall; excellent product, well designed, easy user interface, reliable and typical Vance and Hines quality. Couldn't recommend more highly.  [...]. Thank you!.Update: 08/09/15: I added this unit to my 2015 Harley Softail Fat Boy. I had the same easy experience. I used the AutoTune on the FatBoy and it worked well smoothing out acceleration and riching up the engine. It works as advertised, very simple and very effective. Secondly; I installed hard bags on the FatBoy during which, I dropped the fender. Unbeknownst to me; the FuelPak slipped through a crack down in front of the fender. I recently went to remove it after AutoTuning to discover the accidental "relocation". It was bent, seared (from contact with the motor) and the case was cracked open. I about had a heart attack. I snapped it back together, used electrical tape to close it back up and plugged it in. Works perfectly.Full and complete acknowledgement to Vance and Hines for making a very durable, tough, Harley worthy product! It literally took a beating, burning and cracking and keeps on ticking. Thanks V&H.If this was helpful please click yes below. Thanks for reading.

I put these on my wife's 2015 Forty Eight. They look great. The fit and finish is very high quality. The matte "denim" black perfectly matches the stock Harley denim black on the header heat shields. The were fairly easy to install. The only challenges is the stock muffler clamp is barely fits the V&H pipe. I used a rubber mallet to tap it in place and it worked perfectly.  This was about a 45 minute install, including aligning the heat shields.They sound great. Absolutely great. A word of warning, these are loud pipes. I expected them to be quieter than the Vance and Hines short shots. I'm not sure they are, they're very close. So if you're looking for quieter you'll need something different, or you'll have to try the quiet baffle.  That being said, obviously if you want loud, they are much easier to install than the short shots and look great.I paired mine with a Screaming Eagle stage 1 air cleaner and the Vance and Hines Fuel Pak (separately reviewed).  Excellent combination. Great sound, excellent torque, bike is smoother through the gear range and it runs richer (cooler).Overall we couldn't be happier. Sound is great, look is excellent, fairly easy install.  [...]. Thank you.

A can't live without. I've referenced this for multiple repairs/upgrades in the first 5 months and it's been incredibly helpful.  Although some descriptions are generic across different years of different sportsters; it's mostly spot on. The images and descriptions have saved me a few times from making a mistake, or missing a small, critical step.  If you wrench on your bike, you must have this. For example; when installing a Stage 1 air cleaner, the crappy directions didn't include torque settings. Instead of hunting the internet (and hoping I got the right info), open book and 30 seconds later I'm good to go.[...]. Thank you.

I use an Xbox, Apple TV and computer streaming. I thought the Fire Stick would be a good way to consolidate some of that streaming and be able to take it with me when I travel (which is frequent for work).  The Fire Stick has proven to be a simple, easy, fast way to stream. I couldn't be happier with it.It has a small form factor and the remote is small (er than the Roku), which I like.  Plugging it in and following the directions was incredible easy and took less than 4 minutes to log in, select settings and watch the tutorial.  It took a few minutes to put in my passwords for Hulu and Netflix etc. I used the iPhone app which made this process much easier, since I could type answers using the keyboard vs selecting single letters with the remote.Some people may not like that Amazon puts it's menu content front and center, but that seems a minor thing.  If you are a control freak and want to adjust every position of the menu, you may be disappointed. I found it cleanly laid out, intuitive and quick to navigate.Video quality is excellent. Shows start quickly (with Amazon content starting near instantaneous) and are clean, bright, crisp 1080p (depending on content of course).  The audio is equally excellent, streaming in 5.1 surround.Ease of use, speed, quality and function, this is an excellent product.  Why did I choose this over Roku? 1) I don't like the big, clunky outdated Roku remote. 2) Spec wise the Fire Stick has a more powerful processor, faster speed and more memory. While only a negligible difference now, as the 2 products update (and they do, my Fire Stick updated as soon as I plugged it in), the Roku will possible start to slow down. 3) I stream a lot of Amazon Prime and this is incredible fast/easy with the Fire Stick. 4) It came with an HDMI extender, Roku doesn't 5) I like the Amazon app better than Roku's. 6) I like then clean black form of the Fire Stick. Simple and it virtually disappears.[...]. Thanks for reading.

Firstly; my wife and I are huge coffee lovers. We spend a few hundred a month on Starbucks, CB&TL and Peets (sadly). We've used keurigs, the Vue and other home pod systems. We were looking for a coffe maker that 1) makes good espresso/latte 2) makes good coffee 3) doesn't require massive clean up and 4) doesn't cost $1200. This one beats all I've tried and meets all the criteria.I'd held off the Nespresso because you have to order the pods and it didn't make regular cups of coffee. Both issues solved. Firstly local boutiques sell the pods and you can order them through the Nespresso app & Amazon with a 2 day delivery. The Virtuoline makes regular coffee. Sweet!About the machines;The Virtuoline is completely reengineered. It takes a bar coded pod (which the machine reads), spins the pod at high speed while injecting over 19 bars of pressure. The result is a very creamy (Crema) coffee or espresso before you even add creamer/milk. Works exactly as they advertise.The Aerrocino plus is my new favorite toy. Somehow it froths milk into either a creamy blend or whipped froth (depending on which whip you use). My wife loves a foamy cappuccino and I like creamy latte's. It delivers every time. Coolest thing, one touch button and go. Simple and consistent. If you want to control the temperature, hear the steaming sound etc and then have to clean the nozzle everytime; you'll want a full espresso machine (ie pay 3 times as much and do 3 times as much work).Pros;* easy to use. Everything is literally 1 touch button.* Easy to clean. Auto eject pod, rinse milk frother. Done.* great performance: cream/milk frother; perfect!* Excellent espresso; vacuum sealed perfectly roasted coffee beans ground and pressurized.* Impressive Crema both coffee and expresso* Well made, heavy duty components.* Good selection of espresso and coffee* Superior customer service* Cost vs other options.Cons;* regular coffee (not espresso) is a little watery (but flavorful) if you don't short the cup at about 6 ounces.* lack of ability to customize, options (if you really want to meddle)* ordering pods* separate milk frother.Summary;This is an absolute keeper. Meets all my needs, is affordable, doesn't require a massive cleanup every time you make an espresso and delivers consistent delicious coffee. Worth waiting for![...]

I am a casual enthusiast that travels a lot and wanted a comfortable bag that holds my camera gear, some other gear and an iPad.I returned the canon camera backpack and bought this one. The main 2 reasons; access and comfort. The canon forced the heavier items higher on the pack, which pulled causing soldier strain eventually (FYI I'm 6'0 and fit, so not a physical issue on my part). Also I discovered I really wanted to be able to have side access. Nearly every other backpack I compared required you to take it off or sling it oddly around your waist.I love this Tamrac. First, it's sturdy, well made, has solid zippers, a reinforced flat bottom and a great layout. The camera and heavier components sit low and close to your back properly distributing weight. It's easy to adjust the gear customized inside so that with an easy left or right swing you can access the fear and change lenses. I can't tell you how much better this is. You don't appreciate it until your in cold weather fiddling with your gear, gloves and zippers (my trip to DC).Positives;  * great layout with dual side access  * Sturdy construction, good zippers and specialized pockets.  * comfortable to wear, adjustable padded straps  * sits upright on flat bottom  * fits up to 2 iPads or notebook  * included raincover  * completely customizable and expandableCons;  * price (worth it though)  * less waterproof than other tamracs  * not a great tripod attachment (if u need that)Overall a great versatile backpack with excellent side access, durability and function.[...]

Casual hobbyist photographer.I used this lens recently in DC outdoors and in the Smithsonian. Amazing! It was great for portraits out side and capturing some beautiful depth of field shots of memorials, reflections etc. Color, clarity and depth are beautiful. I shot mostly at 2.0 or 4.0. I can't get over the elegance of the photos!The only downside is the motor. It's not STM so you'll hear it and it seems a tad slower. It also may draw a little more battery. But that's the only downside I can see and that never affected my shooting. Regardless of materials (plastic) it feels durable. It's not a weather sealed, all metal lens (hence price). But the mechanics and glass are clearly very good.For $100+/- it's crazy not to get this lens, unless your paying $400 for the 1.4. To a non pro this lens was worth the savings which I can apply towards the 55-250.[...]  Thank you!
This fit the assigned lens perfect with the enclosed adapter. It's well made and durable. A perfect match for an excellent affordable lens.[...]

I carried this pack on multiple trips, one recently to DC. I'm a casual, hobbyist photographer.Generally this bag is well made, with many pockets, adjustable compartments, durable (albeit thin) construction and a multitude of exterior straps. I found a day of wearing began to really pull on my neck and shoulders with only a medium load. You must keep it cinched very high and tight to limit the pull. The default setup (main body on top) doesn't help as the weight is high and pulling off your back vs low and against you. This setup makes the most sense though, otherwise you have to dig to the bottom of the bag for your camera or gear. Also, there is no "quick" access. This killed me shooting in 15 degree cold of DC. It took too long to change setups/lenses. I had to remove it and unzip each time. Not fun in cold weather.  Also had to set it on the ground. I did like the space though. The exterior pockets held an iPad, my over the ear headphones and small accessories. Excellent flexibility.All in all a good pack if you understand the limitations.  I traded mine for a Tarmac Zuma 7, which fixed my issues noted below.Good:* flexible, multiple straps, spacious* good zippers with weather fold to provide some protection* customizable interior for a full set of gear* well designed and durable.Bad:* feels thin, padding seems average with gear in it* no quick or side access (must remove and unzip)* uncomfortable after a few hours* feels top heavy when loaded* no rain guard included* not great in cold weather (see; no quick access)* top handle feels cheap*[...]
Great quality, look gorgeous and elegant. Unusual to see the black diamonds. They are surprisingly light and the shape looks great when worn. My wife loved them.[...]. Thank you!

Bought this bag for work and travel. I carry a 15 inch dell laptop, 2 iPads, Bose headphones and misc stuff. I fly frequently. Fits everything perfectly. It could use a few more small, interior segmented pockets but it works. It's a bit heavy when loaded, but that's a testament to the leather quality. No other complaints.It's good quality, the leathers solid, has good seams and a thick base. The clips are heavy duty and the handle is well made. Overall I couldn't be happier. It's well made, looks great, with good space, padded interior and seems durable.If this was helpful, please click yes. Thank you!

2009 iMac...Perfect. Took me less than 10 minutes to install. Easy as could be required only a Phillips screwdriver. Just make sure press hard enough to seat the cards in the slot. It takes some pressure. Immediately booted up. My 2009 iMac recognized the memory and showed the 16g. Awesome. Clear improvement. Windows pop open fast like they used to. Elements, Aperture, iMovie are all noticeably quicker. Thanks crucial, gave me my mac back![...]
Great transition from the movie to TV. The entry to a long and well crafted TV series. It onlygets better and better.

If you like being over promised and under delivered by Abrams; this book is for you. Or if you want to relive your Disappointment with the wrap of Lost, this will make you feel it all over again.A brilliant concept, creatively marketed and poorly executed. The idea was great, the story line starts off intriguing and then becomes a murky, convoluted, distracting mess. The marginal characters are just that; flimsy and mediocre. The entire storyline (Theirs and Ship of Theseus) wraps up without so much as a quiet murmur.Like many things, the beautiful wrapping does not go skin deep. Sorry to have to report its a near miss.

I bought this vacuum recently as I was feeling my older Dyson pet vac wasn't really doing the job. I was absolutely right. Firstly, the Dyson was not sealed and although it has a "hepa" filter, it was losing dust. You could see the dust around the ball and around the base of the body. I vacuumed with the Dyson, brought home the Shark and revacuumed. Incredible! I have a 2 story 1800 sq ft place. The Shark filled up 3 canisters of dirt on the previously vacuumed floors. WOW. I was immediately sold.The Shark has an on/off switch for the roller brush, lights, cleanable filters, long cord, several attachments including a long wand for under appliances or the couch (priceless) and a  small roller that is great for couches, furniture, steps etc. It's so powerful that the roller frequently stops spinning on my longer "shaggy" throw rugs. It also emits no dust. Its clean, tight and quiet keeping the dust in the canister system where it belongs.  The small roller works awesome. I used it on upholstery, steps and pet furniture, delighted at how powerful it is and how much dust/dirt it pulled out.I also like how sturdy the Shark is made. The buttons are firm, the latches are strong and intuitively placed. It feels like a vacuum that will last. The roller ball makes access to tight areas easier and it almost feels self propelled gliding along most areas easily (not so on my throw rugs as described above).  My wife has some mild allergies so this vacuum is a god send as we can already see a reduction in dust through using it.Cons:None reallyDoesn't have a height adjustment? Maybe that could be an issueOverall:This is a great must have vacuum cleaner. I can't find any flaws and it works great.[...]

I've had 3 of these remotes. Only because I'm able to exchange them for free, otherwise I'd never buy it again.In short, it works great, takes some time to program but then operates multiple pieces of equipment completely and flawlessly. No doubt. I've used it for TV, Directv, Apple TV, Xbox and DVD. Perfect. The Harmony software is a little clunky and it takes some time to get it set up just how you want, but then after that? Junk all your old remotes, at least put them in a junk drawer because you will need them when this one breaks. And it will.All 3 of mine worked for a while, maybe even several months, then suddenly when I push a button, it lights up, starts the activity and then restarts. Every time I push a button it does that. New batteries don't help, reprogramming it doesn't help. This remote has some flaw in the power system or power connections that causes it to lose power and restart. Take my advice and don't buy this.I've had the Harmony One for 3+ years. It works flawlessly and has never been a problem. It's substantially more in price, but worth it. I suggest upgrading or going with an alternative. If you buy this one, get the extended warranty.[...].

I bought this a few years ago and have loved it every since. Firstly, I'm not a germaphobe and am not really anti-household cleaning chemicals. I don't mind using bleach etc and knowing it's really clean. But this is different. I can't even fathom going back to any mop system and pushing dirty water around my floor. Or using a swifter and having to pay for refills just to basically wet wipe my floor.  This steamer is lightweight, easy to maneuver, easy to use and works flawlessly every time. Fill the water, turn it on and steam. I love that it's high temperature kills germs and "sanitizes" without having do anything special or add anything to it.Some people complain that "they still have to scrub their floors". Really? What's on your floor? Dried chocolate, candle wax, spaghetti sauce? Maybe some people don't understand steam cleaning. You have to go slow and sometimes let it sit over an area moving it back and forth in very small movements to release dirt/grime etc. The steam has to have time to penetrate the stain, heat it and lift it. I suspect many people take a quick pass and then wonder why it didn't remove any and all dirt immediately.  Also understand, it's a steam cleaner, not a pressure washer and not a magic wand. I have had a dog and I have had cats, suffice it to say they dirty up floors. This thing works on probably 90%+ of the floor dirt I need removed. Anything else I wouldn't expect it to get anyway. Don't even get me started on bathrooms. The first few times I used it in there I could smell the stains and dirt it was lifting, that I thought was already pretty clean. Thanks steamer for showing me how much I needed to really clean.. :-(.Lastly, I've used the carpet attachment and it's awesome. It steams cloth surfaces or carpet and does lift odor and/or some stains. Again it's not magic, but I've been really impressed. Steam and heat lifted things that normal cleaning struggled to remove. Great way to remove odor or dirt in carpet fibers.Cons:Cord is too short (I added a black extension cord)Water volume is low (wish it had a bigger reservoir, but I just refill, 90 seconds no problem)After a while the pads don't retain their velcro ability (not a big deal they still stay put)You have to go slow for steaming to work (adjust to it).Overall:I love this steamer. It cleans incredibly well (I compared it side by side against swifters and mops), it's easy to use, kills germs, kills dust mites and keeps my house fresh and clean.[...]

Put this on our car in CA, works great, looks great and stays put. The bolts are a little shallow and I needed longer ones to make it through the plastic and my plate.  Also know that in many states, it's illegal and gives the police a free shot to pull you over.[...]! Thanks.

I bought this mostly for my wife's diamond rings, necklaces and other jewelry. I use hot water, the recommended cleaner and 120 seconds (3 minutes).  The jewelry comes out noticeably cleaner and the diamond regains it's sparkle.  Clearly the water is a dull dirty cloudy color afterwards and you can tell that the sonic vibrations loosened substantial dirt.It's important to follow the directions; stubborn oils or dirt may need to be pre brushed with a toothbrush etc, to loosen it up. Also, I always rinse them in clean water and blow dry them after cleaning. If you handle them wet or store them straight out of the cleaner, the moisture is going to collect new oils and dirt, making you feel like the jewelry is dirty again very quickly.I've used this for a few months now on all sorts of jewelry including bracelets, earrings etc. No complaints.  It did vibrate the coating off an old cheap piece of fashion jewelry, but I shouldn't have put that in there I guess. It did reinforce how powerful it is. No complaints and it's doing what i expected.  I'd say be realistic though, it's not magic and won't remove five years of tarnish on silver or dirt that accumulates over time in prongs etc. Some supplemental cleaning is still necessary, but it's a great way to keep jewelry clean or freshen it up before a night out![...]Thanks.

Trying to consume more decaf and less caffeine in my coffee, we tried this in our Vue. Tastes great, not watery like some machine based decaf coffee's. Now it's our go to for decaf. My wife likes to do a half and half (mixing half decaf and half regular). We use the Newmans for this and it's excellent.Enjoy![...]

Simple Bell, attaches well and rings loudly. Stays in place even after vibrations etc. I bought it for my wife's beach cruiser and she love's it. Its unique and silly. She nicknamed him Lady Chatterly's Lover.Enjoy![...]

I am a huge fan of Goodkind and this series. But in the last couple books culminating in Chainfire, the series has lost it's way. Im not sure if there are additional writers supporting him or if he's just gotten too busy to devote his full attention to these books, but they are no where near the first 6+ quality.Specifically? 1/3rd of the book feels like rehashing old story lines, reeducating a new reader to the series and awkward historical summaries. Another third of the book are character monologues about vague and/or uninteresting philosophical ideals usually with Richard using some type of childish comparison to try to convince a group of people to see his way. Not to mention, the actions of the characters never truly reflect their growth into their roles, making the dialogues feel inconsistent and artificial. To top it off, after losing a defined antagonist, Goodkind has struggled to identify meaningful tension. The whole "Chainfire" premise is vague at best. The solution makes you suspend all belief and is certainly not up to his prior storytelling.I don't enjoy writing this review, but sometimes writers need to quit when they are ahead and stop churning out drivel just to satisfy ambitious publishers.[...]

Bought one of these for my wife who discovered that she is allergic to cats after we had our cat for a year. Dang.We put one in the bedroom and one in the living room. Yes, as the machine kicks on the first 24 hours there is an ozone smell from it. This fades quickly and isn't a big deal. I don't even know why people mention it.Usage:It has 5 settings, which is really just fan speed so don't be impressed by the "germ" label. We use it on 1-3 mostly. At 5 it's pretty loud, but will quickly recirculate the room air if needed. At 3 it's still fairly fan loud, but tolerable. 1 and 2 are the only "quiet" settings. The ambiance lights can be dimmed if needed and it has a filter warning reminding you to clean it.  I LOVE the auto off timer setting. I frequently set it for 2, 4 or 8 hours and leave. A great feature. I also love that the filter is cleanable and I don't have to buy an expensive filter every few months.After approximately 3 days, we noticed a huge difference. Firstly, even time we walk in the bedroom, it has a clean fresh smell. Not that it didn't smell good before, but it's noticeable. Most importantly though, my wife has been sleeping better. She hasn't coughed in the middle of the night (which she did about 4 times a week, loud enough to wake me up). She also doesn't wake up congested and stuffy. This is a huge difference. She's reduced her intake of claritin and is sleeping better. I'm sure it's not a magic fix all for allergies, but it absolutely helped my wife.Overall:I have nothing but positive things to say. It works well, performs as advertised, is nice looking, has solid electronic touch screen buttons, a full feature set and an economical washable/cleanable filter. Most importantly, it seems to be helping.[...]

Im a casual photographer, who travels a lot and wanted a SLR to take with me. I also want to enhance my photography as a hobby, although I don't plan on ever being professional. I've owned several compact digital prior to this camera.Size:Even though I knew what I was ordering, I couldn't get over the size. It's so small for an SLR and so lightweight. I've checked multiple times because I didn't think it was loaded in my bag, it felt empty. No kidding, it's that light weight. But still has all the buttons you need, well placed and easy to operate.  It also feels tough and durable, so don't be dissuaded by the light weight or small size. I'm not sure about the concern some voiced about it being "too small" to hold. It's very comfortable. If you are going to shoot for 2 hours straight and/or have shot with a larger camera for 5 years, then maybe this would take some getting used to. But it's very easy to manage, comfortable to hold and feels solid in my hand.Performance:I've been experimenting for a couple months now with various settings, different creative shots and I love the camera. Any failures are certainly mine as an amateur. It's easy to shoot, fast enough (I'm not shooting for the NHL) and takes accurate, colorful pictures that are only limited by my creativity. I've shot macro, landscape, architecture, pets and portraits. I love it. It has a deep, feature rich set of custom options, menus and settings. I'm almost addicted to loading my amazing photos into a post photo software (name omitted) and playing with them to see how incredible they can get. That being said, they look incredible (when composed properly) straight from the RAW image. Also remember, this is a canon, so you can use virtually any lens ever created by them.Video:The improved AF Focus and STM lens is evident when shooting video. Video is amazingly clear, the AF does a good job keeping up with most subjects (again not shooting NHL or nocturnal animal scenery). The touchscreen, nearly silent lens combo is a huge improvement over prior versions. All but the most demanding professionals will find it does a remarkable job.Cons:Not many, seriously.No built in stereo mic..(minor issue use an external)No built in wifi (use an eye fi card)I kept this simple as there are some more technical reviews out there. I thought simple usage from a consumer standpoint would be most helpful. My advice, be very careful hanging your hat on some of the Amazon reviews that are overly technical. Some of the reviewers don't know as much as they pretend and quote erroneous facts, like the fact that this camera uses "contrast phase detect" for it's auto focus. Wrong, older canon's did, not this one.  If you really need the technical details read a review by dpmag, dppreview, camera labs etc. They will be spot on accurate and not a pseudo  professional opinion. Happy hunting...If you found this helpful, please click yes! Thank you.

My wife is a part time massage therapist and we bought this for her to use at home with me.Great table; adjustable, thick padding, comfortable and versatile. It has everything you want and is well made. Stitching, padding and mechanical are all heavy duty and built to last. It sets up in a minute and is fully adjustable from the arm rests, to the face rest etc. We have had no problem with the table and have enjoyed many massages on it. It comes as advertised and is really a steal for the quality vs price. Hundreds less than competitor products.Downsides?It's a bit heavy (read the weight). I wouldn't want to lug this around if I was a professional massage therapist.

Size and function, great. I have had these type of gates over the years and always thought they worked great.This one worked for about a week and then suddenly is incredible difficult to slide. Try as I might, I can't adjust it, tweak it or make it slide like it did the first day. We didn't do anything to it, it's just cheaply designed. It still works, but I have a wrestling match every time I try to stretch it open to fit a doorway.Height is great and the rest of it is fairly simple straightforward. I wouldn't buy this product again though.

I have had this TV for nearly 2 years, moved it twice and am still in love with it. The setup, functionality and most importantly; picture are amazing. I watch Directv, Apple TV, Blu Ray and Xbox on it. All sources are crystal clear, dark deep blacks and great motion.  There are now newer TV's with advanced features, but it's hard to beat this TV. I'd buy another Samsung in a second.I'm not a big 3D fan, so I don't have much to say. I've used it, it looks great, the picture is even clearer than regular HD. It's easy to setup, the glasses work fine (although they are battery operated and heavier than the new ones).  If you are a 3D fan this will make you happy, it's just not my thing.Downsides:Older and Heavier than an new equivalent TVNone

I bought this for a lakeside patio area that was getting bombarded daily by birds.  I had tried the sticky glue, no affect whatsoever and it ruined my stucco. Awesome. I tried a stationary owl, didn't work and birds landed on it's head after 2 days.I bought this one, and it worked immediately out of the box. Within 24 hours, not one bird poop on my patio. It was miraculous, seriously.  I hear the head click and spin every so often, it wobbles in the wind and keeps all the birds off my patio.  I don't even have to relocate it, maybe 1 time every few weeks just to be safe. Love it and it's has totally allowed me to reclaim my awesome patio and view!No downsides. Have had it for a year, works perfect, no maintenance.

I bought this and returned it with in about 1/2 hour.It's much bigger than it looks, way bigger than even my large Maine Coon requires. I didn't like the buzzing noise in my kitchen all the time. Not sure how to measure the noise level, but it was much louder than my fridge.I get the potential benefits and I understand I could have predicted size and noise, but once it was in my kitchen, I didn't think the benefits outweighed the annoyance, or the increased electricity (however minor).If these don't bother you, then I'm sure it'll be a great product. It's well made, heavy ceramic, easy to setup and the pump works well.

I bought this bike for my wife to use at the beach as we cruise (almost daily around town).Setup:Not sure of the other reviewers issues. My bike came very well packaged, wrapped and protected. All parts were in perfect condition, not a scratch.  Assembly took me less than an hour and I was moving slowly trying to do it while she was asleep so as to surprise her when she woke up. It was not complicated, fairly simple and I had no issues. It doesn't require "professional assembly" as another reviewer stated, unless you aren't at all mechanically inclined.  As for adjustments; the manual tells you how to adjust the brakes and gears. This can't be done until the bike and wheels are assembled, so again I'm not sure why people were commenting about this? It's a very straightforward adjustment. I set mine and in 4 months it's been perfect, no further work needed. Definitely didn't need to pay a professional tune up.Bike Itself;Great bike, comfortable, multiple gears are a must and it works well.  It's well designed and my wife loves it. We added an electra basket to the front and lights. We live in a beach town full of cruisers and this one get's compliments all the time as it's unique.Downsides:NoneYes you have to put it together yourself (if you don't like this then go buy a $500 bike from a box store)The rear gear is exposed versus sealed, so they can slip IF out of adjustment. Common with this type of gear, but buy one with a sealed gear if you want to upgrade.

I bought this to keep my cat off certain areas and to help him stop eating my plants. It works very well. Set it up, turn it on, position it and forget it about it. We do and my wife sets it off accidentally.It has a good radius and definitely startles my cat, shooing him out of areas he shouldn't be. The downside is that I think he's learned the unit and steers clear of it, but once it's relocated, the area becomes fair game again. This is the general downside to all deterrence products.  Eventually though, maybe he'll just avoid the area, we'll see.No downsides, it works as advertised, is harmless to the animal, doesn't annoy humans and is more flexible than some of the competitor items.

I bought this bag to fit my small Canon SL1, extra equipment and an iPad. I returned it as it wasn't a good fit for me.Design:The bag design is well made. Reinforced zippers, heavy duty ballistic nylon, some weather proofing and a lot of customizable padding. The clips work as advertised, locking in to prevent any accidental opening of the bag, but left unclipped with an "easy pull" tab you can quickly access the camera.  The upper compartment has room for accessories and could fit a small bottled water, snacks etc or camera gear.  The iPad pocket was disappointing. It's very snug and couldn't fit my iPad with a case on it. It was also very difficult to get in and out due to the tight fit. Technically it fits, but this didn't work for me.Comfort:The bag is bulky due to it's square/cylindrical shape. It felt bigger on my back than it looks. The straps were very stiff and didn't feel comfortable to me at all. Maybe over time they would have loosened up or softened, but I didn't want to wait and find out. Although I looked the idea of the 3 in 1, in practical use I found the set up cluttered and honestly annoying. Any straps you don't use, have to be tucked against your back (which is also where the iPad sleeve is). Although the back's well padded, it adds to the bulkiness of the feel. If you really need 3 in 1 options, maybe this is ok for you, but I didn't want to deal with the bulkiness all the time I'm NOT using the backpack or extra straps.Overall:A very well made and well designed bag. It's protective, versatile and would last. I'm not a fan of the straps, the bulkiness or the iPad sleeve space.  It falls into the old adage, Jack of all trades, master of none. A good flexible bag if you can deal with the idiosyncrasies.Downsides:ipad sleeve is too small, requires you remove the case and isn't functional (for me).The bag is bulky for it's measurements (boxy)The straps were not comfortableThe multiple straps are cluttering when not in use (even tucked away, see bulky above).Too expensive for the bag itself.

I bought this for my Canon SL1 with the stock lens, a hood, a few extra cards, extra battery and filters.Design:The bag is well made. The zippers are strong, all the seams seem completely reinforced and it's very well thought out.  It has solid padding inside all major pockets and across the sling. The main compartment has a neoprene "patent pending" hammock. My camera lens with the hood attached pushes nicely into the star shaped opening and it holds the camera in place. It is velcro so it can be adjusted or removed if needed. I'm not a huge fan of the hammock as it requires a little force in and out, but it seems to work so I'll try it for a while before removing it. The interior space is ample and would support a much larger camera body than mine.  There is plant of depth for my 18-55 lens, Im sure a larger lens would fit, but probably not a huge zoom. It has a large side pocket that I was able to fill with a small bottle of water, multiple protein bars and a small bag of nuts. There's an external set of straps that are designed for a tripod, I've also used it to latch in my jacket or sweatshirt, perfect.  I really like that the slings unclip in both places allowing you to easily adjust or put on the pack.Comfort:The pack is very comfortable for a sling. Meaning, slings always put additional weight on one shoulder. This one has ample padding, spacious adjustment (for tall or shorter people, I'm 6'0") and a secondary strap to secure it so it doesn't swing. I rarely need this and keep it tucked away with the cord keeper.  The padding makes it fairly comfortable. I've worn it for several hours at Disneyland, hiking etc, loaded with camera and food. After a full day I start to feel it, but it takes a few hours. Loaded lightly with just the camera and no water, I don't even feel it. It's incredibly easy to swing under your arm and position to take your camera out. It unzips and the camera is right there. Contrary to bag commercials, I'm not in a position where I need to suddenly draw the camera like a western gunslinger, but it is surprisingly quick and easy to get to.Downsides:After a few hours fully loaded you may feel it a little, it's a sling, not a backpack.If you need to load 5 lenses, a full frame body and a bunch of extras, it may be too small.When carrying it by the handle, the slings and straps seem all over the place, like octopus arms. With a little creative cord keeping you can reduce this, but it is worth noting.Overall:If you are looking for a small, easy to wear convenient sling, this is a great choice. Well made, well designed and comfortable.

The Canon hood fits perfectly on my SL1 screwing perfectly to my lens and offering protection as well as limiting light/flare.  It is sturdy and well made. It feels like it's a little heavier duty/thicker than some of the knock off non Canon brands. The Canon does cost a few dollars more, but it fits like it's supposed to and also looks good perfectly matching the camera lens and body.  Couldn't be happier with the purchase.

We've used this product a handful of times. We love it. It works as advertised. It sprays powerfully enough to wet the dog then delivers a sudsy mixture of soap and water. Our dog seems to like it. He stays fairly still and enjoys the bath. It's sped up our wash time and clean up time.  Wish we would have gotten it years ago.The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is the construction is a bit flimsy. It's made almost entirely of plastic and I'm not sure how it will hold up over time. That being said it works fine and for the price seems OK.

A wonderful story, beautifully told exploring a young girl's loss and her journey through the grieving process.  I loved the parallel story (of jellyfish) and unique exploration of what could have been a very depressing and difficult to address subject matter for juvenile/young adults.  Completely different than anything I have read this year and highly recommended.

An old fashioned adventure story, famous in the Netherlands and Germany since its original publication in 1962.  There are strong virtuous and moral threads throughout the young, teenage knights quest. This is an awesome, old-school chivalry tale which will appeal to a large group of readers--particularly fantasy adventure fans.

Holly Black and Cassandra Clare have done a fantastic job with the Magisterium series so far.  For any fans of Harry Potter (younger and older), you will definitely appreciate and enjoy the series.  There are a few fantasy-trope plot aspects that may be a bit obvious to readers who are very familiar to the genre, however, for the most part I found the book to be exciting and surprising.  A very nice read, well worth checking out!

A fantastic novel! Patrick Ness is one of my favorite YA authors, and he always exceeds my expectations with every new novel.  The Rest of Us has extraordinary characters that quickly draw you in! I read a lot of YA, but I won't forget this one for a long time. Highly recommended!

Not quite as pigmented as I expected,  however it is very glossy/shimmery. Unfortunately, caused my lips to dry out very badly.  I mixed it with a base layer of tiny touch of Burts Beeswax for moisture and darker red lipstick to get a nice glossy hue.  Not bad overall, just not quite was I was expecting initially.  The force is strong with this lipstick :-)

Turtle Beach makes excellent budget gaming headsets and the Recon 60P is no exception.  I have always been impressed with their products in the past, and this set seems thoughtfully designed and well-constructed.PROS:-USB and 3.5mm connectors allow for versatile usage: you can connect it to your PS3/4 via USB, your PC or mobile devices via 3.5mm, etc…-Great quality audio, similar in quality to the mid-range $99-149 headsets.-Good mic with minimal background noise, distortion on Skype, Mumble, Ventrilo, XBOX Live…-Mic audio monitored in headset (you can hear yourself, if you choose, to avoid shouting)-Over-ear design is comfortable and blocks ambient noise.  Ear cups are soft.-Extra long cord (13’) reaches completely across the room-Volume control/mute functions on cordPossible CONS:-The extra-long cord is a bit of a trade off.  If you are using this at your desk, you’ll have a tangle of cords at your feet.-Microphone does not retract, however it can be removed completely.-I’m a little more partial to the P12 design, in my opinion is lighter weight and more comfortable.This headset really feels like it was designed by actual gamers who knew exactly what they wanted in a headset.  It’s a great budget headset and probably one of the best under $99 wired headsets.  Definitely recommended!

I was born in the gap between the theatrical release of Back to the Future I and II.  My parents (bless them!) wasted no time exposing me to this astounding and timeless series at the age of 7.  I was, thenceforth, a science fiction super fan and rank BTTF among my all-time favorite pieces of pop culture across all formats.  Upon the 30th anniversary of its release I started scouring the internet for signs of historical ephemera.  I was delighted and promptly ordered this tome, eagerly awaiting its timely October 21th arrival.The book itself is designed and bound quite nicely, I am quite picky about these things.  My copy arrived shrink wrapped and in generally good condition (there's a slight tear in the cover material on the back cover due to poor packing material).The interior pages are glossy, printed on nice stock paper and all 224 pages are stocked full of wonderful photos, prints of scripts, storyboards, concept art and handwritten production notes.  There are also several prop replicas (see my photos) which have been included, peppered along throughout the book.  As other reviewers have mentioned, the prop replicas are a very, very cool addition to the book in itself; however, the method in which they are affixed to the pages was very irritating.  In some cases, a thick peel-able backing glue was used which left a round "oil stain" on either the book page, the prop or both.  In other cases, a more treacherous and near-impossible to remove tape was used which caused some tearing/blemishing of the book page, the prop or both.  I ended removing all of the props and storing them in an 8 x 10 envelope for safekeeping.Here is a list of all the included prop replicas:- Save the Clock Tower Flyer (with Jennifer's number on the back)- Doc's hand drawn Flux Capacitor schematic- Marty's pink tardy slip (reason for being late: slacker)- Marty and sibling color photo (holographic: holding it at an angle makes Marty's brother and sister disappear!)- "Do Not Open Until 1985" (The letter that could have potentially disrupted the space-time continuum)- Lorraine and George's Enchantment Under the Sea Dance photo- Jaws 19 Movie Poster (Directed by Max Spielberg)- Receipt from 2015 for the purchase of the antique Sports Amanac- Western Union letter from Doc c. 1885- A "Biff" dollar bill from the alternate 1985- "A Match Made in Space" by George McFly dust jacket cover- Portrait of Doc and Marty in front of the future clock tower clock c. 1885The content/writing of the book is just marvelous and will be an absolute thrill for even casual fans (if they even exist).  I have been enjoying reading it all day and have been driving my friends and family bonkers popping up with new trivia about the series every 5 minutes. All three movies are covered, and attention is given to the Universal Studios ride (with its accompanying mini-movie) and the animated television series.All-in-all this is a real treat and I'm delighted to add it to my BTTF collection.  My tremendous appreciation and gratitude for everyone involved in bringing this project to the fans.  Highly recommended!
Perfect, just what we needed for a new PC build and an old PC refurbish job.  High quality, works great, just as described.  Would buy again!

The book itself and illustrations are absolutely, incredibly extraordinary.  In that way, this is 100% a 10-STAR book and is absolutely to die for for Harry Potter fans. I was ravenous to get my hands on my copy as soon as it was delivered this morning, but was quickly disappointed.First, Amazon's packaging was utterly and despicably inadequate. (See Photo)  My book was shipped in a box, with *no packing material* of any kind.  At first glance, it seemed OK.  But when I took a close look at my dust jacket, I was extremely upset to find that the gold foil lettering for "Harry Potter" had been rubbed away and destroyed completely in some places leaving ugly, black matte in its place-- pock marking the otherwise handsome gold lettering.  Also, the matte-finish of the dust jacket had been rubbed so badly due to the bad packaging that it left scars and shiny markings where the matte finish was worn off.  For an obvious gift/collectors item, this is absolutely unacceptable.  I called Amazon and they didn't seem to "get" what my fuss was all about and just offered to ship a replacement which, undoubtedly, will be shipped in exactly the same way.Second, after I got over my initial outrage over the shipping/packaging.  I sat down to enjoy the actual book itself, which as I said is absolutely extraordinary! I was extremely cautious handling the book and binding, being unsure how tolerant the binding is of weight.  I carefully opened both the right and left sides of the binding and supported the weight of the opened cover using a small pillow.  By the time I reached the back 3/4th of the book (on Professor McGonagall's full page illustration) the binding separated from the spine the very first time I turned the page.  In other words, the binding fell apart during my very first pass through the book.  (See Photo).  Another thing that really drove me crazy was the way that the stitched in book mark was carelessly folded into the book.  It left dents all over my pages (See Photo), which of course had to be on a full page illustration of Hagrid!Needless to say I'm in awe how Bloomsbury has managed to put together such an incredible project, with JK Rowling's remarkable literature and Jim Kay's otherworldly illustrations-- and allowed it to be put together in a low quality binding!  I noticed that all of the previous Harry Potter books were printed and bound in USA (some in Mexico) but this book was printed and bound in China.  I would like to hope that they would quality check a thing like this, but perhaps not.  Either way, I am extremely disappointed in the quality/binding of my book.  I would be interested to know if others are seeing the same thing. And please, Amazon, pack these books in bubble wrap and packing material! Not all alone in a box...Update (October 9th): I have finally received my new book and it was in much, much better condition.  The cover and spine were tight, intact and falling apart from the binding like my original copy.  Addtl photos to follow...

Charmin Basic has become our preferred toilet paper, not just because of its great quality-- but because it lasts significantly longer than the other "ultra plush" papers (which are really just excessively fluffy and clog your toilets) and can be used as tissue for allergies due to its non scented, non-bleached fibers.  I think this is the perfect compromise between 1-ply/industrial style super thin paper and the ultra plush tissue which is far too thick.  Very good quality and an attractive price.  It's our preferred paper now!

I was drawn to this book because: 1) I love a good historical fiction novel, and 2) I found the premise unusual against a backdrop of the Spanish Civil War.  In fact, I regrettably know almost nothing of the Spanish Civil War, other than the fact that it was a great human tragedy. Our heroine here, Drina, is caught between worlds being half-Spaniard and half-gypsy.  When her life unravels, she must take on a journey of self discovery, uncover truths and forge her own path.The prose is absolutely beautiful and among one of the most well written books I have read this year.  In general, the plot is well crafted and moves along at a satisfactory pace.  Action-craving readers or steamy-romance seekers may complain of pacing or lack of substance.  Also, the ending was a bit disappointing, which would make this actually about a 3.5 star read for me.  Overall, if you have an interest in historical fiction and a heroine's coming of age journey in an uncertain world, you will most likely enjoy this book!

Wow! Christina Farley has outdone herself! I really enjoyed GILDED and the second installment SILVERN didn't disappoint at all-- in fact, it may even be a few degrees better! This book has tons of plotting, intrigue, action and intensity.  Jae is a unique and truly likeable heroine.  She's intelligent and capable and doesn't collapse into a blabbering heap the moment a boy comes around (sorry, Bella Swan.)  I have noticed lots of people complaining that the cultural references/elements of the book are not "real Korean."  Its fantasy folks.  One of my absolute favorite series I read this year, the Grisha Trilogy, wasn't really Russian but brought elements of that Russian culture to create a newly imagined fantasy world.  I don't think the author of GILDED ever claimed that she was going after a culturally accurate Korea.  Even so, this is a great series-- even more a plus that its on Kindle Unlimited now. Highly recommended and anxiously awaiting book 3!

My friends and I really love to play D&D and MTG but our lives often get busy and we can't keep up with the new card releases, deck building, new editions of tabletop games etc... And these hybrid games offer a super alternative. We set up and played this Pathfinder game (we are familiar with regular Pathfinder) and we really enjoyed the format and will be making this part of our regular gaming rotation. It's expandable, but works well as a standalone. The box art, card quality and instructions are very nice and high quality.
I love these labels for cute paper and cardboard  crafts, mason jars and lots of other practical uses. They stick well, run through the printer perfectly and work for tons of different things. Great!

My cat Homer is a picky eater, and usually likes to eat only treats (not real food). We are really e cited because he seems to like this food all the way to the end of the bag, which is rare for him. He's a 2 year old in/out door extremely active cat. This food seems to keep him lean, healthy and happy!

I devoured this book the moment it came in the mail. The premise looked absolutely awesome and within the first 20 pages I was gripped-- hook, line and sinker. In a nutshell: WOLF BY WOLF takes place in an alternate 1956, in a world where the Third Reich reigned victorious in WW2. Now Hitler's empire, along with the Empire of Japan control the overwhelming majority of Europe, Asia and Africa and its peoples. The protagonist, Yael, survived the Holocaust and is a member of the resistance plotting to assassinate Hitler himself.This book was truly incredible and remarkably well written. Most definitely one of my favorite reads this year, by far. There are so many unique elements, I worry that a comparison to "Hunger Games" or "Divergent" or "Code Name Verity" devalues its truly particular qualities. But, suffice it to say there are elements of dystopia, historical fiction, science fiction/fringe science, mystery, thrill, romance and loads of intrigue.My only complaint (if you can call it that) is that this book keeps you going at a break neck pace with such a strong, forward driving plot that it demands a solid and satisfying conclusion. I had not realized when I began reading that this is a planned series. While I don't mind it being part of a series, I truly wish there had been a more satisfying conclusion as a payoff for all the suspense. Instead, we have an abrupt ending. The more I chew on it, the more I wonder how this will work in a series. In truth, I think this could have been a truly incredible standalone with some adjustments to the ending, but we shall see.All in all, excellent writing, excellent world building/imagination, compelling characters and a fantastic plot. A truly enjoyable read, despite a slightly disappointing conclusion. I will certainly read the next installment.
Beautiful, unique story.  A great third installment in the series. I love how unique and different these books are compared to everything else out there.

This book is NOT TFIOS, I am a little disappointed that so many readers are just seeing the words "teen boy and girl + cancer" and automatically assuming its a rip-off of John Green's book. It's not.  This is a completely different story, and in my mind, that's a good thing.  I thought that TFIOS was more than 75% fairy tale. It was sad, yes, but it didn't really dig into the reality of cancer in my opinion.  A.J Betts hits much closer to reality with his portrayal of teenage cancer and how to reconcile your imminent mortality with the need to keep living each day. This is not a love story, but it is a beautiful story of friendship.  Definitely recommended, especially for readers looking for something a little deeper than TFIOS.

This book was a little disappointing for me... There were a lot of great summer romance reads this year (Jenny Han, Sarah Dessen, Huntley Fitzpatrick!) so I was all set for another with PROMISE OF AMAZING.  But, the main characters' personalities (Wren and Grayson) just didn't cut it for me.  They didn't seem realistic and the premise of insta-love it a little hard to dig.  The writing and pacing wasn't bad, just the portrayal of romance-- it didn't hook me and keep me interested.

This is the first Robison Wells novel I have read, but I may pick up VARIANT after reading reviews.  I really enjoy sci-fi, fantasy, dsytopia, time travel and, of course, super heroes (doesn't everyone??) But, BLACKOUT wasn't a 5-star read for me due to the uneven pacing.  The story starts out great, and has great characters but starts to fall flat after the big reveal.  I think that the next book(s) in the series could make up for the pacing, so I'll definitely check them out.

This is a super backpack for a quick overnight, school/college, or for air travel.  It fits my Macbook, iPad and accessories perfectly with room for a sweater, some snacks and whatever other stuff I need to bring along.  The construction is very nice quality.  The colors are more exciting than just "plain black" (everyone has a black Swiss gear backpack these days...) but it still looks professional.  The chest strap attachments can be removed and the zippers are nice and sturdy.  I really like it!

I really like this for my home fitness room.  I use it for just basic squats, side lunges, free weight, and ab work.  It works great for me (~130lbs, petite female).  The only warning I have is that you will need a pretty good quality air pump to get it sufficiently inflated.  The pump that comes with it is complete junk and should be thrown away.  It doesn't provide nearly enough pressure to inflate the step.  I used a foot-pedal driven 150psi bike tire pump with a taper attachment and it inflated nicely. Seems to hold air well also.

How did this get published? It drove me crazy to pedal through this book...First things first: this book is NOT about assassins. This book is about a bratty teenage girl who is about as dimensional as a blank sheet of paper. She goes on, and on, and on and on talking about how beautiful she is, how shes the "worlds best" assassin and how "bored" she is with everything. Then, when presented with opportunities to show us anything (compete in a gladiator-style duel, attend a ball, seek a deadly sorcery, solve a mystery) she literally just wants to go take a nap. (Literally).The dialogue is probably the very worst part, and what killed the book for me. The way the narrator whines and carries on is infantile and reminiscent of inane middle-school lunch room conversations. I mean, what world-class assassin falls apart and takes to bed in the middle of the day when she gets her *gasp* monthly cycle. Nevermind that, why is that even a scene? Also, she self-proclaims herself as a "prodigy" assassin, but shes never even engaged in a single fight--truly--not one action/battle sequence. The author needs to read some R.A Salvatore (specifically Artemis Entreri) and play some Assassins Creed before she writes her next "Assassin" novel.If you're attracted to a good love story, be advised: The romance is flat and boring. The love interest(s) are not interesting or likeable. They seem to be guys that are just "around." There wasn't a particularly compelling character in the entire book. I'm sad to say that even 8 hours into reading, I really don't care whether she triumphs or fails in her quest. And, I don't really care what the mystery evil is that's lurking behind the corner either. The author really didn't get me to *care* about her world, characters or plot.It's too bad... the plot is a GREAT idea, but the execution is hideous.  One more pet peeve: why does she vomit so much? Someone get this girl some pepto bismol! I have read 50+ books, most of them fantasy, and I think maybe 1-2 instances of vomiting.  This girl vomits multiple times per chapter.  Really.

My cat loves these, and on gold box special for just under $5 per box, it was a great deal! They stay fresh for a very long time and will keep well in these containers.  These treats are fairly high in fats/carbs, so they're best for younger, still growing and highly active cats!

This is a very nice, high quality pencil bag/organizer.  I use it in my backpack for work to keep a few small tools (mini screwdriver, wrench, pocket knife set) separate from my pencils and permanent markers.  There are three separate compartments which are perfect for this.  It also fits in a three-ring binder, if needed.  Better than the $1 cheap pencil bags by far.

I really like these Burts Bee's lip balms.  I was most eager for the vanilla "flavor" but was slightly surprised at the texture.  I typically use cherry chap-stick (Hey, it gets the job done!) which has a much more "solid" feel.  The vanilla, pomegranate and pink grapefruit flavors all have the same somewhat greasy texture.  Upon checking the ingredient list, I see why: beeswax is the third ingredient, behind sunflower and coconut oils.  The yellow capped "Beeswax lip balm" has the best texture-- solid, minty and long lasting.  I wish the other flavors had the same texture, but they're all still very good and will make great little gifts.

Armada has been sitting at the top of my pre-order list for months.  As soon as it hit my kindle, I started reading it and listened to the Audible version as well over the course of the day.  First and foremost: this is not "Ready Player One". As much as you may be tempted to compare this to RP1, you probably shouldn't lest you'll be let down.  But, this is a very fun, nostalgic, fast paced, romp through interstellar space with hardcore gamer geeks saving the world. The entire plot takes place over the course of one (maybe two) full days, so its heavy on action and light on character depth and development.  There are pop culture references a plenty, which are laid like bread crumbs for eager fans.  All in all, the plot was well imagined, hastily executed but ultimately enjoyable. I've definitely read worse (and better) but you really can't go wrong here if you are a video game, science fiction, pop culture or fantasy fan.The Audible narration, performed by Will Wheaton, was excellent (as expected) including epic Yoda voices throughout.

I'm a huge fan of fantasy and sci-fi, so I set my expectations pretty high... This one sat on my "to-read" pile for an embarrassingly long time.  Admittedly, I passed it up to read more established authors books several times over the last few months... I wish I hadn't!  This book is OUTSTANDING! Sabaa Tahir hits all the benchmarks to set her apart from the average and mediocre fantasy novelists out there.  Unique and intriguing magic system & world building, check! Deep, interesting and resourceful characters, check! Great heroes and villains, check! Intrigue, politics, treachery and suspense, check!! Complicated and exciting romance, check!!  I especially loved her talent for writing from two viewpoints (male and female).  I am officially a fan and anxiously awaiting the next book in the series!

I really enjoyed the first 2/3rds of this novel but the massive plot twist really ruined everything.  The problem is that there is literally no "up side" to anything in the entire novel.  Two flawed and vulnerable teens, struggle, struggle and then struggle some more.  The author builds some suspense with the budding romance between two main characters, but dashes it over and over again until the reader regrets meeting these two people at all.  For me, a "poignant" novel is one where the characters live on in your memory-- where they meet challenges, struggle and ultimately triumph in some way that makes their tale moving and memorable.  The portrayal of OCD is not wrong per say, but as other reviewers have mentioned, its not very realistic.  If you are looking for something heartwarming, look elsewhere.  This novel is filled with emotional downers... I think I felt happier after reading Fault in Our Stars!

“Since You’ve Been Gone” is a well written, summer teen drama peppered with romance, comedy and enduring friendships.  The protagonist Emily is extremely awkward and shy, which makes her both endearing and annoying throughout the book.  At times, her inability to stand on her own two feet and survey the world around her builds suspense—other times, it’s bordering on unrealistic.For me, the book is a solid 3.5 stars and recommended more enthusiastically for younger teens (age 13-15).  The character development was not quite where it should have been, given the length of the book.  By the last page, I felt acquainted with everyone but I didn’t really know any one character up close and personally.  The central conflict (“Will she complete the list?”) was never really in question, it was assumed that she would—one way or another—trudge her way through the list by the end. This lack of suspense kept the book from gaining much momentum, in fact, I stopped caring about whether she completed the list at all 1/3rd of the way in. All I was worried about was whether she would finally get together with her senior-class-president-neighbor Frank. But, my interest remained piqued from start to finish.In many ways, Emily probably reflects a much more accurate 16 year old teen girl than Hollywood or other bestseller-list romance novel teens.  She’s scared, uncertain, and eager all at once.  She doesn’t senselessly dive into sex, drugs, alcohol or dangerous situations.  She needs her Mom and Dad, her brother and her best friend for guidance and support.  These less overt qualities make her more real, but admittedly fail to “pop off the page.”  At the end of the day, this is a novel about finding out who you are, and finding your own identity.  It’s about going from being “the girl who hands out with so-and-so” to becoming “You.”Ending Spoiler:I think that Emily should have written Sloane a letter (with a new list enclosed) rather than take the road trip to SC.  Ultimately, the road trip didn’t move the plot forward in any appreciable/unique way for her and Frank and seemed to be a downshift in pace at the end.  I would have preferred Emily spend the time making the grand gesture to her present (Frank) as opposed to her past (Sloane), but that’s just me.

Extremely well written, tween science fiction book with a fun, interesting plot and lots of realistic science interspersed.  This book will appeal greatly to kids age 9-12 and will hold grown ups attention as well (for family reading nights).  Plot elements and vocabulary are not "watered down" which will make this a very satisfying read for ambitious young readers.  For kids who enjoy Minecraft, Star Wars, Jurassic Park, or science in general this is a great start to a very promising new series! Highly Recommended!

Beautiful Tone, great feel and durable.  I love Elixir strings.  We use them on our basses, acoustic and electric guitars.  These are outstanding bass strings that are easy to install, feel great, eliminate fret noise and finger squeaks.  They stretch (as expected) after you initially string them, however, once they settle I rarely needed to re-tune. Definitely a cut above the cheap string alternatives and worth the investment, if you're serious about your instrument. (Tested on my c.2001 Fender Jazz Bass)

Extremely thought provoking and profound.  Highly recommended for teens/pre-teens.  The book deals with serious (but real) subject matter, so parents may need to use discretion.  There is also significant profanity.  However, I still recommend this for almost any teen because bullying seems to have become a larger than life issue given our overly-connected society.  The characters are flawed (real) and not often likeable, but this adds to the impact and message behind the story.  I think the author has done a great job bringing the narrator's voice out in a realistic, believable way that will resonate with young readers.

I took the GRE myself and have spent the last few years coaching other students preparing for the GRE.  Unquestionably, the best way to prepare is to practice questions that are actually phrased, arranged and "GRE-styled."  The other test prep books use mutiple choice and free response questions that aren't realistically "styled" as they would appear on the GRE.  They also seem to be much less difficult than the real questions you'll encounter on the exam.  This book from Manhattan Prep is appropriately difficult and filled with hundreds upon hundreds of useful, realistic GRE questions.  Once you've passed your test, the book itself makes an ample doorstop-- its truly a whopping 5lbs.  Make sure when you practice, you divide your practice questions into sets and time yourself. A lot of folks forget to practice timing! Good Luck!

This is a great all around headset that I keep handy at my desk.  I have an office setup which includes: a PC, an iMac, iPad and iPhone.  I only occasionally have need of headphones and/or a mic, so having one single headset to work for all of my devices is a real plus. This is a lightweight headset with moderately good audio quality and very good mic quality for video conferencing, voice-only calls and online game chat.  The audio quality is certainly not going to blow anyone away (look at the price point of this headset and set your expectations accordingly) but at the same time its great for what its designed for.The headset itself is fairly comfortable, though I would not wear it for hours at a time (i.e. for long gaming sessions, pick up a better/padded headset).  I especially like that you can wear the mic on either side, rotate it upright or remove it entirely. That's a nice little feature if you're not prone to lose the mic like I am  :-)A+ for value and performance.

This high density rubber case fits around my iPod nano perfectly and is easy to install.  This was exactly what I was looking for, I only wish they made a version with a nice low-profile clip secured to the back.  Overall, a nice purchase and fits my needs!

I like this case, but with some caveats:1) The size: it is much larger than I expected.  For ladies, if you are looking for something low profile and sleek to clip onto your running shorts, this probably isn't what you are looking for.  The pouch will be obvious under an athletic top/tee shirt.2) The pouch is secured to your clothing via magnets.  You will need to take this into consideration before you just stick your wallet, keys, iPod, etc... into it.  You could quite easily demagnetize your credit cards, or key cards, key fabs, hard drives in older iPods etc... I'm weary of sticking my electronics or keychain (with electronic devices on it) into this for that reason.  On the other hand, if you needed to carry around an inhaler, some medication, a traditional set of keys, etc... this would work perfectly.I'm much more likely to secure this to my bike than to my waist band for an outdoor excursion.  I'm disappointed that it won't suffice for everyday use (putting my iPod on my running shorts and just dashing off) because its just too big/bulky to wear comfortably on my lightweight workout clothes.

I purchased this screen protector for my Dad for his new Moto G Verizon phone. He was able to apply it, first try without any problems or unsightly air bubbles.  Works perfectly and gives nice coverage without compromising screen clarity.  Would buy again!

I purchased this case for my father for his new Moto G Verizon phone. This provides a perfect amount of low-profile protection.  No need to go for a full Otter box.  The grip is good, but the natural surface of the phone itself is still a better feel.  The case itself only adds a moderate weight/thickness to the phone.

I really, really liked these shoes but the right and left shoes didn't fit the same (the right shoe was smaller than the left) so I had to return them. I'm a little surprised, because I have bought nearly a dozen pairs of Sauconys over the years and never ran into this issue.... Either way, these are attractive low profile sneakers with great cushion and very comfortable to wear for hours.

Readers will be divided on this one into: "love it" or "hate it" camps.  Unfortunately, I wasn't particularly blown away by this one.  Teen angst has been done (a lot) and heavy topics, life events and struggles have been tackled really well by the genre.  This book doesn't stand up in a field with so many other options.  (See Eleanor and Park, Paper Towns, Finding Alaska, Perks of Being a Wallflower, the DUFF, Speak, etc... etc... just to name a few) In particular, there are cliches that are perpetuated seemingly for the sake of it.  Lots of harsh language that lends no apparent authenticity to the dialogue and shallow, one-dimensional characters that many readers will find difficult to relate to.  This one wasn't for me, but it may be for some readers.  As I said, its one of those love it or hate it kind of books.

This book really blew me away! I didn't have high expectations and wasn't completely sold by the blurb on the back cover, however, I saw so many positive reviews here on Amazon and Goodreads that I decided to give 'Rites' a shot and I'm so glad that I did.  Hensley creates a full cast of fantastic characters with a *strong* protagonist and a really, really compelling story line.  This is one of those books that completely and unexpectedly captures your attention and keeps you reading till the last page.  Highly recommended!

Not quite what I expected. The taste and consistency of the spreads are much different than nut butters or similar spreads. These probably wouldn't do well on fruit, but could definitely work with yogurt or shortbread cookies (foods that can disperse the gritty texture a bit). The gift box and packaging however is quite nice and makes a great gift presentation.

This is the perfect companion for road travel and sporting events.  I work 100% travel (field) and drive several thousand miles a month in my company SUV.  I often travel with a cooler to bring refrigerated and pre-cooked meals and beverages along with me.  In addition, I use it to keep my groceries organized in the trunk.  Most recently, I used it for a picnic/BBQ party in the park.  It's a great multi-use organizer and one of my favorite travel accessories!

Fantastic Food! My allergy-prone 1 year old male cat LOVES this food.
