This deep, interesting book tells how and why in a very demonstrative style how animal dissection has become outdated, unnecessary.Based on what I have read on him in various Biology journals, Reverend Dr. Aaron Laird has done extensive study, research in both animal biology and human biology as extra-curricular self-betterment, thus making him one of the most qualified people in the world to bring this subject to the forefront of consideration.From the back of this book, I can see Laird has his Doctorate of Science and Bachelors of Science from California University 6556 Fountain Avenue, Los Angeles, CA 90028 U.S.A. In addition, Laird was ordained as a non-denominational Minister. This additional qualification solidified his stance as a humanitarian and a supporter of life in all of the various forms that God has created it.Overall a great read ..I highly recommend this book..

I love this book. It has everything Joyce Meyer. This is a must have for women of the faith. Actually it's a must have for ANY believer, period. What I love about Joyce Meyer is her ability to reach out to all gender, races, age groups. I went to some of her ministries and saw this to be true. Truly an anointed woman of God.

What can be more taboo than dating/sleeping with two men?  Having sex with them at the same time.  Leila's fantasy about having Ryan and John at the same time is similar to what may be on other people's sexual bucket list.  It is difficult for her to pick just one as they both excite her in their own way.  While I can understand her attraction to John, the sexy businessman who has a great deal in common with her, Ryan is a free spirit that can make a woman flustered during a conversation and lose control of their inhibitions.  With physical connections to both of them, are they game to share her?  It is a fantasy worth exploring in this story.  Maybe it was he meddling of her mother and friend.  Maybe it was the time in her life that she needs to go wild and do something crazy.  For whatever reason, Leila is taking a risk to being two lovers into bed with her, and the results are hot.  This book is a quick read but with a complete story that helps forge Leila's connection with her men ..

Very easy and nice looking ideas , images are also quite helpful in better understanding the projects - however I doubt the durability and practicality of the same . Fun to do projects . Three stars for the author's efforts and nice step by step instructions followed by pictures .

I really like this approach to chaos magic.1) This is presented from a perspective of improving one's life, as opposed to using magick to 'do things' to other people (like making spells to hurt others, get lovers to come to you etc)2)The author gives a framework for the beginner and extra material for the experienced magician to work with. It's well written and presented in a manner that allows for the reader to 'take it into their own magickal hands'3) After incorporating some of the ideas in this book, I actually have a more clearer view of chaos magick and I've actually seen CLEAR signs of this in my life already.4) There wasn't a stupid 'upsell' to a $300 course or anything that I see a lot in books like these.Good buy!!!

At first I couldn't tell where the story was going. Each character had his or her own conflict, demons to face, and questions to answer.  It took a few chapters, but we find that LA cop Reese Tarrant, archaeologist Penelope "Rusty" Webber, and billionaire vampire Ajax Rasmussen had a connection that that is complex and deadly.  Reese had solved and ended a serial killer's blood draining spree, yet he could not shake the feeling that it went even further. He makes his way to Santa Marina, and this quiet, coastal town becomes the site of horrific murders, not to mention missing persons.  Rusty Webber can have any archaeological journey she wants so long as she helps her benefactor Rasmussen tie up a few loose ends.  As she uncovers new mysteries, her own life is in danger time and time again.  Rasmussen, well, seeing is believing, so you will have to read this supernatural thriller that combines vampire suspense and police mystery.

The stories given in the book highlight an aspect that had gained very little attention - the importance of UDT ( Underwater Demolition Teams ) during World War 2 . Without modern day equipments , these brave men who signed up for these early teams – faced real dangers and struggles that we could have never even imagined. Life at the war was no less than hell . I was really moved while reading about the exceptionally brave men who went through so much to be of service to their country. Editing issues aside , this is a very well written small e-book with some true stories from the First Navy SEALs : The amphibious scout raiders. This book is short but is informative too. I have a lot of Ryan Jenkins books in my kindle collection . I finished reading it in one sitting . Much recommend this short e-book which would introduce you to the forerunners of today’s Special Forces Warriors.

I got this Lampat Lamp as a gift from my sister …. And boy , do I like it ? Hell yeah , I love it !!!!It is beautifully designed , is easily adjustable , has a USB charger built in the side of the arm , has great features – I like the lighting modes and the auto timer. Although I’m still confused how to set the timer to 30 minutes - I’m pretty happy and satisfied with the product ! Great product – worth the price. Much recommend it .
Good ideas but these are not very practical .The book could have been even better with some good editing and formatting.3 stars for the author's efforts !!

As the seasons change from summer to fall , the onset of winters slowly creeps up . In some people , this change triggers the inception of a clinical depression also known as seasonal affective disorder (SAD). People who suffer from SAD slowly sink into a depressed state, and often find themselves eating more , sleeping more, socializing less, and doing their routine activities less often. Although I downloaded this book on promo – I feel that whether if you suffer from this condition or not , this book is a good resource that will outline possible solutions and treatments to this depression that affects so many people every year. Not one of the best books on SAD , nevertheless good overview . It would have been even better with some more information with in depth research . Still - Worth a try !

My mom suffers from High Cholesterol Problems . I was looking for some material to read more about it . Ordered it for free on a promotion - so a total win win for me.. !!This short ebook tells about a lot of aspects of reducing cholesterol . Quick , simple and straight to the point read. The write-up is also simple and easy to follow. I’m not sure how accurate is the research done by the author but I found some really interesting good to know information from this book . I never knew there was good and bad cholesterol . I got some new insights and information on what it is all about. Definitely a must have. Even if you’re not having problems with your cholesterol levels - I still highly recommend getting this informative guide.  It is even more valuable to those who want to prevent it.

Definitely not my usual read, but I’m really glad I took a chance on this one. Loved it. Couldn’t put it down loved it. I’m the kind of romance reader who really like to focus on the interpersonal relationships, and the love story, and well, yes, the sex too, but this was actually so much more. The love story is a big part of it, but it’s only one part out of so much going on. The leading lady is a bad-ass. Totally take charge an in control. Pretty much what you’re used to seeing with male leads. But Jack is equally hot and smart and man, is that guy tenacious. This is definitely not your typical relationship, and that in and of itself made the story really good for me.As for the rest, I have to say it’s just as exciting. I'm the kind of reader where if a book takes too long to get to the juicy bits, I lose interest, but gosh there was just so much other stuff going on here! The cast of characters were really awesome too. And reading about how they operate as well as their relationships with each other was really cool.Consensus: Excellent read. This book is really well-written. I mean, the prose is fantastic. I almost can’t believe Alexi Lawless is a new author with the way she writes. (I kind of wonder if she’s another author using a pen name.  Like… Lee Child or something?) The only thing that’s tough is the ending, but as long as you like a series, it’s cool. If you want an HEA, this is not a book you want to get going on because you won’t be able to put it down. I HAVE to know what’s going to happen next.

Beating alcohol addiction is difficult . A lot of people are dying from alcoholism . The problem of excessive drinking should not be taken lightly . This is a good book and I recommend you to buy it if you are the one who has this problem , or if know someone who has this – please buy it for them.  It can be truly a life saver. I think there are many other books on the kindle store , that are better than this one , but I would still recommend this because the author has excellently mentioned some nice techniques  for being sober and staying sober.If you have made the decision to stop drinking, you have a wonderful resource here to help keep you straight.  Give it a try .

I ordered this one right after I finished reading Mike’s excellent write up in the book – LOA : The Magic Of Creating Reality  .This book has very good manual that outlines the (innate) spiritual gifts that people have along and linking them to the law of attraction. Like another reviewer said, this book had a great SPIRITUAL aspect that I found missing in a lot of books on LOA. The exercise were not only practical to do, but I also found it to give me results as well. Straight to the point book with a real enlightening value to it.I highly recommend it.

I like DIY books , but I’m not a fan of making gifts myself. I’m too lazy for that. I would rather go to the mall and purchase something randomly ;) …. But - I didn’t mind reading this one since I downloaded it for free. Nonetheless , it is an interesting book. It has some really easy DIY Valentine’s day gift ideas and will definitely impress anyone that you make them for.  A good resource to read if you are in to experiments and making unique romantic gifts . Some of them that really caught my attention were – DIY Story in a Heart , DIY Tuxedo Heart Gift box and DIY Book Vault.The instructions are clear and even the ‘not-so-crafty’ kind of people can also make some good stuff through this. Nice book. Give it a try !!

I heard of this book through the author - being familiar with his local work with N.L.P.  I must say - EXCELLENT book - or law of attraction "manual" as I see it's being referred to as. First off, this manual hits all touches on a bunch of different metaphysical aspects - such as dreams, telepathy, shifting realities - but keeps it grounded with applicable understandings about manifestation, belief systems, energy and ascending masters.I also saw the author touch on 'magick' which was awesome. I hope he expands on that in a later book.Anyway, this is really a good manual for adding a strong layer of knowledge to the law of attraction. I highly recommend it.

A diet that is high in fats, sufficient in proteins and low in carbs is known as the `Ketogenic Diet'. This ebook by Jennifer Jones is a great beginners guide for the Ketogenic Diet. It does a good job of explaining what this diet is and how it works. Losing extra weight and staying healthy is a really important part of life. This short ebook provides a thorough breakdown of the Ketogenic Diet and offers simple recipes that are easy to follow . This diet is not about deprivation , its about changing unhealthy patterns and creating a new and healthier lifestyle. Although this is not one of the best books on Ketogenic diet , nevertheless it is a great guide for beginners. Even I learned some great info from this book and I highly recommend it to everyone who's considering to implement this diet.

This ebook helps you save a lot of your time and money with a number of really simple , very quick and easy Mason Jar Meal recipe ideas that anyone can do! These recipes are designed to be prepared in advance and stored so you'll have grab and go meals every time. I am always interested in trying new ways to make food and also in different kinds of diet.  If you know how to prepare them - Mason Jar meals have a whole bunch of advantages !!Though I am new to mason jar meals , I find it really exciting - can’t wait to try some recipes soon . This ebook is great , to-the-point and very helpful guide if you’re a beginner at creating mason jar meals.Much Recommended.

This HIO chair is incredibly comfortable and it is exactly what I needed. It fits easily in the relatively small space that I have available at my desk.My previous chair had arms on it and was real big . This chair is a great value for money and even the assembling is really simple and quick . Much recommend it.

The first book had me really hooked in, but holy hell, the second has me full-on addicted!I seriously didn't think it would get better than the first, but Lawless actually picks up the pace and introduces some seriously kick-ass new characters. This book has way more action, is far more complicated and literally had me on the edge of my seat. It's another cliff, be warned, but I can't wait to get my hands on the next installment!Type faster, Alexi! TYPE FASTER!

A comprehensive look back on the role the soldiers of the U. S. Navy played during the WWII . The timelines and the unfolding events are brilliantly related and turn a history book into a riveting read. The stories tell about the valor and importance of those men who fought at the sea including soldiers from the Surface Navy as well as the Merchant Marine . Good write up of such important stories and good description of a difficult time.Being too short , this ebook is a refresher or reminder of the struggles and hardships of these brave men during the WWII . I would recommend Ryan Jenkins books to anyone who is looking for brief overview about the time , for in depth study – you might want to try other authors work. In summary, a good overview by an author to watch. His previous books are already in my kindle collection .

I traveled to the Czech Republic before knowing none of the language.  A friend coached me on how to say "hello" and the name of our Prague metro station where our hotel was.  While I made it alright with English in the tourist areas, I wanted to show more respect to them in greetings and such.  Also, not everyone spoke English so I can't rely on that every time.  I want to see more of Eastern Europe and I want more phrases to interact with the citizens in their countries.  Each language in this book is different in spelling, pronunciation, and even alphabet in some cases, but the phonetic pronunciation guide after each phrase makes it possible to speak and start communicating in the language.  With each language in this book. It is broken down into categories where you are likely to use them (shopping, eating, emergencies).  It is easy to locate it if you need it right away.  This book will be helpful in my travels even if I don't get to use every phrase.

Readers who enjoy Tony Thorne's speculative fiction may wonder how he gets inspired to write such amazing works full of detail, facts, and creativity about a world we are yet to see. In this case, readers can find his muse as the setting in Tenerife, one of the islands in the Canary Islands. While the location provides a beautiful backdrop, it also provides the author with a setting that is perfect for jungle habitats for micro-dinosaurs and volcano experiments. These are tall tales, but there is something about them that makes the reader feel like it could happen if it isn't already in the works now. Whether the characters are amateur scientists or professional PhDs, the stories are easy to read as well as entertaining. Any type of technical terminology is still comprehensible to the average readers who want nothing more than a great read from an imaginative author. Some just make you think how we have evolved while others can be debated if science is trying too hard to create or recreate things that the world is not ready for. These stories vary in context and length, so there is always the chance to find a favorite piece or storyline within the variety of tales from the Tenerife Island.Highly recommended !!

This is a really good dialog novel. The book came recommended by a friend of mine who had read it and said to me that I would get attached to the characters. It took a little getting used to Zandri's writing style and I had to give him some credit, for a first release it was really above average. Once I got comfortable with the style of the story I became attached to the characters and found myself wanting to read ahead to see what happened to them next. It seemed like a slow build up but it caught me by surprise..The outline of the writing indirectly turns you. At times it is a false turn and sets you right back onto the storyline you're expecting and other times it takes you right off track. After a while you end up second guessing what happens next to the main characters.The main characters are everyday people. They are flawed. They have been knocked down and run over. Most have every reason to withdraw but they fight to resist that. You root for them to rise above their own shortcomings. The story is set in such a way to remind us of that human condition to try to be a little more than you already are and to realize that you cannot truly appreciate the heights of success without appreciating the depths of loss.This story will move you. You will not be able to resist feeling it.Much recommended !

These screen protectors are excellent! They fit perfectly and don't affect the sensitivity of the screen adversely at all. They install easily too. This is a really effective essential oil for foot and nail fungus and a host of other things. Although as a topical treatment, it helps to kill off fungus on the skin and nails. I really am impressed with this Super Instamometer! This item gives a highly accurate and precise temperature reading every time. I have never seen a thermometer with such a wide range before. The temperature range on this is from -58 to +572 degrees Fahrenheit (-50 to +300C) so it is very versatile for checking temperatures on both cold and hot items. I have put it in the refrigerator to make sure it is operating at at least 40F or colder. I have tested it on food items as well. It gives an instant and continuous reading as the temperature goes up or down. It also has a Min and Max temperature memory which can also be helpful. It is super easy to use. Simply press the on/off button and select between Celsius or Fahrenheit and it is ready to go. It also will turn itself off in 15 minutes. It comes with an extra battery too - which is very convenient. This is a very accurate and excellent product for testing food temperatures and without having to wait. The reading is instant. I have included a couple of pictures of it that you can check out too. Five stars!

This is a great little radio. It has excellent range and is very easy to program. I have been having a lot of fun with this. It is durable and made of quality materials. My 12 year old had been wanting to learn how to play the Ukulele and when she saw this one, she decided this was the one she wanted the most. She loved the color. This has been a lot of fun and she is really learning quickly. A great value for the money. Five stars!

The Phylink PLC – 128 Series is a covert network security camera that is easy to set up and operate. This IP camera allows you to access the live viewing of your camera from your computer, smart phone or tablet, or from any web browser anywhere in the world – in real time. I own this camera and wanted to share my review and some information that could be helpful to anyone getting one of these also.Hardware:  The main unit is what everything plugs into and operates the camera. This is very easy to set up, so don’t be intimidated if you are not very tech savvy. The manual included is very well written and guides you step by step. On one end of the main unit you plug in your Ethernet cable and plug in the other end to the router. On the other end of the main unit is where you plug in the camera. Screw on the antenna, plug in the power adaptor and you are ready to go. There is a slot for a micro SD card that the camera records to when using motion detection. The unit records to the SD card at 30.3MB per minute and records continuously over the previous video once it has reached the memory capacity. There is a jack for a line-in microphone on the main unit too if you want to have audio as well. The camera also comes with mounting hardware that allows you to mount the camera either in plain view - straight on or at a 45 degree angle, or covertly behind a wall. The camera itself is very small. The lens is about the size of one on a smart phone. The casing around it is made of steel and has two holes at the bottom which makes it easy to mount. Attached to the camera is about 26 feet (8 meters) of cable. Everything is constructed and manufactured well and seems to be made of quality materials.Software: To see the video from the camera live on your computer screen, install the software CD that is included. It is a very simple and quick installation. After the software is installed, you can click on the Phylink icon on your home screen to see the live viewing window. When the window opens, you have a toolbar along the top that helps you easily navigate the program. From here you can add your camera and even multiple cameras that you can view. After you have added a camera, then you will see an indicator on the window showing if it is connected or disconnected. My camera always connected quickly every time – within about 10 to 15 seconds. You can then click on the camera window and see it larger on your screen. On this screen you have record, snapshot and control options for the camera. When you record, the video is saved onto a file within the Documents folder in your computer. From the main screen you can also set up your camera so that you can view it remotely from a web browser. You can do this from the Setup tab.The App:  To view the video from your smart phone, you can download the Phycam app for free on The App Store. Once installed, you can add a camera in the same way as on the computer and access the functions of the camera.  It is recommended that you have a current version of IOS 9 or newer. I had some delay issues that had to do with using an older version.The Camera: The Phylink PLC – 128 is an indoor camera and not made for outdoor use. However, you can easily mount it by a window inside for outdoor viewing. The quality and clarity of the camera is impressive. The video quality is very clear with optimal lighting. But, just as with any video camera, as it becomes darker, the picture becomes more pixilated. The brighter the lighting, the better the quality of the video. It works fine in normal lighting conditions.Potential Problems & Fixes: Although I had no problems whatsoever with the camera or equipment, there are a few things worth mentioning in regards to technical issues you may encounter and how to fix them. As I mentioned previously, you need to have an up-to-date operating system for the app to work correctly on your smartphone. Another app you can try if you have issues with the Phycam app is one called Anyscene.  I set up and tested this camera at two different locations using Wi-Fi. One location was at an office with multiple computers connected to the internet. The other location was at home with only a couple of computers online. I did encounter about a 5 second delay in the video at the office, but none at all at home. So, I assume the delay at the office was due to the number of computers using the internet. At home it worked perfectly in real time. For downloads and software updates, you can find them at http://www.phylink.com/downloads/index.htmConclusion: This camera is very quick and easy to set up.  It is made of quality materials and is constructed well. The long cable between the camera and the main unit allows you to set up the camera a good distance from the router connection. You can also connect a longer Ethernet cable between the router and main unit if you need more distance to work with.  Mounting the camera is also very easy. The mounting hardware allows you to set it up in the position you want for best viewing.  Navigation of the toolbar and live viewing screen on the computer is user friendly and easy to understand. The user’s manual is very well written and illustrated. The instructions cover the complete setup of the camera as well as the software and app installation.  The video from the camera is very clear. The technical support is superb and prompt. They are very helpful when it comes to answering any questions or addressing any issues you may have, and that is a major plus! The app allows you to view the video and operate its functions remotely. So does the computer software. This camera works well and comes with a number of convenient features. I am very pleased with the quality and how user-friendly it is to set up and operate

Four Seats: Martial Law is part two in a series by author Aaron Cooley and just like the first book, it hooks you quickly. This modern day political thriller is a wild ride of suspense, action and intrigue. The characters are very well developed and unique in their personalities. The dialogue is excellent and what really brings life and vision to the plot and storyline. This book keeps you engaged and entertained from start to finish without unnecessary filler. You cant wait to find out what is going to happen next and that is what makes this series fun to read.

3 Mad Monks is a highly entertaining story that is intriguing and engaging from the first page. The plot of the story is quite unlike anything I have read before. The author is obviously a very talented storyteller. The characters are colorful, amusing and well developed. What I especially stood out to me was how good the dialogue was between the characters. It really gave a lot more depth and visual appeal to the characters and the story. This book has a little something to offer anyone. It is definitely as thought provoking as it is entertaining. Five stars!

I have always been fascinated by the personality types of people, what makes them think and react the way they do and what they believe and why. I have also been quite interested in understanding my own personality type and what causes me to be set in my own ways. This book is highly informative and insightful about understanding the ISFJ personality type based on the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator (MBTI) I discovered that my own father was more of an ISFJ and this book was very helpful for me to understand his thoughts, feelings and decision making capabilities. My father was a brilliant parent and I really respected the way he handled things when it came to parenting even though he and I really had very different perspectives and often conflicting opinions about a number of various subjects. This book provides a great deal of interesting and compelling details about the working of the ISFJ protector type of personality. After reading this, I am more intrigued to learn more about the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator and discover more about my own personality as well as others who were influential in my life.

I have been very pleased with the results of this cream. I like the way it feels on my skin. It goes on smooth and doesn't leave a greasy or sticky residue. Five stars for its quality, ingredients and effectiveness.

These new silicone baking products are really a blessing in the kitchen. They are oven, microwave and dishwasher safe. This is an entertaining, amusing, humorous and out of the ordinary story. I enjoyed the mystery and magic and the narrative of the plot. I especially enjoyed the character interaction and dialogue. The story flows quickly and keeps you engaged to find out what is going to happen next. Five stars for its plot, character development, creativity and dialogue.

A highly engaging and entertaining book. This story hooks you from the first page and keeps you locked in. It is very visually and creatively written. You get a great visual of the characters and their personality through their dialogue and feel like you are right there in the action. A fun and creative book that I got to share with my best friend's little boy. The poems are enjoyable to read with attractive and entertaining illustrations to go along. Reading the poems out loud to the child brings up all kinds of little conversations, creative expressions and little educational moments along the way. He points at the pictures and has responds to what I am reading him. This is a very fun book to share with young children. I might add it is equally as fun for adults to read and enjoy too. The different font styles and illustrations really jump out and keep the reading experience engaging and entertaining.

I communicate online via Skype and other programs with various clients from around the globe. This bed is exceptionally comfortable. It feels incredible to lay on. It is also very durable and made of quality materials that always return to its original shape. I like to start my day with a blended fruit and vegetable smoothie and take it with me to work in one of the drink bottles that I have. I recently bought a new laptop that has a web camera built in at the top of the screen. I have never liked that thing pointing at me all the time when I'm on the computer. It just kind of creeped me out. I've certainly heard and read the news about how hackers can possibly access your webcam as well. I didn't like the idea of using black tape which leaves a sticky residue. I discovered this webcam cover here and ordered it. I am really happy with this product. It is a perfect fit to cover the cam and thin enough at the same time that I can close the laptop without it interfering with it closing. It is made of a soft, spongy kind of material that doesn't scratch any surfaces. I also really like that you can use it over and over again. It sticks perfectly to the surface of the laptop every time and never leaves any residue. For me, this product is worth it for the peace of mind and that I can just leave it attached whenever I am not using the camera and it doesn't get in the way. Five stars.

This is great! The headband is very comfortable and fits nicely. I have MP3's of sound effects like ocean waves and rainstorms on my iPad and they sound so amazing with this speaker headband. I can just lay back and melt into the sound until I fall asleep. The speakers provide crystal clear sound and the speakers are thin enough and padded enough by the fabric that they are very comfortable on the ears too. This is the perfect way to relax and listen to your music or other audio while meditating or to drift off to sleep. I love them!

This is a great guidebook that helps you to learn more about the various accommodations, restaurants and places of interest in Cartagena. This guide lists a number of different attractions, lunch spots, local hang out places, transportation options and maps of the city. Each hotel, restaurant and other destination is shown with a color photograph and links to their website where you can learn more about each of these places. This is really convenient when you are researching your trip. This book saves you a lot of unnecessary searching online with direct links to the places you want to know about and want to get in touch with directly. This is a very helpful guide to those who are planning to visit Cartagena.

This is an excellent story that combines real life settings with fictional characters. It begins with a brief meeting between two young kids at the Huntington Library. This meeting leaves a profound impression on both of them that causes them to try to reach out to each other after their encounter, but not being able to make a connection because of the powers that be. The story continues about these two young characters; Sarah and David and their lives growing up and circumstances that cause them to become close to reconnecting. Do they again? Well, you will have to read to find out. There are a number of unexpected twists and turns in the story that are very surprising and keeps you locked in and reading to see what is going to happen next. This is a fascinating read with excellent character development and thought provoking content. Five stars!

This is an action-packed, highly engaging and very entertaining story. Because of the fast pace of the book, it really locks you in and holds your attention. What I liked most about the book was the character dialogue. It is not easy to write natural sounding dialogue but this author really is able to do so in a manner where you feel like you are right there in the scene. Because of this, you get a real feel for the characters and the plot as well as a great visual of the setting. The book also flows really well from each chapter and scene keeping you reading and waiting to see what will happen next. Excellent creative writing, visual storytelling and dialogue. Five stars!

This book is the true story of Dr. Elsayed and documents his life, his challenges and his triumphs. It is a highly engaging and thought provoking true story and it really causes you to reflect and put things into perspective. This book is difficult to read at times in the sense that it makes you frustrated and upset with the legal system in the U.S. and how terribly unfairly a person can be treated as well. I really liked the way Dr. Elsayed expressed himself in such an open and honest way. For me, this is what made the story very powerful and made me want to keep reading. This is a really great read and I highly recommend it!

I was recently given this product to try out in exchange for an honest review. As more people have begun to realize that not only the foods we eat, but also our environment in which we live in contains toxins that remain in our bodies, more people are realizing the positive effects of detoxifying the body. Once you begin a detox, you start to really notice the positive effect that a cleans has on the way you feel and the function of your body. This product works gently and naturally to remove the toxins from your body and clean your digestive system. Because it is a natural formula, it is 100% safe. Within a couple of days you will begin to notice that it is working. It eases and eliminates constipation, leaving you feeling more comfortable and clean. I am very pleased with the results so far!

It’s certainly one of the very few books that do their best to correct rather than cement the widely held misconceptions about North Korea. It confirms what I had already learned from a rare insider memoir, Felix Abt’s “A Capitalist in North Korea: My Seven Years in the Hermit Kingdom”, where he explains, from personal experience and with plenty of examples, that North Korea isn’t stuck in the past, but has been undergoing dramatic changes in recent years. Abt not only witnessed this transition, but implemented, or was a party to, many ground breaking reforms himself.Abt’s lively depiction of life in contemporary North Korea and his ventures and adventures are full of eye-opening surprises, especially to those unused to an informed, impartial portrayal of life in the country. Similarly, North Korea itself may well surprise observers, not as the source of sensationalist headlines loved by Western media, but with tales of moderation, change and advancement.

This is an excellent combination of personal care and fitness to recover and physically improve your body after childbirth. The book is full of detailed and very relevant information and presented in a way that is easy to understand. I like the author’s approach in the way she discusses the subject matter. It is not stiff and academic, but much more down to earth and on a personal level. This book offers a lot of insight about the mechanics of your body as well as a number of tips, advice and strategies to recover and restore your body in a healthy and natural way. The illustrations throughout the book are also very helpful to understanding some of the topics and exercises covered.  This book is a comprehensive guide that I highly recommend to all mothers and mothers to be for better health, fitness and well-being.

This is a great book providing some interesting insight about the background and career of Richard Sherman. A lot of people know the player and his colorful character, but this book gives a more complete picture about this amazing athlete - from his humble upbringing, his influences and his accomplishments both on and off the field. From his season by season career to his charitable and philanthropic work, this book helps you to get to know and understand the real man and how he got to where he is today.

I love being able to listen to my music while I exercise without that wire down the middle that gets in the way! These headphones are high quality, great sounding and fit perfectly. They are quick and easy to sync up to your device and enjoy rich digital quality sound without any interference or delay. The headphones are feather light and comfortable to wear. They stay in place nicely too. I can use them while jogging or horseback riding and they stay put. These are a great value for the money. They are so convenient too. I can use them when I'm cooking or doing housework and I never have to deal with the wire getting in the way of what I'm doing. Once you own a pair of these you never want to go back to the traditional style of headphones again!

This tablet is a great value for the money. I really like the versatility of having the USB port and cord - which some of the most popular brands don't have. This is so convenient for being able to transfer files from the tablet to an external device or computer. Another great feature that is also versatile are the two SIM card slots - allowing you to make calls on this tablet. It is bluetooth enabled, so you can use it for hands free calls and for use with bluetooth headphones and other components. The touch screen works very well. It takes great pictures and the dual cameras work well too. This tablet is very user friendly and connects to wifi very easily. This is a great value for the money considering all of the extra features. Five stars!

This is a very user-friendly product that is quick and easy to set up and begin using right away. This gives you so much more versatility for television, radio, movies and gaming and everything is right there at your fingertips. I like that it is compact - which makes it easy to take with you while traveling. You can easily plug it in and go on any TV. It is easy to install your favorite apps and be able to access and view them on your TV. You can stream movies and videos on Netflix, Youtube and others without delay. The USB ports on the side are also convenient for plugging in an external video source to view on the TV. Five stars for its ease of setup and use and convenience!

Yoga is defined as the union of the individual soul with the cosmic soul and the state of oneness with the higher self, so the yoga of relationships is about the double union between self and source and self and other. While we are born knowing our connection to source, we lose it through constant abrasion against the reality of our parents, peers, and surroundings. We then spend much of the rest of our lives trying to recapture this feeling of connection. Yogi Desai suggests that we use our relationships as mirrors to reflect back to us who we think we are, and may be attracted to another person because we like the image we think they see. These relationships with people, food, entertainment, substances may give us some temporary pleasure and relief from pain or fear, but they also may lead to addictions and dependencies. The most important relationship in our lives is the one we have with ourselves, and unless we love and accept ourselves, how can we expect others to love and accept us?"Understand that in all significant relationships, we project our own unmet emotional needs and desires onto those we love.”When life moves on and people change, we lose our anchor. We become fixated on holding on to the past because we fear the unknown that lies ahead. The only way to move forward and create a new future for ourselves is to release anger and adopt forgiveness – and that includes forgiving ourselves.There is a section about our relationship to food that many will resonate with. Yogi Desai points out that we often use food to fill our inner emptiness, a sign of spiritual starvation. We have distorted the basic function of food as a source of nourishment and made it primarily a source of pleasure. He urges us to return to the design of Mother Nature, treating food with respect and gratitude. To end spiritual starvation, start by feeding the soul. On a practical basis, he suggests eating half as much and chewing twice as long.The final chapter talks about love as union, and he already defined yoga as union, so the yoga of relationships is really the practice of rekindling the awareness of our union with the divine and of our essence as love. With this as our foundation we can move forward into any relationship with trust and joy.This is a small book with some profound (and possibly hard-earned) wisdom about relationships, and provides valuable food for thought.

This is a delightful memoir from an intelligent and deeply thoughtful woman. Growing up in England during World War II, Toinette Lippe was deeply imprinted with the ethos of hard work and making do with very little imposed by wartime austerity, which in England persisted well into the 1950s. She was discouraged from pursuing “male” professions for which her formidable intellect was suited, so she trained as a secretary and went into publishing. She was hired out from under the nose of her British publisher boss by the US head of Simon and Schuster. She  progressed from secretary to editor with Alfred A Knopf and eventually was responsible for an entire imprint.Jewish by birth and Buddhist by inclination, she was a committed workaholic with a passion for beauty, simplicity and minimalism, traits she carried into her active urban retirement that includes writing, editing, travel and Asian brush painting. Her personal story and observations on life are told with enormous charm and humor. An engaging read.

Very nice brush - firm enough to get to the scalp, but soft enough to be pleasant to use on a sensitive scalp. I have fine, short hair, so I don't know how it would work on long hair. It came with a handy brush cleaner, and was packed in a beautiful box that would make a lovely gift presentation.

My life after deathThis book occupies a special niche between the growing numbers of first-hand accounts of near-death experiences and channeled books about the afterlife. While it is channeled through a medium, or spiritual translator as she prefers to be called, the voice of 20-year-old Erik Medhus comes through with such clarity and integrity that you have the sense of a living presence behind the transcription. The text is down-to-earth and liberally peppered with the vulgarities and usages of young males. That, however, is part of what makes this book uniquely valuable. It speaks directly to those who are vulnerable and hurting in language they can resonate with.When Erik took his own life, he could have been just another statistic among the epidemic of alienated and emotionally disturbed youth (as well as adults and seniors) who have lost all sense of hope and meaning in their lives. He suffered from a complex of emotional troubles from ADHD to bipolar disorder, and the detailed description he gives of his mental state leading up to his suicide is worthy of being studied by professionals and parents of kids with these challenges.  Erik, however, did not go quietly because he had a mission.He rapidly developed the ability to appear either visually or in dreams, first to members of his immediate family and then to members of the online community gathering around his mother's blog, channelingErik.com, which she started as a means of dealing with her grief. As he acclimated to life on the "other side" Eric came to realize that he had planned his life path in order to gain empathy for those suffering from mental illness and depression, as well as from grief and loss. The mission he undertook was to help as many people as possible understand both our immortality and our interconnection – we don't die and we are never alone. We always have beings around us to guide and support us if we but listen and/or ask.Erik’s descriptions about what happened to him after a passing offer a number of original observations, but mostly echo reports from much of the near-death literature. The wonder and delight of this book is truly in the voice of this extraordinary young man – a voice full of humor, the energy of youth, and a passion for living and helping others.Just as his physician mother overcame her science oriented skepticism and embraced the notion of a vibrant afterlife, so whatever level of skepticism you may start out with, you will turn the last page with a strengthened confidence that while our role in this universe may shift and change, it will never end. You are left with a quiet smile on your face and perhaps a nagging sense that you might want to get your act together because down the line you're going to be your own judge and jury. The good news is that everybody else will still love you - unconditionally.

One Great Year is a cosmic saga that follows the tempestuous loves and conflicts of its three main characters across the 26 millennia of the axial precession or Great Year, from the time of Atlantis to the present. As they weave their way through multiple incarnations, they bring to life the complex dance of relationships believed by many in esoteric circles to occur within soul groups in order to work out their karmic destiny.The love triangle between Theron, Marcus and Helghul sets the stage for an exploration of love and longing, passion and rejection, anger and jealousy, ambition and service, good and evil – in short all of the primal passions, dark forces and noble impulses animating the human spirit. They are followed through wars, cultural flowerings and conflicts throughout history to an apocalyptic climax.The action and the narrative are brilliantly realized, and the authors build upon historical records as well as myths and legends to re-create the eras of Plato and Genghis Khan, for example, which are then overlaid with the character, lives, lusts, and enmity of the protagonists. The book is very visual and visceral, and would make a fantastic movie. The challenge would be to translate the epic scope of this book into a two-hour screenplay. A gripping read.

This book is fascinating, witty, intelligent, informative, disturbingly visionary, and alternately funny and scary as hell. The authors, R.U. Sirius (no, not his real name) and Jay Cornell have put together a guide to terms most people haven't heard about, or only vaguely recognize, that describe scientific and technological developments already well advanced and that will inevitably change modern life as we know it. You know those science fiction movies like 2001, Terminator, and the Matrix? Their respective premises are no longer far out nor far away.The book revolves around the concepts of trans-humanism and the singularity. Trans-humanism relates to radical technological alteration of the human body – mind, including genetic manipulation and biomechanical and electronic implants. The singularity refers to the crossover point when artificial intelligence becomes smarter than human beings. Probably the most high profile proponent of this is Ray Kurzweil, who predicts the singularity to occur in 2045.The authors combine history, science, and technology with a good dollop of philosophy and humor. It makes great reading for trivia addicts, but also raises profound questions and issues that any reflective individual should be aware of. Dorothy, we are not in Kansas anymore and there's no going back, so we had better start thinking about the moral, ethical and survival issues related to going forward with little or no oversight or restraint. This book provides the signposts to this new Land of Oz, and describes the major players – in front of and behind the curtains. This is not a text book nor a book for people well-versed in the science. It is a good introduction to terms and concepts most will find unfamiliar, but whose implications deserve to be contemplated by all of us.

When I got this for review, I was intrigued and immediately searched the house for colored pencils to try it out. I couldn't find them and tried markers, but you really need sharpened pencils to have the control you need to cope with some of the the mind-blowingly intricate designs in the book. I then discovered that there is a whole genre of adult coloring books, and I'm not surprised. The concentration required to do a decent job of staying in the lines has just the right level of mindlessness to put one into a meditative state - rather like walking a labyrinth - and it is most therapeutic. The added bonus is that you can express your mood and artistic vision through your choice of colors, and have something to show for it afterwards. The individual pages come out cleanly if you want to frame your hard-earned masterpiece. So if you want to get in touch with your inner child, this is quite a fun way to do so.

It is exciting to see so many people opening up to the magic of the universe and tuning into their psychic abilities. As with artists or musicians, there are many different ways they express their vision of what they are inspired to communicate.  Psychic mediums generally use their gifts to bring comfort, healing of the spirit and a better understanding of “how things work,” the purpose of life and the nature of death and the afterlife.In Soul Secrets, Miki Jacobs introduces her own concept of the “TEAM,” a group of spirits that surrounds each of us throughout our physical life, and help us through the transition of death into the harvest of wisdom from our earthly experiences. The Team is made up of the Archangels, Guardian Angels, Spirit Guides, and a Departed Loved One. Everyone has them, and Miki provides a detailed list of ways to connect with them and to see signs in everyday occurrences that can reassure us that we are never alone. Two-way communication is possible and immensely helpful, she says, and gives instructions on how to do automatic writing. The secret to developing your own abilities to communicate with your team is practice, especially through a discipline of meditation.Ever since seeing the movie, Despicable Me, I’ve secretly wanted my own team of Minions. Now it seems that they were there all along, just standing by and waiting to be asked!

There are a gazillion diet books out there, and we already know we should be eating a healthy diet and exercising, so it is refreshing to find a book that actually addresses all the excuses we use to avoid doing so. Dr. James Rouse’s mission is all about helping his patients and his readers achieve the lifestyle and mindset shift to create a healthy life. You can sense the energy and passion leaping off the page, as he explains the science (in layman’s terms) and the psychology behind the factors that rob us of a long, rewarding and vigorous life.His integrated body-mind-spirit approach starts with how we think. Are we buoyed and motivated by a grand vision of who we want to be and what we want to contribute, or is our essence submerged in a sea of negativity from past hurts, self-doubt and the daily news. His prescription for change is based on many years of observing and coaching successful people. It incorporates principles and action steps for kick-starting your day with early rising, meditation, movement or exercise of some kind, and healthy eating.It is not a diet, but rather guidelines on what to eliminate and what to emphasize in your diet. His diet and exercise recommendations reflect the best of current research, and if followed, would produce noticeable improvement in a fairly short time. The “Thrive” part of his title is both an outcome of the recommendations of the first three parts, as well as a heartfelt exhortation to become the best you possible.All in all, an upbeat and doable recipe for physical and mental transformation.

An exuberant romp through love, sexuality, and relationships– where, when, why and how they may have gone wrong in this life or another.  this mother and daughter team draws upon their own colorful life experiences,  blending intuition and professional expertise  to deliver some real life wisdom.

According to the author, "divine audacity is bold spiritual living, living under the radical premise that I A M divine." Drawing on the spiritual texts and traditions of many religions, the Martella-Whitsett makes a bold case for each of us to claim our own spark of divinity. Beginning from a foundation of meditation she guides you into using and cultivating your imagination to find an expression of divine identity that you feel comfortable inhabiting.As a divine being or a spark of the divine, one has the obligation to make the most of the gift of life. The author points out that, “the opposite of life is not death. The opposite of life is stagnation. The currency of life is divine ideas, the limitless possibilities that we either quash or set in motion.”  So remind yourself that you give life to your dreams, and that only the dreams that you give life to, live. Dare to dream!

Self-help books tend to be very earnest and intense, this one however is about lightning up. It talks about the great value of laughter not only to  improving your mental state but your physical state as well.  The hormones released by laughing relax the blood vessels, lower your blood pressure and reduce other markers of stress. The good news is that you can fake it till you make it. Faking  or forcing laughter, it turns out, gives you pretty much the same benefits as doing the real thing spontaneously. The author went to India to study with the originator of laughter yoga, which has been catching on around the world because it's fun as well as healthful. So how about it, let's gather in groups and get our giggle on!

There are always times in our lives when everything seems to be falling apart and you really don't know where to turn.  They say that that which doesn't break us makes us stronger.  They don't say that it's not going to hurt, nor that it's going to be easy to turn around. So the question is, are you going to fight or close down? That's the subject of this book by a former star athlete turned hopeless addict turned Unity Minister. Having been there herself, Temple Hayes is particularly well-placed to provide insight and guidance – and indeed a whole rooting section to encourage you and show you how to take back the reins of your life.  If you don't have anyone you can turn to, like a wise friend, this book could be the support you need

Whether you are trying to de-stress, develop your insight and intuition, or activate the law of attraction, you are sure to find one or more approaches to meditation in this book that will be comfortable and effective for you. The Levey's are the absolute masters of the art, and their book provides interesting background, gentle guidance, practices and visualizations that will be helpful whatever your prior experience with meditation may be. Warmly recommended.

This book provides an impressively wide-ranging overview of the interrelationships and interdependencies among the environmental, economic, sociological, and political issues at play in the world today. They feed into the rather pressing question of whether humanity will be able to continue its existence on this planet with some semblance of order and dignity, or whether our social and environmental systems will break down into chaos.As clearly evidenced from the exhaustive annotation and impressive detail, the book is aimed at academics, researchers, and decision-makers charged with navigating their companies, organizations or political institutions into the precarious and unknown territory ahead. While the authors are both academics, their roots are firmly planted in the real world and the warnings and conclusions they offer cannot be lightly dismissed. This book is at once sober and sobering. For example, according to the World Wildlife Fund, 35% of the world's natural wealth has been lost over the past 30 years alone.Lay on top of that the growing inequalities between rich and poor; the dwindling supplies of mined and extracted resources like fresh water, oil, uranium, rare earths, lithium (for batteries), which have all reached peak status; climate change; environmental degradation due to agricultural and industrial pollution; and the growing pressures of developing countries understandably wanting to move into a Western-style consumer society. Coupled with the exponential rise in the world's population, it does not take a PhD to appreciate that our current global standard of living, particularly in the West, is not only unsustainable, but precarious in the extreme.I would say that one of the greatest contributions of this book is to point out the insular and self-serving nature of academic, governmental and corporate research, and to issue a clarion call for interdisciplinary collaborations in order to have some chance of coming up with workable solutions to benefit the greater whole. Make no mistake, playtime is over as is business as usual. It's time for all of us to step into our responsibilities as grown-ups and to demand urgent action from those in power, as well as to take those individual actions and choices that we know in our hearts can make a difference, however small.While this book is valuable in defining the problems and indicating where we need to change, at the end of the day it's up to each of us. The authors are optimistic that we will collectively step up to the plate. Let's hope that we do so before we’ve passed the final tipping point.

I resonated very strongly with this book, probably because I have a very independent streak and don’t like the idea that we are here being judged on whether we learn this or that lesson well enough, or if we’ve been really good or bad. What this book does, differently from most other books dealing with manifestation and the law of attraction, is to present a picture of reality that is at once really liberating and rather intimidating. Liberating in the sense of making one's particular manifestation of reality a matter between you and your consciousness/soul. Angels, demons, past lives and past misdeeds can be set aside; what matters is recognizing your existence in the eternal now, and allowing the passion of your soul to resonate within you.Enlightenment is as easy – and as difficult – as integrating the consciousness of your soul into the physical reality of your humanity. The engine that drives your manifestations is passion, which attracts the energy needed from the the limitless resources of the universe. The tricky part is that whether the passion is positive or negative, it is still effective in creating your life experience. That’s the scary part.Passion is different from emotion, which is a process of the mind based on thought and associations with memory. Passion is the feeling essence that gives form and substance to the energy flow that results in the physical experience. According to Adamus, we are soon going to see amazing breakthroughs in the understanding of "natural physics,” which will open up our perspectives of reality from the limited linear perspective based on time, space, and matter to an unlimited perspective based on the consciousness of the of the observer.As our consciousness expands so will our ability to manifest our life experiences without getting sucked into the drama. All will be seen merely as experience and an opportunity for growth. So, at the end of the day, whether we revel in the joy of experiencing this adventure of being human, or get sucked into pain and drama and powerlessness, it’s all up to us. Absolute freedom! Pretty cool, huh?

I found the material soft and not too tight, but the headphone disks moved around freely in the sleeve. I supposed that is an advantage in that you can adjust the position to where your ears are, but that also means they can slide out of position as you move your head around. I also thought the headphone disks were larger and harder than I expected from reading the other reviews. You therefore need a pretty soft pillow to keep them from pressing too hard into your head if you're a side sleeper. The sound was fine, but overall I expected a better product.

I received the Lavender candle from the manufacturer to try, and I was pleased with the whole concept. It's perfect for spoiling yourself or a loved one with a candle-lit bath followed by a warm oil body rub. The lavender essential oil gives it a delightful aroma that is strong and natural, and lingers on the skin for a while until it is completely absorbed. The warm oil goes on smoothly, and the little pool of liquid wax/oil doesn't get too hot, even right after you have blown out the flame. It leaves the skin soft, with little danger of irritation, given the evident purity and quality of the ingredients. The tin packaging and stretch band make it great for travel with no danger of it opening. Really nice.

“Switch On” provides intelligent tools for understanding and overcoming the barriers to thriving in a climate of rapid change and uncertainty. Nick Jankel synthesizes his formidable knowledge of psychology and philosophy, biology and business, to explain how experiences, especially from early childhood, create habits of thought and behavior that become hard-wired in our brains and by-pass our conscious control.  In a breezy style attuned to Gen-Xers and Millennials, he describes the roots of the problems and self-sabotaging reaction patterns that lead to stress and despair. With just enough science to inform but not confuse, he explains the psychological and biochemical mechanisms that literally anchor doubts and fears in our mind-body, that lead us to switch off to avoid pain and unpleasant emotions, and give up on our dreams in the process. Once we can recognize what we’re doing to ourselves, we can reverse the process and start reclaiming our life force and switch on to the full creative essence of our being.The book  is  simple, without being simplistic, and cleverly illustrated with graphics and typography. For example, the J-shaped curve that describes the 10 stages of the breakdown-breakthrough process drives home the point that things usually have to get pretty painful before we are motivated enough to change. On the downward slope of the J are the problems, patterns and pain that got us to the point of wanting to change. At the bottom we have the point of presence, where we open our minds to the reality of our situation and come to terms with it. Once you come to terms with it you can choose to “metabolize” this problem, as Jankel says, using it to fuel your upward drive to a resolution. You also have the choice not to do anything, which leaves you wallowing in the status quo. The choice to deal with it, to recognize it for what it is, open your mind to the possibility of alternatives, and then to act on it, is what propels you on the upward slope to resolution and power and possibility.If it were easy to make the right choices, the world would be a different place. However, the insights, thoughts for contemplation, and tools Jankel provides help bring clarity and understanding to how our personal defense mechanisms are working; and as they say: the truth will set you free. By recognizing when and why we go into fear and protection mode, and consciously moving towards connection with source, we can stop cringing and get creative. Being a generation or two older, I was surprised to find how much I resonated with this book.  (Note to publisher: being nearsighted I was actually able to read the teeny print, but it was a challenge!) The advice, which sounds hip and contemporary, reverberates with the wisdom of millennia.Echoing the great wisdom teachers, he calls us to recognize our interconnectedness, and notes that we are innately wired for compassion, not for greed and indifference. In fact our greatest rush comes from oxytocin, the feel-good hormone that floods in when we feel love and connection, and know that we're doing good in the world. Yes, it takes effort, but the alternatives are leading us off a cliff. So, whether you’re a Gen-Xer in a soul-destroying job, a millennial who can’t find a job at all, or a boomer who will never be able to retire, you will find inspiration and guidance in this book on how to take your destiny - and the planet’s - into your own hands. This is the time to switch on and Nick Jankel is a wisdom teacher for this time.

Fantastic flavors of a rich and complex cultural mix. Ottolenghi has done it again. The recipes range from simple to gourmet level, but all are just bursting with color, wonderful taste combinations and eye appeal. The ingredients are heavily into fresh herbs and a rainbow of veggies, offering exhuberant inspiration for anyone who loves to cook. Yotam and Sami's collaboration on the book is also an inspiration. Let's hope it catches on.

This book is modest and intimate in tone, but vast and lofty in ambition. History and folk tales weave through the narrative like warp and weft, while nature provides the ancient patterns that we have forgotten. Parry explores the devolution of our relationship with nature, and urges a return to Original Thinking, which perceives life as an integral whole, fed by knowledge and inspiration from the natural environment.There was a turning point in art history when the ability to depict perspective took us outside of the frame where we became the observer rather than an integral part of the picture. This illustrated both a conceptual and spiritual separation from what was observed that culminated in the age of reason, and the dominance of rational thought over feeling and intuition. While we gained the ability to develop science, mathematics and technology, it came at the cost of our estrangement from nature and from ourselves as spirit. Not seeing ourselves as a part of the flow of creation and kin to all life cuts us off from the source of love that sustains our balance and vitality. Parry urges us to reconnect to the ground of our being with our roots firmly planted in the soil of compassion and love for ourselves and for all of nature.Parry is very passionate about rethinking our system of education. When we look at the process of education as a way to learn from but not be bound by the past, we encourage curiosity and exploration of ideas, unshackled by academic conventions and received wisdom. Higher education is not serving us well because of the division of academia into more and more specialized disciplines; this encourages myopic thinking and leads people to lose sight of the interconnections among all subjects and the cross-fertilization that would leave all minds enriched. He urges us to see education not just as a path to earning a living, but as an initiation into one's life purpose. It should be a system that maximizes our creativity and encourages the use of all of our human aspects – our spiritual, intuitive, mental and physical selves – as an integrated whole.This book is a clarion call to nourish our roots before they wither. It has the air of ancient tales told around the fire, drawing us into the beauty that is our birthright, and a sense of relationship and community with all of life. Aho.

I received this glass teapot and infuser with the pink butterfly on the lid from Tea Beyond teas for review, along with a combo box of deliciously fragrant teas . I must admit that they had me at the butterfly. The little teapot holds two good-size cups or three smaller ones. Because the pot and infuser are clear glass, you can enjoy watching the tea flowers unfurl, or just judge the strength of the tea you are brewing. You can pour a second batch of water over the tea(carefully to not disturb the flower, if you are using one), but expect the delicate flavor to diminish on a second batch.Getting back to the teapot - it wasn't just about the pink butterfly, which, by the way, you need to hold down when you pour or the lid will fly away. It is just a great little pot for one or two cups. It is well-designed with a no-drip spout, feels comfortable in the hand when you pour, and because the infuser is glass as well it will always be clean and not affect the flavor. I like being able to watch it to see the color deepen, and there is great play value in watching the little tea flowers bloom. It is definitely going to be on my shopping list next Christmas, with the tea of course.

These earrings are very pretty and well-made. The color is even nicer than in the photo, although they are a bit smaller than I expected from the illustration on the silhouette. Altogether I am pleased with them.

I received this combo box of Tea Beyond teas for review, along with their glass teapot and infuser with the pink butterfly on the lid. I must admit that they had me at the butterfly. The little teapot holds two good-size cups, which is about what each flower can do well. The instructions say that you can pour a second batch of water over (carefully to not disturb the flower), but I think the delicate flavor was lost on a second batch. It's OK if you just use it to warm say half a cup of the first batch. There is great play value in watching the flower unfurl in an all-glass pot. The aroma is lightly perfumed and the flavor is like a delicate green tea. I was not able to discern much difference in flavor among the various "flower buds" but I thought they were all lovely, and am using them as a treat for myself or to share with a friend, since my husband doesn't like green tea.I really liked the loose teas - Jasmine Green, Black Caramel and Black Earl Gray. They were all made of whole leaves, with no tea dust - really high quality.  Because of this, they may need to steep a bit longer than most people may be used to, but the resulting flavor is clean, fresh, aromatic and rewarding. My English husband prefers a more robust flavor, so he will stick with the Earl Gray, which had lemon peel in it, rather than the oil of bergamot that most people associate with it. I thought it was pleasant but not memorable and not really what I think of as Earl Gray. My favorites were the Jasmine green tea and Caramel Black.Getting back to the teapot - it wasn't just about the pink butterfly, which, by the way, you need to hold down when you pour or the lid will fly away. It is just a great little pot for one or two cups. It is well-designed with a no-drip spout, feels comfortable in the hand when you pour, and because the infuser is glass as well it will always be clean and not affect the flavor. I like being able to watch it to see when it is brewed, and you can also watch the little tea flowers bloom.  It is definitely going to my best friends next Christmas, with the tea of course.

So you are trying to eliminate junk food, but sometimes you just NEED something salty and crunchy. Simply 7 to the rescue! I've tried both the Lentil and the Quinoa chips, and Quinoa is my favorite. It has a much better crunch, and a slightly better flavor, though the lentil chips are also nice. It even, surprisingly, is much higher in protein than the lentil - 7 gm vs. 2 gm per serving. They are non-GMO certified, which is relevant, since the Quinoa chips contain corn flour and corn starch, and are made with sea salt. On the minus side, they also contain a bit of sugar, however less than 1 gram. You do wonder if they really needed it, since the lentil chips don't have any.These snacks are gluten-free, use reasonably decent and much less oil for cooking, are nutritious, high protein and free of additives - and they're delicious. Really, was it so hard? I sure hope it filters down.

This is a book to be experienced and savored along multiple dimensions – the visual, the intellectual, and one I would call the timeless. Indeed one’s sense of time melds with the narrative and takes on a whole different rhythm; time is measured in eons as it carries one's imagination gracefully through successive waves of creation and evolution.The story is told across two-page spreads in this sumptuously rendered large-format edition. On the right side of each spread is an illustration – beautifully rendered, sinuous, almost psychedelic - upon which the author has penned an often-amusing encapsulation of events. On the facing page is the detailed narrative, which takes the reader through the annals of cosmic history, using the Helianx as protagonists.The Helianx are a fascinating cultural invention, being vast creatures who are so successful in living in harmony within their environment – feeding off cosmic energy and regulating their procreation to keep their population stable – that they are able to spend the eons in contemplation, creating poetry and song, and observing other civilizations through their telepathic abilities, and later through direct contact during their nomadic travels across the universes, and recording their cultures.As they assimilate all this wisdom, they look for a way to preserve it for eternity, and thereby hangs the tale.While this is the author's first fictional book, it incorporates themes and stories about the celestial hierarchy found in his earlier writings, including the Rebel Angels series, as well is as in such diverse sources as the Urantia book, the Bible, and the work of Zechariah Sitchin. It is delightful as a cosmic fable, yet also very intriguing as a colorful backstory to the creation myth most of us learned in childhood. The book is relatively short, and a compelling and thoroughly enjoyable read. You finish it with a sense of bemusement, and you will probably never look at time the same again.

Sensible advice based on solid science, which is meticulously explained. Most enlightening and useful. It is a fairly easy way of bringing one's diet into line with the latest  understanding of the influence of refined carbs on the metabolism and fat stores. Having one day a week to relax and eat anything you've been craving, so it is quite easy to comply with the restrictions.This is not a quick fix. It is a lifestyle decision. Even with adding a glass of wine in the evening, I am a size smaller in two months.

This is a cry from the heart from a scientist who has his feet firmly planted on the ground and his spiritual roots drawing from the wisdom of the ages.Long known as a teacher of ancient wisdom made relevant for the modern world, Greg looks at our present society in the context of both the degradation we are inflicting on our environment and the almost limitless capacity we have for inventive solutions to the thorniest questions facing us today.Greg's voice is a refreshing call for honesty in dealing with the problems facing humanity – an honesty that is submerged by the voices of self interest, nationalism, and political correctness, as well as the voices of conspiracy theorists and political journalists who may be using fear - each for their own ends.He traces the root of our difficulties in dealing with our problems to the hierarchy of thinking inherited from our past, particularly thinking based in the false assumptions of science. These assumptions suggest that we can solve all our problems through competition, force, and conflict. Throw enough money at a problem, and industry will come up with a technological fix for whatever might ail us – in medicine, energy, in agriculture, and so on. The thinking that he proposes instead is based in cooperation, understanding and mutual aid. It is only through acknowledging our mutual interdependence – across the planet – that we will marshal the best minds and creativity available, combining them to bring forth the solutions that will pull us back from the brink of disaster, towards which we are wrongheadedly advancing.The good news is that there is no shortage of solutions. These solutions are based in the notion of resilience. Resilience is something that used to be built into heavy machinery or electronics to provide redundancy for failure. It was a way to ensure that if one system failed another one would take up the slack. Our global systems are teetering on the brink as are our resources. We do have solutions available both in the short-term and the long-term. The short-term fixes are primarily to buy us time for the long-term solutions.The good news is there that there are many individuals and organizations who have been working with this mindset and making impressive advances. It is most encouraging to read about them, and it is hoped that they will that their example will lead the way to more and more creative innovators. There will probably never be a consensus as to what a better world will look like. As Greg points out, there will probably be as many opinions as there are people. The thing is, that it is in the collective that the pieces of the puzzle come together – that the contributions of the individual elements will make a greater, more coherent and sustainable whole.This is a call to action, and make no mistake about it – it is a call that needs to be heeded.

As this demographic bulge of boomers enters the third age, we are faced with a choice – in fact a number of choices. We can accept the " sentence" of age and decay, with all the associated degenerative illnesses, and try to make the best of our twilight years. Alternatively, we can revel in the opportunities for personal expansion and contribution to the community that come with the release from the confines of the workplace.It would be a great pity to waste the fruits of all the wisdom we have acquired in over half a century of living, but more often than not, that is the case. In traditional societies this wisdom is highly prized and honored, but in the youth culture of the West it is too often ignored and wasted. If, as elders, we acquiesce in this and go quietly into our retirement homes and vegetate, we will be missing out on what could be one of the most exciting and fulfilling periods of our lives.To take full advantage of these years we need to be healthy and have a positive attitude. But as the author points out, conscious aging goes a step further. Conscious aging has a spiritual dimension in which the individual connects deeply to a sense of purpose and connection. He or she is inspired to find ways to give back to the community that will nurture their spirits and enrich all those around them. That is the difference between being an elder and simply getting old. Which do you choose?
