I normally love books where the H & H come from really different life styles, but this book has limited characterizations and basically no plot. The whole story is will she/won't she - the main character lost her husband 3 years before the book starts and has trouble committing to a new relationship. Blake gives us no understanding of her other than that she's hot; although there are some subsidiary characters, her interactions with them amount to about 10 pages. Her love interest is equally 2-dimensional: a ghetto boy (but white!) who hits it big as a hip hop star. Even their relationship - with the exception of a good dozen extended sex scenes - is barely sketched in.The cover picture is completely deceptive. They've got no business showing a guy with a guitar - there's not a single instance of Trax (ugh) playing an instrument, and there's not even much music in the book. But he's sexy because he's got a tattoo of a Rilke poem on his inner arm (Rilke's the first poet we all think of when hip hop comes up, right?). And she's never described wearing anything other than short, tight city clothes. Because, after all, women who've spent their whole lives in a 1000-person town in Montana love to dress like hookers and go to LA dance clubs.Liora Blake doesn't write badly from a technical point of view, but she's cobbled this book together from a couple of ideas, and the whole thing never gels.
This is the best sunscreen I've ever used. It goes on easily, smells fresh and clean, and doesn't leave your skin sticky or white.  I only wish it were reasonably priced.

These aren't bad looking seat covers, and they're comfortable to sit on, but they're pretty hard to fix in place on the car seats - I couldn't get the seat portion hooked up (how much room do other people have under their car seats? I'm not crazy about kneeling in the driveway with one hand jammed under the seat trying to hook something in place), and it slides across the seat as you get in and out of the car. Beyond that, the fabric snags incredibly easily, so you end up with ugly pulled threads. So I wouldn't buy them again.

This is the thickest sunscreen I've ever tried - it's more like putty than like lotion coming out of the tube, although it wasn't difficult to rub into the skin. What I really didn't like is that skin remains sticky for at least an hour after using it. Although this is often true of natural sunscreens, it's a deal breaker for me, hence the 2-star review.

This toothpaste seems to work very well at eliminating odors in the mouth. It's a clear gel that you use on a dry toothbrush, and it doesn't foam in the mouth, so it's quite different from standard toothpastes. While my mouth definitely feels clean after I use it, I actually prefer the minty aftertaste of regular toothpaste, so I don't think I'll be switching.

I'm a big fan of Command hooks; I've never had one fail unless I put more weight on it than the label recommended. But I had some concern with this Broom gripper, since you have to twist the broom handle a bit to get it out. I should have known it would be well designed; 3M does an excellent job of making sure their products work. In this case the gray "grippers" rotate out away from the center of the hook and the broom just falls into your hands.  Super easy to install; super easy to use.  And now I'm going to buy a few more so I can get all my handled tools off the floor of the utility closet.

I'm at the stage where I'm willing to try almost any magic elixir in hopes of making a dent (or rather smoothing some dents) in my aging skin.  This is the first serum I've tried that has actually made a difference. My skin is definitely more hydrated, and when I wake up in the morning it's both soft and sort of "plumped" up. Fewer wrinkles around the eyes & no irritation for my rosacea. This is a product I'll stick with.

I love Jane Yellowrock. Some reviewers complain that she questions herself too much, but that's one of the things about this series that I find intensely engaging. Yes, the action is fast and furious, the powers of heroes & villains alike are exciting, and the characters are consistently strong and compelling, but Jane is no Mary Sue, and her doubts and worries keep her from becoming a comic book character. She's not just strong and snarky, like most urban fantasy main characters, she's also concerned with behaving honorably, and that, for me, pushes her beyond the ordinary.Faith Hunter is an excellent writer, and my only complaint is that I want more! The secondary characters are so interesting & Jane's interactions with them are so fun, that I wish they all could have their own story lines.

The plot moves excruciatingly slowly and McMaster is one of those authors who likes to keep the reader in the dark, both as far as the characters go and in terms of world building. I admit I'm not a huge fan of steampunk - the restrictions of 19th-century England and the freedom of sci-fi fantasy just seem too antithetical to me to work - but this book has such rave reviews that I thought I should try it.  But nope, the poor, yet virginal heroine, who just does not want to give into her passion and the evil, but good-at-heart hero whose passion sweeps her away is such a familiar trope that I could not get engaged.

I loved the first 3 books of this series, but this one not so much.  Let me start by saying I HATE cliffhangers. Daniels used one before - in book 2 - but at least she'd completed the story before she left us hanging. This time the story  just stops, right in the middle. Beyond that, the first several chapters have absolutely nothing to do with the rest of the book. So basically she's given us part of a book.As far as the plot itself goes, it's ok (if incomplete), but the characters don't develop at all, and I'm getting pretty tired of Kit Colbana, the only female character worth a damn, surrounded by males who love and admire her. I don't know why a woman writer is so reluctant to allow her female lead to have women friends, but in Daniels' world women who can fight are either terribly annoying or downright evil (excepting always Kit, the wonder woman). Kit's no Mary Sue - she's definitely failed at things, which is one of the elements that made Books 2 & 3 so engrossing - but in this book she feels flat and uninteresting. Daniels should take a lead from Ilona Andrews on how to allow her main character to shine even among other kick-ass female characters.It seems as if Daniels is attempting to string this series along. Instead of dealing with the aneira world that was so tantalizingly held out to us in books 1-3, she's gone in a completely new direction, and if this cliffhanger is anything to go by, she plans to use the new storyline in a multi-book arc. But I don't want the new arc yet - I want to understand aneira.  This book was really disappointing.

I've read other books by Helen Harper that I liked fine, but this one's a real stinker.  The plot idea is ok - she bases the story on Greek myths - but there are absolutely no characterizations, next to no dialogue, and no world building. The only outstanding element is that the main character likes poetry, so there are several quotations, which is nice, but that's nowhere near enough to carry a book.  Skip it.

This is an excellent stapler for large stacks of paper, and it doesn't look like a heavy industrial tool.  Plus it comes with a staple remover, which, I have to admit, I need to use more often than I should (how much "automatic stapling" should one person do?).
My dog likes this quite well. I just wish rabbit, rather than potato, were the primary ingredient.

It looks green on the Amazon page, but it's actually mushroom colored. It's unlined and has no bottom support, so it probably won't last well, and the shoulder strap lets the bottom of the bag hang near my knees (crossbody!). However, it's a nice stiff felt, lightweight, but more than big enough for a laptop, and the style details are extremely attractive. There are 3 interior pockets: one big zippered, one for smaller things and one for a phone. I do like it, though I really wanted a green bag.By the way, this company pays buyers for 5-star reviews. Obviously I didn't go for it.

I really like this leash.  It's only 3/8" wide, so it's definitely for a smaller dog, but the leather is nicely thick and well finished. It's also a lovely chestnut color. I wouldn't hesitate to buy another one, especially at this very reasonable price.

My dog  has multiple food allergies, including chicken & turkey, which makes finding food she can tolerate difficult. Beyond that, she doesn't like eating the same food week in and week out, so feeding her can be constant battle.  She likes this food very much and seems to be tolerating it quite well. The Dog Food advisor website does not consider it a quality food, since potato is the main ingredient (whereas dogs need meat as the primary ingredient for optimum  health), but I'm amping it up with some canned meat. I wouldn't like to give it to my dog as her sole food source, but in a rotation with higher-quality foods I think it's ok.

The fabric is mid-weight and supple, but I'm not loving the surface. It's shiny leather-like fabric (not as shiny as patent leather, but rather like a plastic shower curtain) with an intense petroleum odor. I'm disappointed after all the great reviews.

You could certainly chop garlic on this board, but an onion would probably be too big. But I bought it more for serving than for utility. It's only big enough for one chunk of cheese or one lemon sliced, which is exactly what I was looking for. It has a very attractive organic (i.e. irregular) shape, good thickness, and light weight. Excellent value & service from the seller.

I hate, hate, hate those white-wire shelves that you find in every discount store in the country. Although they perform a useful function, they're flimsy and ugly. Having recently spent big bucks to redo my kitchen, I didn't want to put them in my cabinets. But I needed to stack small items more efficiently, so an hour browsing on Amazon brought me to this. No reviews, so I had to take a chance, and this time the chance paid off. It's a great little shelf that suits my kitchen well, and while it's not the cheapest one you can get, its attractiveness is matched by its sturdiness, which is worth more money in my opinion. It's also not the most expensive you can buy - maybe those shelves are good values, but they were too costly for me. This shelf strikes an excellent balance between cheap (in every sense of the word) and extravagant. I'll definitely buy more.

This shelf is not much different in function from the kind of wire shelves you might find in a big box store, but it's very different in appearance and strength. Well made and elegant, it doesn't look at all industrial and turns a necessary function (expanding cupboard space) into a decorative appearance. It's not the cheapest shelf I could find, but it's definitely the most attractive.

OXO does a good job of making utilitarian items function better and this hook is no exception. It's made of strong, but not stiff plastic, so it doesn't scratch your door. Its hanging system is deep enough to fit over the top of even quite thick doors, while a "thumb" projects out to hold it securely in place on thinner doors. There are two hooks, covered in plastic "bulbs," which catch any fabric item you want to hang nicely, although they're too thick for items with narrow hanging holes. All in all it's a nicely functional hook. It's not intended to be a decorative item, but I find the appearance pretty clunky - I would only use it inside a door.

This is a very simple, structured bag. It's very stiff but seems nicely constructed. I didn't want real leather, but the material has a nice hand that could pass for leather. The magnetic closure is on the brown flap (under the rivet) - it adheres to the bag flap, but it's not a strong hold. The strap is nicely adjustable, so if you like a long crossbody you can arrange that, while a short one is also manageable. There are no pockets anywhere, and the body is surprisingly deep. When combined with the stiffness of the construction, it means you have to do some digging to get things out.I got the orange, which is a lovely dark spice color. Very classic looking bag, which isn't easy to find.

I need a conditioner to do 1 thing:  detangle my superfine hair without leaving so much residue that my hair comes out limp.  While this conditioner detangles nicely, my hair is definitely limp and lifeless after using it along with the matching shampoo.  It doesn't feel as if there's residue, but the lack of volume (something the ads claim it provides) makes it not worth using.  Someone with less determinedly flat hair might have better results with this conditioner, but I've had better hair with Dove's regular volumizing shampoo-conditioner combo.

In many ways I like this shampoo: it has a light scent; it doesn't foam excessively; it rinses nicely.  But it adds no volume to my baby-fine hair and my hair seems to get dirty faster after using it.  So it's a no-go for my situation.

I'm surprised that even reviewers who gave this book 2 or 3 stars said it was well written; in what universe are jumping from viewpoint to viewpoint to viewpoint to viewpoint (including even the perspectives of bystanders to the action), unexplained alternate universes, and characters whose motivations and relationships are undeveloped the elements of good writing?  There's tons of action - the book is really a wild ride - but the reader has little idea what the logic behind it is.  At the same time the plot moves excruciatingly slowly, so unless you like action for its own sake, it's really easy to get bored.  I was determined to plow through the book in hopes of getting past the initial bumps of learning the author's world, but it never improved - a painful slog the whole way.

This star doesn't need assembling & is painted on both sides, so it shouldn't rust outside.  It comes with a couple of rings inserted in the top point so you can hang it & appears very sturdy.  I live in a quite windy spot & will be hanging it outside - if it doesn't hold up I'll change my rating, but on first impression, I'm pleased.  It was also very well packed and arrive with nary a scratch.

Preen has been around so long, that I don't think it needs a recommendation - if you want to stop weeds from germinating, it works quite well (although in my experience it stops some desirable plants as well).  What's new here is the battery-operated applicator, which scatters a light coating of Preen pellets.  It works pretty well - no big clumps of pellets anywhere - though it was a little balky at times, which suggests to me that it way not last through the whole giant container of pellets.

This is an excellent product.  It has sufficient weight and density to hold a rug in place and give it some extra cushion.  It will require some effort if you need to cut it, but it can be done, and it makes a real difference in the "foot-feel" of rugs.  Highly recommended.

This is basically porn, with a very secondary murder-mystery thrown in as "plot."  The main character is a nearly 600-year-old female vampire who runs a brothel for other vampires.  There's tons of sex, but not much else seems to interest the author.  While the writing is grammatical, it's also unsophisticated - as soon as characters "sashay" and "saunter," and "I think the fun part will be trying [the equipment in a sex-gym] out" is described as a "quip" you know you're in a land where characters and narrative don't really matter.

Last time I needed bath linens I caved to social pressure and went to restoration hardware.  While their linens are luxuriously soft and generously sized, the towels take FOREVER to dry, and stitches on the rugs started pulling in a big way from the moment I put them down.  This time, I thought I'd try Amazon, and I'm very pleased with these linens.  I don't exactly understand this, but the Pinzon 820 gram towel is not as heavy as restoration hardware's 802 gram towel, so the drying time is not so extreme, while the towel is still soft and absorbent. The rugs (Luxury Reversible Cotton Bath Rug - sorry the new review form won't let me link to it) are also very nice underfoot - no pulls yet!I wasn't sure what color marine is - on my computer the color in the photo is quite accurate. It's a darker color (not as deep as navy or as saturated as royal blue), a little on the green side of blue, but nowhere near teal.  Very nice.

This is a substantial kitchen tool - it weighs approximately 12 oz and the blade is 3.5" in diameter. It should cut through any substantial dough, though I like my pizza crusts thin, so I haven't tried it on a deep dish.  It's also elegantly designed.  It's noticeably heavy, but its curved handle fits comfortably in the hand, and there's an indentation on top for your thumb, so you can press down nicely as you cut.  It makes other pizza wheels look like toys.

The world building in Anne Bishop's recent series - this is book 2 with Written In Red: A Novel of the Others the 1st book - is terrific, and unlike anything else I've read.  The characters are excellent, the action is intense in places,  and the writing is masterful.  You MUST read the first book to understand what's going on here, but that's no burden; Written in Red is even better than Murder of Crows. What is lacking here is a high degree of reader engagement.  I don't know if it's because Bishop covers the perspective of so many characters; if the distinction between good and bad characters is no longer ambiguous; or if the power of the paranormals is so clear that real danger to them seems unlikely, but I didn't find myself emotionally invested in the way I did with the first book.  If I hadn't read the first book, I would probably give this 5 stars - it's just that I know Bishop can give us more!  However, this is still highly recommended.

I have several of these and I love them. Sold in many places by many different manufacturers and I have bought them from several online retailers. Now Amazon carries them with the batteries and charger for a great low price. This is a heck of a deal for less than $20. The Brightness might be exaggerated at 1000 Lumens but its still an excellent flashlight.

I have bought so many of these for myself, friends, and family and every year they get even more affordable. You can not beat this deal of 2 batteries, a charger, and a XML-T6 light for under 20 bucks. I have one of these in every one of my tool boxes and so many of my friends have complimented me on how well it works that I have given several as gifts to my co-workers and friends over the last year. Very bright, and tough light and although I do not know if it claims to be waterproof, mine have seen their fair share of the elements and still work perfectly .

This is a great Flashlight. I have many XML-T6 flashlights and I love them all, but finally one that will take a 26650 battery....oh yeah, a bright light that lasts a long time! that's what I'm talkin about!Pros:+ with a 26650 battery you get a lot of up time in between recharges+comes equipped adapters to support various battery options 26650, 18650, AAA+Very lightweight despite its sizeCons:-The Lumen count on this light is grossly over estimated. I have several smaller XML-T6 flashlights that run on 18650 Batteries. Even though you can put a larger battery in this flashlight the output of the larger battery is the same as the smaller battery it just lasts longer so you are not going to double the brightness just because of the battery. Same LED engine plus Same voltage equals the same brightness as the other smaller lights. Other XML-T6 lights advertise anywhere from 800-1000 lumens and I have compared mine to commercial lights in the states that sell as 500 lumens and the XML-T6 are right about the same brightness. So there is no way this thing puts out 2000 lumens and for that I have to take away a star. if this light was advertised more honestly I would give it a 5 star rating.- Its smaller counterparts all have the ability to focus the lens this larger model does not, what a bummer.I think most folks will be more than happy with thier purchase considering the cost versus performance...Its a bang for the buck, but wish they used a more accurate description of the performance. Having several of these type of lights I knew what to expect as far as the brightness is concerned, but other buyers may not so heed my warning, if you are looking for a 2000 Lumen light this is not it.

First of all, unless you carry a big bag all the time, I would not consider this an EDC item. Although it will fit in most pockets, it wont be comfortable there and its also a bit heavy. In my opinion it is a great collection of tools for the glove box for taking care of unexpected repairs. It has a knife which is great for many tasks. Scissors which are also suited to many tasks and these are larger than the standard Swiss army knife scissors and easier to use. It has a saw blade which is good for cutting through hose material or plastic bumper material that is dragging on the ground or in the wheel well after a fender bender. It has both a Philips and flat tip screw driver, an adjustable wrench, flash light and allen wrenches all of which are handy in day to day uses and road side emergencies. This is perfect to keep in a glove box or next to your spare tire kit.The only reason this does not get a full 5 stars in my opinion is that the allen wrenches are metric. This is fine for me because I drive an import, but it would be nice to have the option to buy the same tool with SAE sized wrenches in case you drive American, however I guess even Amercian cars these days are using metric hardware so maybe its not that big a deal unless you are using this for something other than roadside use.It also has a Ferro Rod for sparking up tinder, Not really useful to me in the manner I use this tool, but some might appreciate that it's there so its worth mentioning. it strikes fairly well with the serrated side of the knife.

Another compelling chapter in the case of the West Memphis 3. If you are not familiar with this case or the HBO Paradise Lost trilogy you really must watch this to see how local politics and corrupt public service workers can put 3 innocent teens on death row while the real killer goes free. If you are interested in this case I would recommend the Paradise Lost series first since it is currently available free with Amazon prime. However if you do not have prime and don't want to rent the previous movies, this movie does work well on its own. It summarizes most of what happens in the first the documentaries and then gives some additional information not in the first 3 films . After watching the first Paradise lost film I was compelled to watch the remaining film, then this film, and also purchases some of the books By Damien Echols, the oldest of the 3 teens sentenced to death row who had used his 18 years on death row to become a very proficient writer.  The story of how these Kids were wronged by the justice system yet never gave up to despair and managed to walk away with most of their humanity intact while seeing the murder who put them in their situation walk free from persecution is both inspiring and gut wrenching at the same time.

Will light while wet and stay lit even if submerged in water. Comes in a easy to store plastic can. Only have 2 complaints. (1) the striker is flimsily attached to the outside of the case so it peels off too easily. Personally I prefer peeling off the striker and putting it inside the plastic case to prevent it from getting wet. Or if you carry a EDC tin, just super glue it to the inside of the lid of your tin to keep it safe. (2) Other competitor products are capable of being struck with out a striker so these are kind of lower grade than some others out there. However, even though similar products are better quality these are way cheaper.  There are many ways for matches to fail and lighting a fire with a match is often a war of attrition. Keeping that in mind you may want to ask yourself...Do I feel more comfortable buying a large amount decent quality matches or a small amount of excellent quality matches. Personally I find these to be of acceptable quality and think 10 packs for the price of one pack of the leading brand is a fair trade off.

These lighters are very handy. They can be used as both a standard lighter or a torch lighter although I mainly use it as a torch for both work and crafts. There is a bit of a quirk with the operation of it. In my experience if you want to use it in standard lighter mode you have to first light it in torch mode then switch. Switching back while ignited tends to blow the flame out completely. Not a big deal for me since I rarely use the standard lighter feature anyway but it is worth mentioning for others who are interested in this mode. The main reason I give this torch 5 stars is the igniter. I have several other torches I've used before from nameless cheapo brands to more expensive Benz-o-matics. None I have used that are both this small and have a built in igniter that actually works consistently. Most either need to be sparked using a lighter or match, or have an igniter so terrible you end up clicking 10 to 15 times before you actually get a flame. That translates into a lot of wasted fuel. This one is very efficient, strikes a flame virtually every click and costs less for 2 than it does for 1 of the other brands.

I like having a pair of scissors handy and the tiny scissors that come on most multi tools are difficult to use for someone with large hands like I have. This makes a great keychain and ensures I always have scissors handy. I also like that it has a bottle opener and a knife, but also having a serrated knife is overkill for me and would prefer to see something different, the Philips screwdriver is also kind of worthless and it is not really made to work with any philips screw I have ever seen. All that aside I still give this tool 5 stars because the 3 tools I do use work well and worth the $10 price tag on their own. The only alternative to this I have been able to find is the Leatherman Micra and it costs nearly 3 times as much. Not many other options out there that offer scissors instead of pliers so this is definitely worth the price in my opinion.

I got 2 of these, one for myself and one for a co-worker. As a technician we are often building cable connectors and wiring electronic devices. Many times we are asked to go out in the field to troubleshoot, find a damaged cable or wire and think "I wish I had my wire strippers with me!" . This tool has been a life saver time and time again and I have only owned it a short time. It comes with several tools, but I mainly find 3 of them irreplaceable. (1) the wire stripper for stripping wire (2) the Knife for cutting off the insulation jacket from cables (3) the Scissors for trimming the braided shield present on many types of cable. If I have to re-terminate a cable re-using the original connector, 9 times out of 10 I can make it happen using just this tool and a little ingenuity. I also think the way Leatherman designed the spring system in the wire strippers is top notch. where most Strippers have a coil spring that would not work on a tool that folds up like the leatherman. The way they tackled this problem was a very clever design and one that will likely outlast a normal coil spring. It is a little pricey considering the small size of the tool, but since there are no others on the market like it that I have found it has been worth the price for already. The strippers handle wire sizes from 14 to 22 AWG which is about 75%of the cables I work with.

GOt it just in the nick of time, bought son a new mattress...this came in two days later and he wet the bed the next day. saved us from pulling our hair out. we bought 2. reasonably priced and super easy to clean compared to others we have used in the past.

A perfect purchase. It's easy to use. It does a very nice job of honing and maintaining a blade edge. all the pieces store neatly inside so its easy to stow or carry with you. It does everything it advertises and is less than $20. Other Lansky products also work great but tend to be pricey. This one works great and is super affordable.

Love this knife. Haven't left the house without it since it arrived on the front porch. It deploys fast and retracts just as fast. There is no safety on it but the switch takes quite a few pounds of force to deploy so it is very safe for pocket carry. If anything (even something as weak as a piece of paper or thin fabric) interrupts the deployment it knocks the blade off the track to prevent injury. The blade can then easily be pulled out manually and locked into position. I only have one other OTF knife and it is a single action only by another well known american manufacturer known for good quality knives. With all the safety mechanisms in the more expensive American made knife it still managed to deploy and cut me. The injury was minor but avoidable. This knife in my opinion is much safer and is a double action not just a single action like the more popular american made ones.I don't know what kind of steel is used in the blade but the blade on this knife is awesome. Most OTF knives have slimmer lightweight blades. This one is hefty size and the profile on the edge is very nice. The blade comes super sharp and I use mine a lot with no wear to the edge yet. There is a little play on the lock up but it is very slight and this is something that is fairly common with any automatic OTF knife. this one locks up pretty good considering its cheap price. I have seen OTF knives that cost 3 times as much as this one that have more slop in the blade than this one.  If you are looking for a double action OTF knife just to add to your collection you cant beat this one for the price. It will even serve you well as an EDC knife as long as you realize its limitations. It cant do real heavy tasks because of the play in the blade and the possibility of breaking the action under too much force. However for opening letters, cutting rope, slicing through card board boxes. you should have no problem....Handle with care ...this thing comes surprisingly sharp.

The performance of this sharpener varies wildly depending on the profile of your knife. I have seen reviews saying that it works on any knife, but I have not found that to be true at all. It is also possible that mine is defective. The angle of the coarse steels seems to be more aggressive on the right side of the blade then the left. if I line the knife up dead center (aligned with the "aiming" notch) it forms a massive burr on the left side of the blade which is too aggressive for the fine steels to get rid of so I have to fix the edge using one of my other sharpeners.when I use this on my outdoor knives which have a more shallow profile in general, I find the performance of the edgemaker to be hit or miss. sometimes great but usually awful. On kitchen knives It is a little more consistent, but still not as great as I had expected based on reviews I read. I know I am using it correctly having seen several youtube videos of people pitching this product, I read the instructions more than once, and I have seen the instructional videos on the manufacturers website. Its not rocket science and the device is pretty simple to use. So the only determination I can  make is that this product is not as good as people say it is or the one I purchased has misaligned steels. The latter is quite possible Since two of the steels are touching and the other two are not. This hardly seems like the precision I'd been hearing about from this company. On the knives it works on it REALLY works well but on 80% of my knives (and I have a bunch) this tool does more damage than good.

Got this at the right time since the price went up since my purchase but even at the current price it is definitely worth it. It is not very expensive and it is not full tang like some of the competitor models however, the tang does extended about 1/3 of the handle legth and the nylon handle is very sturdy so I am not concerned at all about the tomahawk breaking. The lack of a full tang also keeps the wieght managable on this tool so I think over all it is well balanced and I am not concerned about  durability...I put it through some Hell the first time I used it and took everything I threw at it. After a weekend of heavy chopping and splitting, I took it home rinsed it in the sink and dried it off thoroughly to find 2 small scuffs on the nylon (barely noticeable) and no wear whatsoever on the edge or the black finish. This thing is though for a bargain priced tomahawk. I was told that United cutlery is a less than  desirable brand but if their other products hold up as well as this one then they are definitely worth the price you pay for them.The only disappointment was the paracord wrap. It is a very simple bush league wrap job on the handle, but I figured that would be the case from the picture. After about 20 minutes of use all the paracord came loose and began slididng off the handle. Then I cut a peice with my knife and found that (of course) they did not use legit 550 cord. No biggie, I had plenty on hand and I re wrapped it with the real stuff in jiffy and was back to chopping in no time. This doesn't really make a big difference in the performance of the Tomahawk, however, I know how some folks get about their cordage so I mention it just because if you are buying this with the idea that the paracord wrap is a bonus then you are better off getting one of their other models that are not wrapped. You might save a few bucks and you will be much happier if you wrap it yourself the right way with the right stuff. besides, it takes less than $5 of cord to wrap this handle so the wrapped version is not that much of a better deal, the only reason I got that version is that it was on sale. United Cutlery has about a Dozen other versions of this M48 Hawk.

These are convenient little scissors for small jobs or a quick snip of a loose thread or something like that. I find that the scissors on my multi tool or Swiss army knives are easier to control and cut way better. The Spring pin that releases the scissors from my keys had a little corrosion on it which is kind of a let down. So many people talk about the high quality of True Utility products I was surprised to see the corrosion. I was able to break through it with some metal polish so it isn't the end of the world just a bit disappointing, especially since this product came packed in a cool water tight box. The Spring in the scissors is a bit too strong so it makes cutting a challenge particularly if you are going for a straight line. I imagine they put a real tense spring because this tool is stored with the spring in its compressed state and they want it to last a while. It might break in with enough use, but these are so hard to cut with efficiently that you probably wont use them enough to break them in. If you already carry a multi tool with a scissor function then skip these completely. If you don't carry a knife or multi tool everyday and like the idea of having a scissor handy then I guess this is better than not having any scissors at all.

Not much to say, but that is a good thing.  Works exactly like advertised. Easy to install, no air bubbles or dust specks gives a nice smooth finish on the screen that feels like the actual phone glass and not like the plastic type protectors. Does not scratch as easy as plastic either. Lowest prices temepered glass I could find but performs as well as others I have purchased for much more.

Complete bologna. There is no way this light is anywhere near 300 Lumens. I have 2 Tank007 E09 flashlights one purchased here on Amazon and another from a differerent vendor. Those lights are rated at 120 lumens and they blow this Welltop light away. The Tank007s also use a single AAA battery, is waterproof, and it is actually about 1/2 the size of this Welltop. I like the Tank007 lights a lot and was hoping that this Welltop would be a more affordable substitute for the Tank007, after all...its not too far fetched to get a good bright light from a light that is bigger than the one I already have right?Well if I knew how week this light would be I would have just bought another Tank007 it may be $13 compared to this one at $7 but it's a tougher, brighter, better constructed version that will out perform and out last this one. Definitely worth the extra $6.

Another beautiful Knife by Kershaw. I have never been disappointed with any of my Kershaw knives and this one is no exception. It is well constructed. the finish has a satin like smooth feeling in the hand and is very attractive. The Speed safe deployment is as good as my other Kershaws which is to say it is better than most. The jimping on the back is comfortable an not too aggressive. the clip can be adjusted in 4 positions and is a deep pocket clip. The blade locks firmly in place using a frame lock system which has an over travel protection built in. This is a great "not too large" sized knife that I will mainly use as an EDC knife while wearing business causal clothing when carrying a larger knife is not possible. It would probably meet most peoples EDC needs, but it is so nice it makes me want to pamper it. However it is a Kershaw so I am sure it can handle the punishment if necessary. I have purchased many Kershaws over the years and find them to be top notch knives that are extremely well built and more affordable than most of the knifes of similar value on the market. You're not gonna find a much finer folding knife for $25.

This is a very high quality sturdy knife for the price. The knife is easily worth more than its $26 price tag in my opinion. I saw another review that stated this is not a survival knife or good for bushcraft. Depending on what specific task you need it for,that may be a fair overall assesment, but for what I use it for, this knife is perfect. I am a contractor that does a lot of work aboard Naval ships. The coating on the blade helps with preventing rust. The grips are impervious to moisture and allow for a good grip wet or dry. The recurved blade makes it better suited than a straight knife for cutting through nylon webbing, nylon or fibrous rope, and box material such as cardboard or tri-wall. It cuts well on cable insulation and rubber too. a lot of folks don't like recurved blades because there is no belly for more common cutting tasks. What I like about this knife is that even though it calls itself a tanto, the point of the knife is not straight, it is slightly curved which emulates the belly of a more common drop point blade. So you get the benefit of the hard working recurved blade without loosing the functionality of a smaller outwardly curved blade. I also like that it is a stout full tang knife that is well balanced blade to handle. It feels comfortable in my hands even though its size is a bit in the middle. You can either consider it a small big knife or a large small knife if that makes any sense. It is smaller than a survival knife but probably too big for a neck knife for most people, which is probably why the Nylon sheath is comes with is only set up for a belt wear option. In my line of work I can find a million uses for this knife and it is made extremely well for such an affordable knife.

this is my first time buying a Byrd Knife but I like my spydercos and I wanted one for work but didnt want to spend $70+ for a knife I would be taking to work with me everyday. I rather spend that money on a good knife to use away from work when I am having fun LOL.I heard that Byrd is the budget version of Spyderco so I tried it out. I love this knife every bit as much as My spydercos. This knife is a great deal for the price. The blade might not be as polished as a spyderco but I for one dont really care about that. This is a razor sharp knife made of good steel with a comfortable handle for a great price. I will definitely consider a Byrd again the next time I am shopping for a good working knife.

I like just about everything about this wallet. I bought it to fit a passport sized notepad in along with my credit cards and cash. It does the trick I even found room inside to fit a small pen to used with the pad. My only complaint with this wallet is that it is very soft leather. the wallet feels padded with pillow like lining material and the leather is way to supple. I prefer a hard more durable leather on my wallets. So far I have not had any issues though. Not sure if the soft leather will make it less durable but it feels weird to have such a soft cushioned wallet.

The best part about this knife is the price. there isn't a lot of great craftsmanship that went into putting this knife together The overall assmbly is a bit sloppy and mine even had some surface rust in the grooves at the top of the blade on both sides. The sheath is also just barely functional. I can remove my knife from the sheath even without unsnapping the retention button. Finally the blade was not honed very well either.This knife isn't completely hopeless though. If you don't mind putting a new edge on the blade, modify the sheath or possibly make a new one, and are not too hung up on cosmetics, this knife can be a good bargain work horse for you. Once I re-honed it and removed the rust spots, this knife works great and because it was so inexpensive, i don't feel bad about abusing the heck out of it. It holds an edge well under abuse and it can't get any uglier than it was than I received it so its become by go to knife for dirty jobs. It could benefit from a slightly larger handle but if you have smaller hands then it might be comfortable for you. I prefer a larger grip, particularly from my fixed blade knives and this one is a tiny bit too small for my liking.

I have carried this knife every day since I bought it. The carabiner built into the blade makes it easy to snap this knife to my belt loop, back pack, neck lanyard, and just about a thousand other convenient places, The Blade arrived Razor sharp like all of my Sanrenmu knives I have ordered (I am really beginning to become a fan-boy of their products). The pattern etched in the blade is really cool looking and it is a sturdy little knife for its size. the butt of the handle can be used as a small wrench in theory, however, I think the way the sales stick out, actually using it for that purpose would be impracticle. I instead used this feature as a lanyard hole to tie a paracord lanyard through.The lanyard helps make up for the short handle and allows me to get a better grip when cutting. This is a very Attractive, affordable, and useful little knife to ad to your EDC for those small tasks that don't require a full sized knife.

as with other products by majestic it is important to keep in mind that their sizes reflect the build of athletes...an I am no athlete! My 2XL is about the size of a  mens Large if you were shopping for an average T-shirt. I kind of had a feeling that would be the case having purchased many Majestic Products in the past. Unfortunately 2XL was the largest size they had and I took a chance on it.  I should have passed. If they have your size and you buy the next size up you should be happy with this shirt.

Really cool piece of kit for the low price. This is a small handy knife for under 10 bucks It can be easily be worn around the neck with a ball chain or piece of paracord and it would weigh about as much a a medium sized pendant. It might make a good key chain except there is no way to lock the blade from opening, so if you carry your keys in a pocket it could be dangerous.  Mine arrived super sharp out of the box. The finish is hard to decipher in the images but the scales are a satin brushed finish which contrasts against the blade which is a bit shinier. Not polished but shinier.It has a real eligant look to it when closed. When opened, I can only get a 3 finger grip on the scales, however the way the heel of the blade is notched for your index finger and the scales have a conformable curve, the knife is real stable in my hand even if my pinky is not griping the handle.I admit that this knife is something of a novelty, but for the cheap price and the attractive design it is worth buying. I am sure most people will find plenty of everyday uses for this unique knife regardless of how gimmicky it is.

This is a sturdy and well built knife with a razor sharp cutting edge. The handle is heavy and thick with Jimpng on the spine for a comfortable grip even in big hands. The blade is heave and fat which provides a good balance with the weighty handle. the blade is a strange combination between a re-curved blade and a hawkbill. I've never had anything shaped quite like this but it is very usable in a lot of situations. Even though the blade is shorter than 3 inches to accommodate a multitude of carry laws...it seams that you get more than 3 inches of cutting edge because of the unique curvature of the blade, although its difficult to measure the shape so I can't know for sure. I just know this short stout blade is just as effective for cutting as any of my 4 to 5 inch blades. There is a have metal portion on the butt of the handle which can be useful for impact needs. The pocket clip can be placed in 4 locations not only making it top or bottom but also righty and lefty adjustable. It has a lanyard hole just big enough for a paracord lanyard if you choose to make one and the stiffness in the slip joint is powerful so even though there is no blade lock, this knife will never close on you by mistake. It requires two hands to open and close it.There are a lot of reviews on this knife talking about how it doesn't have a lock or does not compare well to models put out by other manufacturers. Technically this is true, there are better everyday knives out there, but here is where they don't match up. this knife complies with knife carrying laws of many different countries and states. in my line of work I have to do a lot of domestic and overseas travel and having a good knife is definitely a benefit to my job. This knife meets the criteria for all the locations I normally travel too where many of my other knives do not. The other benefit is even if you do not travel, you will be hard pressed to find a sturdy and hansom knife of this quality for the ridiculously low price point of the Lansky World Legal. I have never in my life bought a knife this well made for under $20. When I saw the price of this knife I was expecting junk, especially since Lansky is not really known for making knives, they make sharpeners! If Lansky continues to put out quality knives at this price point I may never buy another brand again. Best $16 bucks I ever paid for a knife.

I bought this knife because It looks like a tiny little Spyderco knife with a bottle opener, and lets face it...with backyard grilling season right around the corner, who couldn't use another bottle opener, Right? Well turns out this is a pretty cool little knife. It is super small and the handle is really well designed. Even though I can only get about 2 fingers around the handle with my large hands, the curve in the handle locks it tight in my hand for a surprisingly good grip...even with the smooth texture on the scales. The lanyard hole is big enough for me to put a ball chain through and I wear it around my neck although I could see lots of folks using it as a keychain instead.There is no locking mechanism on this Knife. Its a basic slipjoint style knife. It hold open very stiff though so I wouldn't worry about it closing during use and even though there is a Thumb hole reminiscent of a Syderco blade I would say the slipjoint is too stiff to comfortably open one handed. It can be done, but not worth the hassle.This knife has many every day uses like opening mail or packages for example. Since it usually requires two hands to open, for me it is like having one of those Old Timer Knives that I can wear around my neck and have the added benefit of a bottle opener.

I was looking for a Karambit, but wasn't sure if I would like this style of knife so I didn't want to spend a lot of money on something I would never use. Never having bought a TacForce brand product before I took a chance and Purchased 2 different models from another vendor. I have to say, that for a $10 price tag both of the knives I bought are of surprisingly good quality, nice weight, sturdy build, and the blades are nicely sharpened right out of the box. I think they are both worth the tiny price.The only bad thing about this model (TF-620) is that it is a smaller knife in general. It has a smaller blade than the other model I purchased (the other one is a TF-543 if anyone is interested) and the handle is also smaller which makes it a bad fit for my larger hands. The Karambit is designed as a fighting knife that is held with the index finger in the hole and the blade sticking out of the bottom of the fist curling towards the intended target. I cannot hold it in this way because my hand is too wide to fit the grip. It does however fit in my hand the reverse way with my pinky in the hole and the blade coming out of the top of my fist. Although this is not really the way its supposed to be carried, I have found this method to be useful for things other than fighting. It gives you a solid grip of the knife. Curved blades are also very good at cutting through fabric, carpet, heavy rope, and nylon banding. So if you need a knife for jobs like installing carpet, working in a warehouse or the shipping and receiving department where you need to cut rope, open boxes and cutting banding material this little knife is very practical for non-combat uses and it is a surprisingly stout and tough lil folding knife for the tiny price. If you need something for self defense or martial arts training, get the larger model TF-543. it doesn't come in desert Camo but they do have a winter camo version for the same price as this knife.

This is a Cheap way to restore a drawer full of knives in an afternoon. I have a set of Wusthof Knives that I got as a gift from my mother in law and they must have cost her a fortune. It came with a Fillet Knife, Boning Knife, and 11" chef Knife and they worked amazing for over 15 years now. I took great care of them and now after all those years of use they were ready to be resharpened back to their former glory. All the culinary cutlery places around here wanted a lot of money to sharpen each knife then I saw a commercial for the Work Sharp and thought...that machine costs about the same as getting each knife sharpened by a professional once.Based on the good reviews I took a risk and tried this with my much coveted Wustofs. Just using a medium belt and follwoing up with the fine my knives were as good as they were out of the box, maybe even better if memory serves me right. Soon I was rounding up every knife and scissor in the house and putting bright new polished edges on them that cut like a razor. It works fast with little friction so the knives never get too hot, so you don't have to worry about them losing their temper. It also puts a convex edge on the blade which means the edge holds longer and as long as you keep your knives Steeled and stropped regularly, the edge will last a long long long time. When you feel your blade getting dull. give it a good stropping and it probably will surprise you how sharp it is. One use of this sharpener on a knife will give you years of good cutting on that blade before you have to resharpen it completely again assuming you are properly caring for your blades. It isnt something you'll have to use often if you do it right the first time or you will be taking too much metal off of your blades, however, it is still handy to keep around to resharpen other items around the house that do take a lot of punishment such as Hatchets and Mower blades.The unit has 2 guides that will handle most of your knife needs. kitchen knives, field knives, hunting knives, and scissors.  If you remove the guides the belt train can be rotated and locked in a horizontal configuration that can be used in a free hand operation to sharpen Hatchets, Axes, Sickles and lawnmower blades etc. It also has a 3 position switch witch works as a "push and hold to power", off, and "press once to power" so it you want to lock it in the on position while grinding larger objects like a lawnmower blade you can without having to hold the button down the whole time. They thought of everything on this one. There are sooooo many sharpening devices for a wide rang of prices and I own many of them, but this one is actually as easy to operate as it claims and works as good as it claims too.It also claims to do serrated edges and Gut hooks too. I cant tell you about the serrated blades because I don't own any. Never liked them so I haven't tried. Maybe I will do one for a friend and see. For gut hooks ...your mileage may vary. To do the gut hooks and serrated blades you need to use the fine grit belt which will bend. When I try this the abrasive scrapes off the belt easily. it is done with the guide off so good technique may help, apparently I'm not real good at it.

I purchased a Colt G10 Marlin Spike from Ebay not too long ago for about 11 bucks. Its a nice knife and that design has been around for a while and lots of people use it. Its popular, its cheap, it works, and When I was in the Navy it seemed like everyone was walking around with one. When I bought mine recently I was replacing the old one I had from back in my navy days and I was surprised to see that it only cost $11 which is about what I paid for one 20 years ago.  Well I soon saw why, they were made a lot cheaper now with rough edges and stiff hinges. I had to run mine under a buffing wheel because the rough edges were catching on my clothes and pockets. Maybe my old one was just as bad and I don't remember but either way is was low quality, but what do you expect for $12.A month later I found this Maxam for $4 less than the Colt  it has more features, is well put together, and in my opinion better overall quality by comparison.The Spike on this one is a little smaller than the Colt but that is better for me since I normally work with small rope and cord and don't need something too large. Its a good size for most jobs on your average sailboat. I wish I had found this one earlier I would have saved 4 bucks and been a lot happier.

Bought one for myself last year in green. When the mercury dropped last week my wife discovered how warm this jacket is and I haven't been able to wear it since. Every time I went to grab it it was missing from my closet. I finally broke down and got her one of her own. It arrived in less than a week from Brooklyn NY which was way ahead of schedule according to the tracking information provided. She absolutely loves hers as much as I love mine. Snug fit, super warm, wind resistant, easy to clean, and looks like an open can of whoop ass when your wearing it.

I was going to make my own Jig for making bracelets but then saw how cheap this one was with prime shipping and figured, what's the point. For the price of materials, my time in building it, and the effort to buy all the parts of a DIY rig, I could have this one delivered to my door in 2 days for about the same cost and much less effort.For a beginner Jig you cant go wrong with this. It is easy to use, can be adapted to any buckles you may use, and is fairly tough for its size. My only major problem with it is that It doesn't fit well on my work bench and I haven't figured out a way to clamp it down sturdy in a way that is comfortable to use. I suppose most people would find it comfortable to use on their lap clamped between their legs but that doesn't work for me because It forces me to hold my head down constantly.If you can figure out a comfortable way to set it up in your home or workshop then its hard to argue with the value of this item, particularly when available for Prime shipping.

Bracelets are cool, kids love em and work pretty well for the most part. I had 2 out of the dozen that didn't work at all. I opened them up with a small screw driver and cleaned off the switch contacts with some alcohol and put them back together and they all work great now. I would rate these higher is the quality control were better but at the price listed these are a great deal and lots of fun.

Good for measuring ring size, but not the best for sizing. The mandrel is made of soft metal, presumably aluminum. If you are sizing rings made of harder metals then it will get marred and worn after repeated use. It worked okay for gold and silver rings at first. I used it to make rings out of old coins made from harder alloys and it wore even more. If you are looking for a mandrel for working your rings I would suggest one made from stainless steel which are not that much more expensive. Even using this with softer metals it will eventually wear down and then you may not be able to trust the sizes printed on it. If you need a kit simply for measuring rings and fingers then this will be more than adequate for that purpose.

Best holiday movie ever made and probably one of the best films I have ever seen. Every single scene is magical and hilarious. Funny, heartwarming, and appeals to just about any audience. I can't make it through the winter without watching this at least 5 times and is one of the most quotable movies ever. The child actors are amazing, the story is charming, and the narration is hysterically funny. Even my 8 year old loves it and he hates everything!

This is a great deal for the price. The batteries work about as well as the original OEM battery in my phone despite the fact that they actually have a lower mAh rating than the original. I prefer walking around with an extra fully charged battery instead of a charger. It takes up less room in my pocket and is instantly ready with 100% charge. way more convenient that looking for places to plug in, carrying around a battery bank, or being tethered to your computer all day. I work in the field most of the time and aside from my car there is nowhere I can stop and charge. Now I just slip a couple extra batteries in my pocket before I leave the house and I never worry about my battery consumption. I have also had an android phone that lost its ability to charge via the USB port. If you are concerned about wear and tear on your charge port, this is one way to avoid damage to the phone.

I bought an Onite 2350mAh battery to replace my original LG battery when it was no longer able to reach 100% charge. The Onite battery lasted much longer than the original battery and I have been happy with it. several months after I bought it the charging port on my phone stopped working and I found this external charger that came with 2 Onite batteries. This purchase was a no brainer, an external charger that comes with 2 batteries I already know to be great. I saw some bad comments about the pins on the charger being broken or getting damaged. I had not had that problem but I do admit I been extra careful with handling the charger after having read that. I have since bout another charger of the same manufacturer for my Galaxy SIII phone. I like the ability to have fully charged extra batteries with me instead of walking around with a charger.

I was a teenager when Genesis was at the height of its popularity and I remember spending a lot of my best years playing (or perhaps wasting my life) playing Genesis. I saw that this company made 2 different units...A console version which allows you to play your old cartridges and the portable version shown here. I opted for the portable version so that my son could use it to keep entertained on long car trips. Also I didn't want to go up into the attic and find my box of Genesis Cartridges that I am convinced is still up there!This unit is surprisingly small, surprisingly light weight (weighing less than a Nintendo gameboy or DS). The battery is small but lasts surprisingly long. Comes with 80 preloaded games. Many of the games stink (E-S.W.A.T., Altered Beast, and other crappy 1st generation Genesis games). It does also include some of the better games though. Almost all of the Sonic series, The entire Echo the Dolphin set (I actually enjoy that series), and Virtua Fighter along with other fun games. Its nostalgic and fun to play with. You can even output it the video to a TV if you have a TV with a Composite input. It's not my sons favorite game system, but when we are stuck in the car a few hours, he surely enjoys it then so between the two of us using it...We got our money's worth.The only problem with the system in my opinion is the SD card feature. It is intended that you can go on the website and download more game ROMS to expand your library of games by playing them off the SD Card. The problem is that the manufacturer must be a company in its infant stages still, so their website doesn't really have any game titles to download yet. In fact the only game ROMs I saw there were for the games already preloaded on the machine. Maybe in the future there will be more support and options for this feature, but I would say to anyone who plans to buy this then download a bunch of their favorite games....buyer beware...you may want to visit the manufacturers website to see if any new games are available before you buy.

Surprisingly good quality construction for the price. Its golden plated plastic panels riveted to a Fuax leather belt.It is assembled in similar fashion to a real championship belt just with lighter and cheaper materials suitable for children. Fastens shut by velcro which is kind of crappy but my Little John Cena Clone usually presents it proudly over his shoulder before he goes into battle. For less than 20 bucks everyone should have one of these for their World champion.

These are a good deal for the price if you already own a charger. It ships from Overseas and it took several weeks to arrive, so if you are looking for an immediate resolution to your controller battery problems this might not be for you. If you are willing to wait 3 or more weeks to get a good price then  I believe you will be satisfied. I have 4800 mAh battery packs and these have pretty good operation time in comparison. Either my other packs are over estimating their capacity or these are just very good. Either way, both versions of the battery packs last much longer than standard AA batteries.

This "massager"  if really awesome for the price. It is similar to other popular wands sold here, but it is water proof and cordless. You would think it have a significant drop in power compared to the corded models, but it is surprisingly hearty for such a small battery powered device. Its great in the bedroom and great in the shower or bath. It has slow and fast settings and several different pulsating settings. Lots of fun and works with standard wand attachments which are sold separately.

Practical little device. If you want a simple machine to do routine online tasks with, this little box is perfect. It might not have the power to play advanced video games, render and edit video projects, or photoshop, but it does all the routine stuff easily, efficiently,and most of all cheaply.If you have a Google account just register your account on this device and you will have access to email, google app store, google documents, GMail. I was looking for a cheap second computer in the house for doing the everyday stuff like paying bills, google searches, email etc. For the price of about $200 this is a pretty decent little web machine. Here are some of the things I really like about it-It boots up way faster than a normal computer.-Its small and can be mounted directly to the tv or monitor so it has no footprint.-it has a small drive but virtually all of your actions on the machine are backed up to your google account so you don't need to physically store much data on your local machine.-it runs apps similar to a smartphone instead of large programs so it is frugal on memory. It runs fast and never locks up.-Its portable. just bring the contents of this box and an HDMI cable in your luggage and you can turn any HDTV with an HDMI port into a mobile computer.We bought this primarily to be used by my son for school work. He is ready to start using a computer on his own but still too young to justify buying an expensive and overly complicated computer. I can see this platform being practical for most families or even older users that want to use simple web based media like Facebook but are not comfortable using a Microsoft or Apple platform computer. This does most things you need to handle online, it is cheap, has an easy to learn operating system, and can be configured to work with any TV or monitor in about 10 minutes.

Bought for my wife, she says it worked, but she wasn't really thrilled with the results. It is a little harder to use than regular shampoo and does not lather up as easily. The wife says she would be ok with a product that is a little harder to use of it performed better than her regular shampoo but this bar was no better or worse than regular shampoo in her opinion.

Seems like everyone these days are wearing this style hat. If you are willing to wait for the somewhat long shipping time this is a heck of a deal. I see these hats all the time at stores like Walmart and Target for about the same price or perhaps a bit more expensive. This one is affordable with free shipping. It fits ok, maybe just a hair small but adjustable. Organic cotton means its easy to wash when dirty.

Great for use as an inner lining for a warmer set of gloves. they work ok as stand alone gloves, but only for milder cold. I find that they really excel being worn under a heavier pair of gloves as a warm waterproof liner that keeps your hands warm even if your outer gloves are wet. They are real tight when putting them on but they stretch a lot once you get them on they are very form fitting and comfortable. similar to putting on a latex glove....you have to tug and stretch to get them on but once you get them on, they feel like a comfortable second skin. I have good dexterity in these gloves and on cold days I can take off my outer gloves and leave these on and comfortably drive my car, operate my radio, or write with a pen and paper.

Over all this Balaclava will keep your head and face warm for the most part so it isn't completely useless. However, this thing has too many problems to give a good review. some of the problems are.- Strong Chemical odor that requires a couple washes before it is completely gone.-Although you may somehow figure out a way to make it a "6 in 1" good luck making it look like any of the pictures in the description. any attempt to make this thing look like a hat of any kind looks completely ridiculous.- It is too small to be comfortable. It is too small on the crown of the head and it is also to short at the neck. I bought this to wear with a North Face Jacket that does not have its own hood. Since my jacket has a raised collar you should be able to tuck this hood into the jacket collar to have an over lapping seam with no exposed skin. Unfortunately the neck of the hood is way shorter than the images depict so only comes down to just below my scalp and leaves most of my neck exposed. Or I can pull it down to the base of my neck and that will make it so that my entire forehead is exposed. Its an un-winnable .game of tug of war.

I was expecting this face mask to be more suitable for cold and windy days. I like the idea that it seals off the bottom of the hard hat to prevent cold gusts of air from blowing under your hard hat and chilling your head. At first glance it looks like a great Idea. Unfortunately The knit of the fabric is not very good at blocking wind and is not particularly warm either.When I read the description of the product again after using it on a cold windy day I saw that I misread it. It states that it protects ears and head from wind and cool conditions. Does not say cold and windy conditions. That begs the question, Why would I need to wear a ski mask on a day with "cool" conditions? So since it does not specifically claim to be for Winter weather, I would argue what is the point of covering that much of your face on just a cool day and if you are not using this to fight off the cold then there really isn't a point in having it. There are similar Balaclavas and face masks available on Amazon made from polyester of  fleece which are much warmer. If you need something for cold weather look for something else.

I have used a lot of different screen protecting films in the past and was skeptical that this one would be worth almost $7. The only reason I decided to try it is because of the good reviews it got.First of all if you never put one of these or a similar product on your phone before, let me do you a small favor and explain how it works. (A) clean your device with the alcohol wipe included (B) wipe with lint free cloth provided (C) Use blue sticky tape provided to remove any fine dust (D) peel backing off screen protector being careful not to touch the adhesive side (E) place on phone and squeeze out bubbles.Now, I know this is a review and not a tutorial, but if you buy this product and don't know how to use it...you will go insane because the instructions included are completely beyond comprehension and amounts to a bowl of tossed word salad (photo of instructions attached to this review).  I ignored the instructions and used experience and common sense to figure it out and my application came out flawless.The glass is very resistant to scratches. I have a tough job where my phone gets bumped, scraped, and scuffed every day. This glass protector is much more resilient than the plastic or vinyl sheets I've used before. The others are way cheaper, but when you look at how many you use in a year compared to how long this one lasts, this is actually a superior and more affordable product.Another thing worth mentioning to anyone who has used the plastic covers, the adhesive used on this glass protector is very easy to work with. as long as the surface is clean...line up the glass and press in the center and the adhesive clings to every inch of the phone leaving no bubbles behind at all.  Nothing is more frustrating then taking the time to clean every spec of dust off of your phone or tablet, then you carefully lay the screen protector on and you get a few rogue bubbles that refuse to come out! drives me nuts!....no such problems with this product. I love it.

Wife loves it! I got this for her because she was eyeballing my Apex Bionic Jacket that I recently bought and she wanted something like it. The colors offered in the Women's Bionic didn't thrill her so we went this this Osito instead. At first I was disappointed to see that there was no kind of lining or insulation on the inside of the jacket like on other North Face Products. My wife says she actually prefer that is doesn't because the jacket feels as good on the inside as it does on the outside. It is like wearing a warm furry blanket around everywhere you go. I think she feels super cuddly when she is wearing it and find it hard not to snuggle up while she is wearing it. It is very warm and super soft. Like wearing a muppet!

Its a very soft pillow, but not much else to say. I followed the instructions as to how much water to add for reaching the desired results (soft, medium, firm support) but even with the highests amount of water or lowest amount of water I felt little difference. In fact , you rally cant even tell there's water in it at all. the only thing the water seems to do is weigh the pillow down at the bottom so it doesn't go flying off the bed every time you turn which would be very easy to do since the stuffing in the pillow is extremely light and fluffy. Without the water in it the pillow has almost no weight to it at all. If you like a big airy fluffy pillow that doesn't collapse or lose its shape after a few days you will really like this pillow. It is a quality pillow for a soft pillow. I prefer a firmer pillow so it is not right for me. Bottom line is that is makes a great soft pillow but the water aspect of the pillow has little or no therapeutic benefits in my opinion.

These acrylic spice jars look very nice when filled with spices and set on my counter top. The wide clear jars make it easy to see all my spices with or without the labels. Each jar comes with the option of a coarse or fine sifter on the top. This set up looks cool and is thrifty on space.Although I like this product overall, there is definitely room for some improvements.1. The jars do not have any kind of gasket or seal in the caps. Its just hard plastic on Hard plastic. It is too early to tell how this will effect the overall freshness of my spices. Fortunately I go through my spices very often so They don't often get a chance to go stale. If you tend to not use spices as often and have them sit for long periods of time, you may not want to go with this set.2. The Carousel is not built well and is not stable. I ordered two of these sets at the same time. One of the carousels was broken right out of the box. The main spinning point was just a screw that was screwed into a thin brittle acrylic spindle. If it had not arrived broken, I suspect it would end up broken eventually anyway. Also, The carousel that did work was awful. It looked great but if you spin it with the jars on it, it would wobble and tumble the jars over easily.When I bought this item I did not really want the carousel in the first place, I just wanted the Jars. The jars are available individually on Amazon but they cost almost $2 each. Since I wanted 24 Jars, buying 2 carousel sets with free prime shipping and throwing out the carousels was much cheaper than buying 24 individual jars and I received them faster. So for me it worked out to be a pretty good deal. If you are buying this set because you really want to use the carousel that comes with it, I would advice against it. If you still insist, at least consider keeping the heavier jars towards the bottom, that will make the carousel at least a little bit more stable.

I purchased this because I was looking for a clay mask to dry out my oily pores. I had used other clay mask type products before and they all have been pretty effective even the cheap ones. The problem is that they must not be very popular anymore because none of my local drug stores carry them anymore. I stumbled on Aztec Secrets here on Amazon and with all the great reviews I figured it was worth a try.The first thing I noticed is that it is very affordable and it is not pre-mixed. Since you mix up each batch before you use it the 2lbs in the container will last you a long long time. They instructions suggest mixing with apple cider vinegar so even if you include the cost of the vinegar to the total price, this stuff is way cheaper than any other similar product I have ever used.The mud doesn't really have an odor to it so it pretty much smells like vinegar when you use it. That might not be a problem for you but I hate it. Some reviewers recommended using this product with Bragg's Unfiltered Cider vinegar. I did not notice that the results are any better with the Bragg's But the smell was way smellier when using it.  You can also mix it with plain water too, but as other reviewers mentioned It does make it harder to mix and I feel that you get a more homogeneous mixture with vinegar.After washing off, it does leave my skin looking a bit red which other products I've used in the past will not do, but the redness goes away fast leaving my skin very smooth and oil free.I think this product is about equal to other products I have used in the past and is nothing special in comparison, However, if you are ok with the vinegar smell and mixing up your own batches of mud, then this is a very effective product that will save you a ton of cash in the long run. I suspect this 2lb container will last me a long long time.

I purchased a sample pack of blades about a year ago and among the razors in the batch were Astra and these Astra Superior Premium Platinum. Both were good but the Superior Premium Platinum performed much better with less drag on my face. It is difficult to give a review on something like razor blades because everyone has different skin and beard characteristics and opinions and brand loyalties are subjective. In other words...what works well for me might not work well for everyone. What I can say is that I have a very coarse beard, and very sensitive skin and these blades give me a very close shave with no discomfort or irritation. I have used the blades both in a safety razor and in a shavette style razor and they always deliver a smooth shave. They glide well against the skin without any tugging or pulling at the hair.

I have been looking for a good sandalwood cologne that is affordable and actually smells like sandalwood. There are a lot of good sandalwood colognes out there that cost an arm and a leg. There are also many affordable ones out there, but most of them do not smell anything like sandalwood. Caswell-Massey was recommended to me on a Shaving forum and when I saw it available on Amazon for Under $25 I quickly added it to my shopping cart.So far I have worn it twice. Once out with the family and once to work. It has a pleasant scent of a Sandalwood and soap. A very masculine woodsy, but clean scent. The scent is very persistent. I find that I can use a small amount and it is not overpowering and it lasts all day long. Even when I wore it to work it lasted all day which is amazing since it was a hot summer day doing physical work and sweating a lot. I was very sweaty by the end of the shift and yet the entire drive home I could still smell the clean soapy smell of the Cologne.If you are a fan of Sandalwood like I am you will surely like this cologne. You would be hard pressed to find a better Sandalwood cologne for a better price. If you never smelled Sandalwood before and not sure if you would like it, you may want to sample this at a department store first because Sandalwood can be an acquired taste.

As far as grease keepers go, this one is pretty much perfect. Not that it takes much to make a good grease keeper,  its not rocket science or anything, but this one doesnt make any of the mistakes I've seen on other products for example.1. Making the holes in the strainer to large2. making it out of a heat conductive material like Stainless Steel3. making the opening too narrow to poor grease in directly from a pan.This one is made of ceramic so you can pour hot grease in and it will stay relatively cool to the touch. The opening is wide enough to pour right from my pan into the container. The removable strainer is a fine mesh and works well plus it can be removed and cleaned without having to dump your oil out.Not much I would change about this vessel except maybe adding a pour spout to make it easier to pour the grease back out, but honestly its not that difficult without the spout.

Very clean and efficient way to oil your shredder. This product was recommended to me by Amazon when I purchased a Shredder from them. I wasn't sure what to expect from the image and description...I assusmed it was just sheets of heavey paper stock saturated in oil.
