I figured that would be convenient because anyone who has ever oiled a shredder the old fashioned way knows it can be messy and annoying. I finally put enough paper through my shredder to actually use one of these lubricant sheets and I really like the way it works!First of all, calling them lubricant sheets is misleading. They are not sheets with lubricant on them. They are more like very thin pouches or envelopes with lubricant inside. This means your hands and skin never come in contact with the lubricant. So you can use these in the office with your nice work clothes on and not worry about staining your clothes with oil or getting it on your hands. You simple shred the envelope then run the shredder in reverse for 10 seconds to spread the oil evenly on the blades and you're done. No mess no hassle and best of all no squirt or drip bottles to mess with. Why did it take so long to come up with such a simple solution???

The description states this fragrance was Introduced in 1976. Fragrance notes: orange, lemon, bergamot, oakmoss, sandalwood and patchouli. I bought this aftershave because I was looking for an affordable Sandalwood-ish fragrance. I like the clean smell of citrus, I also enjoy the woodsy smells of oakmoss and sandalwood, but when I wear this fragrance the odor I can smell is overwhelmingly Patchouli. If you are nostalgic for the 70s you may like it but I think it smells a bit dated...If a scent can be considered dated?? reminds me of the perfumes my mom and aunts used to wear in the 70s when I was a small fry. I also think the Patchouli makes it smell too feminine. Definitely not for me.

I have to start by saying that I originally ordered Omega Brush model 10098 which was sold by Warehouse Deals 4 Less. It was a more expensive brush, but they sent me this brush instead. I contacted Amazon and explained the problem. They offered me an exchange to the correct brush or to refund me the difference in price. I took the refund since I was in dire need of a new brush and wanted to get this one broken in right away. So Kudos to Amazon for stepping to the plate with excellent customer service.As for the brush at first glance I think most guys who have been wet shaving a while and never saw an Omega brush up close and personal will probably be amazed by the size of this thing. Its enormous! I think the size of these brushes is why so many people are fans of them. I have used boar hair brushes before but they were always too coarse. The problem is my beard is very rough and to get my whiskers lifted while lathering, soft badger bristles just don't get the job done. In addition, because I have to press so firmly with a badger brush, I tend to flatten out the bristles and wear out a brush after less than a year of service. I needed something more rough and tumble...I needed a boar hair brush that wasn't a piece of junk.This Omega is exactly what I was looking for. The Bristles have some backbone to them so I can scrub as hard as I need without worrying about damaging the bristles. The bristles are not rough and scratchy like other Boar brushes I've used in the past. The enormous loft on the bristles makes the application of lather smooth and soft. I didn't think Boar hair could feel so nice! It also has a big beefy handle that is easy to grab. The tall bristles whip up lather better than any other brush I've used before and another benefit of long bristles is that my knuckles don't hit the top of my scuttle when I am creating my lather which is something that always annoys me with smaller brushes.Now for the bad part. When you first get this brush the bristles are a bit coarse and it stinks to holy hell when you get it wet. Some people say natural bristles smell like wet dog, but I found this brush to stink of burning hair...simply awful! The good news is that the smell goes away with some breaking in. I received this on the weekend so I spent Saturday and Sunday shampooing, drying, and repeating with a strong scented body wash/shampoo conditioner. I also soaked it for a few hours in some oxy-clean. By Monday morning most of the smell was gone  and the bristles were nice and soft yet springy. About 3 shaves later you could no longer smell the nastiness. Breaking it in takes a little work, but your patience will be rewarded with some great shaves. You can either break it in with use, or by cleaning it before use, I found hundreds of forum posts on the subject and it seems that everyone has their favorite method. there's a wealth of knowledge available online  on the subject if you don't want stinky boar smell on your face. This brush is sturdy as heck so I anticipate owning and using it for a long time to come.

Broke about 6 months after purchase. The part that holds the brush in place broke revealing brass plated plastic. The Brush was also terrible. It could not handle the heat of being soaked in hot water and the Knot fell out. Almost entirely made of plastic.

I first saw one of these years ago in one of those junk mail catalogs that wind up in your mailbox all the time. At the time I saw it it cost $300. I thought, this would be a great item for parties and I swore if they ever came down in price I was going to own one. Well this one dropped to $100 and I pulled the trigger and bought one and I am glad I did.Every summer I Brew insane amounts of iced tea and I also work outdoors in the heat and need ice to fill my water cooler for work so I am constantly running out of ice.  The Ice Maker in the fridge just can't keep up with the demand. The freezer takes 2 hours, this thing takes less than 10 minutes!When I come home from work I fill it up and it runs all night until I go to bed. Each day it produces enough ice for me to keep my summer beverages cool and at the same time make an extra bucket of ice that I use in my water cooler.Here are the only cons I have for this item.1. before you use it you may want to give it a thorough cleaning with mild detergent.. I gave mine a quick rinse instead of a thorough wash and my first batch of Ice left a plasti-like taste in my beverage when melted. Cleaning it properly before the next use fixed that.2. It judges the state of the ice by a timer not a thermostat. So 7 minutes for small ice 13 minutes for large (approximately). It takes a while for the chillers to get nice and cold so the first 2 batches or so it makes are pretty lousy little ice balls, but once she gets running up to speed, you'll easily get a pound of ice every hour. So if you are hosting a cocktail hour at your house, you might want to plug this guy in about an hour before your guests arrive. :o)

These have a nice fine point. They take a while to dry, so we just set my daughter's pictures on the counter over night. They dry to beautiful colors. The glitter is a little thick and wet, so it's best on a piece of cardstock. Typing paper works as well, but curls a little bit. I wish the pens had a little more in them, they ran out pretty quickly.They are washable, as they say, but it requires a bit of scrubbing if dry, so I wouldn't just go giving these to a toddler, but for my 2nd grader, they're awesome!
Works great, and hey any toy that results in less kid mess on my floor is great in my book! Easily used by both 8 year olds and 3 year olds. Bright colored and fun!

The top left door is nearly impossible to open. I'm debating on whether to send it back for replacement. The hinges seem a little loose and like they could get more wobbly.Other than that, it is a quality, big and HEAVY toy... but both my 3 and 6 year old sons have had a lot of fun playing with it. They look mechanical type things. Very substantial. Good for their brains :-)
Really neat set of play-doh tools, just as pictured. The quality is really nice.

Beautiful on the outside, but the liner is really flimsy! It was easy to hang up, took about half the time of a traditional curtain to hang up and I'm glad I don't have rings flying all over the house.

VERY happy with this purchase. My 7 year old wanted a guitar in the WORST way for Christmas. This is PERFECT for her without being a huge financial risk. The sound is really good, especially given the price. I think I paid like $36. I was able to pick out a few tunes despite never having held a guitar before.The size is good for a tall 7 year old, I would say up to maybe a 10 year old could/should play this size before going to the next larger option.

A bit of a pain to put together, but using my husband's profanity as a gauge might not be the most accurate :-) The springs were really tight to stretch into the holes, but I don't really consider that a design flaw. My 60 pound kids don't come anywhere near hitting the floor when they are bouncing full force.The size is nice, a good sized bouncing area without being huge.I will say, if the kids are bouncing full force and putting their weight on the bar, the opposite side leaves the ground. I have yet to see this be very dangerous, but the entire thing is very lightweight and easy to move around. I don't see the kids using the handle bar as much as I thought they would anyway. Maybe we'll just take it off.

Zips into a nice neat bin, lays flat for a play mat. Works well because even the seams that might not lay completely flat can be weighted down by Legos since they're dense.Holds about a grocery sack worth of Legos.Zips easily! Good quality!

My kids got this set for Christmas. As someone else said, Legos go for about 10-cents each, so this could be a $160 set. Usually selling for about half that, its a great deal here on Amazon as well.It's a great variety of pieces. It's not a bunch of 1 by 1 pieces or anything like that. There aren't wheels, doors or specialty pieces, just great basic bricks. There are a few round pieces and eyes. The box is about 2 feet tall (impressive size) and the baggies inside fill up the tower, so it's impressive to open as well. The box is sturdy and will last a while as a storage option. The lid is plastic.If you're looking for a wow present or looking to add a bunch of basic bricks to an existing or to start a collection, this is your set!
Nice quality tools, not too difficult to clean. Neat things to do. Nice amount of play-doh. My 3 year old just loves it!

An awesome book for learning letters. The story line flows so nicely, the kids start to remember it. They love the tactile part on each page, ie fuzzy bear nose. They love to hear this book over and over, which is excellent letter exposure. Just bought a copy for my niece. My kids have had it for about 5 years and we still read it daily.

These aren't fancy, but not embarrassingly cheap. They're the right value for the cost. I use a lot of slotted spoons because I have little kids. If I make a chunky soup or cooked vegetables, I use this as I don't want to give toddlers too much liquid. This one is my new go-to because the slots are decent sized, making quick work out of the liquid. While the slots are decent sized, corn doesn't fall through, for size reference. I haven't had any problems with that.
A good value, great taste, works great on a dry throat... or just when I want a great piece of cherry candy!

Please, please, please, save yourself a world of problems and skip not only this model, but the entire brand. After 4 hours of light use, all of the paddles and scrappers need to be replaced. It's "normal wear" so it's, of course not cover by warrant and of course the cost would be $100 IF the parts were available. The retailer referred us to warranty repair shops who said they're no longer willing to even touch this brand. The repair shops referred us to the company, who referred us (if you can get through to them) back to the retailer who refers you to more bogus repair shops. Ridiculous. I have NEVER had this bad of an experience with a company. The cost of this piece of junk is basically stolen from us, we're stuck with it. If you want further evidence, go to their social media sites. They don't allow customers to post on their pages (red flag), but when they make a post, all the comments are complaints that look exactly like mine. Save yourself a lot of money and trouble with this scam of a company, skip it all together!!!
Runs true to size, adorable colors. Has a nice glitter/sparkle without being too flashy.

Really nice, thick socks. The "lines" (seams) aren't much of an issue. They're still sort of present, but I don't get the tantrums about them anymore. They do run slightly big, so if you're unsure, order down.
This will fit for a long time because the pants are stretchy and the top could be a dress, tunic or a shirt. My 9 month old niece is wearing the 2T and I bet it will fit for 2 years. Nice quality!

My 5 year old was struggling to hold his pencil correctly, he just didn't seem to get it. His teacher tried broken crayons (you have to hold them correctly because they're small), different grippers, thick pencils, etc. When I found these, I figured they were worth a shot, despite seeming expensive. They work awesome! I sent them to school with him and the teacher emailed me the same day asking where to get more, she's been a kindergarten teacher for 30 years and wanted more for her other students that are having difficulty. I do wish they were about half the cost, as they seem pricey for a piece of rubber, but it's worth it if it helps the kids!

These are fantastic. I have very large hands (I'm 6'1"), but I don't like wearing things styled for men if I can help it. These are nice and stretchy and warm. I love that I can use my phone without taking them off. I have large palms relative to my fingers, and they still work without the fingers being too long. they fit great!
Doesn't hold air well. Constantly flat and needing more air. I suppose I should have expected as much from an inexpensive ball.

This is a really nice cage. The plastic is high quality, the wire is a little bendable, but if it gets a little bent, it's easy to bend right back. Other reviewers say it is small, and it is, depending on what critter you're putting in there. However, the size is clearly stated in the description, so that's not something to hold against the product.I had it out of the box and set up in about 2 minutes. Super easy to put together.It's deep enough that even if the door gets left open, my guinea pigs don't get out. They poke their head out (which is hilarious!), but stay put.As for size, the large guinea pig igloo that measures about 10 inches across, takes up about half of this cage. Between that and one of the standard, corner guinea pig littler pans take up pretty much all of this cage. This would be best filled with bedding and used in a more traditional way than a guinea pig cage with litter pan, etc.Update!: We had a bigger cage, the one with the canvas bottom. It was nice, except the piggies chewed through the canvas. I repaired it with tape, but I was also SO SICK of cleaning that cage out. Washing the fleece, cleaning up places where they missed their litter pan, it would smell after just a few days, and trying to keep the cage clean looking, not to mention the giant size it took up. I was so sick of it that I thought about getting rid of the pigs all together, which is sad because I love our pigs!In a last ditch effort, I filled this cage with a mix of wood shavings and paper bedding... it was TEN DAYS before it started to show any sign of being dirty and it still DIDNT SMELL! I took out the litter pan because it was taking up so much space. Since I'm not worried about keeping their fleece clean (which isn't good for the feet anyway) I happily give them BIG piles of hay, which they LOVE! They're so much happier with the pile than trying to pull it out of some fancy feeder.I put a paper bag in the bottom so the bedding comes clean off. Spray it down with Windex, and just wipe it out. Refill it and our pigs are SO HAPPY! They love being cozied in there with all their fluffy bedding. Without the litter pan, there's room to run around.So glad my guinea pigs get to stay!!

These are a great way to make a quick pizza at home with your favorite toppings. In the package, they resemble a white tortilla, but they don't taste like it. They're a nice, light flavor. Each has 120 calories, 22 grams of carbs and 2 grams of fiber. The allergens are wheat and soy. They aren't low-carb or whole grain, but they're very large for the calories. They're probably 5 by 10 inches. You could easily make yourself a 5 by 10 inch pizza for 250 calories. It's a satisfying meal, far superior to frozen pizza and you control the toppings! Will buy again!

Now that my older 2 are in school, I actually brave the grocery store with my toddler along. His favorite part is getting a car cart, so this was the PERFECT birthday gift for him. He loves it. Assembly is always a bit of a chore, but it seemed to go fairly painlessly and I didn't hear much swearing out of my husband, so that's a pretty good indicator.I've seen various age recommendations flying around. It's a little bit short for my 7 year old, but she still likes to play with it. So, I would say any child that is under 48 inches and can walk would probably like playing with this and it would work for them. My 2, 5 and 7 year olds all love it. It's so cute, I might like to play with it too!

I bought these cans locally because they were smaller than the regular ones. I keep 3 cans for my 3 kids in my bag. When we go out to eat, it gets enough silent time for food to arrive and doesn't make a mess.This is not really much "softer" than regular play-doh, It sticks and crumbles into everything. It's just okay, and if a conscientious older child or adult were playing with it there wouldn't be as much of a problem. When my 2 and 5 year old boys play with it, good night nurse. It's EVERYWHERE.

Super comfortable straight out of the box. Fits exactly as it should. Nice, cushioned, thick soles with plenty of spring to them. The white/mint color combo is beautiful too, the picture doesn't do it justice. LOVE!

I got the medium size of this, which is a practical size for gift giving. It probably has about 2/3rds the capacity of a traditional loaf pan. It's great! I made 4 batches of banana bread batter and it filled 6 of these and 1 traditional loaf pan.6 of the size mediums fit perfectly on an 11x17 sheet for baking.There seems to be a lot of talk about the holes in the bottom. I decided to line the bottom with a small piece of parchment to prevent leaking. It worked great. I think if I wouldn't have done that, maybe some of the oil would have leaked, but they are very small holes, like a sharp pencil tip.NEXT TIME: Next time I use these I will use even more parchment that comes up and out the sides. This is basically cardboard, so it will absorb fats and be darker brown (think wet paper bag), but only on the inside. The area under the parchment didn't do that.I will post a customer picture of what a finished loaf of banana bread looks like in one of these pans.

These are very nice quality. I sell little items locally and at craft fairs. I've had many compliments on these bags. They would make great party favor bags for a birthday party. They hold maybe slightly more than a sandwich size zip top bag, but fold over and staple nicely for smaller quantities.

Full disclosure, I got this on a Gold Box deal. It was about $12. For $12 this set is a steal.My initial reaction was that the flippers in this set looked cheap. I figured it was fine because I needed new spatulas and got a great deal on this set. Then I used them... they work REALLY well. I really like the smaller one for lifting cookies from the pan.The spatulas are quite large. The head on the largest one is bigger than a credit card. It works great for scraping out a Kitchenaid stand mixer bowl.The smallest of the three you see pictured is a standard spatula size.All are made out of a nice, textured plastic. They go through the dishwasher well.Good value, would purchase again, even at a higher price.

It will probably get your spots out (even older ones), but it requires a certain amount of scrubbing with a damp rag, after it sits for the instructed time, to accomplish that. It also has a very strong scent. I suppose Bissell made it that way to cover up odors of whatever nastiness you're cleaning out of the carpet, but seriously, just removing the spot would be enough, the smell will just about choke you. It does dissipate after a day or two, just don't use it to remove a spot from Fido's little present immediately before company comes!

For my purposes these are a 5 star item. They fit my 7 year old very well. They feel like really nice quality and are very stretchy, so they might fit an older child as well (I got the size 6-8), she could pull them up to her thighs if she wanted to.There are no grippers on the bottom as is listed, however. This is fine for our purposes because they're being worn with basketball shoes, so it's actually better without the grippers. If you're ordering for the purpose or intent of having the grippers, though, they won't be for you.

My mom had one of these when I was kid. I thought it was a no brainer. It's perfectly fine, and it holds butter, so it does it's job, but the lip is just a little too tall around the butter, so a knife doesn't just easily go right through the butter. It does hold it in nicely, though, if it gets too soft.

I love these little bags, they keep the gummy bears soft. They also provide good portion control as each bag is only like 35 calories and it's just enough when you "need" something sweet. Ordered a bunch to hand out for Halloween as a change of pace that I think the kids will love.I will say, be careful with the tub, the plastic around the lid can be sharp.
So happy to have these. They are allergy friendly (except to those with a wheat allergy). They're not as overly sweet as some similar cereal bars, which is great.

This is a thick, rich cream. I love it for both my hands and my face. I keep the little pots of it stashed all over because it really is my favorite lotion. I have no problems with break outs while using this either.

These cookies are a little pricey, so I hide them from my kids who don't have allergies. If you compare them to regular cookie full of luscious eggs and butter fresh out of the oven, you're probably going to be somewhat disappointed. However, my 3 year old has multiple food allergies and he LOVES that these are his special treat. I've tried them and the really aren't bad. I don't need to eat the whole box (okay, the brownie ones I probably could), but they're really good. I can and do make allergy free cookies for him, but I'm so thankful to have a treat that I know is safe for him ready to go right out of the box.If you're on the fence between these and the EL brand crispy ones, go with these instead, the crisp ones come all crushed into pieces. These just ship much better.

My boys LOVE Pete. My boys LOVE food. This book was a sure win for them. They just think it's hilarious how Pete gets carried away putting food on his sandwich. All the Pete the Cat books read so well out loud!
Very high quality set, perfect for a friend birthday gift. The fire truck goes together well and stays together nicely. Wonderful little details like fire hoses, helmets, etc.

These have been great treats and the storage container is a huge plus. It's sturdy and keeps the treats from drying out. The treats are nice and chewy and my dog goes nuts for them (he's kind of picky about his treats). It's probably close to a half gallon of treats.

It's a very inexpensive shelf, so temper your expectations on quality. It is nice and sturdy. I ordered 2 and then added a piece of wood on top to use as a desk in my daughter's room. With a counter height stool, it is perfect and she has an awesome desk for under $50. 2 of the shoe-box size plastic totes fit in each shelf, so it's great for organizing Legos.

My boys have so much fun with this book, they don't realize they're learning. It's more of magazine style inside instead of long blocks of writing that squirmy boys would rather not sit through. Beautiful pictures and fun facts. Caused us to go find some videos of the different lizards to see them live.

These have made a difference in my dog's loose stools.  Be patient.  It takes at least a week to get the bacteria "established."  I have recently added Culturelle.  That has helped a little, I think.  mbUPDATE:  My dog has had diarrhea for 4 months, and I am fed up with FlortiFlora (and Culturelle).  In all, there has been no noticeable improvement.  Waiting for the vet to say ok or no to something like Imodium!  My dog is 15 1/2 years old, and he should not have to feel like this!  mb
Love this case!  I put my mp3 player in the mesh "pocket" and my earbuds in the "main" case.  Easy to find "by feel" in purse, backpack, or briefcase.  And the price!  Such a deal!!  mb
Excellent quality; real brass (not brass-coated pot metal); sturdy; smooth finish.  Great price for 4 of them.You will not be disappointed.  mb

First off, it is NOT crystal. It's glass. If you're expecting a piece of Waterford, you will be speechless with disappointment! Sturdy (but remember it will break if dropped); attractive.The decanter is about as tall as a Campbell's soup can. The stopper is about three-quarters that. Decanter capacity is 1/2 cup.As to having to fill it too often: You do not need a mouthful of mouthwash to do the job! Even the Listerine bottle says to use 4 t. Let's call that 1 T (3 t), assuming the marketing folks at Listerine want you to use more than you really need. (Gosh! Would they do this?) Using 1 T, that makes 16 uses before a refill is needed. For one person, that's over a week with 2x daily use. Measure 1T of water in the cup to see how full to fill it with mouthwash. It's about half-way up.I am wondering whether the users who note their dissatisfaction about decanter capacity are filling the little cup to the brim or near it? If so, this easily accounts for the frequent-fill problem, even for a 2-person household.My dentist says I may add a little water to "soften" the taste (ask yours). I add a splash of water (Hey! 4 t!).Here's the one I bought; it's similar.http://www.amazon.com/CRYSTAL-CLEAR-306233-GB-Crystal-Mouthwash/dp/B0017W75YE/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1427843628&sr=8-1&keywords=mouthwash+bottle

I was skeptical, but they do work.I was also very glad to see that the elastic straps were *exactly* the same length.  Brava, ladies!  (I'm 5'1" and got the 3" size.)I was happy to read they are "made in the USA by women, for women."  Win-win-win!A couple of tips.Put them on your jeans before *you* put on the jeans!  A comical time was had by all when I tried to attach them while wearing the jeans!  One side was sproing-ing undone before I could get the other side clipped on!I put the clips aft of the side seams, just behind the seam allowances.  This gives me the most fabric "bite" and maximum security of the clips' staying clipped.Wear the strap just behind the arch of the foot (not on the ball of the foot or the arch of the foot).  It stays in place there pretty well.  See the pic.Wear with the round "shield" of the clip against your foot.  This was the primary concern I had while [skeptically] considering this purchase:  abrasion bcs I have a high ankle bone.  Lots of shoes rub me raw.  I think it's designed to be against the boot, but it's more important to me to protect my skin than the inside of my boot!Use a shoehorn.  "Boot" shoehorns (long) are available; try a shoe repair shop.A pair of thin socks also will help minimize/even prevent abrasion.  Socks also make your boots easier to get on.  By "thin," I mean about the thickness of men's nylon "dress socks."  Women's hose might work (knee or ankle type), but they are much thinner.  You'll have to experiment.  Maybe you won't want to wear any socks at all!It helps if you start with jeans that are not already knee-sprung from previous wearing (or age).  And are not boot-cut style.Do a trial run around the house before you set off to shop or travel or go to work!UPDATE:  Feb., 2015:  After wearing them about 4 times, the elastic is starting to stretch out.  Still work and are more comfortable.mb

I, too, love the quality.  Very substantial.  I actually bought them to "lengthen" a lamp cord that wouldn't reach to the plug (and for which a 6' extension cord would have been way overkill).  I daisy-chained 3 together.  mb

What put me over the top to choose this one was the video here that demonstrated how the thing fit together.  Folks, the woman must have had silicone salve on those halves to make them slip together so easily!  My assembly did NOT work that way!  (And I've assembled a bunch of dog crates in my life!)The latch(es) on the back do not lift very easily.  I was afraid I was going to break them off; the plastic is pretty flimsy.  When it became apparent that I couldn't assemble the crate without opening them, I used a screwdriver to give them a little nudge, and they popped open enough for me to get my fingertip under them.  After half-a-dozen (I lost count!) attempts to slide the top and bottom halves together (my allotment of colorful language was exhausted), I got a semblance of a crate.  It was still not totally correct, but I used the Marine Corps method.Now the screws and wing nuts....  Note that the holes are square; the screws are round.  Work from the underside and give the screw head a good whack with a stout hammer (Semper Fi!).  This will force the round screw into the square hole, and then it's easy to twist it thru by hand.  There no slot in the screw, so you can't use a screwdriver.  Wing nut (on top) went on with ease. Extra screw and wingnut included. Kudos there.There was a slight alignment problem, as noted.  I couldn't get the top and bottom of the crate married perfectly (should've had some of that silicone stuff, huh?), so the square holes did not line up 100%, which made screw insertion even more of a party.  If you have some washers, you could use two on each corner (one on the underside at screw head and one on the top side at the wingnut).  This allows you to take advantage of the two large -round- holes where the top and bottom of the crate were wire-tied together for shipping and thus leave your hammer and a bit of your vocabulary in your toolbox.Let us now talk about the door!  You have to turn the two handles (those are the black rectangles at nine and three o'clock on the picture) in opposite directions (toward each other) so that you can attach the door.  While holding the handles in the turned position, somehow insert the top 2 and bottom 2 ends of the latch rods simultaneously.  Doing the bottom, say, and then the top doesn't work because when you try to get the top ends of the rods in place, the bottom ends have wandered out.  Let me note that the silver lip thingie (six o'clock) must be snapped into place before you begin the challenge of the handles and rod; otherwise, no go.  Oh, yes: try not to pinch your fingers.Are we having fun yet?Note that there is no top opening; nor is there a handle.  The plastic is not very robust, either.  I would not purchase another of these.  (Try Pet Porter.)Fits my mini poodle well, however (20 lbs., 15" at shoulder). Ok for a standard poodle puppy.  A small Sheltie would fit, as would a beagle, very small Border Collie, or a couple of friendly cats.mb

This rug is not for high-traffic areas, such as a hallway or traffic path in a room.  It is a little too light-weight for that.  I have one on each side of my bed, and they're just fine there.  Under a table would be fine.  Under a sofa, too.  Very soft to the touch. Not "cushy," however bcs the rug is thin. The backing is very thin (less than you'd expect for a throw rug), however (thus the opinion about high-traffic areas).  I am careful when I vacuum, as "100% suction" is too rough for them.  Colors in the picture are true.There has been some discussion of what color the "red/burgundy/brown" is.  Hie thee to an embroidery store (or look for a color chart online).  DMC 3047 is background of light the border; "red/burgundy" is 814.For how and where I'm using them (low-traffic areas) and the price, these rugs are a very great value!  Think you will be pleased.mbPS.  As to the picture, these are the same brand, just in runners.  Really love these rugs!  (Note that they are in a hallway, and I saw they wouldn't work there.)

The friend to whom I sent this told me that this is great for studying for the TABE.  She is using it as an adjunct to the McGraw-Hill "Ed. Prep. for the GED Test" and says there are an abundance of practice examples and the text explanations are clear.I have not seen the book.  I had to have it shipped directly to her, as she is an inmate, but I trust her evaluation bcs her foundation in math was not strong.  mb
Excellent product.  True to original fragrance.  First smelled this at Colonial Williamsburg (VA), and every time I smell it (daily!), I'm taken back there.  mb

This is a big hit!  My grandson loves it.  Makes a "vroom-vroom" sound when it starts up (see the blue key at upper R).  Firetruck and police car sirens.  Beeps and other noises.  Smaller than I expected, however; less than 12" in diameter if memory serves (alas, he lives 7 hrs away so I can't check).  But he loves it.  Therefore it's a good buy!

This is wonderful dog food, but it is atrociously expensive.  Be prepared to pay!  (Sounds like a Wild West bank hold-up!  Yeah, maybe consider a hold-up so you can pay for it!!)I have tried other high-grade dog foods, but this one produces a predictable stool, which other foods do not.  I shall add no further details but leave this statement to your imagination.I had planned to get a different "flavor" each time I bought a bag, but my vet said not to, as switching might lead to stomach upset, which I certainly wanted to avoid!  She also said that dogs don't care about "variety"; that it was a human idea!I also note that now the two main ingredients (venison and potato or whatever) don't seem to be listed on the bag.  Good thing I remember the color!Also, the bag is exceedingly difficult to open and is not recyclable.Company, if you are reading this review, do you have a response about the bag and the problem of the bag's being non-recyclable?  What about the lack of ingredients list?mb, owner of 4 dogs on this dog foodUPDATE:  A tech at my vet's called me to say she wanted to figure out what PV and PR, etc. meant.  She took the effort to call me with her research.  PV = Potato & Venison; PR = rabbit; PR = duck; can't remember the 4th flavor.

Very cute. Read-ee must be old enough to understand about having the ability to prepare for bed and to get into the bed.  Very good for the pre-18-monther, however, just to hear the sound of words and the lilt of the poetry.  Pix are large enough to be seen pretty well via Skype.  Recommend.  mb

My dad loves this....he says.  I've not seen it in action with him, nor have I seen one in person.  I don't think my dad would "play nice-y" with me if he didn't tell me the truth. mb  (I'm just guessing at the # of stars he might give.)

This crate is what I expected.  Have a similar one already; well, ok; I have two...  Use it at home for naps and overnight. Certainly not substantial enough to ship a pet, but fine for travel in your car (or your personal airplane - ha ha!).  Lightweight.  Easy to put together - in theory, at least.  You need some hand strength to turn the wing nuts; if you have arthritis you might need to arrange for some young muscle for this part.  Dismantles easily, too.  mb

This is an ok pad.  Thin on the bottom; all the cushion is on the raised rim (why?).  I put an old bed pillow under it to improve comfort.  I recommend the first 2 times you wash it that you wash it alone, as it sheds like crazy.  Don't know if I'd buy again. mb

Voices are garbled when using the speaker phone feature.  When used without the speaker phone option, the clarity is not a lot better.  Spotty reception.  Big numbers and display a plus. This phone is a loser.  mb

Roll (don't throw) for maximum crazy bounces.  Ends of the "arms" are small enough for puppy mouths.  Dishwasher safe.  Pieces chewed off are blue & easy to spot.  Winner winner, kibble dinner!  Buying a 3rd one for new puppy! mb
I use these for my dogs.  Pink ones are a heck of a lot easier to locate in the shrubbery than blue ones! Lots and lots of bounce.  Perfect!  mb
I'm sure it's not as yummy, but my dogs eat it heartily.  This stuff isn't cheap, but the Royal Canin is very expensive; also high calorie.  Recommend.  mb

Ultra soft, great material and perfect size for small to mid size dog or even cat. Actually, my daughter wants one for herself because it's so soft! I can't think of a better recommendation than that!!!!

She arrived the day school ended for the year and once the batteries were popped in there was no stopping the fun. Six batteries is quite expensive but I think they will last awhile. (*With daily play, it eats those batteries right up, just so you know)  It's the neatest thing...this doll really floats!!! Her head is magnetic and whatever the batteries do makes her float. We don't get the science of it, but it is very cool. The Monster High franchise is always coming up with more dolls, New movies and fun gadgets. What I especially like is that the newer dolls actually have more modest clothing than the originals. Their clothes are still fashionable and fun but not quite so revealing, and I like that.This is well worth the money, easy to assemble and use and your girls will LOVE it!

This is a high end coffee maker for a very reasonable price.  It's programmable so it's ready for you when you get up in the morning.  The feature I like the most is the strength adjustment so you can make coffee stronger or weaker depending on your personal preference.  Another great feature is that the coffee is actually nice and hot when it comes out and not that lukewarm slop I have been drinking for the past 4 months.  I also noticed this coffee maker brews in half the time of my other and I always cleaned our coffee maker with vinegar so I can't say it's because the other was old or dirty.  This one is just faster and I like that especially when we have company and everyone can smell the coffee brewing and they are waiting and waiting.  With this machine I don't have to keep saying, "Five more minutes!"All in all, I really like this and am pleased with the results.  If you want a programmable coffee maker that not only looks good but makes a good cup of Java then this is the coffee maker for you.

This is an oversized, lush scented bar of soap that would make the perfect gift for your child's teacher, a co-workers birthday, or house warming. The scent can be smelled even before it is unwrapped so this is not for the scent sensitive. It is rich and lovely and the scent lasts long after bath time is over.

So far I have found multiple uses for these versatile chalkboard labels.  I have used them on mason jars to label my herbs in my cupboard.  They look adorable!  I also used them at a party last weekend to label the punch and drinks in larger mason jar containers.  Everyone said how great everything looked and most everyone commented on how cool the labels looked.The liquid chalk marker is easy to use.  You shake it, write with it and let the liquid dry for at least 3-5 minutes to be certain it's completely dry.  It looks just like regular chalk on a chalk board.  In this world of "smart boards" it's great to see chalkboards making a comeback, even if it's in such a small way.  I always loved chalkboards when I was little and this is a little bit of nostalgia for me.These labels stay in place and are so versatile.  If you are looking to decorate for a party, these labels can help add something special to the décor.*I was sent these labels and liquid chalk marker in exchange for an honest review.

I got wondering when I first received this emergency car starter if I would have the opportunity to actually use this "in the field" to give an accurate review.  I didn't have to wonder for long.The first time we used this was for charging my phone.  We lost electricity during a storm for 7 hours about a week ago.  I had plugged the unit in and fully charged it before putting it in my car so I knew it was ready to go.  I ran outside, grabbed it and got to charging my phone that was almost ready to die.  It charged in about the same time as my regular plug in charger, but as long as it was charging that was not a problem for me.  I am so glad I remembered I had it as we wouldn't have had a phone to use otherwise.  So, for phones, I can say it works great!Then two days later our car wouldn't start. I thought...can it be?  Yes, it was.  Someone had left the dome light on (again) and it had drained my battery overnight. I grabbed the unit, and my husband hooked it up in a matter of 2 minutes.  We were a bit skeptical, but it worked easily, the car started up and we were on our way.I am going to purchase one for my son's car as well.  It's the gift that says "I care about you...I want you to be safe."  You can't put a price tag on that.

These placemats are colorful, fun and very easy to clean.  They protect your table from sticky fingers and crusty oatmeal. I use two for the kids and one for the cat and one for the dog. (My floors need protection too!)  Everyone is happy.  What more can I say?  Happy is good.  My minions are happy so life is good.If your kids love Despicable Me, they will love these placemats.

This is a really nice leash.  One hand operation, sturdy construction and a great color!  Personally, I  hesitate to use this style leash on a larger dog who pulls...mostly because I'm used to the chain leashes and I know they are sturdy.  I honestly hesitated, even with a medium size dog, but we used this last night and I have to say that it worked out ok.  It is the perfect length and strength for a 40-50 pound dog in my opinion.  If your dog doesn't walk well on a leash, I would continue to use a chain leash.  The dog we had who passed away (I sure do miss that girl) could pull your arm out of its socket if she saw a squirrel....and she was around 85 pounds and I would never have used this leash for her, however that is not a reflection of this leash, just a reflection on her very bad walking manners.Rest easy and use this leash for your 40-50 pound dog with no worries.

This may or may not be a water saver as has been mentioned several times by other reviewers, however, what I can say for sure is that the air powered setting (although a bit louder than the regular) is amazing and feels fantastic on my old back.This shower head was easy to install with help from my handy man husband.  He said the instructions were easy to follow and that he felt it was a decent product. (He said he hoped it didn't feel TOO good, or he'd never be able to get me out of the bathroom!)  It did increase my water pressure, which I really like a lot.  It works really nice when you aim it on your lower back if you have troubles there.  It felt like a deep tissue massage!We can't all afford to go for a massage.  We can't all go to Physical Therapy or a chiropractor. This little gadget loosens things up and makes you feel like a new person!  I am very pleased with this shower head, both for style and function.

If you love The Game of Life AND can't get enough Despicable Me, then this is the game for you!  It's just as much fun as the original game, but with a minion twist.  The kids I played with were 9, 10 and 11 years old and it was a great time had by all.  It's not a difficult game, moves along quickly and the minions add lots of laughs.If you are looking for a different board game to break things up a bit, this just might be for you.  After the game, pop some pop corn and watch the movie!

The Grave Tender is by far the best book I've read in a while.  You come to know and feel the essence of the characters almost immediately.  You become embroiled in their lives, their sadness, their confusion and yes, even their insanity.  There is love, betrayal, hatred, fear, and tenderness here.  There is everything that makes us human within these pages.  There is grace and redemption.  There is friendship and loss.  It's so full of everything that makes up a life with a story that flows along effortlessly and is told with mastery.This is not an easy story to read, but read it you must.  Just when you want to turn your head away, you just can't.  You must see what happens.  You must feel along with these captivating and realistic characters.  The Grave Tender will pull you into a story that has twists and turns. unexpected joys and unthinkable tragedy.  What an achievement!

I love these heavy duty bags!  From the grocery store to the beach or office, they are as versatile as they are gorgeous.  The purple damask is my favorite, but they are all wonderful.  This is a wonderful, thick and sturdy 100% cotton bag that you can count on to carry whatever it is you need to bring along with you.  I've been accused of carrying my life in my bag and maybe that's true, but the only downfall I see to that is that I'm carrying 25-30 pounds around with me that my husband (and my chiropractor) feel I could do without!  These are perfect for those quick trips to the store or a picnic or even for a quick diaper bag for grandma.Sturdy and gorgeous!  I highly recommend.

This portable steamer is fantastic!  I dislike ironing so I avoid it at all costs.  This little gadget takes out those little wrinkles with ease.  Right out of the box, it's easy to figure out how to use and heats up relatively quickly, perhaps 40 seconds or so.  It's small so it tucks away in a drawer or cabinet and is ready for you when you need it.  I will be taking this with me on vacation this year so I can refresh the things I pack away before I wear them.The Gideon Handheld Portable Fabric Steamer is an affordable tool, small and unobtrusive for ease of transport. I am very pleased.*I received steamer in exchange for an honest review.*

This is the perfect way to spread scent through the house without wasting batteries or lighting a flame.  I love incense, but the smoke bothers my family to no end, especially during allergy season.  I love candles, but you always run the risk of fire if you fall asleep.  Yes, I have battery operated candles, but they don't smell like this does.  They are meant mostly for light, not for scent. This is amazing, and I can change the scent anytime I want.  It's easy to fill and to turn on. The instructions are very easy to follow and 3 minutes after opening the box, it was up and running.  It shuts off by itself once the water and oil are gone.  My kids especially like the color change feature which you can use or not, as you see fit.I don't know what I ever did before!  This little gadget is amazing!

Not only does this candle have a nice soft vanilla scent, but the flame is realistic, too!  I got the candle yesterday in the mail.  I quickly opened the package and got it going.  Since it's battery operated, I can put this candle anywhere, even in my windowsill near my curtains and have no fear of a fire.  So, that's what I did.  I left it on and went upstairs to bed.  An hour later I get a call from my neighbor.  He called to tell me he was outside to put out his garbage and he noticed I had a candle burning in the window and wanted to be sure I knew about it, as the house was dark and it looked like we had all gone to sleep!  I told him it was a batter operated candle.  He was genuinely shocked.  Now that's a realistic candle!

These earrings are so very lovely and are very affordable.  They cause no irritation and are not heavy so  you can wear dangly earrings without the worry of weight pulling on your holes.  These are just as stunning with a pair of jeans and a sweater as they are with a little black dress.  I absolutely love these earrings and believe that they are perfect for any woman, no matter her age.  They are understated and classic.  A perfect pair!

The AquaAudio Cubo Waterproof Bluetooth speaker sure packs a punch.  After charging the unit, which took about an hour from what I could figure (I was not paying attention but am estimating) I turned it on and it took approximately 1 minute to hook it up to my Kindle.  I have never been happy with the built in speakers on my Kindle so I have been waiting to get a Bluetooth speaker to help out with that.  I was offered this AquaAudio speaker for review, so I jumped on it!  I'm so glad I did.  Not only can I take this in the bathroom with me as it's waterproof, I can take it in the car and use the suction cup on the back to adhere it to my windshield so I can listen to music while driving.  The sound that comes out of this little thing is amazing and I'm very, very pleased.

This is a nice fragrance lotion to put on before going out to a party or dinner.  I have very dry skin, and  use lotions for that issue, but this is not one I would use for that purpose.  Josie should be used primarily for fragrance, not to help with dry skin.  It's a thinner product than I'm used to using, but it went on nicely and soaked right in.  The scent is strong and lasted quite some time. I got many compliments throughout the evening.

These lights are perfect for what we wanted them for in our backyard.  They are in a shady spot and the solar charger still works well and the lights work all night long, well into the early morning hours.  A few things to consider: You cannot string these lights to other lights, but you can use them side by side and they will appear to be strung together and who would know?  You can store these as you would store any solar lighting for the winter.  I put mine in a plastic bag and hang them in the garage so they won't get squashed in a box.I'm very  pleased with these lights and would purchase again.

The colors are vibrant and the price is perfect.  The other thing that stands out about this rug is that it's not ultra plush so when you walk up to it your foot won't get caught up against the edge of the runner like some other rugs I've had.  My mom is elderly and loves runners but has very thick ones and it's almost like she has to step up a bit to walk on them and I worry about her falling. This rug is stable and doesn't move around and best of all, there is no "step up."  I think I will be replacing her thicker rugs with these runners as it's much safer for her.

I was offered this at a discount in lieu of a fair review.  I accepted this offer for the fact that I needed a sewing kit for when I travel.  It can be a VERY useful when that button falls off, a snag in your fabric, or God forbid a zipper blowout - you know what I'm talking about.  3rd degree embarrassment!However, I had to modify this kit to actually be useful.  There are two needle threaders in this kit that are really cheaply made, but still useful for emergencies.  My main complaint though is the needles - they have no use whatsoever. I had to change out the needles completely.  The eyes on these needles are soooooo tiny, that it is impossible to use the threader or to even try and thread them without the threader.  They are too small for even the thread.  Pointless!With that being said, everything else in the kit is ok.  There is a decent thread selection, although I will have to add "cream/beige and remove one of the pinks or the purple as these are colors that I will never use. Average shirt buttons (3 incl.), and I will also add additional safety pins rather than just the 1 incl.I cannot say this kit is at a decent price point as I've have to alter several pieces in it to be useful.

Simple, easy to use, well made, good sound - I cannot complain.  It makes working out much nicer without a wire dragging around.Music and phone is good...But I prefer to connect this to my iPod nano...I don't want to take phone calls when I'm focused on JUST ME ;)NOTE:  I am really pleased to mention that in the instructions it includes "CORRECT DISPOSAL OF THIS PRODUCT" with clear explanation to the correct way to dispose this type of product at the end of its working life.  I am happy to see this because people would normally throw it in the garbage without realizing the environmental impact.  More electronic companies need to take responsibility to express proper recycling of these types of materials.  A+++  I was provided this sample for an honest review.

I really like the compact size of this thing as it doesn't have near the footprint as my other spiral slicer Paderno World Cuisine A4982799 Tri-Blade Plastic Spiral Vegetable Slicer which is huge, cumbersome to use and clean, - always a chore when considering raw veggie noodles.  This is useful in the sense that it is fairly quick, needs a bit of "man-handling" to get things going, but easy enough to clean and use.I am however, so tired of seeing the trending "diet" topic PALEO.  There are many who choose healthy, simple fresh veggies without having to identify with this nonsense, over-marketed word.  I was provided this sample for an honest review.

My old one is outdated, so I gladly accepted this sample in lieu of an honest review.  The older models (like mine that is 15 years +) just have the plugs that pop out for to use wherever you are in the world.  However, this one includes 2 USB outlets, which is essential in todays electronics.I tried this out with a stereo that I have from when I lived in the UK and is still plugged into a universal adapter.  I also have a universal DVD player that is Euro (two pinned) and this worked just fine as well.  So I will be happy to use this on my next trip knowing that I don't have to bring along a UBS adapter as well.I also want to mention that this comes in a nice zipped nylon case for safe storage and measures approximately 2 3/4" x 2" x 2 3/4" (inside the case).

I'm a huge fan of pepper mills and quite particular to the Peugeot pepper mills - you will leave them in your will!  However, I accepted this in lieu of a fair review based on the items description of "Stainless Steel"...I was hopeful.  Let me be clear that the stainless is simply a cosmetic shell over plastic.  All of the internal grinding mechanics are plastic except for the bolt that allows the course/fine grinding adjustments.  Fresh pepper corns can be pretty hard and I can foresee plastic grinding into the pepper over time.I don't mind the acrylic so much, but I can clearly see the molding seam in this.However, I do like the design...it's just done cheaply that's all.  At $14.95 though, it's at a decent price point.

I have to say first that I was sooo sorry to resort to poison and truly spent a small fortune on natural options...everything from peppermint, balsam & cedar oil, to a homemade spray from garlic, hot peppers, ginger, vinegar, & soap - even fresh cab Fresh Cab Rodent Repellent (4 Pouch Box) Net Wt. 10 Ounce - even 3 electrical devices Hoont™ Powerful Electronic Outdoor/Indoor Animal & Pest Repeller - Motion Activated [New Version] they just walked passed and never skipped a beat to demolishing my garden. I cannot stand to see any living creature suffer, however, I knew that I had a true problem here when I went out late and watched a darn herd fly from my compost bin (which I quit using months ago and bought a new one off the ground and enclosed YIMBY IM4000 Dual Chamber Tumbling Composter, Black).  Who knows how many there were, it was just a mad scurry!The perimeter of my back yard fence is covered in a huge lush mix of greenery from both sides of the fence, I cannot control all places for these critters to live and thrive. I bought two of these and a 4lb bag of Ramik NEOGEN RODENTICIDE Ramik Mouse and Rat Nuggets Pouch, 4-Pound, Green to see how things went.These are two very different poisons.* Bromethalin is a rodenticide (Tom Cat) which poisons the central nervous system, ultimately resulting in increased intracranial pressure, which damages neuronal axons. This damage to the central nervous system causes paralysis, convulsions, and death. This one, like most, are anticoagulants related to warfarin (the drug called Coumadin). These drugs, eaten by the rodent as an overdose, inhibit vitamin K and lead to a loss of clotting activity over several days (clotting factors require vitamin K). The ultimate result is hemorrhage.So, that being said, you can understand the cautions to your pets or children and these things smell like pet food. I have been DILIGENT with my dog and I actually carry him past anywhere near this area and put him down on a leash. All dog exercise is currently at the park until this duty is long over with.The rats do not even bother with the refillable stations. I have one with the Tom Cat bait and the other with the Ramik pellets and the rats are too smart and seem to know this is a trap. So I cut the bottoms off a few liter plastic bottles and a few jar lids as little trays as I don't want this stuff directly on the soil and filled them with Ramik pellets. They still haven't touched the Tom Cat cubes, however, they have DEMOLISHED the Ramik bait. 4lb bag in 4 days! I was refilling the containers 3+ times per day. Yesterday, I had first sign of its working.Be prepared for a sight that may be disturbing and heart wrenching at the same time. It was a rat on my drive early yesterday morning, in convulsions. Yes, it tormented me and I did what I believe was kind and covered it and gave it a smack with a hammer over the head. Yes, I cried like a baby, and so I mention this, because if you can't handle this, then just know before you decide.PLEASE be aware that if there are natural predators in your area, such as fox, feral cats, owls, hawks, etc. that these poisons rats will poison the creature that eats them as well. I say this as I live in a dense urban setting and we deal with this as an epidemic and I have never seen any predators and probably why it is a problem. I only pray that what I have done harms no other.PS...I will update this review in the winter when I have an indoor mouse problem.  I will try these two indoors with perhaps a different outcome.Hope this is helpful:)

I have to say first that I was sooo sorry to resort to poison and truly spent a small fortune on natural options...everything from peppermint, balsam & cedar oil, to a homemade spray from garlic, hot peppers, ginger, vinegar, & soap - even fresh cab Fresh Cab Rodent Repellent (4 Pouch Box) Net Wt. 10 Ounce, - even 3 electrical devices Hoont™ Powerful Electronic Outdoor/Indoor Animal & Pest Repeller - Motion Activated they just walked passed and never skipped a beat to demolishing my garden.  I cannot stand to see any living creature suffer, however, I knew that I had a true problem here when I went out late and watched a darn herd fly from my compost bin (which I quit using months ago and bought a new one off the ground and enclosed YIMBY IM4000 Dual Chamber Tumbling Composter, Black).  Who knows how many there were, it was just a mad scurry!The perimeter of my back yard fence is covered in a huge lush mix of greenery from both sides of the fence, I cannot control all places for these critters to live and thrive.  I bought this and 2 Tom Cats Tomcat Rat Killer II (Kid and Dog Resistant Refillable Rat Bait Station, w/ 15 Bait Blocks) to see how things went.These are two very different poisons.*  Bromethalin is a rodenticide (Tom Cat) which poisons the central nervous system, ultimately resulting in increased intracranial pressure, which damages neuronal axons. This damage to the central nervous system causes paralysis, convulsions, and death.  This one, like most, are anticoagulants related to warfarin (the drug called Coumadin). These drugs, eaten by the rodent as an overdose, inhibit vitamin K and lead to a loss of clotting activity over several days (clotting factors require vitamin K). The ultimate result is hemorrhage.So, that being said, you can understand the cautions to your pets or children and these things smell like pet food.  I have been DILIGENT with my dog and I actually carry him past anywhere near this area and put him down on a leash.  All dog exercise is currently at the park until this duty is long over with.The rats do not even bother with the refillable stations.  I have one with the Tom Cat bait and the other with the Ramik pellets and the rats are too smart and seem to know this is a trap.  So I cut the bottoms off a few liter plastic bottles and a few jar lids as little trays as I don't want this stuff directly on the soil.  They still haven't touched the Tom Cat cubes, however, they have DEMOLISHED the Ramik bait.  4lb bag in 4 days!  I was refilling the containers 3+ times per day.  Yesterday, I had first sign of its working.Be prepared for a sight that may be disturbing and heart wrenching at the same time.  It was a rat on my drive early yesterday morning, in convulsions.  Yes, it tormented me and I did what I believe was kind and covered it and gave it a smack with a hammer over the head.  Yes, I cried like a baby, and so I mention this, because if you can't handle this, then just know before you decide.PLEASE be aware that if there are natural predators in your area, such as fox, feral cats, owls, hawks, etc. that these poisoned rats will poison the creature that eats them as well.  I say this as I live in a dense urban setting and we deal with this as an epidemic and I have never seen any predators and, this is probably why it is a problem.  I only pray that what I have done harms no other.Hope this is helpful:)UPDATE 8/26/15 1 star removal:I'm on my 3rd bag of this stuff and the chore of refilling the 6 trays that I have scattered throughout my garden has slowed down tremendously.  However, I have moved over from battling rats to battling mice.  Now, the same concept applies here to mice as well, but what has become a major chore is not refilling the trays but keeping it in the trays.  The rats are large enough to pick up these pellets and eat the whole thing, but the mice are not.  What the mice are doing is dragging these nuggets out of the trays and nibbling on them leaving bits all around the trays on the soil (yuck!) and dragging them to different areas in the garden.  I have to dig up soil and debris around the trays constantly and go hunting very careful for any rogue nuggets that were drug away.  I mention this because it's a pain in the **tt and I have to be double/triple careful with my dog.  I was planning on using these indoors this winter with a chronic mouse issue, but ABSOLUTELY no way I can control where these could end up and it would leave me paranoid for the safety of my dog.  So this winter, I will have to use the Tom Cat indoors because the bait is a larger chunk that was designed to keep the bait inside the bait boxes.  I will just have to frost them with peanut butter to hopefully make them more appetizing to mice.

I hold all companies in high regards when their goal to make their money and make a socially responsible footprint doing so.  I received an email from the "Communications Guru" of L. and this sentence in the last portion of the email is what got me - "our ambition to make safe sex a human right!".This was the body of the company email:"Our condoms are free of harmful chemicals including spermicide, parabens, casein, and glycerin.  These additives are known to cause infections in women, such as UTIs and yeast infections.  Additionally, we have a 90% reduction in proteins in our latex which means that our condoms are thinner, more transparent, and have less of a latex smell and taste.  Our packaging is made out of entirely recycled material and vegetable based inks.  We were awarded "Best for the World - Overall" by B Corp.  For context, B Corps are certified by the nonprofit B Lab to meet rigorous standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency (other B Corps include Patagonia and Ben & Jerry's).  Out of the entire batch of B Corp certified corporations, ours was selected among a dozen others as the highest scoring across all the evaluators.  When we donate, we don't only send condoms - we endorse a thoughtful approach to ensure the most sustainable and long lasting impact.  We support organizations who train women to become healthcare professionals so that they are able to sell the condoms as a source of income.  This gives them the opportunity to become independent as breadwinners in their community thus giving them a larger say in key decision making, such as the use of contraceptive.  We not only want to raise funds to help make safe sex a human right, we aim to empower women both domestically and around the globe."My company works in health educational products for community outreach.  Mostly with government health departments and nonprofits.  Our largest clientele are within HIV/STD education for high risk youth.  There is a clear misunderstanding that STD's are "ok", as you just go to a clinic and get a pill and keep on going.  This as also recently become the case now with HIV prevention and the new Gilead drug that is being hyped - PrEP: Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis.  Astonishing to me that we do not encourage simple SELF-CONTROL & RESPONSIBLITY for our own health.ok...Off my soap-box!There are lots of condoms out there, but please consider a company with a cause to empowering people and their sexuality.  Especially women in developing countries!  So, I will say in this review, L., International - THANK YOU!Ps...I have passed these over to some young college students - just in case:)Pss...I would also like to thank this company for including instructions on how to properly use a condom.  You would be surprised how many boys/men don't know.  Please read the instructions and be sure to use them properly to keep safe, it's worth the few minutes to read and even try it out ;)

It's slim that is for sure.  However, you can only charge micro USB gadgets with it.  This was very disappointing to me as I accepted this in lieu of a fair review simply for my phone, which is an iPhone.  So you have to get a micro USB to 8 pin lighting adapter AmazonBasics Micro USB to Lightning Adapter (Apple Certified).  There are plenty of power banks that are compatible without buying a separate adapter.  It should mention this in the product description.  However, one of the images showing this charging an iPhone, with an adapter...nonetheless.*  It does however, come with clear instructions and a 12 month warranty

I'm pleased to say this works well, and simple to use. I've had a couple that were silly complicated. I took this to a seminar and had no problems recording a 4 hour session, loaded it to the PC and simple moved the file off the drive to share with my colleagues. Can be very valuable to have this when handy.Also, I am happy to see this company claims a 1 year hardware warranty and actually includes the warrant card with clear instructions and contact details. I mention this, as I've come across lots of products from China that make claims in the product descriptions and when it arrives, there are no details on or inside the packing.The instructions are clear, well written and simple to follow. I get irritated with unintelligible product instructions in poor English.I will get good use from this gadget! I was provided this sample for an honest review.
Sent them back for refund.  They fit to size, but fit strange and it's because of the fabric.  Didn't like and it makes noise when you walk as well.

Pretty expensive for what it is.  It's thin and holds a decent shape.  However, what I DON'T like is that on the sleeves, the fabric made the little  "sweater balls" around the wrist after the first time of wearing it.  Washing it for the first time, only made this worse.

Aromatherapy is underestimated! The right oil or oil combination can change your health and you mood instantly. I was happy when this arrived as my previous diffuser just "bit the dust" and I needed a replacement.I have this in my living room and it is so relaxing in the late evening to unwind with a relaxing tea, relaxing oils, and pale glowing lights. It beats a candle hands down!This is a nice stylish design with the wood effect to look natural.The instructions are simple and clear English with good troubleshooting suggestions as well. I do wish however, that it had a timer setting on it. My previous one did and I liked it next to my bed. This one will shut off when the water well gets too low (approx. 6 hrs running). I was provided this sample for a good 'old use it and test it for an honest review.

The nubbies are made of a stiff silicone and you can get a good deep massage with this.Please note though, instructions does not mention using any sort of massage lotion or oil, which I found strange.  So be sure that you do, as the silicone nubbies will just stick and drag on the skin leaving scratches or bruising.Otherwise, this is a nice set, the curve is really nice for the curve of the arm, calves, and so forth...feels really nice.  I was provided this sample for an honest review.

Nice sports band, does what it is supposed to do and stays in place well.  I've had a couple of these and the same issue applies with most, you cannot use this with a phone in a case any thicker than MAYBE the TPU plastics.  Knowing most people put their phones into a pretty structural case, it would be nice to to get a sports band that was over-sized a bit to accommodate average phone cases.It will not fit my iPhone 6 with a case, (way too tight) but works fine for the 5 series (even in a case).  Otherwise, it will work fine.  I was provided this sample for an honest review.

Very nice!  Perfect gift to someone you care about.  It's heart shaped, and well made.  I can compare this to my Culpepper massager I bought in England years ago.  The nubbies and the back are made from wood and the strap is a nice thick cotton strap.  It's packaged nicely as well.These are great to keep in the shower and rub the back of the thighs!  I was provided this sample for an honest review.

This arrived just in time for a flight with multiple layovers throughout the night...landing at 4am.  I actually got some decent sleep with this pillow.  The groove in the middle is perfect for your head to rest in and still have support on the back and around the sides of your neck.  It snaps in the front and  let's you feel secure that it will stay in place while you rest.  Also, great to easily snap it around the handle of your suit case or carry-carry on, or even your handbag.  Super light as well, and I also like the fabric on the outside is sort of "furry" and the inside is really soft.  I was very happy with this.  Of course the color black hides and stains too and won't get grubby looking as quickly as a lighter color.  I was provided this sample for an honest review.

These are so adorable!  They arrived just in time for a young lady's prom and matched the occasion perfectly.  They are not too heavy, nor gaudy they are cute and quite elegant.  Even if you were out on a posh night, you could pass these off as "real" pearl, diamond, and coral.  Nice quality costume earrings.  For under $6, you can barely get that price at a resale shop these days!  I was provided this sample for an honest review.

Looks like an iPod and I'm guessing that is what is being sought here.  However, I found it very confusing to work with.  Button response, navigation, charging, transferring, etc., is a touch-and-go scenario.  Inconsistencies are irritating to me.I think this is probably best for someone that just wants to listen to music without the smartphone doodling and has the patience to figure this thing out.  It's at an appropriate price point as well.  I was provided this sample for an honest review.

Skeptical...I was...I've not had a car mount that would stick very well, but low and behold, it STICKS! As a matter of fact, it's hard to get offIt rotates well and holds the phone good too. This mount is well made and surely universal. I chose to use this on a glass office desk as it holds the phone perfectly where I can see it and it is strong enough for me to navigate apps and make calls without it even budging. I was provided this sample for an honest review.

I have no idea what people are typically using these things for, but I ordered them for a special project. The rings seem uniform in shape and of good quality. Beware that it takes a pretty good twist to get the rings to come together (you'll need strong fingers or pliers).

I've owned three other Asus laptops, so I'm generally a fan of the brand. But this latest purchase left me disappointed. My last two Asus laptops (two of the same model, just in different colors) were superior to this new model.The screen is dull, grayish, and not as crisp as others I've used. Although it's large, I think it's very disappointing in terms of quality. I've also had many problems networking with other computers and a printer at my office (unclear if that's the fault of the laptop or Windows 10).The biggest complaint I have about this laptop-- and it's a huge complaint-- is that the battery life is absolutely abysmal. It's a joke. I cannot make it through a single day without having to recharge-- and that's with the laptop closed in my suitcase or backpack for about 1/3 of the day. I've tried changing a few "battery saver" settings, but it's still horrible. Today-- for example-- I used the laptop plugged in for about six hours. I then used the laptop for about an hour unplugged and-- as I write this review-- I'm now at 43%. I've lost 53% of my battery with about one hour's use.I will likely be shopping for another brand in the future.
These refills cost more than the pens themselves. Shame on Pilot for trashing the environment and screwing the consumer with this pricing strategy.

The straws are a good value, I like the glass, and the bonus brush cleaner is great, but the straws still aren't big-enough for a milkshake (which is what I'd hoped to use them for). I'm only knocking off one star for that, but in fairness to the company that makes these, they don't really advertise them as being for milkshakes.
It's certainly not going to stop a dedicated heist by ambitious safe crackers, but it'll keep honest people honest at the office.

I liked everything about this brace until the cloth on the webbing in-between the index finger and thumb wore off, and exposed a rather rough/abrasive threading which then immediately began irritating my skin. This may sound like a minor complaint, but it was significant in that: (1) I'd only been wearing the brace for less than a week, (2) the cloth that was very soft wore completely away, exposing the more rough material, and (3) once the rough material was exposed, a mere half-hour of wearing the brace caused redness and significant irritation​.It's possible I got a lemon (as others appear very satisfied with the brace). I'll patch it with some replacement cloth of my own or use a bandaid. The brace is otherwise very good.
This mag carrier will NOT carry Glock 10mm or .45 double-stack mags without modification. Given the huge popularity of Glock large-frame models, this is a product fail in my book.

I'm typically a Fobus fan, but I had trouble finding a holster that would fit a long-slide Glock Gen4 40 in 10mm. This Uncle Mike's holster with the open end fits well, and the price is right. There are a series of offset holes on the back which allow you to adjust somewhat the ride-height and cant. Every position I can think of is available. My only complaint-- and it's a big one-- is that there are two very aggressive teeth on the paddle clip to hold the holster in place, and they are big enough and strong enough to not only make minor adjustments of the holster nearly impossible once mounted on a belt/lip of pants, but I fear the teeth will absolutley destroy nice dress pants over time with wear. I would estimate these teeth are a half-inch long or deep (depending on how you look at them) and they poke through the paddle to aid in belt/pant retention. Anyone who wears something less tough than denim or thick canvas should be cautious though. These teeth are totally overkill, and I'm going to see if I can grind them down with a Dremmel.See the photo for an idea of the size of the teeth and how they stick through the paddle.
This album is sexy fun. Just make sure to skip the Orangutan song.

I was excited when I found this cute, bold, red little cash box. I thought it'd be perfect for my needs, and the price was right. However, my box came wrapped in plastic (in other words, it appeared new), but with no packing material. It was dented in the front, the internal lip was bent/warped back from the frame, and the handle on top was misaligned and therefore wouldn't move freely as it was supposed to. Even if the unit had been in perfect condition, a warning to potential buyers here: The trays are odd sized. For example, the four center trays are tiny and it's not clear what they would hold (they aren't suitable for anything other than very short keys or a very small amount of change).
These are great business-casual pants with a nice flat front (flattering if you're thin or fit), and they fit as expected.

Simple, efficient, versatile, and reasonably priced. This little handy clamp is just what I needed to mount an iPod Touch (which is skinny and a bit thinner than an iPhone) on a tripod for FaceTime video conferencing. It also works with my Samsung Note 3 (which is huge). I especially like the fact that it can be mounted vertically or horizontally (by selecting either of the two brass tripod screw holes.
These are great! High-quality "do not disturb" signs. The black leather is nice, the silver lettering looks sharp, and the two pack is a great value. Perfect for home, office, or travel.

This tripod is what it is: A cheap, possibly disposable tripod. I rated it as "okay" because it's not necessarily bad, but it's clearly destined for the landfill when (not if, but when) one of the many structural plastic pieces breaks. This tripod doesn't use high-quality polymer or composite components, but rather that thin, brittle, cheap plastic you see on low-quality Chinese products. I assume the target market for this tripod is people traveling who want the option of literally throwing the tripod away after the trip (or not worrying about it if it were lost or stolen during the trip).It works. I'm keeping it. It's a tripod that successfully "tripods." But it was of lower quality than I expected given all the reviews.UPDATE: I received a telephone message reportedly from the manufacturer of this tripod who offered a partial refund and also asked that I consider re-writing and re-scoring the review. I appreciate the partial refund, but I think the content of the review is accurate. With the partial refund, the tripod is an even better value, so I'm now rating it as "I like it."

I'm diggin' this tractor seat stool. It was easy to assemble, it's comfortable, the height adjustment range is excellent, the price was right, and it's classy-enough to fit in a professional office environment.I knocked off one star because the pictures for the stool made it look like the seat had sparkles. You know, like a 1970's motorcycle helmet or bowling ball? I thought I would be getting just a little metallic flake or sparkle in the seat color because of the way the photos appear. It's a nice glossy black, but doesn't have the pizzazz I thought it'd have.

This grip has so many positive reviews and I love Israeli gear generally, so I took a chance and ordered one.These grips actually ship from Israel and so mine took a month to arrive.
